[I]82-elizabeth would go and see [her]3233-your daughter if [I]82-elizabeth could have [the carriage]3217-the carriage . "[82-elizabeth]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , feeling really anxious , determined to go to [her]82-elizabeth , though [the carriage]3217-the carriage was not to be had : and as [she]82-elizabeth was [no horsewoman]470-no horsewoman , walking was [her]82-elizabeth only alternative . [She]82-elizabeth declared [her]82-elizabeth resolution .

" How can [you]82-elizabeth be so silly , "[241-her mother] cried [[her]82-elizabeth mother]241-her mother , " as to think of such a thing , in all this dirt ! [You]82-elizabeth will not be fit to be seen when [you]82-elizabeth get there . "[82-elizabeth]

" [I]241-her mother shall be very fit to see [Jane]83-jane -- which is all [I]241-her mother want . "[241-her mother]

" Is this a hint to [me]244-her father , [Lizzy]82-elizabeth , "[244-her father] said [[her]82-elizabeth father]244-her father , " to send for [the horses]3237-the horses ? "[244-her father]

" No , indeed . [I]241-her mother do not wish to avoid the walk . The distance is nothing , when one has a motive ; only three miles . [I]241-her mother shall be back by dinner . "[241-her mother]

" [I]87-mary admire the activity of [your]82-elizabeth benevolence , "[87-mary] observed [Mary]87-mary , " but every impulse of feeling should be guided by reason ; and , in [my]87-mary opinion , exertion should always be in proportion to what is required . "[87-mary]

" [We]474-the three young ladies will go as far as [Meryton]9-meryton with [you]82-elizabeth , "[86-lady catherine] said [Catherine]86-lady catherine and [Lydia]84-lydia . [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth accepted [their]473-their company , and [the three young ladies]474-the three young ladies set off together .

" If [we]474-the three young ladies make haste , "[84-lydia] said [Lydia]84-lydia , as [they]474-the three young ladies walked along , " perhaps [we]474-the three young ladies may see something of [Captain Carter]112-captain carter , before [he]112-captain carter goes . "[84-lydia]

In [Meryton]9-meryton [they]474-the three young ladies parted : [the two youngest]475-the two youngest repaired to [the lodgings of]476-the lodgings of [one of [[the officers]454-the officers ' wives]479-the officers ' wives]477-one of the officers ' wives , and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth continued [her]82-elizabeth walk alone , crossing [field]480-field after [field]480-field at a quick pace , jumping over stiles and springing over puddles , with impatient activity , and finding [herself]82-elizabeth at last within view of [the house]3001-the house , with weary ancles , dirty stockings , and a face glowing with the warmth of exercise .

[She]82-elizabeth was shown into [the breakfast parlour]483-the breakfast parlour , where all but [Jane]83-jane were assembled , and where [her]82-elizabeth appearance created a great deal of surprise . That [she]82-elizabeth should have walked three miles so early in the day in such dirty weather , and by [herself]82-elizabeth , was almost incredible to [Mrs. Hurst]90-mrs. hurst and [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley ; and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth was convinced that [they]484-they held [her]82-elizabeth in contempt for it . [She]82-elizabeth was received , however , very politely by [them]484-they ; and in [[their]484-they brother]339-their brother 's manners there was something better than politeness -- there was good - humour and kindness . [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy said very little , and [Mr. Hurst]88-mr. hurst nothing at all . [The former]327-the former was divided between admiration of the brilliancy which exercise had given to [her]82-elizabeth complexion and doubt as to the occasion 's justifying [her]82-elizabeth coming so far alone . [The latter]487-the latter was thinking only of [his]339-their brother breakfast .

[Her]82-elizabeth inquiries after [[her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister were not very favourably answered . [Miss Bennet]82-elizabeth had slept ill , and though up , was very feverish , and not well enough to leave [[her]82-elizabeth room]489-her room . [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth was glad to be taken to [her]328-her sister immediately ; and [Jane]83-jane , who had only [been withheld by the fear of giving alarm or inconvenience]490-been withheld by the fear of giving alarm or inconvenience , from expressing in [her]83-jane note how much [she]83-jane longed for such a visit , was delighted at [her]83-jane entrance . [She]83-jane was not equal , however , to much conversation ; and when [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley left [them]491-they together , could attempt little beside expressions of gratitude for the extraordinary kindness [she]83-jane was treated with . [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth silently attended [her]83-jane .

When breakfast was over , [they]491-they were joined by [the sisters]492-the sisters ; and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth began to like [them]492-the sisters [herself]82-elizabeth , when [she]82-elizabeth saw how much affection and solicitude [they]492-the sisters showed for [Jane]83-jane . [The apothecary]493-the apothecary came ; and having examined [[his]493-the apothecary patient]494-his patient , said , as might be supposed , that [she]494-his patient had caught a violent cold , and that [they]491-they must endeavour to get the better of it ; advised [her]494-his patient to return to bed , and promised [her]494-his patient some draughts . The advice was followed readily , for the feverish symptoms increased , and [her]494-his patient head ached acutely . [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth did not quit [[her]82-elizabeth room]489-her room for a moment , nor were [the other ladies]496-the other ladies often absent ; [the gentlemen]290-the gentlemen being out , [they]290-the gentlemen had in fact nothing to do elsewhere .

When the clock struck three , [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth felt that [she]82-elizabeth must go , and very unwillingly said so . [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley offered [her]82-elizabeth [the carriage]3217-the carriage , and [she]82-elizabeth only wanted a little pressing to accept it , when [Jane]83-jane testified such concern at parting with [her]82-elizabeth that [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley was obliged to convert the offer of the chaise into an invitation to remain at [Netherfield]2-netherfield for the present . [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth most thankfully consented , and [a servant]499-a servant was despatched to [Longbourn]7-longbourn , to acquaint [the family]416-the family with [her]82-elizabeth stay , and bring back a supply of clothes .

At five o'clock [the two ladies]501-the two ladies retired to dress , and at half - past six [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth was summoned to dinner . To the civil inquiries which then poured in , and amongst which [she]82-elizabeth had the pleasure of distinguishing the much superior solicitude of [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley , [she]82-elizabeth could not make a very favourable answer . [Jane]83-jane was by no means better . [The sisters]492-the sisters , on hearing this , repeated three or four times how much [they]492-the sisters were grieved , how shocking it was to have a bad cold , and how excessively [they]492-the sisters disliked being ill [themselves]492-the sisters ; and then thought no more of the matter : and [their]492-the sisters indifference towards [Jane]83-jane , when not immediately before [them]492-the sisters , restored [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth to the enjoyment of all [her]82-elizabeth original dislike .

[[Their]492-the sisters brother]339-their brother , indeed , was [the only one of the party whom [she]82-elizabeth could regard with any complacency]504-the only one of the party whom she could regard with any complacency . [His]339-their brother anxiety for [Jane]83-jane was evident , and [his]339-their brother attentions to [herself]83-jane most pleasing ; and [they]505-they prevented [her]82-elizabeth feeling [herself]82-elizabeth so much [an intruder]506-an intruder as [she]82-elizabeth believed [she]82-elizabeth was considered by [the others]507-the others . [She]82-elizabeth had very little notice from any but [him]339-their brother . [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley was engrossed by [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy , [[her]91-miss bingley sister]328-her sister scarcely less so ; and as for [Mr. Hurst]88-mr. hurst , by whom [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth sat , [he]88-mr. hurst was [an indolent man , who lived only to eat , drink , and play at cards]509-an indolent man , who lived only to eat , drink , and play at cards , who , when [he]88-mr. hurst found [her]82-elizabeth prefer a plain dish to a ragout , had nothing to say to [her]82-elizabeth .

When dinner was over , [she]82-elizabeth returned directly to [Jane]83-jane , and [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley began abusing [her]82-elizabeth as soon as [she]82-elizabeth was out of [the room]250-the room . [Her]82-elizabeth manners were pronounced to be very bad indeed,--a mixture of pride and impertinence : [she]82-elizabeth had no conversation , no style , no taste , no beauty . [Mrs. Hurst]90-mrs. hurst thought the same , and added,--

" [She]82-elizabeth has nothing , in short , to recommend [her]82-elizabeth , but being [an excellent walker]3238-an excellent walker . [I]90-mrs. hurst shall never forget [her]82-elizabeth appearance this morning . [She]82-elizabeth really looked almost wild . "[90-mrs. hurst]

" [She]82-elizabeth did indeed , [Louisa]117-louisa . [I]90-mrs. hurst could hardly keep [my]90-mrs. hurst countenance . Very nonsensical to come at all ! Why must _ [she]82-elizabeth _ be scampering about [the country]448-the country , because [[her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister had a cold ? [Her]82-elizabeth hair so untidy , so blowzy ! "[90-mrs. hurst]

" Yes , and [her]82-elizabeth petticoat ; [I]90-mrs. hurst hope [you]117-louisa saw [her]82-elizabeth petticoat , six inches deep in mud , [I]90-mrs. hurst am absolutely certain , and the gown which had been let down to hide it not doing its office . "[90-mrs. hurst]

" [Your]117-louisa picture may be very exact , [Louisa]117-louisa , "[91-miss bingley] said [Bingley]91-miss bingley ; " but this was all lost upon [me]91-miss bingley . [I]91-miss bingley thought [Miss Elizabeth Bennet]82-elizabeth looked remarkably well when [she]82-elizabeth came into [the room]250-the room this morning . [Her]82-elizabeth dirty petticoat quite escaped [my]91-miss bingley notice . "[91-miss bingley]

" _ [You]117-louisa _ observed it , [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy , [I]91-miss bingley am sure , "[91-miss bingley] said [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley ; " and [I]91-miss bingley am inclined to think that [you]89-mr. darcy would not wish to see _ [[your]89-mr. darcy sister]3139-your sister _ make such an exhibition . "[91-miss bingley]

" Certainly not . "[91-miss bingley]

" To walk three miles , or four miles , or five miles , or whatever it is , above [her]82-elizabeth ancles in dirt , and alone , quite alone ! what could [she]82-elizabeth mean by it ? It seems to [me]91-miss bingley to show an abominable sort of conceited independence , a most country - town indifference to decorum . "[91-miss bingley]

" It shows an affection for [[her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister that is very pleasing , "[91-miss bingley] said [Bingley]91-miss bingley .

" [I]91-miss bingley am afraid , [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy , "[91-miss bingley] observed [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley , in a half whisper , " that this adventure has rather affected [your]89-mr. darcy admiration of [her]82-elizabeth fine eyes . "[91-miss bingley]

" Not at all , "[511-he] [he]511-he replied : " they were brightened by the exercise . "[511-he] A short pause followed this speech , and [Mrs. Hurst]90-mrs. hurst began again,--

" [I]91-miss bingley have an excessive regard for [Jane Bennet,--she]83-jane is really [a very sweet]3244-a very sweet girl,--and [I]91-miss bingley wish with all [my]91-miss bingley heart [she]83-jane were well settled . But with such [a father]3245-a father and [mother]3198-mother , and such low connections , [I]91-miss bingley am afraid there is no chance of it . "[91-miss bingley]

" [I]91-miss bingley think [I]91-miss bingley have heard [you]91-miss bingley say that [[their]513-they uncle]3247-their uncle is [an attorney in [Meryton]9-meryton]436-an attorney in meryton ? "[91-miss bingley]

" Yes ; and [they]513-they have another , who lives somewhere near [Cheapside]13-cheapside . "[91-miss bingley]

" That is capital , "[328-her sister] added [[her]90-mrs. hurst sister]328-her sister ; and [they]513-they both laughed heartily .

" If [they]513-they had [uncles]3249-uncles enough to fill _ all _ [Cheapside]13-cheapside , "[91-miss bingley] cried [Bingley]91-miss bingley , " it would not make [them]513-they one jot less agreeable . "[91-miss bingley]

" But it must very materially lessen [their]513-they chance of marrying [men]3250-men of any consideration in [the world]303-the world , "[89-mr. darcy] replied [Darcy]89-mr. darcy .

To this speech [Bingley]91-miss bingley made no answer ; but [[his]514-his sisters]282-his sisters gave it [their]282-his sisters hearty assent , and indulged [their]282-his sisters mirth for some time at the expense of [[their]282-his sisters dear friend]516-their dear friend 's vulgar relations .

With a renewal of tenderness , however , [they]282-his sisters repaired to [[her]90-mrs. hurst room]489-her room on leaving [the dining - parlour]518-the dining - parlour , and sat with [her]90-mrs. hurst till summoned to coffee . [She]90-mrs. hurst was still very poorly , and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth would not quit [her]90-mrs. hurst at all , till late in the evening , when [she]82-elizabeth had the comfort of seeing [her]90-mrs. hurst asleep , and when it appeared to [her]82-elizabeth rather right than pleasant that [she]82-elizabeth should go down [stairs]519-stairs [herself]82-elizabeth . On entering [the drawing - room]520-the drawing - room , [she]82-elizabeth found [the whole party]521-the whole party at loo , and was immediately invited to join [them]521-the whole party ; but suspecting [them]521-the whole party to be playing high , [she]82-elizabeth declined it , and making [[her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister the excuse , said [she]82-elizabeth would amuse [herself]82-elizabeth , for the short time [she]82-elizabeth could stay below , with a book . [Mr. Hurst]88-mr. hurst looked at [her]82-elizabeth with astonishment .

" Do [you]82-elizabeth prefer reading to cards ? "[88-mr. hurst] said [he]88-mr. hurst ; " that is rather singular . "[88-mr. hurst]

" [Miss Eliza Bennet]82-elizabeth , "[91-miss bingley] said [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley , " despises cards . [She]82-elizabeth is [a great reader]3252-a great reader , and has no pleasure in anything else . "[91-miss bingley]

" [I]82-elizabeth deserve neither such praise nor such censure , "[82-elizabeth] cried [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth ; " [I]82-elizabeth am _ not _ [a great reader]3252-a great reader , and [I]82-elizabeth have pleasure in many things . "[82-elizabeth]

" In nursing [[your]82-elizabeth sister]3139-your sister [I]91-miss bingley am sure [you]82-elizabeth have pleasure , "[91-miss bingley] said [Bingley]91-miss bingley ; " and [I]91-miss bingley hope it will soon be increased by seeing [her]3139-your sister quite well . "[91-miss bingley]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth thanked [him]88-mr. hurst from [her]82-elizabeth heart , and then walked towards a table where a few books were lying . [He]88-mr. hurst immediately offered to fetch [her]82-elizabeth others ; all that [[his]88-mr. hurst library]259-his library afforded .

" And [I]88-mr. hurst wish [my]88-mr. hurst collection were larger for [your]82-elizabeth benefit and [my]88-mr. hurst own credit ; but [I]88-mr. hurst am [an idle fellow]3255-an idle fellow ; and though [I]88-mr. hurst have not many , [I]88-mr. hurst have more than [I]88-mr. hurst ever looked into . "[88-mr. hurst]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth assured [him]88-mr. hurst that [she]82-elizabeth could suit [herself]82-elizabeth perfectly with those in [the room]250-the room .

" [I]91-miss bingley am astonished , "[91-miss bingley] said [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley , " that [[my]91-miss bingley father]3256-my father should have left so small a collection of books . " It ought to be good , "[88-mr. hurst] [he]88-mr. hurst replied : " it has been the work of many generations . "[88-mr. hurst]

" And then [you]82-elizabeth have added so much to it [yourself]82-elizabeth -- [you]82-elizabeth are always buying books . "[91-miss bingley]

" [I]88-mr. hurst can not comprehend the neglect of [a family library]3258-a family library in such days as these . "[88-mr. hurst]

"[91-miss bingley]

" [I]88-mr. hurst wish it may . "[88-mr. hurst]
