" Upon [my]88-mr. hurst word , [Caroline]118-caroline , [I]88-mr. hurst should think it more possible to get [Pemberley]12-pemberley by purchase than by imitation . "[88-mr. hurst]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth was so much caught by what passed , as to leave [her]82-elizabeth very little attention for [her]82-elizabeth book ; and , soon laying it wholly aside , [she]82-elizabeth drew near the card - table , and stationed [herself]82-elizabeth between [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley and [[his]79-mr. bingley eldest sister]525-his eldest sister , to observe the game .

" Is [Miss Darcy]124-miss darcy much grown since the spring ? "[91-miss bingley] said [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley : " will [she]124-miss darcy be as tall as [I]91-miss bingley am ? "[91-miss bingley]

" [I]91-miss bingley think [she]124-miss darcy will . [She]124-miss darcy is now about [Miss Elizabeth Bennet]82-elizabeth 's height , or rather taller . "[91-miss bingley]

" How [I]91-miss bingley long to see [her]124-miss darcy again ! [I]91-miss bingley never met with anybody who delighted [me]91-miss bingley so much . Such a countenance , such manners , and so extremely accomplished for [her]124-miss darcy age ! [Her]124-miss darcy performance on the pianoforte is exquisite . "[91-miss bingley]

" It is amazing to [me]79-mr. bingley , "[79-mr. bingley] said [Bingley]79-mr. bingley , " how [young ladies]3263-young ladies can have patience to be so very accomplished as [they]3263-young ladies all are . "[79-mr. bingley]

" [All young ladies]3264-all young ladies accomplished ! [[My]91-miss bingley dear]2993-my dear [Charles]122-charles , what do [you]122-charles mean ? "[91-miss bingley]

" Yes , all of [them]3264-all young ladies , [I]79-mr. bingley think . [They]3264-all young ladies all paint tables , cover screens , and net purses . [I]79-mr. bingley scarcely know [any one who can not do all this]3266-any one who can not do all this ; and [I]79-mr. bingley am sure [I]79-mr. bingley never heard [a young lady]3267-a young lady spoken of for the first time , without being informed that [she]3267-a young lady was very accomplished . "[79-mr. bingley]

" [Your]122-charles list of the common extent of accomplishments , "[124-miss darcy] said [Darcy]124-miss darcy , " has too much truth . The word is applied to many [a woman who deserves it no otherwise than by netting a purse or covering a screen]3268-a woman who deserves it no otherwise than by netting a purse or covering a screen ; but [I]124-miss darcy am very far from agreeing with [you]122-charles in [your]122-charles estimation of [ladies in general]3269-ladies in general . [I]124-miss darcy can not boast of knowing more than half - a - dozen in the whole range of [my]124-miss darcy acquaintance that are really accomplished . "[124-miss darcy]

" Nor [I]91-miss bingley , [I]91-miss bingley am sure , "[91-miss bingley] said [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley .

" Then , "[82-elizabeth] observed [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , " [you]122-charles must comprehend a great deal in [your]122-charles idea of [an accomplished woman]3270-an accomplished woman . "[82-elizabeth]

" Yes ; [I]124-miss darcy do comprehend a great deal in it . "[124-miss darcy]

" Oh , certainly , "[527-his faithful assistant] cried [[his]526-his faithful assistant]527-his faithful assistant , " [no one]3271-no one can be really esteemed accomplished who does not greatly surpass what is usually met with . [A woman]3011-a woman must have a thorough knowledge of music , singing , drawing , dancing , and the modern languages , to deserve the word ; and , besides all this , [she]3011-a woman must possess a certain something in [her]3011-a woman air and manner of walking , the tone of [her]3011-a woman voice , [her]3011-a woman address and expressions , or the word will be but half deserved . "[527-his faithful assistant]

" All this [she]3011-a woman must possess , "[124-miss darcy] added [Darcy]124-miss darcy ; " and to all [she]3011-a woman must yet add something more substantial in the improvement of [her]3011-a woman mind by extensive reading . "[124-miss darcy]

" [I]527-his faithful assistant am no longer surprised at [your]122-charles knowing _ only _ [six accomplished women]3273-six accomplished women . [I]527-his faithful assistant rather wonder now at [your]122-charles knowing _ any _ . "[527-his faithful assistant]

" Are [you]122-charles so severe upon [your]122-charles own sex as to doubt the possibility of all this ? "[124-miss darcy]

" _ [I]527-his faithful assistant _ never saw [such a woman]3274-such a woman . _ [I]527-his faithful assistant _ never saw such capacity , and taste , and application , and elegance , as [you]122-charles describe , united . "[527-his faithful assistant]

[Mrs. Hurst]90-mrs. hurst and [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley both cried out against the injustice of [her]90-mrs. hurst implied doubt , and were both protesting that [they]528-them knew [many women who answered this description]529-many women who answered this description , when [Mr. Hurst]88-mr. hurst called [them]528-them to order , with bitter complaints of [their]528-them inattention to what was going forward . As all conversation was thereby at an end , [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth soon afterwards left [the room]250-the room .

" [Eliza Bennet]82-elizabeth , "[91-miss bingley] said [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley , when the door was closed on [her]91-miss bingley , " is one of [those young ladies who seek to recommend [themselves]3275-those young ladies who seek to recommend themselves to the other sex by undervaluing their own to the other sex by undervaluing [their]3275-those young ladies who seek to recommend themselves to the other sex by undervaluing their own own]3275-those young ladies who seek to recommend themselves to the other sex by undervaluing their own ; and with [many men]3276-many men , [I]91-miss bingley daresay , it succeeds ; but , in [my]91-miss bingley opinion , it is a paltry device , a very mean art . "[91-miss bingley]

" Undoubtedly , "[124-miss darcy] replied [Darcy]124-miss darcy , to whom this remark was chiefly addressed , " there is meanness in _ all _ the arts which [ladies]272-ladies sometimes condescend to employ for captivation . Whatever bears affinity to cunning is despicable . "[124-miss darcy]

[Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley was not so entirely satisfied with this reply as to continue the subject .

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth joined [them]528-them again only to say that [[her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister was worse , and that [she]82-elizabeth could not leave [her]328-her sister . [Bingley]91-miss bingley urged [Mr. Jones]121-mr. jones 's being sent for immediately ; while [[his]121-mr. jones sisters]282-his sisters , convinced that no country advice could be of any service , recommended an express to [town]264-town for [one of [the most eminent physicians]535-the most eminent physicians]534-one of the most eminent physicians . This [she]82-elizabeth would not hear of ; but [she]82-elizabeth was not so unwilling to comply with [[their]528-them brother]339-their brother 's proposal ; and it was settled that [Mr. Jones]121-mr. jones should be sent for early in the morning , if [Miss Bennet]82-elizabeth were not decidedly better . [Bingley]91-miss bingley was quite uncomfortable ; [[his]121-mr. jones sisters]282-his sisters declared that [they]282-his sisters were miserable . [They]282-his sisters solaced [their]282-his sisters wretchedness , however , by duets after supper ; while [he]121-mr. jones could find no better relief to [his]121-mr. jones feelings than by giving [[his]121-mr. jones housekeeper]538-his housekeeper directions that every possible attention might be paid to [the sick lady]539-the sick lady and [[her]539-the sick lady sister]328-her sister .

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth passed the chief of the night in [[[her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister 's room]542-her sister 's room , and in the morning had the pleasure of being able to send a tolerable answer to the inquiries which [she]82-elizabeth very early received from [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley by [a housemaid]543-a housemaid , and some time afterwards from [the two elegant ladies who waited on [[his]121-mr. jones sisters]282-his sisters]544-the two elegant ladies who waited on his sisters . In spite of this amendment , however , [she]82-elizabeth requested to have a note sent to [Longbourn]7-longbourn , desiring [[her]82-elizabeth mother]241-her mother to visit [Jane]83-jane , and form [her]82-elizabeth own judgment of [her]82-elizabeth situation . The note was immediately despatched , and its contents as quickly complied with . [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet , accompanied by [[her]85-mrs. bennet two youngest girls]547-her two youngest girls , reached [Netherfield]2-netherfield soon after the family breakfast .

Had [she]82-elizabeth found [Jane]83-jane in any apparent danger , [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet would have been very miserable ; but being satisfied on seeing [her]85-mrs. bennet that [her]85-mrs. bennet illness was not alarming , [she]82-elizabeth had no wish of [her]85-mrs. bennet recovering immediately , as [her]85-mrs. bennet restoration to health would probably remove [her]85-mrs. bennet from [Netherfield]2-netherfield . [She]82-elizabeth would not listen , therefore , to [[her]82-elizabeth daughter]463-her daughter 's proposal of being carried [home]3219-home ; neither did [the apothecary , who arrived about the same time]550-the apothecary , who arrived about the same time , think it at all advisable . After sitting a little while with [Jane]83-jane , on [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley 's appearance and invitation , [the mother]395-the mother and [three daughters]552-three daughters all attended [her]85-mrs. bennet into [the breakfast parlour]483-the breakfast parlour . [Bingley]91-miss bingley met [them]552-three daughters with hopes that [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet had not found [Miss Bennet]82-elizabeth worse than [she]82-elizabeth expected .

" Indeed [I]82-elizabeth have , [sir]3161-sir , "[82-elizabeth] was [her]82-elizabeth answer . " [She]82-elizabeth is a great deal too ill to be moved . [Mr. Jones]121-mr. jones says [we]3279-we must not think of moving [her]82-elizabeth . [We]3279-we must trespass a little longer on [your]85-mrs. bennet kindness . "[82-elizabeth]

" Removed ! "[91-miss bingley] cried [Bingley]91-miss bingley . " It must not be thought of . [[My]91-miss bingley sister]3280-my sister , [I]91-miss bingley am sure , will not hear of [her]82-elizabeth removal . "[91-miss bingley]

" [You]85-mrs. bennet may depend upon it , [madam]3281-madam , "[91-miss bingley] said [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley , with cold civility , " that [Miss Bennet]82-elizabeth shall receive every possible attention while [she]82-elizabeth remains with [us]3279-we . "[91-miss bingley]

[Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet was profuse in [her]85-mrs. bennet acknowledgments .

" [I]85-mrs. bennet am sure , "[85-mrs. bennet] [she]85-mrs. bennet added , " if it was not for [such good friends]3282-such good friends , [I]85-mrs. bennet do not know what would become of [her]82-elizabeth , for [she]82-elizabeth is very ill indeed , and suffers a vast deal , though with the greatest patience in [the world]303-the world , which is always the way with [her]82-elizabeth , for [she]82-elizabeth has , without exception , the sweetest temper [I]85-mrs. bennet ever met with . [I]85-mrs. bennet often tell [[my]85-mrs. bennet other girls]3284-my other girls [they]3284-my other girls are nothing to _ [her]82-elizabeth _ . [You]3285-you have [a sweet room here]3286-a sweet room here , [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley , and a charming prospect over [that gravel walk]3287-that gravel walk . [I]85-mrs. bennet do not know [a place in [the country]448-the country that is equal to [Netherfield]2-netherfield]3288-a place in the country that is equal to netherfield . [You]3285-you will not think of quitting [it]3288-a place in the country that is equal to netherfield in a hurry , [I]85-mrs. bennet hope , though [you]3285-you have but a short lease . "[85-mrs. bennet]

" Whatever [I]554-i do is done in a hurry , "[554-i] replied [he]554-i ; " and therefore if [I]554-i should resolve to quit [Netherfield]2-netherfield , [I]554-i should probably be off in five minutes . At present , however , [I]554-i consider [myself]554-i as quite fixed here . "[554-i]

" That is exactly what [I]82-elizabeth should have supposed of [you]554-i , "[82-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth .

" [You]82-elizabeth begin to comprehend [me]554-i , do [you]82-elizabeth ? "[554-i] cried [he]554-i , turning towards [her]82-elizabeth .

" Oh yes -- [I]554-i understand [you]82-elizabeth perfectly . "[554-i]

" [I]554-i wish [I]554-i might take this for a compliment ; but to be so easily seen through , [I]554-i am afraid , is pitiful . "[554-i]

" That is as it happens . It does not necessarily follow that a deep , intricate character is more or less estimable than such a one as [yours]82-elizabeth . "[554-i]

" [Lizzy]82-elizabeth , "[554-i] cried [[her]82-elizabeth mother]241-her mother , " remember where [you]82-elizabeth are , and do not run on in the wild manner that [you]82-elizabeth are suffered to do at [home]3219-home . "[554-i]

" [I]79-mr. bingley did not know before , "[79-mr. bingley] continued [Bingley]79-mr. bingley , immediately , " that [you]82-elizabeth were [a studier of character]3291-a studier of character . It must be an amusing study . "[79-mr. bingley]

" Yes ; but [intricate characters]3292-intricate characters are the _ most _ amusing . [They]3292-intricate characters have at least that advantage . "[554-i]

" [The country]448-the country , "[124-miss darcy] said [Darcy]124-miss darcy , " can in general supply but few subjects for such a study . In [a country neighbourhood]3294-a country neighbourhood [you]82-elizabeth move in a very confined and unvarying society . "[124-miss darcy]

" But [people]3234-people [themselves]3234-people alter so much , that there is something new to be observed in [them]3234-people for ever . "[554-i]

" Yes , indeed , "[85-mrs. bennet] cried [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet , offended by [his]79-mr. bingley manner of mentioning [a country neighbourhood]3294-a country neighbourhood . " [I]85-mrs. bennet assure [you]82-elizabeth there is quite as much of _ that _ going on in [the country]448-the country as in [town]264-town . "[85-mrs. bennet]

[Everybody]304-everybody was surprised ; and [Darcy]124-miss darcy , after looking at [her]85-mrs. bennet for a moment , turned silently away . [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet , who fancied [she]85-mrs. bennet had gained a complete victory over [him]79-mr. bingley , continued [her]85-mrs. bennet triumph,--

" [I]85-mrs. bennet can not see that [London]5-london has any great advantage over [the country]448-the country , for [my]85-mrs. bennet part , except [the shops]3299-the shops and [public places]3300-public places . [The country]448-the country is a vast deal pleasanter , is not it , [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley ? "[85-mrs. bennet]

" When [I]79-mr. bingley am in [the country]448-the country , "[79-mr. bingley] [he]79-mr. bingley replied , " [I]79-mr. bingley never wish to leave it ; and when [I]79-mr. bingley am in [town]264-town , it is pretty much the same . [They]3304-they have each [their]3304-they advantages , and [I]79-mr. bingley can be equally happy in either . "[79-mr. bingley]

" Ay , that is because [you]82-elizabeth have the right disposition . But [that gentleman]3305-that gentleman , "[85-mrs. bennet] looking at [Darcy]124-miss darcy , " seemed to think [the country]448-the country was nothing at all . "[85-mrs. bennet]

" Indeed , [mamma]3033-mamma , [you]3033-mamma are mistaken , "[82-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , blushing for [[her]82-elizabeth mother]241-her mother . " [You]3033-mamma quite mistook [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy . [He]89-mr. darcy only meant that there was not such a variety of [people]3234-people to be met with in [the country]448-the country as in [town]264-town , which [you]82-elizabeth must acknowledge to be true . "[82-elizabeth]

" Certainly , [[my]559-his sister dear]2993-my dear , [nobody]3077-nobody said there were ; but as to not meeting with [many people in [this neighbourhood]3314-this neighbourhood]3313-many people in this neighbourhood , [I]559-his sister believe there are [few neighbourhoods larger]3315-few neighbourhoods larger . [I]559-his sister know [we]3316-we dine with [four - and - twenty families]3317-four - and - twenty families . "[559-his sister]

Nothing but concern for [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth could enable [Bingley]79-mr. bingley to keep [his]79-mr. bingley countenance . [[His]79-mr. bingley sister]559-his sister was less delicate , and directed [her]559-his sister eye towards [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy with a very expressive smile . [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , for the sake of saying something that might turn [[her]82-elizabeth mother]241-her mother 's thoughts , now asked [her]241-her mother if [Charlotte Lucas]101-charlotte had been at [Longbourn]7-longbourn since _ [her]101-charlotte _ coming away .

" Yes , [she]101-charlotte called yesterday with [[her]101-charlotte father]244-her father . What [an agreeable man]3319-an agreeable man [Sir William]80-sir william is , [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley -- is not [he]80-sir william ? so much [the man of fashion]3320-the man of fashion ! so genteel and so easy ! [He]80-sir william has always something to say to [everybody]304-everybody . _ That _ is [my]559-his sister idea of good breeding ; and [those persons who fancy [themselves]3322-those persons who fancy themselves very important and never open their mouths quite mistake the matter very important and never open [their]3322-those persons who fancy themselves very important and never open their mouths quite mistake the matter mouths quite mistake the matter]3322-those persons who fancy themselves very important and never open their mouths quite mistake the matter . "[559-his sister]

" Did [Charlotte]101-charlotte dine with [you]79-mr. bingley ? "[559-his sister]

" No , [she]101-charlotte would go [home]3219-home . [I]559-his sister fancy [she]101-charlotte was wanted about the mince - pies . For [my]559-his sister part , [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley , _ [I]559-his sister _ always keep [servants]3324-servants that can do [their]3324-servants own work ; _ [[my]559-his sister _ daughters]3325-my _ daughters are brought up differently . But [everybody]304-everybody is to judge for [themselves]304-everybody , and [the Lucases]100-the lucases are [a very good sort of girls]3327-a very good sort of girls , [I]559-his sister assure [you]79-mr. bingley . It is a pity [they]100-the lucases are not handsome ! Not that _ [I]559-his sister _ think [Charlotte]101-charlotte so _ very _ plain ; but then [she]101-charlotte is [[our]3328-our particular friend]3329-our particular friend . "[559-his sister]

" [She]101-charlotte seems [a very pleasant young woman]3330-a very pleasant young woman , "[79-mr. bingley] said [Bingley]79-mr. bingley .

" Oh dear , yes ; but [you]79-mr. bingley must own [she]101-charlotte is very plain . [Lady Lucas]81-lady lucas [herself]81-lady lucas has often said so , and envied [me]559-his sister [Jane]83-jane 's beauty . [I]559-his sister do not like to boast of [[my]559-his sister own child]3331-my own child ; but to be sure , [Jane]83-jane -- [one]3041-one does not often see [anybody]3099-anybody better looking . It is what [everybody]304-everybody says . [I]559-his sister do not trust [my]559-his sister own partiality . When [she]83-jane was only fifteen there was [a gentleman at [[my]559-his sister brother]3212-my brother [Gardiner]125-mrs. gardiner 's in [town]264-town]3335-a gentleman at my brother gardiner 's in town so much in love with [her]83-jane , that [[my]559-his sister sister - in - law]3338-my sister - in - law was sure [he]3335-a gentleman at my brother gardiner 's in town would make [her]83-jane an offer before [we]3339-we came away . But , however , [he]3335-a gentleman at my brother gardiner 's in town did not . Perhaps [he]3335-a gentleman at my brother gardiner 's in town thought [her]83-jane too young . However , [he]3335-a gentleman at my brother gardiner 's in town wrote some verses on [her]83-jane , and very pretty they were . "[559-his sister]

" And so ended [his]3335-a gentleman at my brother gardiner 's in town affection , "[82-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , impatiently . " There has been many a one , [I]82-elizabeth fancy , overcome in the same way . [I]82-elizabeth wonder who first discovered the efficacy of poetry in driving away love ! "[82-elizabeth]

" [I]89-mr. darcy have been used to consider poetry as the _ food _ of love , "[89-mr. darcy] said [Darcy]89-mr. darcy .

" Of a fine , stout , healthy love it may . Everything nourishes what is strong already . But if it be only a slight , thin sort of inclination , [I]82-elizabeth am convinced that [one good sonnet]3340-one good sonnet will starve it entirely away . "[82-elizabeth]

[Darcy]89-mr. darcy only smiled ; and the general pause which ensued made [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth tremble lest [[her]82-elizabeth mother]241-her mother should be exposing [herself]241-her mother again . [She]82-elizabeth longed to speak , but could think of nothing to say ; and after a short silence [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet began repeating [her]85-mrs. bennet thanks to [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley for [his]79-mr. bingley kindness to [Jane]83-jane , with an apology for troubling [him]79-mr. bingley also with [Lizzy]82-elizabeth . [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley was unaffectedly civil in [his]79-mr. bingley answer , and forced [[his]79-mr. bingley younger sister]562-his younger sister to be civil also , and say what the occasion required . [She]562-his younger sister performed [her]562-his younger sister part , indeed , without much graciousness , but [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet was satisfied , and soon afterwards ordered [[her]562-his younger sister carriage]563-her carriage . Upon this signal , [the youngest of [[her]241-her mother daughters]237-her daughters]564-the youngest of her daughters put [herself]564-the youngest of her daughters forward . [The two girls]566-the two girls had been whispering to each other during the whole visit ; and the result of it was , that [the youngest]567-the youngest should tax [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley with having promised on [his]79-mr. bingley first coming into [the country]448-the country to give a ball at [Netherfield]2-netherfield .

[Lydia]84-lydia was [a stout , well - grown girl of fifteen , with a fine complexion and good - humoured countenance]569-a stout , well - grown girl of fifteen , with a fine complexion and good - humoured countenance ; [a favourite with [[her]84-lydia mother]241-her mother , whose affection had brought [her]84-lydia into public at an early age]570-a favourite with her mother , whose affection had brought her into public at an early age . [She]84-lydia had high animal spirits , and a sort of natural self - consequence , which the attentions of [the officers]454-the officers , to whom [[her]84-lydia uncle]573-her uncle 's good dinners and [her]84-lydia own easy manners recommended [her]84-lydia , had increased into assurance . [She]84-lydia was very equal , therefore , to address [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley on the subject of the ball , and abruptly reminded [him]79-mr. bingley of [his]79-mr. bingley promise ; adding , that it would be the most shameful thing in [the world]303-the world if [he]79-mr. bingley did not keep it . [His]79-mr. bingley answer to this sudden attack was delightful to [[her]84-lydia mother]241-her mother 's ear .

" [I]79-mr. bingley am perfectly ready , [I]79-mr. bingley assure [you]241-her mother , to keep [my]79-mr. bingley engagement ; and , when [[your]241-her mother sister]3139-your sister is recovered , [you]241-her mother shall , if [you]241-her mother please , name the very day of the ball . But [you]241-her mother would not wish to be dancing while [she]3139-your sister is ill ? "[79-mr. bingley]

[Lydia]84-lydia declared [herself]84-lydia satisfied . " Oh yes -- it would be much better to wait till [Jane]83-jane was well ; and by that time , most likely , [Captain Carter]112-captain carter would be at [Meryton]9-meryton again . And when [you]241-her mother have given _ [your]241-her mother _ ball , "[84-lydia] [she]84-lydia added , " [I]84-lydia shall insist on [their]3342-their giving one also . [I]84-lydia shall tell [Colonel Forster]107-colonel forster it will be quite a shame if [he]107-colonel forster does not . "[84-lydia]

[Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet and [[her]85-mrs. bennet daughters]237-her daughters then departed , and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth returned instantly to [Jane]83-jane , leaving [her]82-elizabeth own and [[her]82-elizabeth relations]577-her relations ' behaviour to the remarks of [the two ladies]501-the two ladies and [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy ; [the latter of whom]579-the latter of whom , however , could not be prevailed on to join in [their]501-the two ladies censure of _ [her]83-jane _ , in spite of all [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley 's witticisms on _ fine eyes _ .

The day passed much as the day before had done . [Mrs. Hurst]90-mrs. hurst and [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley had spent some hours of the morning with [the invalid , who continued , though slowly , to mend]580-the invalid , who continued , though slowly , to mend ; and , in the evening , [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth joined [their]501-the two ladies party in [the drawing - room]520-the drawing - room . The loo table , however , did not appear . [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy was writing , and [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley , seated near [him]89-mr. darcy , was watching the progress of [his]89-mr. darcy letter , and repeatedly calling off [his]89-mr. darcy attention by messages to [[his]89-mr. darcy sister]559-his sister . [Mr. Hurst]88-mr. hurst and [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley were at piquet , and [Mrs. Hurst]90-mrs. hurst was observing [their]501-the two ladies game .

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth took up some needlework , and was sufficiently amused in attending to what passed between [Darcy]89-mr. darcy and [[his]89-mr. darcy companion]424-his companion . The perpetual commendations of [the lady]584-the lady either on [his]89-mr. darcy hand - writing , or on the evenness of [his]89-mr. darcy lines , or on the length of [his]89-mr. darcy letter , with the perfect unconcern with which [her]584-the lady praises were received , formed a curious dialogue , and was exactly in unison with [her]584-the lady opinion of each .

" How delighted [Miss Darcy]124-miss darcy will be to receive such a letter ! "[89-mr. darcy]

[He]89-mr. darcy made no answer .

" [You]89-mr. darcy write uncommonly fast . "[585-i]

" [You]89-mr. darcy are mistaken . [I]585-i write rather slowly . "[585-i]

" How many letters [you]89-mr. darcy must have occasion to write in the course of a year ! Letters of business , too ! How odious [I]585-i should think them ! "[585-i]

" It is fortunate , then , that they fall to [my]585-i lot instead of to [yours]89-mr. darcy . "[585-i]

" Pray tell [[your]89-mr. darcy sister]3139-your sister that [I]585-i long to see [her]3139-your sister . "[585-i]

" [I]585-i have already told [her]3139-your sister so once , by [your]585-i desire . "[585-i]

" [I]585-i am afraid [you]585-i do not like [your]585-i pen . Let [me]585-i mend it for [you]585-i . [I]585-i mend pens remarkably well . "[585-i]

" Thank [you]585-i -- but [I]585-i always mend [my]585-i own . "[585-i]

" How can [you]585-i contrive to write so even ? "[585-i]

[He]585-i was silent .

" Tell [[your]89-mr. darcy sister]3139-your sister [I]585-i am delighted to hear of [her]3139-your sister improvement on the harp , and pray let [her]3139-your sister know that [I]585-i am quite in raptures with [her]3139-your sister beautiful little design for a table , and [I]585-i think it infinitely superior to [Miss Grantley]126-miss grantley 's . "[585-i]

" Will [you]585-i give [me]585-i leave to defer [your]585-i raptures till [I]585-i write again ? At present [I]585-i have not room to do [them]3345-them justice . "[585-i]

" Oh , it is of no consequence . [I]585-i shall see [her]3139-your sister in [January]14-january . But do [you]585-i always write such charming long letters to [her]3139-your sister , [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy ? "[585-i]

" They are generally long ; but whether always charming , it is not for [me]585-i to determine . "[585-i]

" It is a rule with [me]585-i , that [a person who can write a long letter with ease]3346-a person who can write a long letter with ease can not write ill . "[585-i]

" That will not do for a compliment to [Darcy]89-mr. darcy , [Caroline]118-caroline , "[585-i] cried [[her]586-her brother]3108-her brother , " because [he]89-mr. darcy does _ not _ write with ease . [He]89-mr. darcy studies too much for words of four syllables . Do not [you]585-i , [Darcy]89-mr. darcy ? "[585-i]

" [My]585-i style of writing is very different from [yours]585-i . "[585-i]

" Oh , "[91-miss bingley] cried [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley , " [Charles]122-charles writes in the most careless way imaginable . [He]122-charles leaves out half [his]122-charles words , and blots the rest . "[91-miss bingley]

" [My]585-i ideas flow so rapidly that [I]585-i have not time to express them ; by which means [my]585-i letters sometimes convey no ideas at all to [[my]585-i correspondents]3347-my correspondents . "[585-i]

" [Your]89-mr. darcy humility , [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley , "[82-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , " must disarm reproof . "[82-elizabeth]

" Nothing is more deceitful , "[89-mr. darcy] said [Darcy]89-mr. darcy , " than the appearance of humility . It is often only carelessness of opinion , and sometimes an indirect boast . "[89-mr. darcy]

" And which of the two do [you]585-i call _ [my]585-i _ little recent piece of modesty ? "[585-i]

" The indirect boast ; for [you]89-mr. darcy are really proud of [your]89-mr. darcy defects in writing , because [you]89-mr. darcy consider them as proceeding from a rapidity of thought and carelessness of execution , which , if not estimable , [you]89-mr. darcy think at least highly interesting . The power of doing anything with quickness is always much prized by [the possessor]3348-the possessor , and often without any attention to the imperfection of the performance . When [you]89-mr. darcy told [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet this morning , that if [you]89-mr. darcy ever resolved on quitting [Netherfield]2-netherfield [you]89-mr. darcy should be gone in five minutes , [you]89-mr. darcy meant it to be a sort of panegyric , of compliment to [yourself]89-mr. darcy ; and yet what is there so very laudable in a precipitance which must leave very necessary business undone , and can be of no real advantage to [yourself]89-mr. darcy or [anyone else]3349-anyone else ? "[89-mr. darcy]

" Nay , "[79-mr. bingley] cried [Bingley]79-mr. bingley , " this is too much , to remember at night all the foolish things that were said in the morning . And yet , upon [my]89-mr. darcy honour , [I]89-mr. darcy believed what [I]89-mr. darcy said of [myself]89-mr. darcy to be true , and [I]89-mr. darcy believe it at this moment . At least , therefore , [I]89-mr. darcy did not assume the character of needless precipitance merely to show off before [the ladies]249-the ladies . "[89-mr. darcy]

" [I]89-mr. darcy daresay [you]79-mr. bingley believed it ; but [I]89-mr. darcy am by no means convinced that [you]79-mr. bingley would be gone with such celerity . [Your]79-mr. bingley conduct would be quite as dependent on chance as that of [any man [I]89-mr. darcy know]3351-any man i know ; and if , as [you]79-mr. bingley were mounting [your]79-mr. bingley horse , [a friend]3352-a friend were to say , ' [Bingley]79-mr. bingley , [you]79-mr. bingley had better stay till next week , ' [you]79-mr. bingley would probably do it -- [you]79-mr. bingley would probably not go -- and , at another word , might stay a month . "[89-mr. darcy]

" [You]79-mr. bingley have only proved by this , "[82-elizabeth] cried [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , " that [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley did not do justice to [his]79-mr. bingley own disposition . [You]79-mr. bingley have shown [him]79-mr. bingley off now much more than [he]79-mr. bingley did [himself]79-mr. bingley . "[82-elizabeth]

" [I]79-mr. bingley am exceedingly gratified , "[79-mr. bingley] said [Bingley]79-mr. bingley , " by [your]79-mr. bingley converting what [[my]79-mr. bingley friend]3353-my friend says into a compliment on the sweetness of [my]79-mr. bingley temper . But [I]79-mr. bingley am afraid [you]79-mr. bingley are giving it a turn which [that gentleman]3305-that gentleman did by no means intend ; for [he]3305-that gentleman would certainly think the better of [me]79-mr. bingley if , under such a circumstance , [I]79-mr. bingley were to give a flat denial , and ride off as fast as [I]79-mr. bingley could . "[79-mr. bingley]

" Would [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy then consider the rashness of [your]79-mr. bingley original intention as atoned for by [your]79-mr. bingley obstinacy in adhering to it ? "[89-mr. darcy]

" Upon [my]89-mr. darcy word , [I]89-mr. darcy can not exactly explain the matter -- [Darcy]89-mr. darcy must speak for [himself]89-mr. darcy . "[89-mr. darcy]

" [You]79-mr. bingley expect [me]89-mr. darcy to account for opinions which [you]79-mr. bingley choose to call [mine]89-mr. darcy , but which [I]89-mr. darcy have never acknowledged . Allowing the case , however , to stand according to [your]79-mr. bingley representation , [you]79-mr. bingley must remember , [Miss Bennet]82-elizabeth , that [the friend who is supposed to desire [his]3305-that gentleman return to [the house]3001-the house , and the delay of [his]3305-that gentleman plan]3355-the friend who is supposed to desire his return to the house , and the delay of his plan , has merely desired it , asked it without offering one argument in favour of its propriety . "[89-mr. darcy]

" To yield readily -- easily -- to the _ persuasion _ of [a friend]3352-a friend is no merit with [you]79-mr. bingley . "[89-mr. darcy]

" To yield without conviction is no compliment to the understanding of either . "[89-mr. darcy]

" [You]79-mr. bingley appear to [me]89-mr. darcy , [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy , to allow nothing for the influence of friendship and affection . A regard for [the requester]3358-the requester would often make [one]3041-one readily yield to a request , without waiting for arguments to reason one into it . [I]89-mr. darcy am not particularly speaking of such a case as [you]79-mr. bingley have supposed about [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley . [We]3360-we may as well wait , perhaps , till the circumstance occurs , before [we]3360-we discuss the discretion of [his]79-mr. bingley behaviour thereupon . But in general and ordinary cases , between [friend]3361-friend and [friend]3361-friend , where one of [them]3363-them is desired by the other to change a resolution of no very great moment , should [you]79-mr. bingley think ill of [that person]3364-that person for complying with the desire , without waiting to be argued into it ? "[89-mr. darcy]

" Will it not be advisable , before [we]3360-we proceed on this subject , to arrange with rather more precision the degree of importance which is to appertain to this request , as well as the degree of intimacy subsisting between [the parties]3149-the parties ? "[89-mr. darcy]

" By all means , "[79-mr. bingley] cried [Bingley]79-mr. bingley ; " let [us]3360-we hear all the particulars , not forgetting [their]3363-them comparative height and size , for that will have more weight in the argument , [Miss Bennet]82-elizabeth , than [you]79-mr. bingley may be aware of . [I]79-mr. bingley assure [you]79-mr. bingley that if [Darcy]89-mr. darcy were not such [a great tall fellow]3366-a great tall fellow , in comparison with [myself]79-mr. bingley , [I]79-mr. bingley should not pay [him]89-mr. darcy half so much deference . [I]79-mr. bingley declare [I]79-mr. bingley do not know a more awful object than [Darcy]89-mr. darcy on particular occasions , and in particular places ; at [[his]89-mr. darcy own house]3147-his own house especially , and of a Sunday evening , when [he]89-mr. darcy has nothing to do . "[79-mr. bingley]

[Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy smiled ; but [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth thought [she]82-elizabeth could perceive that [he]89-mr. darcy was rather offended , and therefore checked [her]82-elizabeth laugh . [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley warmly resented the indignity [he]89-mr. darcy had received , in an expostulation with [[her]91-miss bingley brother]3108-her brother for talking such nonsense .

" [I]286-his friend see [your]89-mr. darcy design , [Bingley]79-mr. bingley , "[286-his friend] said [[his]89-mr. darcy friend]286-his friend . " [You]89-mr. darcy dislike an argument , and want to silence this . "[286-his friend]

" Perhaps [I]89-mr. darcy do . Arguments are too much like disputes . If [you]89-mr. darcy and [Miss Bennet]82-elizabeth will defer [yours]89-mr. darcy till [I]89-mr. darcy am out of [the room]250-the room , [I]89-mr. darcy shall be very thankful ; and then [you]89-mr. darcy may say whatever [you]89-mr. darcy like of [me]89-mr. darcy . "[89-mr. darcy]

" What [you]89-mr. darcy ask , "[82-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , " is no sacrifice on [my]82-elizabeth side ; and [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy had much better finish [his]89-mr. darcy letter . "[82-elizabeth]

[Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy took [her]82-elizabeth advice , and did finish [his]89-mr. darcy letter .

When that business was over , [he]89-mr. darcy applied to [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth for the indulgence of some music . [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley moved with alacrity to the pianoforte , and after a polite request that [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth would lead the way , which [the other]590-the other as politely and more earnestly negatived , [she]82-elizabeth seated [herself]82-elizabeth .

[Mrs. Hurst]90-mrs. hurst sang with [[her]90-mrs. hurst sister]328-her sister ; and while [they]592-they were thus employed , [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth could not help observing , as [she]82-elizabeth turned over some music - books that lay on the instrument , how frequently [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy 's eyes were fixed on [her]82-elizabeth . [She]82-elizabeth hardly knew how to suppose that [she]82-elizabeth could be an object of admiration to [so great a man]593-so great a man , and yet that [he]89-mr. darcy should look at [her]82-elizabeth because [he]89-mr. darcy disliked [her]82-elizabeth was still more strange . [She]82-elizabeth could only imagine , however , at last , that [she]82-elizabeth drew [his]89-mr. darcy notice because there was something about [her]82-elizabeth more wrong and reprehensible , according to [his]89-mr. darcy ideas of right , than in [any other person present]594-any other person present . The supposition did not pain [her]82-elizabeth . [She]82-elizabeth liked [him]89-mr. darcy too little to care for [his]89-mr. darcy approbation .

After playing some Italian songs , [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley varied the charm by a lively Scotch air ; and soon afterwards [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy , drawing near [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , said to [her,--]82-elizabeth

" Do [you]82-elizabeth not feel a great inclination , [Miss Bennet]82-elizabeth , to seize such an opportunity of dancing a reel ? "[89-mr. darcy]

[She]82-elizabeth smiled , but made no answer . [He]89-mr. darcy repeated the question , with some surprise at [her]82-elizabeth silence .

" Oh , "[82-elizabeth] said [she]82-elizabeth , " [I]82-elizabeth heard [you]89-mr. darcy before ; but [I]82-elizabeth could not immediately determine what to say in reply . [You]89-mr. darcy wanted [me]82-elizabeth , [I]82-elizabeth know , to say ' Yes , ' that [you]89-mr. darcy might have the pleasure of despising [my]82-elizabeth taste ; but [I]82-elizabeth always delight in overthrowing those kind of schemes , and cheating [a person]3130-a person of [their]3130-a person premeditated contempt . [I]82-elizabeth have , therefore , made up [my]82-elizabeth mind to tell [you]89-mr. darcy that [I]82-elizabeth do not want to dance a reel at all ; and now despise [me]82-elizabeth if [you]89-mr. darcy dare . "[82-elizabeth]

" Indeed [I]82-elizabeth do not dare . "[82-elizabeth]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , having rather expected to affront [him]595-him , was amazed at [his]595-him gallantry ; but there was a mixture of sweetness and archness in [her]82-elizabeth manner which made it difficult for [her]82-elizabeth to affront [anybody]3099-anybody , and [Darcy]89-mr. darcy had never been so bewitched by [any woman]597-any woman as [he]89-mr. darcy was by [her]82-elizabeth . [He]89-mr. darcy really believed that , were it not for the inferiority of [her]82-elizabeth connections , [he]89-mr. darcy should be in some danger .

[Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley saw , or suspected , enough to be jealous ; and [her]91-miss bingley great anxiety for the recovery of [[her]91-miss bingley dear friend]598-her dear friend [Jane]83-jane received some assistance from [her]91-miss bingley desire of getting rid of [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth .

[She]82-elizabeth often tried to provoke [Darcy]89-mr. darcy into disliking [[her]82-elizabeth guest]599-her guest , by talking of [their]600-their supposed marriage , and planning [his]89-mr. darcy happiness in such an alliance .

" [I]82-elizabeth hope , "[82-elizabeth] said [she]82-elizabeth , as [they]600-their were walking together in the shrubbery the next day , " [you]89-mr. darcy will give [[your]89-mr. darcy mother - in - law]3370-your mother - in - law a few hints , when this desirable event takes place , as to the advantage of holding [her]3370-your mother - in - law tongue ; and if [you]89-mr. darcy can compass it , to cure [the younger girls]3371-the younger girls of running after [the officers]454-the officers . And , if [I]82-elizabeth may mention so delicate a subject , endeavour to check that little something , bordering on conceit and impertinence , which [[your]89-mr. darcy lady]3373-your lady possesses . "[82-elizabeth]

" Have [you]89-mr. darcy anything else to propose for [my]82-elizabeth domestic felicity ? "[82-elizabeth]

" Oh yes . Do let the portraits of [[your]89-mr. darcy uncle]3374-your uncle and [aunt Philips]3375-aunt philips be placed in [the gallery at [Pemberley]12-pemberley]3376-the gallery at pemberley . Put them next to [[your]89-mr. darcy great - uncle]3377-your great - uncle [the judge]3378-the judge . [They]601-they are in the same profession , [you]89-mr. darcy know , only in different lines . As for [your]89-mr. darcy [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth 's picture , [you]89-mr. darcy must not attempt to have it taken , for what painter could do justice to those beautiful eyes ? "[82-elizabeth]

" It would not be easy , indeed , to catch [their]601-they expression ; but [their]601-they colour and shape , and the eyelashes , so remarkably fine , might be copied . "[82-elizabeth]

At that moment [they]601-they were met from another walk by [Mrs. Hurst]90-mrs. hurst and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth [herself]82-elizabeth .

" [I]91-miss bingley did not know that [you]89-mr. darcy intended to walk , "[91-miss bingley] said [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley , in some confusion , lest [they]601-they had been overheard .

" [You]89-mr. darcy used [us]601-they abominably ill , "[90-mrs. hurst] answered [Mrs. Hurst]90-mrs. hurst , " running away without telling [us]601-they that [you]89-mr. darcy were coming out . "[90-mrs. hurst]

Then taking the disengaged arm of [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy , [she]90-mrs. hurst left [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth to walk by [herself]82-elizabeth . [The path]602-the path just admitted [three]603-three . [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy felt [their]601-they rudeness , and immediately said,--

" [This walk]3379-this walk is not wide enough for [[our]601-they party]3380-our party . [We]601-they had better go into [the avenue]3381-the avenue . "[89-mr. darcy]

But [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , who had not the least inclination to remain with [them]601-they , laughingly answered,--

" No , no ; stay where [you]89-mr. darcy are . [You]89-mr. darcy are charmingly grouped , and appear to uncommon advantage . The picturesque would be spoilt by admitting a fourth . Good - bye . "[82-elizabeth]

[She]82-elizabeth then ran gaily off , rejoicing , as [she]82-elizabeth rambled about , in the hope of being at [home]3219-home again in a day or two . [Jane]83-jane was already so much recovered as to intend leaving [[her]83-jane room]489-her room for a couple of hours that evening .

When [the ladies]249-the ladies removed after dinner [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth ran up to [[her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister , and seeing [her]328-her sister well guarded from cold , attended [her]328-her sister into [the drawing - room]520-the drawing - room , where [she]82-elizabeth was welcomed by [[her]82-elizabeth two friends]609-her two friends with many professions of pleasure ; and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth had never seen [them]609-her two friends so agreeable as [they]609-her two friends were during the hour which passed before [the gentlemen]290-the gentlemen appeared . [Their]609-her two friends powers of conversation were considerable . [They]609-her two friends could describe an entertainment with accuracy , relate an anecdote with humour , and laugh at [their]609-her two friends acquaintance with spirit .

But when [the gentlemen]290-the gentlemen entered , [Jane]83-jane was no longer [the first object]612-the first object ; [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley 's eyes were instantly turned towards [Darcy]89-mr. darcy , and [she]91-miss bingley had something to say to [him]89-mr. darcy before [he]89-mr. darcy had advanced many steps . [He]89-mr. darcy addressed [himself]89-mr. darcy directly to [Miss Bennet]82-elizabeth with a polite congratulation ; [Mr. Hurst]88-mr. hurst also made [her]82-elizabeth a slight bow , and said [he]89-mr. darcy was " very glad ; "[89-mr. darcy] but diffuseness and warmth remained for [Bingley]91-miss bingley 's salutation . [He]89-mr. darcy was full of joy and attention . The first half hour was spent in piling up the fire , lest [she]82-elizabeth should suffer from the change of room ; and [she]82-elizabeth removed , at [his]89-mr. darcy desire , to the other side of the fireplace , that [she]82-elizabeth might be farther from the door . [He]89-mr. darcy then sat down by [her]82-elizabeth , and talked scarcely to [anyone else]3349-anyone else . [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , at work in the opposite corner , saw it all with great delight .

When tea was over [Mr. Hurst]88-mr. hurst reminded [[his]88-mr. hurst sister - in - law]614-his sister - in - law of the card - table -- but in vain . [She]614-his sister - in - law had obtained private intelligence that [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy did not wish for cards , and [Mr. Hurst]88-mr. hurst soon found even [his]88-mr. hurst open petition rejected . [She]614-his sister - in - law assured [him]88-mr. hurst that [no one]3271-no one intended to play , and the silence of [the whole party]521-the whole party on the subject seemed to justify [her]614-his sister - in - law . [Mr. Hurst]88-mr. hurst had , therefore , nothing to do but to stretch [himself]88-mr. hurst on one of the sofas and go to sleep . [Darcy]89-mr. darcy took up a book . [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley did the same ; and [Mrs. Hurst]90-mrs. hurst , principally occupied in playing with [her]90-mrs. hurst bracelets and rings , joined now and then in [[her]90-mrs. hurst brother]3108-her brother 's conversation with [Miss Bennet]82-elizabeth .

[Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley 's attention was quite as much engaged in watching [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy 's progress through _ [his]89-mr. darcy _ book , as in reading [her]91-miss bingley own ; and [she]91-miss bingley was perpetually either making some inquiry , or looking at [his]89-mr. darcy page . [She]91-miss bingley could not win [him]89-mr. darcy , however , to any conversation ; [he]89-mr. darcy merely answered [her]91-miss bingley question and read on . At length , quite exhausted by the attempt to be amused with [her]91-miss bingley own book , which [she]91-miss bingley had only chosen because it was the second volume of [his]89-mr. darcy , [she]91-miss bingley gave a great yawn and said , " How pleasant it is to spend an evening in this way ! [I]91-miss bingley declare , after all , there is no enjoyment like reading ! How much sooner one tires of anything than of a book ! When [I]91-miss bingley have [a house of [my]91-miss bingley own]3382-a house of my own , [I]91-miss bingley shall be miserable if [I]91-miss bingley have not [an excellent library]3383-an excellent library . "[91-miss bingley]

[No one]3271-no one made any reply . [She]91-miss bingley then yawned again , threw aside [her]91-miss bingley book , and cast [her]91-miss bingley eyes round [the room]250-the room in quest of some amusement ; when , hearing [[her]91-miss bingley brother]3108-her brother mentioning a ball to [Miss Bennet]82-elizabeth , [she]91-miss bingley turned suddenly towards [him]3108-her brother and said,--

" By the bye [Charles]122-charles , are [you]122-charles really serious in meditating a dance at [Netherfield]2-netherfield ? [I]91-miss bingley would advise [you]122-charles , before [you]122-charles determine on it , to consult the wishes of [the present party]3384-the present party ; [I]91-miss bingley am much mistaken if there are not some among [us]3385-us [to whom a ball would be rather a punishment than a pleasure]3386-to whom a ball would be rather a punishment than a pleasure . "[91-miss bingley]

" If [you]91-miss bingley mean [Darcy]89-mr. darcy , "[3108-her brother] cried [[her]91-miss bingley brother]3108-her brother , " [he]89-mr. darcy may go to bed , if [he]89-mr. darcy chooses , before it begins ; but as for the ball , it is quite a settled thing , and as soon as [Nicholls]127-nicholls has made white soup enough [I]91-miss bingley shall send round [my]91-miss bingley cards . "[91-miss bingley]

" [I]91-miss bingley should like balls infinitely better , "[91-miss bingley] [she]91-miss bingley replied , " if they were carried on in a different manner ; but there is something insufferably tedious in the usual process of such a meeting . It would surely be much more rational if conversation instead of dancing made the order of the day . "[91-miss bingley]

" Much more rational , [[my]91-miss bingley dear]2993-my dear [Caroline]118-caroline , [I]91-miss bingley dare say ; but it would not be near so much like a ball . "[91-miss bingley]

[Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley made no answer , and soon afterwards got up and walked about [the room]250-the room . [Her]91-miss bingley figure was elegant , and [she]91-miss bingley walked well ; but [Darcy]89-mr. darcy , at whom it was all aimed , was still inflexibly studious . In the desperation of [her]91-miss bingley feelings , [she]91-miss bingley resolved on one effort more ; and , turning to [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , said,--

" [Miss Eliza Bennet]82-elizabeth , let [me]91-miss bingley persuade [you]82-elizabeth to follow [my]91-miss bingley example , and take a turn about [the room]250-the room . [I]91-miss bingley assure [you]82-elizabeth it is very refreshing after sitting so long in one attitude . "[91-miss bingley]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth was surprised , but agreed to it immediately . [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley succeeded no less in the real object of [her]91-miss bingley civility : [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy looked up . [He]89-mr. darcy was as much awake to the novelty of attention in that quarter as [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth [herself]82-elizabeth could be , and unconsciously closed [his]89-mr. darcy book . [He]89-mr. darcy was directly invited to join [[their]623-their party]624-their party , but [he]89-mr. darcy declined it , observing that [he]89-mr. darcy could imagine but two motives for [their]623-their choosing to walk up and down [the room]250-the room together , with either of which motives [his]89-mr. darcy joining [them]623-their would interfere . What could [he]89-mr. darcy mean ? [She]82-elizabeth was dying to know what could be [his]89-mr. darcy meaning -- and asked [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth whether [she]82-elizabeth could at all understand [him]89-mr. darcy .

" Not at all , "[82-elizabeth] was [her]82-elizabeth answer ; " but , depend upon it , [he]89-mr. darcy means to be severe on [us]623-their , and [our]623-their surest way of disappointing [him]89-mr. darcy will be to ask nothing about it . "[82-elizabeth]

[Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley , however , was incapable of disappointing [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy in anything , and persevered , therefore , in requiring an explanation of [his]89-mr. darcy two motives .

" [I]89-mr. darcy have not the smallest objection to explaining them , "[89-mr. darcy] said [he]89-mr. darcy , as soon as [she]82-elizabeth allowed [him]89-mr. darcy to speak . " [You]82-elizabeth either choose this method of passing the evening because [you]82-elizabeth are in [each other]3144-each other 's confidence , and have secret affairs to discuss , or because [you]82-elizabeth are conscious that [your]82-elizabeth figures appear to the greatest advantage in walking : if the first , [I]89-mr. darcy should be completely in [your]82-elizabeth way ; and if the second , [I]89-mr. darcy can admire [you]82-elizabeth much better as [I]89-mr. darcy sit by the fire . "[89-mr. darcy]

" Oh , shocking ! "[91-miss bingley] cried [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley . " [I]91-miss bingley never heard anything so abominable . How shall [we]3390-we punish [him]89-mr. darcy for such a speech ? "[91-miss bingley]

" Nothing so easy , if [you]89-mr. darcy have but the inclination , "[82-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth . " [We]3390-we can all plague and punish [one another]3391-one another . Tease [him]89-mr. darcy -- laugh at [him]89-mr. darcy . Intimate as [you]89-mr. darcy are , [you]89-mr. darcy must know how it is to be done . "[82-elizabeth]

" But upon [my]91-miss bingley honour [I]91-miss bingley do _ not _ . [I]91-miss bingley do assure [you]89-mr. darcy that [my]91-miss bingley intimacy has not yet taught [me]91-miss bingley _ that _ . Tease calmness of temper and presence of mind ! No , no ; [I]91-miss bingley feel [he]89-mr. darcy may defy [us]3390-we [there]305-there . And as to laughter , [we]3390-we will not expose [ourselves]3390-we , if [you]89-mr. darcy please , by attempting to laugh without a subject . [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy may hug [himself]89-mr. darcy . "[91-miss bingley]

" [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy is not to be laughed at ! "[82-elizabeth] cried [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth . " That is an uncommon advantage , and uncommon [I]82-elizabeth hope it will continue , for it would be a great loss to _ [me]82-elizabeth _ to have many such acquaintance . [I]82-elizabeth dearly love a laugh . "[82-elizabeth]

" [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley , "[626-he] said [he]626-he , " has given [me]626-he credit for more than can be . [The wisest and best of [men,--nay]3394-men,--nay]3393-the wisest and best of men,--nay , the wisest and best of [their]3394-men,--nay actions,--may be rendered ridiculous by [a person whose first object in life is a joke]3395-a person whose first object in life is a joke . "[626-he]

" Certainly , "[82-elizabeth] replied [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , " there are [such people]3396-such people , but [I]82-elizabeth hope [I]82-elizabeth am not one of _ [them]3396-such people _ . [I]82-elizabeth hope [I]82-elizabeth never ridicule what is wise or good . Follies and nonsense , whims and inconsistencies , _ do _ divert [me]82-elizabeth , [I]82-elizabeth own , and [I]82-elizabeth laugh at [them]3396-such people whenever [I]82-elizabeth can . But these , [I]82-elizabeth suppose , are precisely what [you]82-elizabeth are without . "[82-elizabeth]

" Perhaps that is not possible for [anyone]3102-anyone . But it has been the study of [my]82-elizabeth life to avoid those weaknesses which often expose a strong understanding to ridicule . "[82-elizabeth]

" Such as vanity and pride . "[82-elizabeth]

" Yes , vanity is a weakness indeed . But pride -- where there is a real superiority of mind -- pride will be always under good regulation . "[82-elizabeth]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth turned away to hide a smile .

" [Your]91-miss bingley examination of [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy is over , [I]91-miss bingley presume , "[91-miss bingley] said [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley ; " and pray what is the result ? "[91-miss bingley]

" [I]82-elizabeth am perfectly convinced by it that [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy has no defect . [He]89-mr. darcy owns it [himself]89-mr. darcy without disguise . "[82-elizabeth]

" No , "[89-mr. darcy] said [Darcy]89-mr. darcy , " [I]89-mr. darcy have made no such pretension . [I]89-mr. darcy have faults enough , but they are not , [I]89-mr. darcy hope , of understanding . [My]89-mr. darcy temper [I]89-mr. darcy dare not vouch for . It is , [I]89-mr. darcy believe , too little yielding ; certainly too little for the convenience of [the world]303-the world . [I]89-mr. darcy can not forget the follies and vices of [others]3103-others so soon as [I]89-mr. darcy ought , nor [their]3103-others offences against [myself]89-mr. darcy . [My]89-mr. darcy feelings are not puffed about with every attempt to move them . [My]89-mr. darcy temper would perhaps be called resentful . [My]89-mr. darcy good opinion once lost is lost for ever . "[89-mr. darcy]

" _ That _ is a failing , indeed ! "[82-elizabeth] cried [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth . " Implacable resentment _ is _ a shade in a character . But [you]627-you have chosen [your]627-you fault well . [I]82-elizabeth really can not _ laugh _ at it . [You]627-you are safe from [me]82-elizabeth . "[82-elizabeth]

" There is , [I]89-mr. darcy believe , in every disposition a tendency to some particular evil , a natural defect , which not even the best education can overcome . "[89-mr. darcy]

" And _ [your]627-you _ defect is a propensity to hate [everybody]304-everybody . "[82-elizabeth]

" And [yours]627-you , "[627-you] [he]627-you replied , with a smile , " is wilfully to misunderstand [them]304-everybody . "[627-you]

" Do let [us]3401-us have a little music , "[91-miss bingley] cried [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley , tired of a conversation in which [she]91-miss bingley had no share . " [Louisa]117-louisa , [you]117-louisa will not mind [my]91-miss bingley waking [Mr. Hurst]88-mr. hurst . "[91-miss bingley]

[[Her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister made not the smallest objection , and the pianoforte was opened ; and [Darcy]89-mr. darcy , after a few moments ' recollection , was not sorry for it . [He]89-mr. darcy began to feel the danger of paying [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth too much attention .

In consequence of an agreement between [the sisters]492-the sisters , [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth wrote the next morning to [[her]82-elizabeth mother]241-her mother , to beg that [the carriage]3217-the carriage might be sent for [them]492-the sisters in the course of the day . But [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet , who had calculated on [[her]85-mrs. bennet daughters]237-her daughters remaining at [Netherfield]2-netherfield till the following Tuesday , which would exactly finish [Jane]83-jane 's week , could not bring [herself]85-mrs. bennet to receive [them]492-the sisters with pleasure before . [Her]85-mrs. bennet answer , therefore , was not propitious , at least not to [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth 's wishes , for [she]85-mrs. bennet was impatient to get [home]3219-home . [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet sent [them]492-the sisters word that [they]492-the sisters could not possibly have [the carriage]3217-the carriage before Tuesday ; and in [her]85-mrs. bennet postscript it was added , that if [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley and [[his]79-mr. bingley sister]559-his sister pressed [them]492-the sisters to stay longer , [she]85-mrs. bennet could spare [them]492-the sisters very well . Against staying longer , however , [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth was positively resolved -- nor did [she]82-elizabeth much expect it would be asked ; and fearful , on the contrary , of being considered as intruding [themselves]492-the sisters needlessly long , [she]82-elizabeth urged [Jane]83-jane to borrow [[Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley 's carriage]636-mr. bingley 's carriage immediately , and at length it was settled that [their]492-the sisters original design of leaving [Netherfield]2-netherfield that morning should be mentioned , and the request made .

The communication excited many professions of concern ; and enough was said of wishing [them]492-the sisters to stay at least till the following day to work on [Jane]83-jane ; and till the morrow [their]492-the sisters going was deferred . [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley was then sorry that [she]85-mrs. bennet had proposed the delay ; for [her]85-mrs. bennet jealousy and dislike of [one sister]637-one sister much exceeded [her]85-mrs. bennet affection for [the other]590-the other .

[The master of [the house]3001-the house]639-the master of the house heard with real sorrow that [they]492-the sisters were to go so soon , and repeatedly tried to persuade [Miss Bennet]82-elizabeth that it would not be safe for [her]83-jane -- that [she]83-jane was not enough recovered ; but [Jane]83-jane was firm where [she]83-jane felt [herself]83-jane to be right .

To [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy it was welcome intelligence : [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth had been at [Netherfield]2-netherfield long enough . [She]82-elizabeth attracted [him]89-mr. darcy more than [he]89-mr. darcy liked ; and [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley was uncivil to _ [her]82-elizabeth _ and more teasing than usual to [himself]89-mr. darcy . [He]89-mr. darcy wisely resolved to be particularly careful that no sign of admiration should _ now _ escape [him]89-mr. darcy -- nothing that could elevate [her]82-elizabeth with the hope of influencing [his]89-mr. darcy felicity ; sensible that , if such an idea had been suggested , [his]89-mr. darcy behaviour during the last day must have material weight in confirming or crushing it . Steady to [his]89-mr. darcy purpose , [he]89-mr. darcy scarcely spoke ten words to [her]82-elizabeth through the whole of Saturday : and though [they]641-they were at one time left by [themselves]641-they for half an hour , [he]89-mr. darcy adhered most conscientiously to [his]89-mr. darcy book , and would not even look at [her]82-elizabeth .

On Sunday , after morning service , the separation , so agreeable to almost all , took place . [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley 's civility to [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth increased at last very rapidly , as well as [her]91-miss bingley affection for [Jane]83-jane ; and when [they]641-they parted , after assuring [the latter]487-the latter of the pleasure it would always give [her]91-miss bingley to see [her]82-elizabeth either at [Longbourn]7-longbourn or [Netherfield]2-netherfield , and embracing [her]82-elizabeth most tenderly , [she]91-miss bingley even shook hands with [the former]327-the former . [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth took leave of [the whole party]521-the whole party in the liveliest spirits .

[They]641-they were not welcomed [home]3219-home very cordially by [[their]641-they mother]434-their mother . [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet wondered at [their]641-they coming , and thought [them]641-they very wrong to give so much trouble , and was sure [Jane]83-jane would have caught cold again . But [[their]641-they father]247-their father , though very laconic in [his]247-their father expressions of pleasure , was really glad to see [them]641-they ; [he]247-their father had felt [their]641-they importance in [the family circle]648-the family circle . The evening conversation , when [they]641-they were all assembled , had lost much of its animation , and almost all its sense , by the absence of [Jane]83-jane and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth .

[They]641-they found [Mary]87-mary , as usual , deep in the study of [thorough bass and human nature]649-thorough bass and human nature ; and had some new extracts to admire and some new observations of threadbare morality to listen to . [Catherine]86-lady catherine and [Lydia]84-lydia had information for [them]641-they of a different sort . Much had been done , and much had been said in [the regiment]650-the regiment since the preceding Wednesday ; [several of [the officers]454-the officers]651-several of the officers had dined lately with [[their]651-several of the officers uncle]3247-their uncle ; [a private]654-a private had been flogged ; and it had actually been hinted that [Colonel Forster]107-colonel forster was going to be married .

" [I]75-mr. bennet hope , [[my]75-mr. bennet dear]2993-my dear , "[75-mr. bennet] said [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet to [[his]75-mr. bennet wife]231-his wife , as [they]656-they were at breakfast the next morning , " that [you]231-his wife have ordered a good dinner to - day , because [I]75-mr. bennet have reason to expect an addition to [our]656-they family party . "[75-mr. bennet]

" [The person of whom [I]75-mr. bennet speak]3406-the person of whom i speak is [a gentleman]3407-a gentleman and [a stranger]3408-a stranger . "[75-mr. bennet]

[Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet 's eyes sparkled . " [A gentleman]3407-a gentleman and [a stranger]3408-a stranger ! It is [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley , [I]85-mrs. bennet am sure . " It is _ not _ [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley , "[255-her husband] said [[her]85-mrs. bennet husband]255-her husband ; " it is [a person whom [I]255-her husband never saw in the whole course of [my]255-her husband life]3413-a person whom i never saw in the whole course of my life . "[255-her husband]

This roused a general astonishment ; and [he]255-her husband had the pleasure of being eagerly questioned by [[his]255-her husband wife]231-his wife and [five daughters]659-five daughters at once .

After amusing [himself]255-her husband some time with [their]660-their curiosity , [he]255-her husband thus explained:--"About a month ago [I]255-her husband received this letter , and about a fortnight ago [I]255-her husband answered it ; for [I]255-her husband thought it a case of some delicacy , and requiring early attention . "[255-her husband]

" Oh , [[my]231-his wife dear]2993-my dear , "[231-his wife] cried [[his]255-her husband wife]231-his wife , " [I]231-his wife can not bear to hear that mentioned . "[231-his wife]

[Jane]83-jane and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth attempted to explain to [her]231-his wife the nature of an entail . [They]662-they had often attempted it before : but it was a subject on which [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet was beyond the reach of reason ; and [she]85-mrs. bennet continued to rail bitterly against the cruelty of settling [an estate]341-an estate away from [a family of five daughters]664-a family of five daughters , in favour of [a man whom [nobody cared anything about]666-nobody cared anything about]665-a man whom nobody cared anything about .

" It certainly is a most iniquitous affair , "[75-mr. bennet] said [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet ; " and nothing can clear [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins from the guilt of inheriting [Longbourn]7-longbourn . "[75-mr. bennet]

" [Dear Sir]3423-dear sir ,[85-mrs. bennet]

" The disagreement subsisting between [yourself]3415-you and [[my]85-mrs. bennet late honoured father]3424-my late honoured father always gave [me]85-mrs. bennet much uneasiness ; and , since [I]85-mrs. bennet have had the misfortune to lose [him]129-mr. collins , [I]85-mrs. bennet have frequently wished to heal the breach : but , for some time , [I]85-mrs. bennet was kept back by [my]85-mrs. bennet own doubts , fearing lest it might seem disrespectful to [his]129-mr. collins memory for [me]85-mrs. bennet to be on good terms with [anyone with whom it had always pleased]3425-anyone with whom it had always pleased [him]129-mr. collins to be at variance . "--'There[85-mrs. bennet] , [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet . '--"My mind , however , is now made up on the subject ; for , having received ordination at Easter , [I]85-mrs. bennet have been so fortunate as to be distinguished by the patronage of [the Right Honourable Lady [Catherine de Bourgh]86-lady catherine , widow of [Sir Lewis de Bourgh]130-sir lewis de bourgh , whose bounty and beneficence has preferred [me]85-mrs. bennet to [the valuable rectory of [this parish]3428-this parish]3427-the valuable rectory of this parish]3426-the right honourable lady catherine de bourgh , widow of sir lewis de bourgh , whose bounty and beneficence has preferred me to the valuable rectory of this parish , where it shall be [my]85-mrs. bennet earnest endeavour to demean [myself]85-mrs. bennet with grateful respect towards [her]86-lady catherine Ladyship , and be ever ready to perform those rites and ceremonies which are instituted by [the Church of [England]3-england]18-the church of england . " [WILLIAM COLLINS]131-william collins . "[75-mr. bennet]

" In point of composition , "[87-mary] said [Mary]87-mary , " [his]3443-this peace - making gentleman letter does not seem defective . The idea of the olive branch perhaps is not wholly new , yet [I]87-mary think it is well expressed . "[87-mary]

To [Catherine]86-lady catherine and [Lydia]84-lydia neither the letter nor [its writer]669-its writer were in any degree interesting . It was next to impossible that [[their]670-their cousin]671-their cousin should come in a scarlet coat , and it was now some weeks since [they]670-their had received pleasure from the society of [a man in any other colour]672-a man in any other colour . As for [[their]670-their mother]434-their mother , [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins 's letter had done away much of [her]434-their mother ill - will , and [she]434-their mother was preparing to see [him]129-mr. collins with a degree of composure which astonished [[her]434-their mother husband]255-her husband and [daughters]3439-daughters .

[Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins was punctual to [his]129-mr. collins time , and was received with great politeness by [the whole family]311-the whole family . [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet indeed said little ; but [the ladies]249-the ladies were ready enough to talk , and [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins seemed neither in need of encouragement , nor inclined to be silent [himself]129-mr. collins . [He]129-mr. collins was [a tall , heavy - looking young man of five - and - twenty]678-a tall , heavy - looking young man of five - and - twenty . [He]129-mr. collins had not been long seated before [he]129-mr. collins complimented [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet on having so fine [a family of daughters]679-a family of daughters , said [he]129-mr. collins had heard much of [their]679-a family of daughters beauty , but that , in this instance , fame had fallen short of the truth ; and added , that [he]129-mr. collins did not doubt [her]85-mrs. bennet seeing [them]679-a family of daughters all in due time well disposed of in marriage . " [You]129-mr. collins are very kind , [sir]3161-sir , [I]85-mrs. bennet am sure ; and [I]85-mrs. bennet wish with all [my]85-mrs. bennet heart it may prove so ; for else [they]679-a family of daughters will be destitute enough . Things are settled so oddly . "[85-mrs. bennet]

" [You]129-mr. collins allude , perhaps , to the entail of [this estate]3450-this estate . "[85-mrs. bennet]

[He]682-he was interrupted by a summons to dinner ; and [the girls]3008-the girls smiled on [each other]3144-each other . [The hall]685-the hall , [the dining - room]686-the dining - room , and all [its]686-the dining - room furniture , were examined and praised ; and [his]682-he commendation of everything would have touched [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet 's heart , but for the mortifying supposition of [his]682-he viewing it all as [his]682-he own future property . The dinner , too , in its turn , was highly admired ; and [he]682-he begged to know to which of [[his]682-he fair cousins]687-his fair cousins the excellence of its cookery was owing . But here [he]682-he was set right by [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet , who assured [him]682-he , with some asperity , that [they]688-they were very well able to keep [a good cook]689-a good cook , and that [[her]85-mrs. bennet daughters]237-her daughters had nothing to do in [the kitchen]691-the kitchen . [He]682-he begged pardon for having displeased [her]85-mrs. bennet . During dinner , [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet scarcely spoke at all ; but when [the servants]692-the servants were withdrawn , [he]75-mr. bennet thought it time to have some conversation with [[his]75-mr. bennet guest]693-his guest , and therefore started a subject in which [he]75-mr. bennet expected [him]682-he to shine , by observing that [he]682-he seemed very fortunate in [[his]682-he patroness]694-his patroness . [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet could not have chosen better . [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins was eloquent in [her]85-mrs. bennet praise . The subject elevated [him]682-he to more than usual solemnity of manner ; and with a most important aspect [he]682-he protested that [he]682-he had never in [his]682-he life witnessed such behaviour in [a person of rank]695-a person of rank -- such affability and condescension , as [he]682-he had [himself]682-he experienced from [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine . [She]85-mrs. bennet had been graciously pleased to approve of both the discourses which [he]682-he had already had the honour of preaching before [her]85-mrs. bennet . [She]85-mrs. bennet had also asked [him]682-he twice to dine at Rosings , and had sent for [him]682-he only the Saturday before , to make up [her]85-mrs. bennet pool of quadrille in the evening . [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine was reckoned proud by [many people]696-many people , [he]682-he knew , but _ [he]682-he _ had never seen anything but affability in [her]86-lady catherine . [She]85-mrs. bennet had always spoken to [him]682-he as [she]85-mrs. bennet would to [any other gentleman]697-any other gentleman ; [she]85-mrs. bennet made not the smallest objection to [his]682-he joining in [the society of [the neighbourhood]3015-the neighbourhood]698-the society of the neighbourhood , nor to [his]682-he leaving [[his]682-he parish]700-his parish occasionally for a week or two to visit [[his]682-he relations]701-his relations . " [Her]85-mrs. bennet indifferent state of health unhappily prevents [her]85-mrs. bennet being in [town]264-town ; and by that means , as [I]85-mrs. bennet told [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine [myself]85-mrs. bennet one day , has deprived [the British Court]3480-the british court of [its]3480-the british court brightest ornament . [[Her]85-mrs. bennet Ladyship]3464-her ladyship seemed pleased with the idea ; and [you]3482-you may imagine that [I]85-mrs. bennet am happy on every occasion to offer those little delicate compliments which are always acceptable to [ladies]272-ladies .
