"[75-mr. bennet]

[Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet raised [his]75-mr. bennet eyes from [his]75-mr. bennet book as [she]85-mrs. bennet entered , and fixed them on [her]85-mrs. bennet face with a calm unconcern , which was not in the least altered by [her]85-mrs. bennet communication .

" [I]75-mr. bennet have not the pleasure of understanding [you]85-mrs. bennet , "[75-mr. bennet] said [he]75-mr. bennet , when [she]85-mrs. bennet had finished [her]85-mrs. bennet speech . " Of what are [you]85-mrs. bennet talking ? "[75-mr. bennet]

" Of [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins and [Lizzy]82-elizabeth . [Lizzy]82-elizabeth declares [she]82-elizabeth will not have [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins , and [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins begins to say that [he]129-mr. collins will not have [Lizzy]82-elizabeth . "[85-mrs. bennet]

" And what am [I]75-mr. bennet to do on the occasion ? It seems a hopeless business . "[75-mr. bennet]

" Speak to [Lizzy]82-elizabeth about it [yourself]75-mr. bennet . Tell [her]82-elizabeth that [you]75-mr. bennet insist upon [her]82-elizabeth marrying [him]129-mr. collins . "[85-mrs. bennet]

" Let [her]82-elizabeth be called down . [She]82-elizabeth shall hear [my]75-mr. bennet opinion . "[75-mr. bennet]

[Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet rang the bell , and [Miss Elizabeth]82-elizabeth was summoned to [the library]1011-the library .

" Come here , [child]3675-child , "[82-elizabeth] cried [[her]82-elizabeth father]244-her father as [she]82-elizabeth appeared . " [I]82-elizabeth have sent for [you]82-elizabeth on an affair of importance . [I]82-elizabeth understand that [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins has made [you]82-elizabeth an offer of marriage . Is it true ? "[82-elizabeth]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth replied that it was .

" Very well -- and this offer of marriage [you]82-elizabeth have refused ? "[85-mrs. bennet]

" [I]85-mrs. bennet have , [sir]3161-sir . "[85-mrs. bennet]

" Very well . [We]3747-we now come to the point . [[Your]82-elizabeth mother]3715-your mother insists upon [your]82-elizabeth accepting it . Is it not so , [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet ? "[85-mrs. bennet]

" Yes , or [I]85-mrs. bennet will never see [her]3715-your mother again . "[85-mrs. bennet]

" An unhappy alternative is before [you]82-elizabeth , [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth . From this day [you]82-elizabeth must be [a stranger to one of [[your]82-elizabeth parents]3750-your parents]3749-a stranger to one of your parents . [[Your]82-elizabeth mother]3715-your mother will never see [you]82-elizabeth again if [you]82-elizabeth do _ not _ marry [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins , and [I]85-mrs. bennet will never see [you]82-elizabeth again if [you]82-elizabeth _ do _ . "[85-mrs. bennet]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth could not but smile at such a conclusion of such a beginning ; but [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet , who had persuaded [herself]85-mrs. bennet that [[her]85-mrs. bennet husband]255-her husband regarded the affair as [she]85-mrs. bennet wished , was excessively disappointed .

" What do [you]255-her husband mean , [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet , by talking in this way ? [You]255-her husband promised [me]85-mrs. bennet to _ insist _ upon [her]3715-your mother marrying [him]129-mr. collins . "[85-mrs. bennet]

" [[My]255-her husband dear]2993-my dear , "[255-her husband] replied [[her]85-mrs. bennet husband]255-her husband , " [I]255-her husband have two small favours to request . First , that [you]255-her husband will allow [me]255-her husband the free use of [my]255-her husband understanding on the present occasion ; and , secondly , of [[my]255-her husband room]3753-my room . [I]255-her husband shall be glad to have [the library]1011-the library to [myself]255-her husband as soon as may be . "[255-her husband]

Not yet , however , in spite of [her]85-mrs. bennet disappointment in [[her]85-mrs. bennet husband]255-her husband , did [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet give up the point . [She]85-mrs. bennet talked to [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth again and again ; coaxed and threatened [her]82-elizabeth by turns . [She]85-mrs. bennet endeavoured to secure [Jane]83-jane in [her]85-mrs. bennet interest , but [Jane]83-jane , with all possible mildness , declined interfering ; and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , sometimes with real earnestness , and sometimes with playful gaiety , replied to [her]85-mrs. bennet attacks . Though [her]85-mrs. bennet manner varied , however , [her]85-mrs. bennet determination never did .

[Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins , meanwhile , was meditating in solitude on what had passed . [He]129-mr. collins thought too well of [himself]129-mr. collins to comprehend on what motive [[his]129-mr. collins cousin]704-his cousin could refuse [him]129-mr. collins ; and though [his]129-mr. collins pride was hurt , [he]129-mr. collins suffered in no other way . [His]129-mr. collins regard for [her]85-mrs. bennet was quite imaginary ; and the possibility of [her]85-mrs. bennet deserving [[her]85-mrs. bennet mother]241-her mother 's reproach prevented [his]129-mr. collins feeling any regret .

While [the family]416-the family were in this confusion , [Charlotte Lucas]101-charlotte came to spend the day with [them]416-the family . [She]101-charlotte was met in [the vestibule]1004-the vestibule by [Lydia]84-lydia , who , flying to [her]101-charlotte , cried in a half whisper , " [I]84-lydia am glad [you]101-charlotte are come , for there is such fun here ! What do [you]101-charlotte think has happened this morning ? [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins has made an offer to [Lizzy]82-elizabeth , and [she]82-elizabeth will not have [him]129-mr. collins . "[84-lydia]

[Charlotte]101-charlotte had hardly time to answer before [they]1020-they were joined by [Kitty]86-lady catherine , who came to tell the same news ; and no sooner had [they]1020-they entered [the breakfast - room]1005-the breakfast - room , where [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet was alone , than [she]85-mrs. bennet likewise began on the subject , calling on [Miss Lucas]92-miss lucas for [her]92-miss lucas compassion , and entreating [her]92-miss lucas to persuade [[her]85-mrs. bennet friend]402-her friend [Lizzy]82-elizabeth to comply with the wishes of [[her]85-mrs. bennet family]885-her family . " Pray do , [[my]85-mrs. bennet dear]2993-my dear [Miss Lucas]92-miss lucas , "[85-mrs. bennet] [she]85-mrs. bennet added , in a melancholy tone ; " for [nobody]3077-nobody is on [my]85-mrs. bennet side , [nobody]3077-nobody takes part with [me]85-mrs. bennet ; [I]85-mrs. bennet am cruelly used , [nobody]3077-nobody feels for [my]85-mrs. bennet poor nerves . "[85-mrs. bennet]

[Charlotte]101-charlotte 's reply was spared by the entrance of [Jane]83-jane and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth .

" Ay , there [she]82-elizabeth comes , "[85-mrs. bennet] continued [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet , " looking as unconcerned as may be , and caring no more for [us]3759-us than if [we]3759-us were at [York]25-york , provided [she]82-elizabeth can have [her]82-elizabeth own way . But [I]85-mrs. bennet tell [you]101-charlotte what , [Miss Lizzy]82-elizabeth , if [you]101-charlotte take it into [your]101-charlotte head to go on refusing every offer of marriage in this way , [you]101-charlotte will never get [a husband]3760-a husband at all -- and [I]85-mrs. bennet am sure [I]85-mrs. bennet do not know who is to maintain [you]101-charlotte when [[your]101-charlotte father]3223-your father is dead . _ [I]85-mrs. bennet _ shall not be able to keep [you]101-charlotte -- and so [I]85-mrs. bennet warn [you]101-charlotte . [I]85-mrs. bennet have done with [you]101-charlotte from this very day . [I]85-mrs. bennet told [you]101-charlotte in [the library]1011-the library , [you]101-charlotte know , that [I]85-mrs. bennet should never speak to [you]101-charlotte again , and [you]101-charlotte will find [me]85-mrs. bennet as good as [my]85-mrs. bennet word . [I]85-mrs. bennet have no pleasure in talking to [undutiful children]3763-undutiful children . Not that [I]85-mrs. bennet have much pleasure , indeed , in talking to [anybody]3099-anybody . [People who suffer as [I]85-mrs. bennet do from nervous complaints]3765-people who suffer as i do from nervous complaints can have no great inclination for talking . [Nobody]3077-nobody can tell what [I]85-mrs. bennet suffer ! But it is always so . [Those who do not complain]3767-those who do not complain are never pitied . "[85-mrs. bennet]

[[Her]1024-her daughters]237-her daughters listened in silence to this effusion , sensible that any attempt to reason with or soothe [her]1024-her would only increase the irritation . [She]1024-her talked on , therefore , without interruption from any of [them]237-her daughters till [they]237-her daughters were joined by [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins , who entered with an air more stately than usual , and on perceiving whom , [she]1024-her said to the girls,--

" Now , [I]1024-her do insist upon it , that [you]237-her daughters , all of [you]237-her daughters , hold [your]237-her daughters tongues , and let [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins and [me]1024-her have a little conversation together . "[1024-her]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth passed quietly out of [the room]250-the room , [Jane]83-jane and [Kitty]86-lady catherine followed , but [Lydia]84-lydia stood [her]84-lydia ground , determined to hear all [she]84-lydia could ; and [Charlotte]101-charlotte , detained first by the civility of [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins , whose inquiries after [herself]101-charlotte and all [[her]101-charlotte family]885-her family were very minute , and then by a little curiosity , satisfied [herself]101-charlotte with walking to the window and pretending not to hear . In a doleful voice [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet thus began the projected conversation:--

" Oh , [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins ! "[85-mrs. bennet]

" [[My]129-mr. collins dear madam]3768-my dear madam , "[129-mr. collins] replied [he]129-mr. collins , " let [us]3769-us be for ever silent on this point . Far be it from [me]129-mr. collins , "[129-mr. collins] [he]129-mr. collins presently continued , in a voice that marked [his]129-mr. collins displeasure , " to resent the behaviour of [[your]3768-my dear madam daughter]3233-your daughter . Resignation to inevitable evils is the duty of [us]3769-us all : the peculiar duty of [a young man who has been so fortunate as [I]129-mr. collins have been , in early preferment]3771-a young man who has been so fortunate as i have been , in early preferment ; and , [I]129-mr. collins trust , [I]129-mr. collins am resigned . Perhaps not the less so from feeling a doubt of [my]129-mr. collins positive happiness had [[my]129-mr. collins fair cousin]3706-my fair cousin honoured [me]129-mr. collins with [her]3706-my fair cousin hand ; for [I]129-mr. collins have often observed , that resignation is never so perfect as when the blessing denied begins to lose somewhat of its value in [our]3769-us estimation . [You]3768-my dear madam will not , [I]129-mr. collins hope , consider [me]129-mr. collins as showing any disrespect to [[your]3768-my dear madam family]3435-your family , [[my]129-mr. collins dear madam]3768-my dear madam , by thus withdrawing [my]129-mr. collins pretensions to [[your]3768-my dear madam daughter]3233-your daughter 's favour , without having paid [yourself]3768-my dear madam and [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet the compliment of requesting [you]3768-my dear madam to interpose [your]3768-my dear madam authority in [my]129-mr. collins behalf . [My]129-mr. collins conduct may , [I]129-mr. collins fear , be objectionable in having accepted [my]129-mr. collins dismission from [[your]3768-my dear madam daughter]3233-your daughter 's lips instead of [your]3768-my dear madam own ; but [we]3777-we are all liable to error . [I]129-mr. collins have certainly meant well through the whole affair . [My]129-mr. collins object has been to secure an amiable companion for [myself]129-mr. collins , with due consideration for the advantage of all [[your]3768-my dear madam family]3435-your family ; and if [my]129-mr. collins _ manner _ has been at all reprehensible , [I]129-mr. collins here beg leave to apologize . "[129-mr. collins]

The discussion of [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins 's offer was now nearly at an end , and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth had only to suffer from the uncomfortable feelings necessarily attending it , and occasionally from some peevish allusion of [[her]82-elizabeth mother]241-her mother . As for [the gentleman]285-the gentleman [himself]285-the gentleman , _ [his]285-the gentleman _ feelings were chiefly expressed , not by embarrassment or dejection , or by trying to avoid [her]82-elizabeth , but by stiffness of manner and resentful silence . [He]285-the gentleman scarcely ever spoke to [her]82-elizabeth ; and the assiduous attentions which [he]285-the gentleman had been so sensible of [himself]285-the gentleman were transferred for the rest of the day to [Miss Lucas]92-miss lucas , whose civility in listening to [him]285-the gentleman was a seasonable relief to [them]1030-them all , and especially to [[her]92-miss lucas friend]402-her friend .

The morrow produced no abatement of [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet 's ill humour or ill health . [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins was also in the same state of angry pride . [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth had hoped that [his]129-mr. collins resentment might shorten [his]129-mr. collins visit , but [his]129-mr. collins plan did not appear in the least affected by it . [He]129-mr. collins was always to have gone on Saturday , and to Saturday [he]129-mr. collins still meant to stay .

After breakfast , [the girls]3008-the girls walked to [Meryton]9-meryton , to inquire if [Mr. Wickham]136-wickham were returned , and to lament over [his]129-mr. collins absence from the [Netherfield]2-netherfield ball . [He]129-mr. collins joined [them]3008-the girls on [their]3008-the girls entering [the town]1033-the town , and attended [them]3008-the girls to [[their]3008-the girls aunt]443-their aunt 's , where [his]129-mr. collins regret and vexation and the concern of [everybody]304-everybody were well talked over . To [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , however , [he]129-mr. collins voluntarily acknowledged that the necessity of [his]129-mr. collins absence _ had _ been self - imposed .

" [I]129-mr. collins found , "[129-mr. collins] said [he]129-mr. collins , " as the time drew near , that [I]129-mr. collins had better not meet [Mr. Darcy;--that]146-mr. darcy;--that to be in [the same room]3779-the same room , the same party with [him]129-mr. collins for so many hours together , might be more than [I]129-mr. collins could bear , and that scenes might arise unpleasant to more than [myself]129-mr. collins . "[129-mr. collins]

[She]82-elizabeth highly approved [his]129-mr. collins forbearance ; and [they]1036-they had leisure for a full discussion of it , and for all the commendations which [they]1036-they civilly bestowed on [each other]3144-each other , as [Wickham]136-wickham and [another officer]1038-another officer walked back with [them]1036-they to [Longbourn]7-longbourn , and during the walk [he]129-mr. collins particularly attended to [her]82-elizabeth . [His]129-mr. collins accompanying [them]1036-they was a double advantage : [she]82-elizabeth felt all the compliment it offered to [herself]82-elizabeth ; and it was most acceptable as an occasion of introducing [him]129-mr. collins to [[her]82-elizabeth father]244-her father and [mother]3198-mother .

Soon after [their]1036-they return , a letter was delivered to [Miss Bennet]82-elizabeth ; it came from [Netherfield]2-netherfield , and was opened immediately . The envelope contained a sheet of elegant , little , hot - pressed paper , well covered with [a lady]3153-a lady 's fair , flowing hand ; and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth saw [[her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister 's countenance change as [she]82-elizabeth read it , and saw [her]82-elizabeth dwelling intently on some particular passages . [Jane]83-jane recollected [herself]83-jane soon ; and putting the letter away , tried to join , with [her]83-jane usual cheerfulness , in the general conversation : but [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth felt an anxiety on the subject which drew off [her]82-elizabeth attention even from [Wickham]136-wickham ; and no sooner had [he]136-wickham and [[his]136-wickham companion]424-his companion taken leave , than a glance from [Jane]83-jane invited [her]83-jane to follow [her]83-jane [upstairs]703-upstairs . When [they]1045-their had gained [[their]1045-their own room]1046-their own room , [Jane]83-jane , taking out [her]83-jane letter , said , " This is from [Caroline Bingley]118-caroline : what it contains has surprised [me]83-jane a good deal . [The whole party]521-the whole party have left [Netherfield]2-netherfield by this time , and are on [their]1045-their way to [town]264-town ; and without any intention of coming back again . [You]3782-you shall hear what [she]118-caroline says . "[83-jane]

[She]83-jane then read the first sentence aloud , which comprised the information of [their]1045-their having just resolved to follow [[their]1045-their brother]339-their brother to [town]264-town directly , and of [their]1045-their meaning to dine that day in [Grosvenor Street]26-grosvenor street , where [Mr. Hurst]88-mr. hurst had [a house]1049-a house . The next was in these words:--"'I do not pretend to regret anything [I]82-elizabeth shall leave in [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire except [[your]3782-you society]3783-your society , [[my]82-elizabeth dearest friend]3784-my dearest friend ; but [we]1045-their will hope , at some future period , to enjoy many returns of that delightful intercourse [we]1045-their have known , and in the meanwhile may lessen the pain of separation by a very frequent and most unreserved correspondence . [I]82-elizabeth depend on [you]3782-you for that . ' "[82-elizabeth] To these high - flown expressions [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth listened with all the insensibility of distrust ; and though the suddenness of [their]1045-their removal surprised [her]82-elizabeth , [she]82-elizabeth saw nothing in it really to lament : it was not to be supposed that [their]1045-their absence from [Netherfield]2-netherfield would prevent [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley 's being [there]305-there ; and as to the loss of [[their]1045-their society]1051-their society , [she]82-elizabeth was persuaded that [Jane]83-jane must soon cease to regard it in the enjoyment of [his]79-mr. bingley .

" It is unlucky , "[82-elizabeth] said [she]82-elizabeth , after a short pause , " that [you]3782-you should not be able to see [[your]3782-you friends]3785-your friends before [they]3785-your friends leave [the country]448-the country . But may [we]1045-their not hope that the period of future happiness , to which [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley looks forward , may arrive earlier than [she]91-miss bingley is aware , and that the delightful intercourse [you]3782-you have known as [friends]3787-friends will be renewed with yet greater satisfaction as [sisters]3585-sisters ? [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley will not be detained in [London]5-london by [them]3785-your friends . "[82-elizabeth]

" [Caroline]118-caroline decidedly says that [none of the party]3789-none of the party will return into [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire this winter . [I]82-elizabeth will read it to [you]3782-you .[82-elizabeth]

" ' When [[my]82-elizabeth brother]3212-my brother left [us]1045-their yesterday , [he]3212-my brother imagined that the business which took [him]3212-my brother to [London]5-london might be concluded in three or four days ; but as [we]1045-their are certain it can not be so , and at the same time convinced that when [Charles]122-charles gets to [town]264-town [he]122-charles will be in no hurry to leave it again , [we]1045-their have determined on following [him]122-charles thither , that [he]122-charles may not be obliged to spend [his]122-charles vacant hours in [a comfortless hotel]3792-a comfortless hotel . [Many of [my]82-elizabeth acquaintance]3793-many of my acquaintance are already [there]305-there for the winter : [I]82-elizabeth wish [I]82-elizabeth could hear that [you]3795-you , [[my]82-elizabeth dearest friend]3784-my dearest friend , had any intention of making one in [the crowd]3797-the crowd , but of that [I]82-elizabeth despair . [I]82-elizabeth sincerely hope [your]3795-you Christmas in [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire may abound in the gaieties which that season generally brings , and that [your]3795-you beaux will be so numerous as to prevent [your]3795-you feeling the loss of [the three of whom [we]3799-we shall deprive [you]3795-you]3798-the three of whom we shall deprive you . '[82-elizabeth]

" It is evident by this , "[83-jane] added [Jane]83-jane , " that [he]3800-he comes back no more this winter . "[83-jane]

" It is only evident that [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley does not mean [he]3800-he _ should _ . "[82-elizabeth]

" Why will [you]83-jane think so ? It must be [his]3800-he own doing ; [he]3800-he is [[his]3800-he own master]3801-his own master . But [you]3795-you do not know _ all _ . [I]83-jane _ will _ read [you]3795-you the passage which particularly hurts [me]83-jane . [I]83-jane will have no reserves from _ [you]3795-you _ . ' [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy is impatient to see [[his]89-mr. darcy sister]559-his sister ; and to confess the truth , _ [we]3799-we _ are scarcely less eager to meet [her]559-his sister again . [I]83-jane really do not think [Georgiana Darcy]147-georgiana has [her]147-georgiana equal for beauty , elegance , and accomplishments ; and the affection [she]147-georgiana inspires in [Louisa]117-louisa and [myself]83-jane is heightened into something still more interesting from the hope [we]3799-we dare to entertain of [her]147-georgiana being hereafter [[our]3799-we sister]3803-our sister . [I]83-jane do not know whether [I]83-jane ever before mentioned to [you]3795-you [my]83-jane feelings on this subject , but [I]83-jane will not leave [the country]448-the country without confiding [them]3805-them , and [I]83-jane trust [you]3795-you will not esteem [them]3805-them unreasonable . [[My]83-jane brother]3212-my brother admires [her]147-georgiana greatly already ; [he]3212-my brother will have frequent opportunity now of seeing [her]147-georgiana on the most intimate footing ; [her]147-georgiana relations all wish the connection as much as [his]3212-my brother own ; and [a sister]437-a sister 's partiality is not misleading [me]83-jane , [I]83-jane think , when [I]83-jane call [Charles]122-charles most capable of engaging [any woman]597-any woman 's heart . With all these circumstances to favour an attachment , and nothing to prevent it , am [I]83-jane wrong , [[my]83-jane dearest]3228-my dearest [Jane]83-jane , in indulging the hope of an event which will secure the happiness of [so many]3810-so many ? ' What think [you]83-jane of _ this _ sentence , [[my]83-jane dear]2993-my dear [Lizzy]82-elizabeth ? "[83-jane] said [Jane]83-jane , as [she]83-jane finished it . " Is it not clear enough ? Does it not expressly declare that [Caroline]118-caroline neither expects nor wishes [me]83-jane to be [[her]118-caroline sister]328-her sister ; that [she]118-caroline is perfectly convinced of [[her]118-caroline brother]3108-her brother 's indifference ; and that if [she]118-caroline suspects the nature of [my]83-jane feelings for [him]3108-her brother [she]118-caroline means ( most kindly ! ) to put [me]83-jane on [my]83-jane guard . Can there be any other opinion on the subject ? "[83-jane]

" Yes , there can ; for [mine]83-jane is totally different . Will [you]83-jane hear it ? "[82-elizabeth]

" Most willingly . "[83-jane]

" [You]83-jane shall have it in a few words . [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley sees that [[her]91-miss bingley brother]3108-her brother is in love with [you]83-jane and wants [him]3108-her brother to marry [Miss Darcy]124-miss darcy . [She]91-miss bingley follows [him]3108-her brother to [town]264-town in the hope of keeping [him]3108-her brother [there]305-there , and tries to persuade [you]83-jane that [he]3108-her brother does not care about [you]83-jane . "[82-elizabeth]

[Jane]83-jane shook [her]83-jane head .

" Indeed , [Jane]83-jane , [you]83-jane ought to believe [me]83-jane . [No one who has ever seen [you]83-jane together]3817-no one who has ever seen you together can doubt [his]3108-her brother affection ; [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley , [I]83-jane am sure , can not : [she]91-miss bingley is not such [a simpleton]3140-a simpleton . Could [she]91-miss bingley have seen half as much love in [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy for [herself]91-miss bingley , [she]91-miss bingley would have ordered [her]91-miss bingley wedding clothes . But the case is [this:--we]148-this:--we are not rich enough or grand enough for [them]148-this:--we ; and [she]91-miss bingley is the more anxious to get [Miss Darcy]124-miss darcy for [[her]91-miss bingley brother]3108-her brother , from the notion that when there has been _ one _ inter - marriage , [she]91-miss bingley may have less trouble in achieving a second ; in which there is certainly some ingenuity , and [I]83-jane dare say it would succeed if [Miss de Bourgh]132-miss de bourgh were out of the way . But , [[my]83-jane dearest]3228-my dearest [Jane]83-jane , [you]83-jane can not seriously imagine that , because [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley tells [you]83-jane [[her]91-miss bingley brother]3108-her brother greatly admires [Miss Darcy]124-miss darcy , [he]3108-her brother is in the smallest degree less sensible of _ [your]83-jane _ merit than when [he]3108-her brother took leave of [you]83-jane on Tuesday ; or that it will be in [her]91-miss bingley power to persuade [him]3108-her brother that , instead of being in love with [you]83-jane , [he]3108-her brother is very much in love with [[her]91-miss bingley friend]402-her friend . "[83-jane]

" If [we]3823-we thought alike of [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley , "[83-jane] replied [Jane]83-jane , " [your]91-miss bingley representation of all this might make [me]83-jane quite easy . But [I]83-jane know the foundation is unjust . [Caroline]118-caroline is incapable of wilfully deceiving [anyone]3102-anyone ; and all that [I]83-jane can hope in this case is , that [she]118-caroline is deceived [herself]118-caroline . "[83-jane]

" That is right . [You]91-miss bingley could not have started a more happy idea , since [you]91-miss bingley will not take comfort in mine : believe [her]118-caroline to be deceived , by all means . [You]91-miss bingley have now done [your]91-miss bingley duty by [her]118-caroline , and must fret no longer . "[83-jane]

" But , [[my]83-jane dear sister]3825-my dear sister , can [I]83-jane be happy , even supposing the best , in accepting [a man whose [sisters]3585-sisters and [friends]3787-friends are all wishing [him]3826-a man whose sisters and friends are all wishing him to marry elsewhere to marry elsewhere]3826-a man whose sisters and friends are all wishing him to marry elsewhere ? "[83-jane]

" [You]91-miss bingley must decide for [yourself]91-miss bingley , "[82-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth ; " and if , upon mature deliberation , [you]91-miss bingley find that the misery of disobliging [[his]3826-a man whose sisters and friends are all wishing him to marry elsewhere two sisters]278-his two sisters is more than equivalent to the happiness of being [[his]3826-a man whose sisters and friends are all wishing him to marry elsewhere wife]231-his wife , [I]82-elizabeth advise [you]91-miss bingley , by all means , to refuse [him]3826-a man whose sisters and friends are all wishing him to marry elsewhere . "[82-elizabeth]

" How can [you]83-jane talk so ? "[83-jane] said [Jane]83-jane , faintly smiling ; " [you]83-jane must know , that , though [I]83-jane should be exceedingly grieved at [their]278-his two sisters disapprobation , [I]83-jane could not hesitate . "[83-jane]

" [I]82-elizabeth did not think [you]83-jane would ; and that being the case , [I]82-elizabeth can not consider [your]83-jane situation with much compassion . "[82-elizabeth]

" But if [he]1052-he returns no more this winter , [my]83-jane choice will never be required . A thousand things may arise in six months . "[83-jane]

The idea of [his]1052-he returning no more [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth treated with the utmost contempt . It appeared to [her]82-elizabeth merely the suggestion of [Caroline]118-caroline 's interested wishes ; and [she]82-elizabeth could not for a moment suppose that those wishes , however openly or artfully spoken , could influence [a young man]3093-a young man so totally independent of [everyone]1054-everyone .

[She]82-elizabeth represented to [[her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister , as forcibly as possible , what [she]82-elizabeth felt on the subject , and had soon the pleasure of seeing its happy effect . [Jane]83-jane 's temper was not desponding ; and [she]83-jane was gradually led to hope , though the diffidence of affection sometimes overcame the hope , that [Bingley]91-miss bingley would return to [Netherfield]2-netherfield , and answer every wish of [her]83-jane heart .

[They]1056-they agreed that [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet should only hear of the departure of [the family]416-the family , without being alarmed on the score of [the gentleman]285-the gentleman 's conduct ; but even this partial communication gave [her]83-jane a great deal of concern , and [she]83-jane bewailed it as exceedingly unlucky that [the ladies]249-the ladies should happen to go away just as [they]249-the ladies were all getting so intimate together . After lamenting it , however , at some length , [she]83-jane had the consolation of thinking that [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley would be soon down again , and soon dining at [Longbourn]7-longbourn ; and the conclusion of all was the comfortable declaration , that , though [he]79-mr. bingley had been invited only to a family dinner , [she]83-jane would take care to have two full courses .

[The Bennets]99-the bennets were engaged to dine with [the Lucases]100-the lucases ; and again , during the chief of the day , was [Miss Lucas]92-miss lucas so kind as to listen to [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins . [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth took an opportunity of thanking [her]83-jane . " It keeps [him]79-mr. bingley in good humour , "[82-elizabeth] said [she]82-elizabeth , " and [I]82-elizabeth am more obliged to [you]79-mr. bingley than [I]82-elizabeth can express . "[82-elizabeth]

[Charlotte]101-charlotte assured [[her]101-charlotte friend]402-her friend of [her]101-charlotte satisfaction in being useful , and that it amply repaid [her]101-charlotte for the little sacrifice of [her]101-charlotte time . This was very amiable ; but [Charlotte]101-charlotte 's kindness extended farther than [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth had any conception of:--its object was nothing less than to secure [her]83-jane from any return of [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins 's addresses , by engaging [them]1061-them towards [herself]83-jane . Such was [Miss Lucas]92-miss lucas 's scheme ; and appearances were so favourable , that when [they]1062-they parted at night , [she]83-jane would have felt almost sure of success if [he]129-mr. collins had not been to leave [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire so very soon . But here [she]83-jane did injustice to the fire and independence of [his]129-mr. collins character ; for it led [him]129-mr. collins to escape out of [Longbourn House]24-longbourn house the next morning with admirable slyness , and hasten to [Lucas Lodge]10-lucas lodge to throw [himself]129-mr. collins at [her]83-jane feet . [He]129-mr. collins was anxious to avoid the notice of [[his]129-mr. collins cousins]746-his cousins , from a conviction that , if [they]746-his cousins saw [him]129-mr. collins depart , [they]746-his cousins could not fail to conjecture [his]129-mr. collins design , and [he]129-mr. collins was not willing to have the attempt known till its success could be known likewise ; for , though feeling almost secure , and with reason , for [Charlotte]101-charlotte had been tolerably encouraging , [he]129-mr. collins was comparatively diffident since the adventure of [Wednesday]150-wednesday . [His]129-mr. collins reception , however , was of the most flattering kind . [Miss Lucas]92-miss lucas perceived [him]129-mr. collins from an upper window as [he]129-mr. collins walked towards [the house]3001-the house , and instantly set out to meet [him]129-mr. collins accidentally in [the lane]1065-the lane . But little had [she]92-miss lucas dared to hope that so much love and eloquence awaited [her]92-miss lucas [there]305-there .

In as short a time as [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins 's long speeches would allow , everything was settled between [them]1067-their to the satisfaction of [both]774-both ; and as [they]1067-their entered [the house]3001-the house , [he]129-mr. collins earnestly entreated [her]92-miss lucas to name the day that was to make [him]129-mr. collins [the happiest of [men]3250-men]1070-the happiest of men ; and though such a solicitation must be waived for the present , [the lady]584-the lady felt no inclination to trifle with [his]129-mr. collins happiness . The stupidity with which [he]129-mr. collins was favoured by nature must guard [his]129-mr. collins courtship from any charm that could make [a woman]3011-a woman wish for its continuance ; and [Miss Lucas]92-miss lucas , who accepted [him]129-mr. collins solely from the pure and disinterested desire of an establishment , cared not how soon that establishment were gained .

[Sir William]80-sir william and [Lady Lucas]81-lady lucas were speedily applied to for [their]1067-their consent ; and it was bestowed with a most joyful alacrity . [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins 's present circumstances made it a most eligible match for [[their]1067-their daughter]1074-their daughter , to whom [they]1067-their could give little fortune ; and [his]129-mr. collins prospects of future wealth were exceedingly fair . [Lady Lucas]81-lady lucas began directly to calculate , with more interest than the matter had ever

excited before , how many years longer [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet was likely to live ; and [Sir William]80-sir william gave it as [his]80-sir william decided opinion , that whenever [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins should be in possession of [the Longbourn estate]1075-the longbourn estate , it would be highly expedient that both [he]129-mr. collins and [[his]129-mr. collins wife]231-his wife should make [their]1067-their appearance at [[St. James]11-st. james 's]379-st. james 's . [The whole family]311-the whole family in short were properly overjoyed on the occasion . [The younger girls]3371-the younger girls formed hopes of _ coming out _ a year or two sooner than [they]3371-the younger girls might otherwise have done ; and [the boys]1080-the boys were relieved from [their]1080-the boys apprehension of [Charlotte]101-charlotte 's dying [an old maid]1081-an old maid . [Charlotte]101-charlotte [herself]101-charlotte was tolerably composed . [She]101-charlotte had gained [her]101-charlotte point , and had time to consider of it . [Her]101-charlotte reflections were in general satisfactory . [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins , to be sure , was neither sensible nor agreeable : [his]129-mr. collins society was irksome , and [his]129-mr. collins attachment to [her]101-charlotte must be imaginary . But still [he]129-mr. collins would be [[her]101-charlotte husband]255-her husband . Without thinking highly either of [men]3250-men or of matrimony , marriage had always been [her]101-charlotte object : it was the only honourable provision for [well - educated young women of small fortune , and , however uncertain of giving happiness]1084-well - educated young women of small fortune , and , however uncertain of giving happiness , must be [their]1084-well - educated young women of small fortune , and , however uncertain of giving happiness pleasantest preservative from want . This preservative [she]101-charlotte had now obtained ; and at the age of twenty - seven , without having ever been handsome , [she]101-charlotte felt all the good luck of it . The least agreeable circumstance in the business was the surprise it must occasion to [Elizabeth Bennet]82-elizabeth , whose friendship [she]101-charlotte valued beyond that of [any other person]1085-any other person . [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth would wonder , and probably would blame [her]101-charlotte ; and though [her]101-charlotte resolution was not to be shaken , [her]101-charlotte feelings must be hurt by such a disapprobation . [She]101-charlotte resolved to give [her]101-charlotte the information [herself]101-charlotte ; and therefore charged [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins , when [he]129-mr. collins returned to [Longbourn]7-longbourn to dinner , to drop no hint of what had passed before [any of [the family]416-the family]1086-any of the family . A promise of secrecy was of course very dutifully given , but it could not be kept without difficulty ; for the curiosity excited by [his]129-mr. collins long absence burst forth in such very direct questions on [his]129-mr. collins return , as required some ingenuity to evade , and [he]129-mr. collins was at the same time exercising great self - denial , for [he]129-mr. collins was longing to publish [his]129-mr. collins prosperous love .

As [he]129-mr. collins was to begin [his]129-mr. collins journey too early on the morrow to see [any of [the family]416-the family]1086-any of the family , the ceremony of leave - taking was performed when [the ladies]249-the ladies moved for the night ; and [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet , with great politeness and cordiality , said how happy [they]249-the ladies should be to see [him]129-mr. collins at [Longbourn]7-longbourn again , whenever [his]129-mr. collins other engagements might allow [him]129-mr. collins to visit [them]249-the ladies .

" [[My]129-mr. collins dear madam]3768-my dear madam , "[129-mr. collins] [he]129-mr. collins replied , " this invitation is particularly gratifying , because it is what [I]129-mr. collins have been hoping to receive ; and [you]3768-my dear madam may be very certain that [I]129-mr. collins shall avail [myself]129-mr. collins of it as soon as possible . "[129-mr. collins]

[They]249-the ladies were all astonished ; and [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet , who could by no means wish for so speedy a return , immediately said,--

" But is there not danger of [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine 's disapprobation here , [[my]249-the ladies good sir]3832-my good sir ? [You]3832-my good sir had better neglect [your]3832-my good sir relations than run the risk of offending [[your]3832-my good sir patroness]3833-your patroness . "[249-the ladies]

" [[My]129-mr. collins dear sir]3625-my dear sir , "[129-mr. collins] replied [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins , " [I]129-mr. collins am particularly obliged to [you]3625-my dear sir for this friendly caution , and [you]3625-my dear sir may depend upon [my]129-mr. collins not taking so material a step without [[her]86-lady catherine Ladyship]3464-her ladyship 's concurrence . "[129-mr. collins]

" [You]3625-my dear sir can not be too much on [your]3625-my dear sir guard . Risk anything rather than [her]86-lady catherine displeasure ; and if [you]3625-my dear sir find it likely to be raised by [your]3625-my dear sir coming to [us]3836-us again , which [I]249-the ladies should think exceedingly probable , stay quietly at [home]3219-home , and be satisfied that _ [we]3836-us _ shall take no offence . "[249-the ladies]

" Believe [me]85-mrs. bennet , [[my]85-mrs. bennet dear sir]3625-my dear sir , [my]85-mrs. bennet gratitude is warmly excited by such affectionate attention ; and , depend upon it , [you]3625-my dear sir will speedily receive from [me]85-mrs. bennet a letter of thanks for this as well as for every other mark of [your]3625-my dear sir regard during [my]85-mrs. bennet stay in [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire . As for [[my]85-mrs. bennet fair cousins]3455-my fair cousins , though [my]85-mrs. bennet absence may not be long enough to render it necessary , [I]85-mrs. bennet shall now take the liberty of wishing [them]3455-my fair cousins health and happiness , not excepting [[my]85-mrs. bennet cousin]3414-my cousin [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth . "[85-mrs. bennet]

With proper civilities , [the ladies]249-the ladies then withdrew ; all of [them]249-the ladies equally surprised to find that [he]1092-he meditated a quick return . [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet wished to understand by it that [he]1092-he thought of paying [his]1092-he addresses to [one of [[her]85-mrs. bennet younger girls]1094-her younger girls]1093-one of her younger girls , and [Mary]87-mary might have been prevailed on to accept [him]1092-he . [She]85-mrs. bennet rated [his]1092-he abilities much higher than any of the others : there was a solidity in [his]1092-he reflections which often struck [her]85-mrs. bennet ; and though by no means so clever as [herself]85-mrs. bennet , [she]85-mrs. bennet thought that , if encouraged to read and improve [himself]1092-he by such an example as [hers]85-mrs. bennet , [he]1092-he might become [a very agreeable companion]1095-a very agreeable companion . But on the following morning every hope of this kind was done away . [Miss Lucas]92-miss lucas called soon after breakfast , and in a private conference with [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth related the event of the day before .

The possibility of [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins 's fancying [himself]129-mr. collins in love with [[her]92-miss lucas friend]402-her friend had once occurred to [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth within the last day or two : but that [Charlotte]101-charlotte could encourage [him]1092-he seemed almost as far from possibility as that [she]101-charlotte could encourage [him]1092-he [herself]101-charlotte ; and [her]82-elizabeth astonishment was consequently so great as to overcome at first the bounds of decorum , and [she]82-elizabeth could not help crying out,--

" Engaged to [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins ! [[my]82-elizabeth dear]2993-my dear [Charlotte]101-charlotte , impossible ! "[82-elizabeth]

The steady countenance which [Miss Lucas]92-miss lucas had commanded in telling [her]92-miss lucas story gave way to a momentary confusion here on receiving so direct a reproach ; though , as it was no more than [she]82-elizabeth expected , [she]82-elizabeth soon regained [her]82-elizabeth composure , and calmly replied,--

" Why should [you]101-charlotte be surprised , [[my]82-elizabeth dear]2993-my dear [Eliza]82-elizabeth ? Do [you]101-charlotte think it incredible that [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins should be able to procure [any woman]597-any woman 's good opinion , because [he]129-mr. collins was not so happy as to succeed with [you]101-charlotte ? "[82-elizabeth]

But [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth had now recollected [herself]82-elizabeth ; and , making a strong effort for it , was able to assure [her]82-elizabeth , with tolerable firmness , that the prospect of [their]1097-their relationship was highly grateful to [her]82-elizabeth , and that [she]82-elizabeth wished [her]82-elizabeth all imaginable happiness .

" [I]101-charlotte see what [you]101-charlotte are feeling , "[101-charlotte] replied [Charlotte]101-charlotte ; " [you]101-charlotte must be surprised , very much surprised , so lately as [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins was wishing to marry [you]101-charlotte . But when [you]101-charlotte have had time to think it all over , [I]101-charlotte hope [you]101-charlotte will be satisfied with what [I]101-charlotte have done . [I]101-charlotte am not romantic , [you]101-charlotte know . [I]101-charlotte never was . [I]101-charlotte ask only [a comfortable home]3844-a comfortable home ; and , considering [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins 's character , connections , and situation in life , [I]101-charlotte am convinced that [my]101-charlotte chance of happiness with [him]129-mr. collins is as fair as [most people]3845-most people can boast on entering the marriage state . "[101-charlotte]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth quietly answered " undoubtedly ; "[82-elizabeth] and , after an awkward pause , [they]1098-they returned to [the rest of [the family]416-the family]874-the rest of the family . [Charlotte]101-charlotte did not stay much longer ; and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth was then left to reflect on what [she]82-elizabeth had heard . It was a long time before [she]82-elizabeth became at all reconciled to the idea of so unsuitable a match . The strangeness of [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins 's making two offers of marriage within three days was nothing in comparison of [his]129-mr. collins being now accepted . [She]82-elizabeth had always felt that [Charlotte]101-charlotte 's opinion of matrimony was not exactly like [her]82-elizabeth own ; but [she]82-elizabeth could not have supposed it possible that , when called into action , [she]82-elizabeth would have sacrificed every better feeling to worldly advantage . [Charlotte]101-charlotte , [the wife of [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins]1101-the wife of mr. collins , was a most humiliating picture ! And to the pang of [a friend]3352-a friend disgracing [herself]101-charlotte , and sunk in [her]101-charlotte esteem , was added the distressing conviction that it was impossible for [that friend]3654-that friend to be tolerably happy in the lot [she]101-charlotte had chosen .

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth was sitting with [[her]82-elizabeth mother]241-her mother and [sisters]3585-sisters , reflecting on what [she]82-elizabeth had heard , and doubting whether [she]82-elizabeth was authorized to mention it , when [Sir William Lucas]80-sir william [himself]80-sir william appeared , sent by [[his]80-sir william daughter]1106-his daughter to announce [her]1106-his daughter engagement to [the family]416-the family . With many compliments to [them]416-the family , and much self - gratulation on the prospect of a connection between the houses , [he]80-sir william unfolded the matter,--to an audience not merely wondering , but incredulous ; for [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet , with more perseverance than politeness , protested [he]80-sir william must be entirely mistaken ; and [Lydia]84-lydia , always unguarded and often uncivil , boisterously exclaimed,--

" [Good Lord]151-good lord ! [Sir William]80-sir william , how can [you]80-sir william tell such a story ? Do not [you]80-sir william know that [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins wants to marry [Lizzy]82-elizabeth ? "[84-lydia]

Nothing less than the complaisance of [a courtier]1108-a courtier could have borne without anger such treatment : but [Sir William]80-sir william 's good - breeding carried [him]80-sir william through it all ; and though [he]80-sir william begged leave to be positive as to the truth of [his]80-sir william information , [he]80-sir william listened to all [their]416-the family impertinence with the most forbearing courtesy .

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , feeling it incumbent on [her]82-elizabeth to relieve [him]80-sir william from so unpleasant a situation , now put [herself]82-elizabeth forward to confirm [his]80-sir william account , by mentioning [her]82-elizabeth prior knowledge of it from [Charlotte]101-charlotte [herself]101-charlotte ; and endeavoured to put a stop to the exclamations of [[her]82-elizabeth mother]241-her mother and [sisters]3585-sisters , by the earnestness of [her]82-elizabeth congratulations to [Sir William]80-sir william , in which [she]82-elizabeth was readily joined by [Jane]83-jane , and by making a variety of remarks on the happiness that might be expected from the match , the excellent character of [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins , and the convenient distance of [Hunsford]15-hunsford from [London]5-london .

[Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet was , in fact , too much overpowered to say a great deal while [Sir William]80-sir william remained ; but no sooner had [he]80-sir william left [them]1111-them than [her]85-mrs. bennet feelings found a rapid vent . In the first place , [she]85-mrs. bennet persisted in disbelieving the whole of the matter ; secondly , [she]85-mrs. bennet was very sure that [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins had been taken in ; thirdly , [she]85-mrs. bennet trusted that [they]1112-them would never be happy together ; and , fourthly , that the match might be broken off . Two inferences , however , were plainly deduced from the whole : one , that [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth was the real cause of all the mischief ; and the other , that [she]82-elizabeth [herself]82-elizabeth had been barbarously used by [them]1112-them all ; and on these two points [she]82-elizabeth principally dwelt during the rest of the day . Nothing could console and nothing appease [her]82-elizabeth . Nor did that day wear out [her]82-elizabeth resentment . A week elapsed before [she]82-elizabeth could see [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth without scolding [her]82-elizabeth : a month passed away before [she]82-elizabeth could speak to [Sir William]80-sir william or [Lady Lucas]81-lady lucas without being rude ; and many months were gone before [she]82-elizabeth could at all forgive [[their]1112-them daughter]1074-their daughter .

[Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet 's emotions were much more tranquil on the occasion , and such as [he]75-mr. bennet did experience [he]75-mr. bennet pronounced to be of a most agreeable sort ; for it gratified [him]75-mr. bennet , [he]75-mr. bennet said , to discover that [Charlotte Lucas]101-charlotte , whom [he]75-mr. bennet had been used to think tolerably sensible , was as foolish as [[his]75-mr. bennet wife]231-his wife , and more foolish than [[his]75-mr. bennet daughter]1106-his daughter !

[Jane]83-jane confessed [herself]83-jane a little surprised at the match : but [she]83-jane said less of [her]83-jane astonishment than of [her]83-jane earnest desire for [their]1112-them happiness ; nor could [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth persuade [her]83-jane to consider it as improbable . [Kitty]86-lady catherine and [Lydia]84-lydia were far from envying [Miss Lucas]92-miss lucas , for [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins was only [a clergyman]3429-a clergyman ; and it affected [them]1112-them in no other way than as a piece of news to spread at [Meryton]9-meryton .

[Lady Lucas]81-lady lucas could not be insensible of triumph on being able to retort on [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet the comfort of having [a daughter]1117-a daughter well married ; and [she]81-lady lucas called at [Longbourn]7-longbourn rather oftener than usual to say how happy [she]81-lady lucas was , though [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet 's sour looks and ill - natured remarks might have been enough to drive happiness away .

Between [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth and [Charlotte]101-charlotte there was a restraint which kept [them]1112-them mutually silent on the subject ; and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth felt persuaded that no real confidence could ever subsist between [them]1112-them again . [Her]82-elizabeth disappointment in [Charlotte]101-charlotte made [her]82-elizabeth turn with fonder regard to [[her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister , of whose rectitude and delicacy [she]82-elizabeth was sure [her]82-elizabeth opinion could never be shaken , and for whose happiness [she]82-elizabeth grew daily more anxious , as [Bingley]79-mr. bingley had now been gone a week , and nothing was heard of [his]79-mr. bingley return .

[Jane]83-jane had sent [Caroline]118-caroline an early answer to [her]83-jane letter , and was counting the days till [she]83-jane might reasonably hope to hear again . The promised letter of thanks from [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins arrived on Tuesday , addressed to [[their]1112-them father]247-their father , and written with all the solemnity of gratitude which a twelve - month 's abode in [the family]416-the family might have prompted . After discharging [his]247-their father conscience on that head , [he]247-their father proceeded to inform [them]1112-them , with many rapturous expressions , of [his]247-their father happiness in having obtained the affection of [[their]1112-them amiable neighbour]1121-their amiable neighbour , [Miss Lucas]92-miss lucas , and then explained that it was merely with the view of enjoying [her]92-miss lucas society that [he]247-their father had been so ready to close with [their]1112-them kind wish of seeing [him]247-their father again at [Longbourn]7-longbourn , whither [he]247-their father hoped to be able to return on Monday fortnight ; for [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine , [he]247-their father added , so heartily approved [his]247-their father marriage , that [she]86-lady catherine wished it to take place as soon as possible , which [he]247-their father trusted would be an unanswerable argument with [his]247-their father amiable [Charlotte]101-charlotte to name an early day for making [him]247-their father [the happiest of [men]3250-men]1070-the happiest of men .

[Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins 's return into [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire was no longer a matter of pleasure to [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet . On the contrary , [she]85-mrs. bennet was as much disposed to complain of it as [[her]85-mrs. bennet husband]255-her husband . It was very strange that [he]247-their father should come to [Longbourn]7-longbourn instead of to [Lucas Lodge]10-lucas lodge ; it was also very inconvenient and exceedingly troublesome . [She]85-mrs. bennet hated having visitors in [the house]3001-the house while [her]85-mrs. bennet health was so indifferent , and [lovers]1126-lovers were of [all people]1127-all people the most disagreeable . Such were the gentle murmurs of [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet , and they gave way only to the greater distress of [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley 's continued absence .

Neither [Jane]83-jane nor [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth were comfortable on this subject . Day after day passed away without bringing any other tidings of [him]247-their father than the report which shortly prevailed in [Meryton]9-meryton of [his]247-their father coming no more to [Netherfield]2-netherfield the whole winter ; a report which highly incensed [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet , and which [she]85-mrs. bennet never failed to contradict as a most scandalous falsehood .

[Even Elizabeth]82-elizabeth began to fear -- not that [Bingley]79-mr. bingley was indifferent -- but that [[his]79-mr. bingley sisters]282-his sisters would be successful in keeping [him]79-mr. bingley away . Unwilling as [she]82-elizabeth was to admit an idea so destructive to [Jane]83-jane 's happiness , and so dishonourable to the stability of [[her]82-elizabeth lover]1129-her lover , [she]82-elizabeth could not prevent its frequently recurring . The united efforts of [[his]79-mr. bingley two unfeeling sisters]1130-his two unfeeling sisters , and of [[his]79-mr. bingley overpowering friend]1131-his overpowering friend , assisted by the attractions of [Miss Darcy]124-miss darcy and the amusements of [London]5-london , might be too much , [she]82-elizabeth feared , for the strength of [his]79-mr. bingley attachment .

As for [Jane]83-jane , _ [her]83-jane _ anxiety under this suspense was , of course , more painful than [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth 's : but whatever [she]83-jane felt [she]83-jane was desirous of concealing ; and between [herself]83-jane and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , therefore , the subject was never alluded to . But as no such delicacy restrained [[her]83-jane mother]241-her mother , an hour seldom passed in which [she]241-her mother did not talk of [Bingley]79-mr. bingley , express [her]241-her mother impatience for [his]79-mr. bingley arrival , or even require [Jane]83-jane to confess that if [he]79-mr. bingley did not come back [she]83-jane should think [herself]83-jane very ill - used . It needed all [Jane]83-jane 's steady mildness to bear these attacks with tolerable tranquillity .

[Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins returned most punctually on the Monday fortnight , but [his]129-mr. collins reception at [Longbourn]7-longbourn was not quite so gracious as it had been on [his]129-mr. collins first introduction . [He]129-mr. collins was too happy , however , to need much attention ; and , luckily for [the others]507-the others , the business of love - making relieved [them]507-the others from a great deal of [his]129-mr. collins company . The chief of every day was spent by [him]129-mr. collins at [Lucas Lodge]10-lucas lodge , and [he]129-mr. collins sometimes returned to [Longbourn]7-longbourn only in time to make an apology for [his]129-mr. collins absence before [the family]416-the family went to bed .

[Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet was really in a most pitiable state . The very mention of anything concerning the match threw [her]85-mrs. bennet into an agony of ill - humour , and wherever [she]85-mrs. bennet went [she]85-mrs. bennet was sure of hearing it talked of . The sight of [Miss Lucas]92-miss lucas was odious to [her]85-mrs. bennet . As [[her]85-mrs. bennet successor in [that house]1136-that house]1135-her successor in that house , [she]85-mrs. bennet regarded [her]85-mrs. bennet with jealous abhorrence . Whenever [Charlotte]101-charlotte came to see [them]1137-them , [she]101-charlotte concluded [her]101-charlotte to be anticipating the hour of possession ; and whenever [she]101-charlotte spoke in a low voice to [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins , was convinced that [they]1137-them were talking of [the Longbourn estate]1075-the longbourn estate , and resolving to turn [herself]101-charlotte and [[her]101-charlotte daughters]237-her daughters out of [the house]3001-the house as soon as [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet was dead . [She]101-charlotte complained bitterly of all this to [[her]101-charlotte husband]255-her husband .

" Indeed , [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet , "[101-charlotte] said [she]101-charlotte , " it is very hard to think that [Charlotte Lucas]101-charlotte should ever be [mistress of [this house]3416-this house]3846-mistress of this house , that _ [I]101-charlotte _ should be forced to make way for _ [her]101-charlotte _ , and live to see [her]101-charlotte take [my]101-charlotte place in [it]3416-this house ! "[101-charlotte]

" [[My]101-charlotte dear]2993-my dear , do not give way to such gloomy thoughts . Let [us]3849-us hope for better things . Let [us]3849-us flatter [ourselves]3849-us that _ [I]101-charlotte _ may be [the survivor]3850-the survivor . "[101-charlotte]

This was not very consoling to [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet ; and , therefore , instead of making any answer , [she]101-charlotte went on as before .

" [I]101-charlotte can not bear to think that [they]3851-they should have all [this estate]3450-this estate . If it was not for the entail , [I]101-charlotte should not mind it . "[101-charlotte]

" What should not [you]101-charlotte mind ? "[101-charlotte]

" [I]101-charlotte should not mind anything at all . "[101-charlotte]

" Let [us]3849-us be thankful that [you]101-charlotte are preserved from a state of such insensibility . "[101-charlotte]

" [I]101-charlotte never can be thankful , [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet , for anything about the entail . How [anyone]3102-anyone could have the conscience to entail away an estate from [one 's own daughters]3854-one 's own daughters [I]101-charlotte can not understand ; and all for the sake of [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins , too ! Why should _ [he]129-mr. collins _ have it more than [anybody else]3855-anybody else ? "[101-charlotte]

" [I]75-mr. bennet leave it to [yourself]101-charlotte to determine , "[75-mr. bennet] said [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet .

[Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley 's letter arrived , and put an end to doubt . The very first sentence conveyed the assurance of [their]1142-their being all settled in [London]5-london for the winter , and concluded with [[her]91-miss bingley brother]3108-her brother 's regret at not having had time to pay [his]3108-her brother respects to [[his]3108-her brother friends]407-his friends in [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire before [he]3108-her brother left [the country]448-the country .

Hope was over , entirely over ; and when [Jane]83-jane could attend to the rest of the letter , [she]83-jane found little , except the professed affection of [the writer]1146-the writer , that could give [her]83-jane any comfort . [Miss Darcy]124-miss darcy 's praise occupied [the chief of it]947-the chief of it . [Her]83-jane many attractions were again dwelt on ; and [Caroline]118-caroline boasted joyfully of [their]1142-their increasing intimacy , and ventured to predict the accomplishment of the wishes which had been unfolded in [her]118-caroline former letter . [She]118-caroline wrote also with great pleasure of [[her]91-miss bingley brother]3108-her brother 's being [an inmate of [[Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy 's house]1150-mr. darcy 's house]1149-an inmate of mr. darcy 's house , and mentioned with raptures some plans of the latter with regard to new furniture .

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , to whom [Jane]83-jane very soon communicated [the chief of all this]1151-the chief of all this , heard it in silent indignation . [Her]83-jane heart was divided between concern for [[her]91-miss bingley sister]328-her sister and resentment against all others . To [Caroline]118-caroline 's assertion of [[her]91-miss bingley brother]3108-her brother 's being partial to [Miss Darcy]124-miss darcy , [she]118-caroline paid no credit . That [he]3108-her brother was really fond of [Jane]83-jane , [she]83-jane doubted no more than [she]83-jane had ever done ; and much as [she]83-jane had always been disposed to like [him]3108-her brother , [she]83-jane could not think without anger , hardly without contempt , on that easiness of temper , that want of proper resolution , which now made [him]3108-her brother [the slave of [[his]3108-her brother designing friends]1155-his designing friends]1154-the slave of his designing friends , and led [him]3108-her brother to sacrifice [his]3108-her brother own happiness to the caprice of [their]1155-his designing friends inclinations . Had [his]3108-her brother own happiness , however , been the only sacrifice , [he]3108-her brother might have been allowed to sport with it in whatever manner [he]3108-her brother thought best ; but [[her]83-jane sister]328-her sister 's was involved in it , as [she]83-jane thought [he]3108-her brother must be sensible [himself]3108-her brother . It was a subject , in short , on which reflection would be long indulged , and must be unavailing . [She]83-jane could think of nothing else ; and yet , whether [Bingley]91-miss bingley 's regard had really died away , or were suppressed by [[his]3108-her brother friends]407-his friends ' interference ; whether [he]3108-her brother had been aware of [Jane]83-jane 's attachment , or whether it had escaped [his]3108-her brother observation ; whichever were the case , though [her]83-jane opinion of [him]3108-her brother must be materially affected by the difference , [[her]83-jane sister]328-her sister 's situation remained the same , [her]328-her sister peace equally wounded .

A day or two passed before [Jane]83-jane had courage to speak of [her]83-jane feelings to [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth ; but at last , on [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet 's leaving [them]1159-we together , after a longer irritation than usual about [Netherfield]2-netherfield and [its master]1160-its master , [she]83-jane could not help saying,--

" O that [[my]83-jane dear mother]3856-my dear mother had more command over [herself]3856-my dear mother ! [she]3856-my dear mother can have no idea of the pain [she]3856-my dear mother gives [me]83-jane by [her]3856-my dear mother continual reflections on [him]1160-its master . But [I]83-jane will not repine . It can not last long . [He]1160-its master will be forgot , and [we]1159-we shall all be as [we]1159-we were before . "[83-jane]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth looked at [[her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister with incredulous solicitude , but said nothing .

" [You]82-elizabeth doubt [me]83-jane , "[83-jane] cried [Jane]83-jane , slightly colouring ; " indeed , [you]82-elizabeth have no reason . [He]1160-its master may live in [my]83-jane memory as [the most amiable man of [my]83-jane acquaintance]3857-the most amiable man of my acquaintance but that is all . [I]83-jane have nothing either to hope or fear , and nothing to reproach [him]1160-its master with . Thank [God]95-god [I]83-jane have not _ that _ pain . A little time , therefore -- [I]83-jane shall certainly try to get the better---- "[83-jane]

With a stronger voice [she]83-jane soon added , " [I]83-jane have this comfort immediately , that it has not been more than an error of fancy on [my]83-jane side , and that it has done no harm to [anyone]3102-anyone but [myself]83-jane . "[83-jane]

" [[My]82-elizabeth dear]2993-my dear [Jane]83-jane , "[82-elizabeth] exclaimed [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , " [you]83-jane are too good . [Your]83-jane sweetness and disinterestedness are really angelic ; [I]82-elizabeth do not know what to say to [you]83-jane . [I]82-elizabeth feel as if [I]82-elizabeth had never done [you]83-jane justice , or loved [you]83-jane as [you]83-jane deserve . "[82-elizabeth]

[Miss Bennet]82-elizabeth eagerly disclaimed all extraordinary merit , and threw back the praise on [[her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister 's warm affection .

" Nay , "[82-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , " this is not fair . _ [You]83-jane _ wish to think all [the world]303-the world respectable , and are hurt if [I]82-elizabeth speak ill of [anybody]3099-anybody . _ [I]82-elizabeth _ only want to think _ [you]83-jane _ perfect , and [you]83-jane set [yourself]83-jane against it . Do not be afraid of [my]82-elizabeth running into any excess , of [my]82-elizabeth encroaching on [your]83-jane privilege of universal good - will . [You]83-jane need not . There are [few people whom [I]82-elizabeth really love]3862-few people whom i really love , and still fewer of whom [I]82-elizabeth think well . The more [I]82-elizabeth see of [the world]303-the world the more am [I]82-elizabeth dissatisfied with it ; and every day confirms [my]82-elizabeth belief of the inconsistency of [all human characters]3864-all human characters , and of the little dependence that can be placed on the appearance of either merit or sense . [I]82-elizabeth have met with two instances lately : one [I]82-elizabeth will not mention , the other is [Charlotte]101-charlotte 's marriage . It is unaccountable ! in every view it is unaccountable ! "[82-elizabeth]

" [[My]82-elizabeth dear]2993-my dear [Lizzy]82-elizabeth , do not give way to such feelings as these . They will ruin [your]82-elizabeth happiness . [You]82-elizabeth do not make allowance enough for difference of situation and temper . Consider [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins 's respectability , and [Charlotte]101-charlotte 's prudent , steady character . "[82-elizabeth]

" To oblige [you]82-elizabeth , [I]82-elizabeth would try to believe almost anything , but [no one else]3871-no one else could be benefited by such a belief as this ; for were [I]82-elizabeth persuaded that [Charlotte]101-charlotte had any regard for [him]129-mr. collins , [I]82-elizabeth should only think worse of [her]101-charlotte understanding than [I]82-elizabeth now do of [her]101-charlotte heart . [[My]82-elizabeth dear]2993-my dear [Jane]83-jane , [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins is [a conceited , pompous , narrow - minded , silly man]3873-a conceited , pompous , narrow - minded , silly man : [you]83-jane know [he]129-mr. collins is , as well as [I]82-elizabeth do ; and [you]83-jane must feel , as well as [I]82-elizabeth do , that [the woman who marries [him]129-mr. collins]3874-the woman who marries him can not have a proper way of thinking . [You]83-jane shall not , for the sake of [one individual]3875-one individual , change the meaning of principle and integrity , nor endeavour to persuade [yourself]83-jane or [me]82-elizabeth , that selfishness is prudence , and insensibility of danger security for happiness . "[82-elizabeth]

" [I]83-jane must think [your]83-jane language too strong in speaking of both , "[83-jane] replied [Jane]83-jane ; " and [I]83-jane hope [you]83-jane will be convinced of it , by seeing [them]3876-them happy together . [I]83-jane can not misunderstand [you]83-jane , but [I]83-jane entreat [you]83-jane , [dear Lizzy]82-elizabeth , not to pain [me]83-jane by thinking _ [that person]3364-that person _ to blame , and saying [your]83-jane opinion of [him]3364-that person is sunk . [We]3878-we must not be so ready to fancy [ourselves]3878-we intentionally injured . [We]3878-we must not expect [a lively young man]3879-a lively young man to be always so guarded and circumspect . It is very often nothing but [our]3878-we own vanity that deceives [us]3878-we . [Women]3880-women fancy admiration means more than it does . "[83-jane]

" And [men]3250-men take care that [they]3250-men should . "[82-elizabeth]

" If it is designedly done , [they]3250-men can not be justified ; but [I]83-jane have no idea of there being so much design in [the world]303-the world as [some persons]3883-some persons imagine . "[83-jane]

" [I]82-elizabeth am far from attributing any part of [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley 's conduct to design , "[82-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth ; " but , without scheming to do wrong , or to make [others]3103-others unhappy , there may be error and there may be misery . " And do [you]83-jane impute it to either of those ? "[83-jane]

" [You]83-jane persist , then , in supposing [[his]79-mr. bingley sisters]282-his sisters influence [him]79-mr. bingley ? "[83-jane]

" [I]83-jane can not believe it . Why should [they]282-his sisters try to influence [him]79-mr. bingley ? [They]282-his sisters can only wish [his]79-mr. bingley happiness ; and if [he]79-mr. bingley is attached to [me]83-jane [no other woman]3888-no other woman can secure it . "[83-jane]

"[82-elizabeth]

" Beyond a doubt [they]282-his sisters do wish [him]79-mr. bingley to choose [Miss Darcy]124-miss darcy , "[83-jane] replied [Jane]83-jane ; " but this may be from better feelings than [you]83-jane are supposing . If [they]282-his sisters believed [him]79-mr. bingley attached to [me]83-jane [they]282-his sisters would not try to part [us]3892-us ; if [he]79-mr. bingley were so , [they]282-his sisters could not succeed . By supposing such an affection , [you]3893-you make [everybody]304-everybody acting unnaturally and wrong , and [me]83-jane most unhappy . Do not distress [me]83-jane by the idea . [I]83-jane am not ashamed of having been mistaken -- or , at least , it is slight , it is nothing in comparison of what [I]83-jane should feel in thinking ill of [him]79-mr. bingley or [[his]79-mr. bingley sisters]282-his sisters . Let [me]83-jane take it in the best light , in the light in which it may be understood . "[83-jane]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth could not oppose such a wish ; and from this time [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley 's name was scarcely ever mentioned between [them]1163-them .

[Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet still continued to wonder and repine at [his]79-mr. bingley returning no more ; and though a day seldom passed in which [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth did not account for it clearly , there seemed little chance of [her]82-elizabeth ever considering it with less perplexity . [[Her]85-mrs. bennet daughter]463-her daughter endeavoured to convince [her]85-mrs. bennet of what [she]85-mrs. bennet did not believe [herself]85-mrs. bennet , that [his]79-mr. bingley attentions to [Jane]83-jane had been merely the effect of a common and transient liking , which ceased when [he]79-mr. bingley saw [her]83-jane no more ; but though the probability of the statement was admitted at the time , [she]85-mrs. bennet had the same story to repeat every day . [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet 's best comfort was , that [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley must be down again in the summer .

[Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet treated the matter differently . " So , [Lizzy]82-elizabeth , "[75-mr. bennet] said [he]75-mr. bennet , one day , " [[your]82-elizabeth sister]3139-your sister is crossed in love , [I]75-mr. bennet find . [I]75-mr. bennet congratulate [her]3139-your sister . Next to being married , [a girl]3566-a girl likes to be crossed in love a little now and then . [You]82-elizabeth will hardly bear to be long outdone by [Jane]83-jane . Now is [your]82-elizabeth time . Here are officers enough at [Meryton]9-meryton to disappoint [all the young ladies in [the country]448-the country]3899-all the young ladies in the country . Let [Wickham]136-wickham be [[your]82-elizabeth man]3901-your man . [He]136-wickham is [a pleasant fellow]3902-a pleasant fellow , and would jilt [you]82-elizabeth creditably . "[75-mr. bennet]

" Thank [you]75-mr. bennet , [sir]3161-sir , but [a less agreeable man]3904-a less agreeable man would satisfy [me]1167-general unreserve . [We]3905-we must not all expect [Jane]83-jane 's good fortune . "[1167-general unreserve]

" True , "[75-mr. bennet] said [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet ; " but it is a comfort to think that , whatever of that kind may befall [you]82-elizabeth , [you]82-elizabeth have [an affectionate mother who will always make the most of it . "[75-mr. bennet]

[Mr. Wickham]136-wickham 's society]3906-an affectionate mother who will always make the most of it . " mr. wickham 's society was of material service in dispelling the gloom which the late perverse occurrences had thrown on [many of [the Longbourn family]725-the longbourn family]1165-many of the longbourn family . [They]1165-many of the longbourn family saw [him]136-wickham often , and to [his]136-wickham other recommendations was now added that of [general unreserve]1167-general unreserve . [Miss Bennet]82-elizabeth was [the only creature who could suppose there might be any extenuating circumstances in the case unknown to the society of]1169-the only creature who could suppose there might be any extenuating circumstances in the case unknown to the society of [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire : [her]82-elizabeth mild and steady candour always pleaded for allowances , and urged the possibility of mistakes ; but by [everybody else]978-everybody else [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy was condemned as the worst of [men]3250-men .

After a week spent in professions of love and schemes of felicity , [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins was called from [[his]129-mr. collins amiable Charlotte]101-charlotte by the arrival of [Saturday]152-saturday . The pain of separation , however , might be alleviated on [his]129-mr. collins side by preparations for the reception of [[his]129-mr. collins bride]1172-his bride , as [he]129-mr. collins had reason to hope , that shortly after [his]129-mr. collins next return into [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire , the day would be fixed that was to make [him]129-mr. collins [the happiest of [men]3250-men]1070-the happiest of men . [He]129-mr. collins took leave of [[his]129-mr. collins relations]701-his relations at [Longbourn]7-longbourn with as much solemnity as before ; wished [[his]129-mr. collins fair cousins]687-his fair cousins health and happiness again , and promised [[their]687-his fair cousins father]247-their father another letter of thanks .

On the following Monday , [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet had the pleasure of receiving [[her]85-mrs. bennet brother]3108-her brother and [[his]3108-her brother wife]231-his wife , who came , as usual , to spend the Christmas at [Longbourn]7-longbourn . [Mr. Gardiner]153-mr. gardiner was [a sensible , gentlemanlike man , greatly superior to [[his]153-mr. gardiner sister]559-his sister , as well by nature as education]1180-a sensible , gentlemanlike man , greatly superior to his sister , as well by nature as education . [The Netherfield ladies]1182-the netherfield ladies would have had difficulty in believing that [a man who lived by trade]1183-a man who lived by trade , and within view of [[his]153-mr. gardiner own warehouses]1184-his own warehouses , could have been so well - bred and agreeable . [Mrs. Gardiner]125-mrs. gardiner , who was several years younger than [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet and [Mrs. Philips]111-mrs. philips , was [an amiable , intelligent , elegant woman]1185-an amiable , intelligent , elegant woman , and a great favourite with [[her]125-mrs. gardiner Longbourn nieces]1186-her longbourn nieces . Between [the two eldest]397-the two eldest and [herself]125-mrs. gardiner especially , there subsisted a very particular regard . [They]397-the two eldest had frequently been staying with [her]125-mrs. gardiner in [town]264-town .

The first part of [Mrs. Gardiner]125-mrs. gardiner 's business , on [her]125-mrs. gardiner arrival , was to distribute [her]125-mrs. gardiner presents and describe the newest fashions . When this was done , [she]125-mrs. gardiner had a less active part to play . It became [her]125-mrs. gardiner turn to listen . [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet had many grievances to relate , and much to complain of . [They]1189-they had all been very ill - used since [she]125-mrs. gardiner last saw [[her]125-mrs. gardiner sister]328-her sister . [Two of [[her]125-mrs. gardiner girls]1192-her girls]1191-two of her girls had been on the point of marriage , and after all there was nothing in it .

" [I]125-mrs. gardiner do not blame [Jane]83-jane , "[125-mrs. gardiner] [she]125-mrs. gardiner continued , " for [Jane]83-jane would have got [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley if [she]83-jane could . But , [Lizzy]82-elizabeth ! Oh , [sister]3891-sister ! it is very hard to think that [she]83-jane might have been [[Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins 's wife]3908-mr. collins 's wife by this time , had not it been for [her]83-jane own perverseness . [He]79-mr. bingley made [her]83-jane an offer in [this very room]3909-this very room , and [she]83-jane refused [him]79-mr. bingley . The consequence of it is , that [Lady Lucas]81-lady lucas will have [a daughter]1117-a daughter married before [I]125-mrs. gardiner have , and that [Longbourn]7-longbourn estate is just as much entailed as ever . [The Lucases]100-the lucases are [very artful people]3911-very artful people , indeed , [sister]3891-sister . [They]100-the lucases are all for what [they]100-the lucases can get . [I]125-mrs. gardiner am sorry to say it of [them]100-the lucases , but so it is . It makes [me]125-mrs. gardiner very nervous and poorly , to be thwarted so in [[my]125-mrs. gardiner own family]3913-my own family , and to have [[neighbours]3914-neighbours who think of [themselves]3915-neighbours who think of themselves before anybody else before [anybody else]3855-anybody else]3915-neighbours who think of themselves before anybody else . However , [your]3891-sister coming just at this time is the greatest of comforts , and [I]125-mrs. gardiner am very glad to hear what [you]3891-sister tell [us]3917-us of long sleeves . "[125-mrs. gardiner]

[Mrs. Gardiner]125-mrs. gardiner , to whom [the chief of this news]1193-the chief of this news had been given before , in the course of [Jane]83-jane and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth 's correspondence with [her]125-mrs. gardiner , made [[her]125-mrs. gardiner sister]328-her sister a slight answer , and , in compassion to [[her]125-mrs. gardiner nieces]3045-her nieces , turned the conversation .

When alone with [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth afterwards , [she]125-mrs. gardiner spoke more on the subject . " It seems likely to have been a desirable match for [Jane]83-jane , "[125-mrs. gardiner] said [she]125-mrs. gardiner . " [I]125-mrs. gardiner am sorry it went off . But these things happen so often !
