[A young man]3093-a young man , such as [you]3891-sister describe [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley , so easily falls in love with [a pretty girl]3919-a pretty girl for a few weeks , and , when accident separates [them]3920-them , so easily forgets [her]3919-a pretty girl , that these sort of inconstancies are very frequent . "[125-mrs. gardiner]

" An excellent consolation in its way , "[82-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth ; " but it will not do for _ [us]3921-us _ . [We]3921-us do not suffer by accident . It does not often happen that the interference of [friends]3787-friends will persuade [a young man of independent fortune]3923-a young man of independent fortune to think no more of [a girl whom [he]3923-a young man of independent fortune was violently in love with only a few days before]3924-a girl whom he was violently in love with only a few days before . "[82-elizabeth]

" But that expression of ' violently in love ' is so hackneyed , so doubtful , so indefinite , that it gives [me]125-mrs. gardiner very little idea . It is as often applied to feelings which arise only from a half hour 's acquaintance , as to a real , strong attachment . Pray , how _ violent was _ [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley 's love ? "[125-mrs. gardiner]

" [I]82-elizabeth never saw a more promising inclination ; [he]79-mr. bingley was growing quite inattentive to [other people]3885-other people , and wholly engrossed by [her]3919-a pretty girl . Every time [they]3920-them met , it was more decided and remarkable . At [his]79-mr. bingley own ball [he]79-mr. bingley offended [two or three young ladies]3926-two or three young ladies by not asking [them]3926-two or three young ladies to dance ; and [I]82-elizabeth spoke to [him]79-mr. bingley twice [myself]82-elizabeth without receiving an answer . Could there be finer symptoms ? Is not general incivility the very essence of love ? "[82-elizabeth]

" Oh , yes ! of that kind of love which [I]125-mrs. gardiner suppose [him]79-mr. bingley to have felt . [Poor Jane]83-jane ! [I]125-mrs. gardiner am sorry for [her]3919-a pretty girl , because , with [her]3919-a pretty girl disposition , [she]3919-a pretty girl may not get over it immediately . It had better have happened to _ [you]82-elizabeth _ , [Lizzy]82-elizabeth ; [you]82-elizabeth would have laughed [yourself]82-elizabeth out of it sooner . But do [you]82-elizabeth think [she]3919-a pretty girl would be prevailed on to go back with [us]3927-we ? Change of scene might be of service -- and perhaps a little relief from [home]3219-home may be as useful as anything . "[125-mrs. gardiner]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth was exceedingly pleased with this proposal , and felt persuaded of [[her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister 's ready acquiescence .

" [I]125-mrs. gardiner hope , "[125-mrs. gardiner] added [Mrs. Gardiner]125-mrs. gardiner , " that no consideration with regard to [this young man]3929-this young man will influence [her]3919-a pretty girl . [We]3927-we live in [so different a part of [town]264-town]3930-so different a part of town , all [our]3927-we connections are so different , and , as [you]82-elizabeth well know , [we]3927-we go out so little , that it is very improbable [they]3927-we should meet at all , unless [he]3929-this young man really comes to see [her]3919-a pretty girl . "[125-mrs. gardiner]

" And _ that _ is quite impossible ; for [he]3929-this young man is now in the custody of [[his]3929-this young man friend]286-his friend , and [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy would no more suffer [him]3929-this young man to call on [Jane]83-jane in [such a part of [London]5-london]3933-such a part of london ! [[My]125-mrs. gardiner dear aunt]3934-my dear aunt , how could [you]3934-my dear aunt think of it ? [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy may , perhaps , have _ heard _ of [such a place as [Gracechurch Street]28-gracechurch street]3935-such a place as gracechurch street , but [he]3929-this young man would hardly think a month 's ablution enough to cleanse [him]3929-this young man from its impurities , were [he]3929-this young man once to enter [it]3935-such a place as gracechurch street ; and , depend upon it , [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley never stirs without [him]3929-this young man . "[125-mrs. gardiner]

" So much the better . [I]125-mrs. gardiner hope [they]3936-they will not meet at all . But does not [Jane]83-jane correspond with [[his]79-mr. bingley sister]559-his sister ? _ [She]83-jane _ will not be able to help calling . "[125-mrs. gardiner]

" [She]83-jane will drop the acquaintance entirely . "[125-mrs. gardiner]

But , in spite of the certainty in which [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth affected to place this point , as well as the still more interesting one of [Bingley]79-mr. bingley 's being withheld from seeing [Jane]83-jane , [she]82-elizabeth felt a solicitude on the subject which convinced [her]82-elizabeth , on examination , that [she]82-elizabeth did not consider it entirely hopeless . It was possible , and sometimes [she]82-elizabeth thought it probable , that [his]79-mr. bingley affection might be re - animated , and the influence of [[his]79-mr. bingley friends]407-his friends successfully combated by the more natural influence of [Jane]83-jane 's attractions .

[Miss Bennet]82-elizabeth accepted [[her]82-elizabeth aunt]1198-her aunt 's invitation with pleasure ; and [the Bingleys]141-the bingleys were no otherwise in [her]82-elizabeth thoughts at the same time than as [she]82-elizabeth hoped , by [Caroline]118-caroline 's not living in [the same house]3501-the same house with [[her]118-caroline brother]3108-her brother , [she]118-caroline might occasionally spend a morning with [her]118-caroline , without any danger of seeing [him]3108-her brother .

[The Gardiners]154-the gardiners stayed a week at [Longbourn]7-longbourn ; and what with [the Philipses]137-the philipses , [the Lucases]100-the lucases , and [the officers]454-the officers , there was not a day without its engagement . [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet had so carefully provided for the entertainment of [[her]85-mrs. bennet brother]3108-her brother and [sister]3891-sister , that [they]1204-they did not once sit down to a family dinner . When the engagement was for [home]3219-home , [some of [the officers]454-the officers]1206-some of the officers always made part of it , of which [officers]458-officers [Mr. Wickham]136-wickham was sure to be one ; and on these occasions [Mrs. Gardiner]125-mrs. gardiner , rendered suspicious by [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth 's warm commendation of [him]136-wickham , narrowly observed [them]1204-they both . Without supposing [them]1204-they , from what [she]125-mrs. gardiner saw , to be very seriously in love , [their]1204-they preference of each other was plain enough to make [her]125-mrs. gardiner a little uneasy ; and [she]125-mrs. gardiner resolved to speak to [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth on the subject before [she]82-elizabeth left [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire , and represent to [her]82-elizabeth the imprudence of encouraging such an attachment .

To [Mrs. Gardiner]125-mrs. gardiner , [Wickham]136-wickham had one means of affording pleasure , unconnected with [his]136-wickham general powers . About ten or a dozen years ago , before [her]125-mrs. gardiner marriage , [she]125-mrs. gardiner had spent a considerable time in [that very part of [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire to which [he]136-wickham belonged]1209-that very part of derbyshire to which he belonged . [They]1204-they had , therefore , many acquaintance in common ; and , though [Wickham]136-wickham had been little there since the death of [[Darcy]89-mr. darcy 's father]1210-darcy 's father , five years before , it was yet in [his]136-wickham power to give [her]125-mrs. gardiner fresher intelligence of [[her]125-mrs. gardiner former friends]1211-her former friends than [she]125-mrs. gardiner had been in the way of procuring .

[Mrs. Gardiner]125-mrs. gardiner had seen [Pemberley]12-pemberley , and known [the late Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy by character perfectly well . Here , consequently , was an inexhaustible subject of discourse . In comparing [her]125-mrs. gardiner recollection of [Pemberley]12-pemberley with the minute description which [Wickham]136-wickham could give , and in bestowing [her]125-mrs. gardiner tribute of praise on the character of [its late possessor]1212-its late possessor , [she]125-mrs. gardiner was delighting both [him]136-wickham and [herself]125-mrs. gardiner . On being made acquainted with the present [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy 's treatment of [him]89-mr. darcy , [she]125-mrs. gardiner tried to remember something of [that gentleman]3305-that gentleman 's reputed disposition , when quite [a lad]1214-a lad , which might agree with it ; and was confident , at last , that [she]125-mrs. gardiner recollected having heard [Mr. Fitzwilliam Darcy]89-mr. darcy formerly spoken of as [a very proud , ill - natured boy]1215-a very proud , ill - natured boy .

[Mrs. Gardiner]125-mrs. gardiner 's caution to [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth was punctually and kindly given on the first favourable opportunity of speaking to [her]82-elizabeth alone : after honestly telling [her]82-elizabeth what [she]82-elizabeth thought , [she]125-mrs. gardiner thus went on:--

" [You]82-elizabeth are too sensible [a girl]3566-a girl , [Lizzy]82-elizabeth , to fall in love merely because [you]82-elizabeth are warned against it ; and , therefore , [I]125-mrs. gardiner am not afraid of speaking openly . Seriously , [I]125-mrs. gardiner would have [you]82-elizabeth be on [your]82-elizabeth guard . Do not involve [yourself]82-elizabeth , or endeavour to involve [him]3305-that gentleman , in an affection which the want of fortune would make so very imprudent . [I]125-mrs. gardiner have nothing to say against _ [him]3305-that gentleman _ : [he]3305-that gentleman is [a most interesting young man]3939-a most interesting young man ; and if [he]3305-that gentleman had the fortune [he]3305-that gentleman ought to have , [I]125-mrs. gardiner should think [you]82-elizabeth could not do better . But as it is -- [you]82-elizabeth must not let [your]82-elizabeth fancy run away with [you]82-elizabeth . [You]82-elizabeth have sense , and [we]3940-we all expect [you]82-elizabeth to use it . [[Your]82-elizabeth father]3223-your father would depend on _ [your]82-elizabeth _ resolution and good conduct , [I]125-mrs. gardiner am sure . [You]82-elizabeth must not disappoint [[your]82-elizabeth father]3223-your father . "[125-mrs. gardiner]

" [[My]125-mrs. gardiner dear aunt]3934-my dear aunt , this is being serious indeed . "[125-mrs. gardiner]

" Yes , and [I]125-mrs. gardiner hope to engage [you]82-elizabeth to be serious likewise . "[125-mrs. gardiner]

" Well , then , [you]82-elizabeth need not be under any alarm . [I]125-mrs. gardiner will take care of [myself]125-mrs. gardiner , and of [Mr. Wickham]136-wickham too . [He]136-wickham shall not be in love with [me]125-mrs. gardiner , if [I]125-mrs. gardiner can prevent it . "[125-mrs. gardiner]

" [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , [you]82-elizabeth are not serious now . "[125-mrs. gardiner]

" [I]125-mrs. gardiner beg [your]82-elizabeth pardon . [I]125-mrs. gardiner will try again . At present [I]125-mrs. gardiner am not in love with [Mr. Wickham]136-wickham ; no , [I]125-mrs. gardiner certainly am not . But [he]136-wickham is , beyond all comparison , [the most agreeable man [I]125-mrs. gardiner ever saw]3944-the most agreeable man i ever saw -- and if [he]136-wickham becomes really attached to [me]125-mrs. gardiner -- [I]125-mrs. gardiner believe it will be better that [he]136-wickham should not . [I]125-mrs. gardiner see the imprudence of it . Oh , _ that _ abominable [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy ! [[My]125-mrs. gardiner father]3256-my father 's opinion of [me]125-mrs. gardiner does [me]125-mrs. gardiner the greatest honour ; and [I]125-mrs. gardiner should be miserable to forfeit it . [[My]125-mrs. gardiner father]3256-my father , however , is partial to [Mr. Wickham]136-wickham . In short , [[my]125-mrs. gardiner dear aunt]3934-my dear aunt , [I]125-mrs. gardiner should be very sorry to be the means of making any of [you]3934-my dear aunt unhappy ; but since [we]3948-we see , every day , that where there is affection [young people]3160-young people are seldom withheld , by immediate want of fortune , from entering into engagements with [each other]3144-each other , how can [I]125-mrs. gardiner promise to be wiser than so many of [my]125-mrs. gardiner fellow - creatures , if [I]125-mrs. gardiner am tempted , or how am [I]125-mrs. gardiner even to know that it would be wiser to resist ? All that [I]125-mrs. gardiner can promise [you]3934-my dear aunt , therefore , is not to be in a hurry . [I]125-mrs. gardiner will not be in a hurry to believe [myself]125-mrs. gardiner [his]136-wickham first object . When [I]125-mrs. gardiner am in company with [him]136-wickham , [I]125-mrs. gardiner will not be wishing . In short , [I]125-mrs. gardiner will do [my]125-mrs. gardiner best . "[125-mrs. gardiner]

" Perhaps it will be as well if [you]82-elizabeth discourage [his]136-wickham coming [here]2994-here so very often . At least [you]82-elizabeth should not _ remind _ [[your]82-elizabeth mother]3715-your mother of inviting [him]136-wickham . "[125-mrs. gardiner]

" As [I]82-elizabeth did the other day , "[82-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , with a conscious smile ; " very true , it will be wise in [me]82-elizabeth to refrain from _ that _ . But do not imagine that [he]136-wickham is always here so often . It is on [your]82-elizabeth account that [he]136-wickham has been so frequently invited this week . [You]82-elizabeth know [[my]82-elizabeth mother]3227-my mother 's ideas as to the necessity of constant company for [[her]3227-my mother friends]310-her friends . But really , and upon [my]82-elizabeth honour , [I]82-elizabeth will try to do what [I]82-elizabeth think to be wisest ; and now [I]82-elizabeth hope [you]82-elizabeth are satisfied . "[82-elizabeth]

[[Her]82-elizabeth aunt]1198-her aunt assured [her]82-elizabeth that [she]82-elizabeth was ; and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , having thanked [her]1198-her aunt for the kindness of [her]1198-her aunt hints , [they]1217-they parted,--a wonderful instance of advice being given on such a point without being resented .

[Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins returned into [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire soon after [it]1218-it had been quitted by [the Gardiners]154-the gardiners and [Jane]83-jane ; but , as [he]129-mr. collins took up [his]129-mr. collins abode with [the Lucases]100-the lucases , [his]129-mr. collins arrival was no great inconvenience to [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet . [His]129-mr. collins marriage was now fast approaching ; and [she]85-mrs. bennet was at length so far resigned as to think it inevitable , and even repeatedly to say , in an ill - natured tone , that [she]85-mrs. bennet " _ wished _ [they]1221-they might be happy . "[85-mrs. bennet] Thursday was to be the wedding - day , and on Wednesday [Miss Lucas]92-miss lucas paid [her]92-miss lucas farewell visit ; and when [she]92-miss lucas rose to take leave , [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , ashamed of [[her]82-elizabeth mother]241-her mother 's ungracious and reluctant good wishes , and sincerely affected [herself]82-elizabeth , accompanied [her]92-miss lucas out of [the room]250-the room . As [they]1221-they went down [stairs]519-stairs together , [Charlotte]101-charlotte said,--

" [I]101-charlotte shall depend on hearing from [you]82-elizabeth very often , [Eliza]82-elizabeth . "[101-charlotte]

" _ That _ [you]82-elizabeth certainly shall . "[101-charlotte]

" And [I]101-charlotte have another favour to ask . Will [you]101-charlotte come and see [me]101-charlotte ? "[101-charlotte]

" [We]1221-they shall often meet , [I]101-charlotte hope , in [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire . "[101-charlotte]

" [I]101-charlotte am not likely to leave [Kent]17-kent for some time . Promise [me]101-charlotte , therefore , to come to [Hunsford]15-hunsford . "[101-charlotte]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth could not refuse , though [she]82-elizabeth foresaw little pleasure in the visit .

" [[My]101-charlotte father]3256-my father and [Maria]94-maria are to come to [me]101-charlotte in March , "[101-charlotte] added [Charlotte]101-charlotte , " and [I]101-charlotte hope [you]82-elizabeth will consent to be of [the party]3009-the party . Indeed , [Eliza]82-elizabeth , [you]82-elizabeth will be as welcome to [me]101-charlotte as either of [them]1228-them . "[101-charlotte]

The wedding took place : [the bride]1223-the bride and [bridegroom]1224-bridegroom set off for [Kent]17-kent from [the church]3524-the church door , and [everybody]304-everybody had as much to say or to hear on the subject as usual . [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth soon heard from [[her]82-elizabeth friend]402-her friend , and [their]1228-them correspondence was as regular and frequent as it ever had been : that it should be equally unreserved was impossible . [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth could never address [her]402-her friend without feeling that all the comfort of intimacy was over ; and , though determined not to slacken as [a correspondent]1229-a correspondent , it was for the sake of what had been rather than what was . [Charlotte]101-charlotte 's first letters were received with a good deal of eagerness : there could not but be curiosity to know how [she]101-charlotte would speak of [[her]101-charlotte new home]1230-her new home , how [she]101-charlotte would like [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine , and how happy [she]101-charlotte would dare pronounce [herself]101-charlotte to be ; though , when the letters were read , [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth felt that [Charlotte]101-charlotte expressed [herself]101-charlotte on every point exactly as [she]101-charlotte might have foreseen . [She]101-charlotte wrote cheerfully , seemed surrounded with comforts , and mentioned nothing which [she]101-charlotte could not praise . [The house]3001-the house , furniture , [neighbourhood]1232-neighbourhood , and [roads]1233-roads , were all to [her]101-charlotte taste , and [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine 's behaviour was most friendly and obliging . It was [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins 's picture of [Hunsford]15-hunsford and [Rosings]20-rosings rationally softened ; and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth perceived that [she]82-elizabeth must wait for [her]82-elizabeth own visit [there]305-there , to know the rest .

[Jane]83-jane had already written a few lines to [[her]83-jane sister]328-her sister , to announce [their]1236-their safe arrival in [London]5-london ; and when [she]83-jane wrote again , [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth hoped it would be in [her]82-elizabeth power to say something of [the Bingleys]141-the bingleys .

[Her]82-elizabeth impatience for this second letter was as well rewarded as impatience generally is . [Jane]83-jane had been a week in [town]264-town , without either seeing or hearing from [Caroline]118-caroline . [She]83-jane accounted for it , however , by supposing that [her]83-jane last letter to [[her]83-jane friend]402-her friend from [Longbourn]7-longbourn had by some accident been lost .

" [[My]83-jane aunt]3204-my aunt , "[83-jane] [she]83-jane continued , " is going to - morrow into [that part of [the town]1033-the town]3958-that part of the town , and [I]83-jane shall take the opportunity of calling in [Grosvenor Street]26-grosvenor street . "[83-jane]

[She]83-jane wrote again when the visit was paid , and [she]83-jane had seen [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley . " [I]83-jane did not think [Caroline]118-caroline in spirits , "[83-jane] were [her]83-jane words , " but [she]118-caroline was very glad to see [me]83-jane , and reproached [me]83-jane for giving [her]118-caroline no notice of [my]83-jane coming to [London]5-london . [I]83-jane was right , therefore ; [my]83-jane last letter had never reached [her]118-caroline . [I]83-jane inquired after [[their]3960-their brother]339-their brother , of course . [He]339-their brother was well , but so much engaged with [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy that [they]3960-their scarcely ever saw [him]339-their brother . [I]83-jane found that [Miss Darcy]124-miss darcy was expected to dinner : [I]83-jane wish [I]83-jane could see [her]124-miss darcy . [My]83-jane visit was not long , as [Caroline]118-caroline and [Mrs. Hurst]90-mrs. hurst were going out . [I]83-jane dare say [I]83-jane shall soon see [them]328-her sister here . "[83-jane]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth shook [her]82-elizabeth head over this letter . It convinced [her]82-elizabeth that accident only could discover to [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley [[her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister 's being in [town]264-town .

Four weeks passed away , and [Jane]83-jane saw nothing of [him]79-mr. bingley . [She]83-jane endeavoured to persuade [herself]83-jane that [she]83-jane did not regret it ; but [she]83-jane could no longer be blind to [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley 's inattention . After waiting at [home]3219-home every morning for a fortnight , and inventing every evening a fresh excuse for [her]83-jane , [the visitor]1242-the visitor did at last appear ; but the shortness of [her]83-jane stay , and , yet more , the alteration of [her]83-jane manner , would allow [Jane]83-jane to deceive [herself]83-jane no longer . The letter which [she]83-jane wrote on this occasion to [[her]83-jane sister]328-her sister will prove what [she]83-jane felt:--

" [[My]83-jane dearest]3228-my dearest [Lizzy]82-elizabeth will , [I]83-jane am sure , be incapable of triumphing in [her]328-her sister better judgment , at [my]83-jane expense , when [I]83-jane confess [myself]83-jane to have been entirely deceived in [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley 's regard for [me]83-jane . But , [[my]83-jane dear sister]3825-my dear sister , though the event has proved [you]3825-my dear sister right , do not think [me]83-jane obstinate if [I]83-jane still assert that , considering what [her]328-her sister behaviour was , [my]83-jane confidence was as natural as [your]3825-my dear sister suspicion . [I]83-jane do not at all comprehend [her]328-her sister reason for wishing to be intimate with [me]83-jane ; but , if the same circumstances were to happen again , [I]83-jane am sure [I]83-jane should be deceived again . [Caroline]118-caroline did not return [my]83-jane visit till yesterday ; and not a note , not a line , did [I]83-jane receive in the meantime . When [she]328-her sister did come , it was very evident that [she]328-her sister had no pleasure in it ; [she]328-her sister made a slight , formal apology for not calling before , said not a word of wishing to see [me]83-jane again , and was , in every respect , so altered [a creature]3964-a creature , that when [she]328-her sister went away [I]83-jane was perfectly resolved to continue the acquaintance no longer . [I]83-jane pity , though [I]83-jane can not help blaming , [her]328-her sister . [She]328-her sister was very wrong in singling [me]83-jane out as [she]328-her sister did ; [I]83-jane can safely say , that every advance to intimacy began on [her]328-her sister side . But [I]83-jane pity [her]328-her sister , because [she]328-her sister must feel that [she]328-her sister has been acting wrong , and because [I]83-jane am very sure that anxiety for [[her]328-her sister brother]3108-her brother is the cause of it . [I]83-jane need not explain [myself]83-jane farther ; and though _ [we]3966-we _ know this anxiety to be quite needless , yet if [she]328-her sister feels it , it will easily account for [her]328-her sister behaviour to [me]83-jane ; and so deservedly dear as [he]3108-her brother is to [[his]3108-her brother sister]559-his sister , whatever anxiety [she]328-her sister may feel on [his]3108-her brother behalf is natural and amiable . [I]83-jane can not but wonder , however , at [her]328-her sister having any such fears now , because if [he]3108-her brother had at all cared about [me]83-jane , [we]3966-we must have met long , long ago . [He]3108-her brother knows of [my]83-jane being in [town]264-town , [I]83-jane am certain , from something [she]328-her sister said [herself]328-her sister ; and yet it would seem , by [her]328-her sister manner of talking , as if [she]328-her sister wanted to persuade [herself]328-her sister that [he]3108-her brother is really partial to [Miss Darcy]124-miss darcy . [I]83-jane can not understand it . If [I]83-jane were not afraid of judging harshly , [I]83-jane should be almost tempted to say , that there is a strong appearance of duplicity in all this . [I]83-jane will endeavour to banish every painful thought , and think only of what will make [me]83-jane happy , [your]3969-you affection , and the invariable kindness of [[my]83-jane dear uncle]3970-my dear uncle and [aunt]3971-aunt . Let [me]83-jane hear from [you]3969-you very soon . [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley said something of [his]3108-her brother never returning to [Netherfield]2-netherfield again , of giving up [the house]3001-the house , but not with any certainty . [We]3973-we had better not mention it . [I]83-jane am extremely glad that [you]3969-you have such pleasant accounts from [[our]3973-we friends]3974-our friends at [Hunsford]15-hunsford . Pray go to see [them]3974-our friends , with [Sir William]80-sir william and [Maria]94-maria . [I]83-jane am sure [you]3969-you will be very comfortable there .[83-jane]

" [Yours]3969-you , etc . "[1244-the sister]

This letter gave [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth some pain ; but [her]82-elizabeth spirits returned , as [she]82-elizabeth considered that [Jane]83-jane would no longer be duped , by [the sister]1244-the sister at least . All expectation from [the brother]1245-the brother was now absolutely over . [She]82-elizabeth would not even wish for any renewal of [his]1245-the brother attentions . [His]1245-the brother character sunk on every review of it ; and , as a punishment for [him]1245-the brother , as well as a possible advantage to [Jane]83-jane , [she]82-elizabeth seriously hoped [he]1245-the brother might really soon marry [[Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy 's sister]1246-mr. darcy 's sister , as , by [Wickham]136-wickham 's account , [she]82-elizabeth would make [him]1245-the brother abundantly regret what [he]1245-the brother had thrown away .

[Mrs. Gardiner]125-mrs. gardiner about this time reminded [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth of [her]125-mrs. gardiner promise concerning [that gentleman]3305-that gentleman , and required information ; and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth had such to send as might rather give contentment to [[her]82-elizabeth aunt]1198-her aunt than to [herself]82-elizabeth . [His]1245-the brother apparent partiality had subsided , [his]1245-the brother attentions were over , [he]1245-the brother was [the admirer of [some one else]1250-some one else]1249-the admirer of some one else . [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth was watchful enough to see it all , but [she]82-elizabeth could see it and write of it without material pain . [Her]82-elizabeth heart had been but slightly touched , and [her]82-elizabeth vanity was satisfied with believing that _ [she]82-elizabeth _ would have been [his]1245-the brother only choice , had fortune permitted it . The sudden acquisition of ten thousand pounds was the most remarkable charm of [the young lady to whom [he]1245-the brother was now rendering [himself]1245-the brother agreeable]1251-the young lady to whom he was now rendering himself agreeable ; but [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , less clear - sighted perhaps in this case than in [Charlotte]101-charlotte 's , did not quarrel with [him]1245-the brother for [his]1245-the brother wish of independence . Nothing , on the contrary , could be more natural ; and , while able to suppose that it cost [him]1245-the brother a few struggles to relinquish [her]82-elizabeth , [she]82-elizabeth was ready to allow it a wise and desirable measure for both , and could very sincerely wish [him]1245-the brother happy .

All this was acknowledged to [Mrs. Gardiner]125-mrs. gardiner ; and , after relating the circumstances , [she]82-elizabeth thus went on:--"I am now convinced , [[my]82-elizabeth dear aunt]3934-my dear aunt , that [I]82-elizabeth have never been much in love ; for had [I]82-elizabeth really experienced that pure and elevating passion , [I]82-elizabeth should at present detest [his]1245-the brother very name , and wish [him]1245-the brother all manner of evil . But [my]82-elizabeth feelings are not only cordial towards _ [him]1245-the brother _ , they are even impartial towards [Miss King]93-miss king . [I]82-elizabeth can not find out that [I]82-elizabeth hate [her]93-miss king at all , or that [I]82-elizabeth am in the least unwilling to think [her]93-miss king [a very good sort of girl]3976-a very good sort of girl . There can be no love in all this . [My]82-elizabeth watchfulness has been effectual ; and though [I]82-elizabeth should certainly be a more interesting object to all [my]82-elizabeth acquaintance , were [I]82-elizabeth distractedly in love with [him]1245-the brother , [I]82-elizabeth can not say that [I]82-elizabeth regret [my]82-elizabeth comparative insignificance . Importance may sometimes be purchased too dearly . [Kitty]86-lady catherine and [Lydia]84-lydia take [his]1245-the brother defection much more to heart than [I]82-elizabeth do . [They]3977-they are young in the ways of [the world]303-the world , and not yet open to the mortifying conviction that [handsome young men]3979-handsome young men must have something to live on as well as [the plain]3980-the plain . "[82-elizabeth]

With no greater events than these in [the Longbourn family]725-the longbourn family , and otherwise diversified by little beyond the walks to [Meryton]9-meryton , sometimes dirty and sometimes cold , did [January]14-january and [February]157-february pass away . March was to take [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth to [Hunsford]15-hunsford . [She]82-elizabeth had not at first thought very seriously of going thither ; but [Charlotte]101-charlotte , [she]82-elizabeth soon found , was depending on the plan , and [she]101-charlotte gradually learned to consider it [herself]101-charlotte with greater pleasure as well as greater certainty . Absence had increased [her]101-charlotte desire of seeing [Charlotte]101-charlotte again , and weakened [her]101-charlotte disgust of [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins . There was novelty in the scheme ; and as , with [such a mother]1253-such a mother and [such uncompanionable sisters]1254-such uncompanionable sisters , [home]3219-home could not be faultless , a little change was not unwelcome for its own sake . The journey would , moreover , give [her]101-charlotte a peep at [Jane]83-jane ; and , in short , as the time drew near , [she]101-charlotte would have been very sorry for any delay . Everything , however , went on smoothly , and was finally settled according to [Charlotte]101-charlotte 's first sketch . [She]101-charlotte was to accompany [Sir William]80-sir william and [[his]80-sir william second daughter]240-his second daughter . The improvement of spending a night in [London]5-london was added in time , and the plan became as perfect as plan could be .

The only pain was in leaving [[her]101-charlotte father]244-her father , who would certainly miss [her]101-charlotte , and who , when it came to the point , so little liked [her]101-charlotte going , that [he]244-her father told [her]101-charlotte to write to [him]244-her father , and almost promised to answer [her]101-charlotte letter .

The farewell between [herself]101-charlotte and [Mr. Wickham]136-wickham was perfectly friendly ; on [his]244-her father side even more . [His]244-her father present pursuit could not make [him]244-her father forget that [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth had been the first to excite and to deserve [his]244-her father attention , the first to listen and to pity , the first to be admired ; and in [his]244-her father manner of bidding [her]101-charlotte adieu , wishing [her]101-charlotte every enjoyment , reminding [her]101-charlotte of what [she]101-charlotte was to expect in [Lady Catherine de Bourgh]86-lady catherine , and trusting [their]1258-their opinion of [her]101-charlotte -- [their]1258-their opinion of [everybody]304-everybody -- would always coincide , there was a solicitude , an interest , which [she]101-charlotte felt must ever attach [her]101-charlotte to [him]244-her father with a most sincere regard ; and [she]101-charlotte parted from [him]244-her father convinced , that , whether married or single , [he]244-her father must always be [her]101-charlotte model of the amiable and pleasing .

[[Her]101-charlotte fellow - travellers]1260-her fellow - travellers the next day were not of a kind to make [her]101-charlotte think [him]244-her father less agreeable . [Sir William Lucas]80-sir william , and [[his]80-sir william daughter]1106-his daughter [Maria]94-maria , [a good - humoured girl]1262-a good - humoured girl , but as empty - headed as [himself]80-sir william , had nothing to say that could be worth hearing , and were listened to with about as much delight as the rattle of the chaise . [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth loved absurdities , but [she]82-elizabeth had known [Sir William]80-sir william 's too long . [He]80-sir william could tell [her]82-elizabeth nothing new of the wonders of [his]80-sir william presentation and knighthood ; and [his]80-sir william civilities were worn out , like [his]80-sir william information .

It was a journey of only twenty - four miles , and [they]1263-they began it so early as to be in [Gracechurch Street]28-gracechurch street by noon . As [they]1263-they drove to [Mr. Gardiner]153-mr. gardiner 's door , [Jane]83-jane was at a drawing - room window watching [their]1263-they arrival : when [they]1263-they entered [the passage]1264-the passage , [she]83-jane was there to welcome [them]1263-they , and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , looking earnestly in [her]83-jane face , was pleased to see it healthful and lovely as ever . On the stairs were [a troop of [little boys]1266-little boys and [girls]3052-girls , whose eagerness for [[their]1265-a troop of little boys and girls , whose eagerness for their cousin 's appearance would not allow them to wait in the drawing - room , and whose shyness , as they had not seen her for a twelvemonth , prevented their coming lower cousin]671-their cousin 's appearance would not allow [them]1265-a troop of little boys and girls , whose eagerness for their cousin 's appearance would not allow them to wait in the drawing - room , and whose shyness , as they had not seen her for a twelvemonth , prevented their coming lower to wait in [the drawing - room]520-the drawing - room , and whose shyness , as [they]1265-a troop of little boys and girls , whose eagerness for their cousin 's appearance would not allow them to wait in the drawing - room , and whose shyness , as they had not seen her for a twelvemonth , prevented their coming lower had not seen [her]83-jane for a twelvemonth , prevented [their]1265-a troop of little boys and girls , whose eagerness for their cousin 's appearance would not allow them to wait in the drawing - room , and whose shyness , as they had not seen her for a twelvemonth , prevented their coming lower coming lower]1265-a troop of little boys and girls , whose eagerness for their cousin 's appearance would not allow them to wait in the drawing - room , and whose shyness , as they had not seen her for a twelvemonth , prevented their coming lower . All was joy and kindness . The day passed most pleasantly away ; the morning in bustle and shopping , and the evening at [one of [the theatres]1271-the theatres]1270-one of the theatres .

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth then contrived to sit by [[her]82-elizabeth aunt]1198-her aunt . [Their]1273-their first subject was [[her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister ; and [she]82-elizabeth was more grieved than astonished to hear , in reply to [her]1198-her aunt minute inquiries , that though [Jane]83-jane always struggled to support [her]82-elizabeth spirits , there were periods of dejection . It was reasonable , however , to hope that [they]1273-their would not continue long . [Mrs. Gardiner]125-mrs. gardiner gave [her]82-elizabeth the particulars also of [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley 's visit in [Gracechurch Street]28-gracechurch street , and repeated conversations occurring at different times between [Jane]83-jane and [herself]83-jane , which proved that [the former]327-the former had , from [her]83-jane heart , given up the acquaintance .

[Mrs. Gardiner]125-mrs. gardiner then rallied [[her]125-mrs. gardiner niece]1276-her niece on [Wickham]136-wickham 's desertion , and complimented [her]82-elizabeth on bearing it so well .

" But , [[my]125-mrs. gardiner dear]2993-my dear [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , "[125-mrs. gardiner] [she]125-mrs. gardiner added , " what sort of [girl]3982-girl is [Miss King]93-miss king ? [I]125-mrs. gardiner should be sorry to think [[our]3983-our friend]3984-our friend mercenary . "[125-mrs. gardiner]

" Pray , [[my]125-mrs. gardiner dear aunt]3934-my dear aunt , what is the difference in matrimonial affairs , between [the mercenary]3986-the mercenary and the prudent motive ? Where does discretion end , and avarice begin ? Last Christmas [you]3934-my dear aunt were afraid of [his]3984-our friend marrying [me]125-mrs. gardiner , because it would be imprudent ; and now , because [he]3984-our friend is trying to get [a girl with only ten thousand pounds]3987-a girl with only ten thousand pounds , [you]3934-my dear aunt want to find out that [he]3984-our friend is [mercenary]3988-mercenary . "[125-mrs. gardiner]

" If [you]3934-my dear aunt will only tell [me]125-mrs. gardiner what sort of girl [Miss King]93-miss king is , [I]125-mrs. gardiner shall know what to think . "[125-mrs. gardiner]

" [She]93-miss king is [a very good kind of girl]3989-a very good kind of girl , [I]125-mrs. gardiner believe . [I]125-mrs. gardiner know no harm of [her]93-miss king . "[125-mrs. gardiner]

" But [he]3984-our friend paid [her]93-miss king not the smallest attention till [[her]93-miss king grandfather]3990-her grandfather 's death made [her]93-miss king mistress of this fortune ? "[125-mrs. gardiner]

" No -- why should [he]3984-our friend ? If it were not allowable for [him]3984-our friend to gain _ [my]125-mrs. gardiner _ affections , because [I]125-mrs. gardiner had no money , what occasion could there be for making love to [a girl whom [he]3984-our friend did not care about]3991-a girl whom he did not care about , and who was equally poor ? "[125-mrs. gardiner]

" But there seems indelicacy in directing [his]3984-our friend attentions towards [her]93-miss king so soon after this event . "[125-mrs. gardiner]

" [A man in distressed circumstances]3992-a man in distressed circumstances has not time for all those elegant decorums which [other people]3885-other people may observe . If _ [she]93-miss king _ does not object to it , why should _ [we]3994-we _ ? "[125-mrs. gardiner]

" _ [Her]93-miss king _ not objecting does not justify _ [him]3984-our friend _ . It only shows [her]93-miss king being deficient in something [herself]93-miss king -- sense or feeling . "[125-mrs. gardiner]

" Well , "[82-elizabeth] cried [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , " have it as [you]3984-our friend choose . _ [He]3984-our friend _ shall be [mercenary]3988-mercenary , and _ [she]93-miss king _ shall be foolish . "[82-elizabeth]

" No , [Lizzy]82-elizabeth , that is what [I]125-mrs. gardiner do _ not _ choose . [I]125-mrs. gardiner should be sorry , [you]82-elizabeth know , to think ill of [a young man who has lived so long in [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire]3996-a young man who has lived so long in derbyshire . "[125-mrs. gardiner]

" Oh , if that is all , [I]82-elizabeth have a very poor opinion of [young men who live in [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire]3997-young men who live in derbyshire ; and [[their]3997-young men who live in derbyshire intimate friends who live in [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire]3998-their intimate friends who live in hertfordshire are not much better . [I]82-elizabeth am sick of [them]3997-young men who live in derbyshire all . Thank heaven ! [I]82-elizabeth am going to - morrow where [I]82-elizabeth shall find [a man who has not one agreeable quality , who has neither manners nor sense to recommend [him]3999-a man who has not one agreeable quality , who has neither manners nor sense to recommend him]3999-a man who has not one agreeable quality , who has neither manners nor sense to recommend him . [Stupid men]4000-stupid men are [the only ones worth knowing]4001-the only ones worth knowing , after all . "[82-elizabeth]

" Take care , [Lizzy]82-elizabeth ; that speech savours strongly of disappointment . "[125-mrs. gardiner]

Before [they]1277-we were separated by the conclusion of the play , [she]1278-she had the unexpected happiness of an invitation to accompany [[her]1278-she uncle]573-her uncle and [aunt]3971-aunt in a tour of pleasure which [they]1277-we proposed taking in the summer .

" [We]1277-we have not quite determined how far it shall carry [us]1277-we , "[125-mrs. gardiner] said [Mrs. Gardiner]125-mrs. gardiner ; " but perhaps , to [the Lakes]4002-the lakes . "[125-mrs. gardiner]

No scheme could have been more agreeable to [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , and [her]82-elizabeth acceptance of the invitation was most ready and grateful . " [[My]82-elizabeth dear]2993-my dear , [dear aunt]4004-dear aunt , "[82-elizabeth] [she]82-elizabeth rapturously cried , " what delight ! what felicity ! [You]4004-dear aunt give [me]82-elizabeth fresh life and vigour . Adieu to disappointment and spleen . What are [men]3250-men to [rocks and mountains]4006-rocks and mountains ? Oh , what hours of transport [we]1277-we shall spend ! And when [we]1277-we _ do _ return , it shall not be like [other travellers]4007-other travellers , without being able to give one accurate idea of anything . [We]1277-we _ will _ know where [we]1277-we have gone -- [we]1277-we _ will _ recollect what [we]1277-we have seen . [Lakes]4008-lakes , [mountains]4009-mountains , and [rivers]4010-rivers , shall not be jumbled together in [our]1277-we imaginations ; nor , when [we]1277-we attempt to describe any particular scene , will [we]1277-we begin quarrelling about its relative situation . Let _ [our]1277-we _ first effusions be less insupportable than those of the generality of [travellers]4011-travellers . "[82-elizabeth]

Every object in the next day 's journey was new and interesting to [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth ; and [her]82-elizabeth spirits were in a state of enjoyment ; for [she]82-elizabeth had seen [[her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister looking so well as to banish all fear for [her]82-elizabeth health , and the prospect of [her]82-elizabeth northern tour was a constant source of delight .

When [they]1282-they left [the high road]1283-the high road for [the lane]1065-the lane to [Hunsford]15-hunsford , every eye was in search of [the Parsonage]1285-the parsonage , and every turning expected to bring [it]1285-the parsonage in view . The paling of [Rosings park]1286-rosings park was [their]1282-they boundary on one side . [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth smiled at the recollection of all that [she]82-elizabeth had heard of [[its]1285-the parsonage inhabitants]1287-its inhabitants .

At length [the Parsonage]1285-the parsonage was discernible . [The garden]1289-the garden sloping to [the road]1290-the road , [the house]3001-the house standing in [it]1285-the parsonage , the green pales and the laurel hedge , everything declared [they]1282-they were arriving . [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins and [Charlotte]101-charlotte appeared at the door , and [the carriage]3217-the carriage stopped at the small gate , which led by a short gravel walk to [the house]3001-the house , amidst the nods and smiles of [the whole party]521-the whole party . In a moment [they]1282-they were all out of the chaise , rejoicing at the sight of [each other]3144-each other . [Mrs. Collins]158-mrs. collins welcomed [[her]158-mrs. collins friend]402-her friend with the liveliest pleasure , and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth was more and more satisfied with coming , when [she]82-elizabeth found [herself]82-elizabeth so affectionately received . [She]82-elizabeth saw instantly that [[her]82-elizabeth cousin]3587-her cousin 's manners were not altered by [his]3587-her cousin marriage : [his]3587-her cousin formal civility was just what it had been ; and [he]3587-her cousin detained [her]82-elizabeth some minutes at the gate to hear and satisfy [his]3587-her cousin inquiries after all [[her]82-elizabeth family]885-her family . [They]1282-they were then , with no other delay than [his]3587-her cousin pointing out the neatness of the entrance , taken into [the house]3001-the house ; and as soon as [they]1282-they were in [the parlour]1300-the parlour , [he]3587-her cousin welcomed [them]1282-they a second time , with ostentatious formality , to [[his]3587-her cousin humble abode]1301-his humble abode , and punctually repeated all [[his]3587-her cousin wife]231-his wife 's offers of refreshment .

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth was prepared to see [him]3587-her cousin in [his]3587-her cousin glory ; and [she]82-elizabeth could not help fancying that in displaying the good proportion of [the room]250-the room , [its]250-the room aspect , and [its]250-the room furniture , [he]3587-her cousin addressed [himself]3587-her cousin particularly to [her]82-elizabeth , as if wishing to make [her]82-elizabeth feel what [she]82-elizabeth had lost in refusing [him]3587-her cousin . But though everything seemed neat and comfortable , [she]82-elizabeth was not able to gratify [him]3587-her cousin by any sigh of repentance ; and rather looked with wonder at [[her]82-elizabeth friend]402-her friend , that [she]82-elizabeth could have so cheerful an air with such [a companion]1305-a companion . When [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins said anything of which [[his]129-mr. collins wife]231-his wife might reasonably be ashamed , which certainly was not seldom , [she]82-elizabeth involuntarily turned [her]82-elizabeth eye on [Charlotte]101-charlotte . Once or twice [she]82-elizabeth could discern a faint blush ; but in general [Charlotte]101-charlotte wisely did not hear . After sitting long enough to admire every article of furniture in [the room]250-the room , from the sideboard to the fender , to give an account of [their]1308-them journey , and of all that had happened in [London]5-london , [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins invited [them]1308-them to take a stroll in [the garden]1289-the garden , which was large and well laid out , and to the cultivation of which [he]129-mr. collins attended [himself]129-mr. collins . To work in [[his]129-mr. collins garden]1310-his garden was one of [his]129-mr. collins most respectable pleasures ; and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth admired the command of countenance with which [Charlotte]101-charlotte talked of the healthfulness of the exercise , and owned [she]101-charlotte encouraged it as much as possible . Here , leading the way through every walk and cross walk , and scarcely allowing [them]1308-them an interval to utter the praises [he]129-mr. collins asked for , every view was pointed out with a minuteness which left beauty entirely behind . [He]129-mr. collins could number [the fields]1311-the fields in every direction , and could tell how many trees there were in the most distant clump . But of all the views which [[his]129-mr. collins garden]1310-his garden , or which [the country]448-the country or [the kingdom]3670-the kingdom could boast , none were to be compared with the prospect of Rosings , afforded by an opening in the trees that bordered [the park]1315-the park nearly opposite the front of [[his]129-mr. collins house]3109-his house . [It]1317-it was [a handsome modern building , well situated on rising ground]1318-a handsome modern building , well situated on rising ground .

From [[his]129-mr. collins garden]1310-his garden , [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins would have led [them]1308-them round [[his]129-mr. collins two meadows]1320-his two meadows ; but [the ladies , not having shoes to encounter the remains of a white frost]1321-the ladies , not having shoes to encounter the remains of a white frost , turned back ; and while [Sir William]80-sir william accompanied [him]129-mr. collins , [Charlotte]101-charlotte took [[her]101-charlotte sister]328-her sister and [friend]3361-friend over [the house]3001-the house , extremely well pleased , probably , to have the opportunity of showing [it]3001-the house without [[her]101-charlotte husband]255-her husband 's help . [It]3001-the house was rather small , but well built and convenient ; and everything was fitted up and arranged with a neatness and consistency , of which [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth gave [Charlotte]101-charlotte all the credit . When [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins could be forgotten , there was really a great air of comfort throughout , and by [Charlotte]101-charlotte 's evident enjoyment of it , [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth supposed [he]129-mr. collins must be often forgotten .

[She]82-elizabeth had already learnt that [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine was still in [the country]448-the country . It was spoken of again while [they]1327-us were at dinner , when [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins joining in , observed,--

" Yes , [Miss Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , [you]82-elizabeth will have the honour of seeing [Lady Catherine de Bourgh]86-lady catherine on the ensuing Sunday at [church]4012-church , and [I]129-mr. collins need not say [you]82-elizabeth will be delighted with [her]86-lady catherine . [She]86-lady catherine is all affability and condescension , and [I]129-mr. collins doubt not but [you]82-elizabeth will be honoured with some portion of [her]86-lady catherine notice when service is over . [I]129-mr. collins have scarcely any hesitation in saying that [she]86-lady catherine will include [you]82-elizabeth and [[my]129-mr. collins sister]3280-my sister [Maria]94-maria in every invitation with which [she]86-lady catherine honours [us]1327-us during [your]82-elizabeth stay [here]2994-here . [Her]86-lady catherine behaviour to [[my]129-mr. collins dear]2993-my dear [Charlotte]101-charlotte is charming . [We]1327-us dine at Rosings twice every week , and are never allowed to walk [home]3219-home . [[Her]86-lady catherine Ladyship]3464-her ladyship 's carriage is regularly ordered for [us]1327-us . [I]129-mr. collins _ should _ say , one of [[her]86-lady catherine Ladyship]3464-her ladyship 's carriages , for [she]86-lady catherine has several . "[129-mr. collins]

" [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine is [a very respectable , sensible woman]4019-a very respectable , sensible woman , indeed , "[101-charlotte] added [Charlotte]101-charlotte , " and [a most attentive neighbour]4020-a most attentive neighbour . "[101-charlotte]

" Very true , [[my]129-mr. collins dear]2993-my dear , that is exactly what [I]129-mr. collins say . [She]86-lady catherine is [the sort of woman whom one]4022-the sort of woman whom one can not regard with too much deference . "[129-mr. collins]

The evening was spent chiefly in talking over Hertfordshire news , and telling again what had been already written ; and when it closed , [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , in the solitude of [[her]82-elizabeth chamber]1328-her chamber , had to meditate upon [Charlotte]101-charlotte 's degree of contentment , to understand [her]101-charlotte address in guiding , and composure in bearing with , [[her]101-charlotte husband]255-her husband , and to acknowledge that it was all done very well . [She]82-elizabeth had also to anticipate how [her]82-elizabeth visit would pass , the quiet tenour of [their]1330-their usual employments , the vexatious interruptions of [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins , and the gaieties of [their]1330-their intercourse with Rosings . A lively imagination soon settled it all .

About the middle of the next day , as [she]82-elizabeth was in [[her]82-elizabeth room]489-her room getting ready for a walk , a sudden noise below seemed to speak [the whole house]1332-the whole house in confusion ; and , after listening a moment , [she]82-elizabeth heard [somebody]3598-somebody running [upstairs]703-upstairs in a violent hurry , and calling loudly after [her]82-elizabeth . [She]82-elizabeth opened the door , and met [Maria]94-maria in [the landing - place]1335-the landing - place , who , breathless with agitation , cried out,--

" Oh , [my]94-maria dear [Eliza]82-elizabeth ! pray make haste and come into [the dining - room]686-the dining - room , for there is such a sight to be seen ! [I]94-maria will not tell [you]82-elizabeth what it is . Make haste , and come down this moment . "[94-maria]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth asked questions in vain ; [Maria]94-maria would tell [her]82-elizabeth nothing more ; and down [they]1336-they ran into [the dining - room]686-the dining - room which fronted [the lane]1065-the lane , in quest of this wonder ; it was [two ladies]1339-two ladies , stopping in a low phaeton at the garden gate .

" And is this all ? "[82-elizabeth] cried [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth . " [I]82-elizabeth expected at least that the pigs were got into [the garden]1289-the garden , and here is nothing but [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine and [[her]86-lady catherine daughter]463-her daughter ! "[82-elizabeth]

" La ! [[my]94-maria dear]2993-my dear , "[94-maria] said [Maria]94-maria , quite shocked at the mistake , " it is not [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine . [The old lady]4027-the old lady is [Mrs. Jenkinson]145-mrs. jenkinson , who lives with [them]1336-they . [The other]590-the other is [Miss De Bourgh]132-miss de bourgh . Only look at [her]590-the other . [She]590-the other is quite a little creature . Who would have thought [she]590-the other could be so thin and small ! "[94-maria]

" [She]132-miss de bourgh is abominably rude to keep [Charlotte]101-charlotte out of doors in all this wind . Why does [she]590-the other not come in ? "[82-elizabeth]

" Oh , [Charlotte]101-charlotte says [she]101-charlotte hardly ever does . It is the greatest of favours when [Miss De Bourgh]132-miss de bourgh comes in . "[94-maria]

" [I]82-elizabeth like [her]590-the other appearance , "[82-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , struck with other ideas . " [She]590-the other looks sickly and cross . Yes , [she]590-the other will do for [him]80-sir william very well . [She]590-the other will make [him]80-sir william [a very proper wife]4029-a very proper wife . "[82-elizabeth]

[Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins and [Charlotte]101-charlotte were both standing at the gate in conversation with [the ladies]249-the ladies ; and [Sir William]80-sir william , to [[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth 's high diversion]1341-elizabeth 's high diversion , was stationed in the doorway , in earnest contemplation of the greatness before [him]80-sir william , and constantly bowing whenever [Miss De Bourgh]132-miss de bourgh looked that way .

At length there was nothing more to be said ; [the ladies]249-the ladies drove on , and [the others]507-the others returned into [the house]3001-the house . [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins no sooner saw [the two girls]566-the two girls than [he]129-mr. collins began to congratulate [them]566-the two girls on [their]566-the two girls good fortune , which [Charlotte]101-charlotte explained by letting [them]566-the two girls know that [the whole party]521-the whole party was asked to dine at Rosings the next day .

[Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins 's triumph , in consequence of this invitation , was complete . The power of displaying the grandeur of [[his]129-mr. collins patroness]694-his patroness to [[his]129-mr. collins wondering visitors]1348-his wondering visitors , and of letting [them]566-the two girls see [her]694-his patroness civility towards [himself]129-mr. collins and [[his]129-mr. collins wife]231-his wife , was exactly what [he]129-mr. collins had wished for ; and that an opportunity of doing it should be given so soon was such an instance of [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine 's condescension as [he]129-mr. collins knew not how to admire enough .

" [I]129-mr. collins confess , "[129-mr. collins] said [he]129-mr. collins , " that [I]129-mr. collins should not have been at all surprised by [[her]86-lady catherine Ladyship]3464-her ladyship 's asking [us]4031-us on Sunday to drink tea and spend the evening at Rosings . [I]129-mr. collins rather expected , from [my]129-mr. collins knowledge of [her]86-lady catherine affability , that it would happen . But who could have foreseen such an attention as this ? Who could have imagined that [we]4031-us should receive an invitation to dine [there]305-there ( an invitation , moreover , including [the whole party]521-the whole party ) so immediately after [your]80-sir william arrival ? "[129-mr. collins]

" [I]80-sir william am the less surprised at what has happened , "[80-sir william] replied [Sir William]80-sir william , " from that knowledge of what the manners of the great really are , which [my]80-sir william situation in life has allowed [me]80-sir william to acquire . About [the court]4034-the court , such instances of elegant breeding are not uncommon . "[80-sir william]

Scarcely anything was talked of the whole day or next morning but [their]1350-them visit to [Rosings]20-rosings . [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins was carefully instructing [them]1350-them in what [they]1350-them were to expect , that the sight of [such rooms]1351-such rooms , so many [servants]3324-servants , and so splendid a dinner , might not wholly overpower [them]1350-them .

When [the ladies]249-the ladies were separating for the toilette , [he]129-mr. collins said to [Elizabeth,--]159-elizabeth,--

" Do not make [yourself]159-elizabeth,-- uneasy , [[my]129-mr. collins dear cousin]3731-my dear cousin , about [your]159-elizabeth,-- apparel . [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine is far from requiring that elegance of dress in [us]249-the ladies which becomes [herself]86-lady catherine and [daughter]4036-daughter . [I]129-mr. collins would advise [you]159-elizabeth,-- merely to put on whatever of [your]159-elizabeth,-- clothes is superior to the rest -- there is no occasion for anything more . [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine will not think the worse of [you]159-elizabeth,-- for being simply dressed . [She]86-lady catherine likes to have the distinction of rank preserved . "[129-mr. collins]

While [they]249-the ladies were dressing , [he]129-mr. collins came two or three times to [their]249-the ladies different doors , to recommend [their]249-the ladies being quick , as [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine very much objected to be kept waiting for [her]86-lady catherine dinner . Such formidable accounts of [[her]86-lady catherine Ladyship]3464-her ladyship , and [her]86-lady catherine manner of living , quite frightened [Maria Lucas]94-maria , who had been little used to company ; and [she]94-maria looked forward to [her]94-maria introduction at Rosings with as much apprehension as [[her]94-maria father]244-her father had done to [his]244-her father presentation at [St. James]11-st. james 's .

As the weather was fine , [they]249-the ladies had a pleasant walk of about half a mile across [the park]1315-the park . [Every park]1357-every park has [its]1357-every park beauty and its prospects ; and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth saw much to be pleased with , though [she]82-elizabeth could not be in such raptures as [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins expected the scene to inspire , and was but slightly affected by [his]129-mr. collins enumeration of the windows in front of [the house]3001-the house , and [his]129-mr. collins relation of what the glazing altogether had originally cost [Sir Lewis de Bourgh]130-sir lewis de bourgh .

When [they]249-the ladies ascended the steps to [the hall]685-the hall , [Maria]94-maria 's alarm was every moment increasing , and even [Sir William]80-sir william did not look perfectly calm . [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth 's courage did not fail [her]82-elizabeth . [She]82-elizabeth had heard nothing of [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine that spoke [her]82-elizabeth awful from any extraordinary talents or miraculous virtue , and the mere stateliness of money and rank [she]82-elizabeth thought [she]82-elizabeth could witness without trepidation .

From [the entrance hall , of which [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins]1360-the entrance hall , of which mr. collins pointed out , with a rapturous air , the fine proportion and finished ornaments , [they]249-the ladies followed [the servants]692-the servants through an antechamber to [the room where [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine , [[her]86-lady catherine daughter]463-her daughter]1362-the room where lady catherine , her daughter , and [Mrs. Jenkinson]145-mrs. jenkinson were sitting . [[Her]86-lady catherine Ladyship]3464-her ladyship , with great condescension , arose to receive [them]249-the ladies ; and as [Mrs. Collins]158-mrs. collins had settled it with [[her]158-mrs. collins husband]255-her husband that the office of introduction should be [hers]158-mrs. collins , it was performed in a proper manner , without any of those apologies and thanks which [he]255-her husband would have thought necessary .

In spite of having been at [[St. James]11-st. james 's]379-st. james 's , [Sir William]80-sir william was so completely awed by the grandeur surrounding [him]80-sir william , that [he]80-sir william had but just courage enough to make a very low bow , and take [his]80-sir william seat without saying a word ; and [[his]80-sir william daughter]1106-his daughter , frightened almost out of [her]1106-his daughter senses , sat on the edge of [her]1106-his daughter chair , not knowing which way to look . [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth found [herself]82-elizabeth quite equal to the scene , and could observe [the three ladies before [her]82-elizabeth]1368-the three ladies before her composedly . [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine was [a tall , large woman , with strongly - marked features , which might once have been handsome]1369-a tall , large woman , with strongly - marked features , which might once have been handsome . [Her]86-lady catherine air was not conciliating , nor was [her]86-lady catherine manner of receiving them such as to make [[her]86-lady catherine visitors]1370-her visitors forget [their]1370-her visitors inferior rank . [She]86-lady catherine was not rendered formidable by silence : but whatever [she]86-lady catherine said was spoken in so authoritative a tone as marked [her]86-lady catherine self - importance , and brought [Mr. Wickham]136-wickham immediately to [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth 's mind ; and , from the observation of the day altogether , [she]82-elizabeth believed [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine to be exactly what [he]136-wickham had represented .

When , after examining [the mother]395-the mother , in whose countenance and deportment [she]82-elizabeth soon found some resemblance of [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy , [she]82-elizabeth turned [her]82-elizabeth eyes on [the daughter]1372-the daughter , [she]82-elizabeth could almost have joined in [Maria]94-maria 's astonishment at [her]1372-the daughter being so thin and so small . There was neither in figure nor face any likeness between [the ladies]249-the ladies . [Miss de Bourgh]132-miss de bourgh was pale and sickly : [her]132-miss de bourgh features , though not plain , were insignificant ; and [she]132-miss de bourgh spoke very little , except in a low voice , to [Mrs. Jenkinson]145-mrs. jenkinson , in whose appearance there was nothing remarkable , and who was entirely engaged in listening to what [she]132-miss de bourgh said , and placing a screen in the proper direction before [her]132-miss de bourgh eyes .

After sitting a few minutes , [they]249-the ladies were all sent to one of the windows to admire the view , [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins attending [them]249-the ladies to point out its beauties , and [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine kindly informing [them]249-the ladies that it was much better worth looking at in the summer .

The dinner was exceedingly handsome , and there were all [the servants]692-the servants , and all the articles of plate which [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins had promised ; and , as [he]129-mr. collins had likewise foretold , [he]129-mr. collins took [his]129-mr. collins seat at the bottom of the table , by [[her]86-lady catherine Ladyship]3464-her ladyship 's desire , and looked as if [he]129-mr. collins felt that life could furnish nothing greater . [He]129-mr. collins carved and ate and praised with delighted alacrity ; and every dish was commended first by [him]129-mr. collins , and then by [Sir William]80-sir william , who was now enough recovered to echo whatever [[his]80-sir william son - in - law]1376-his son - in - law said , in a manner which [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth wondered [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine could bear . But [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine seemed gratified by [their]249-the ladies excessive admiration , and gave most gracious smiles , especially when any dish on the table proved a novelty to [them]249-the ladies . [The party]3009-the party did not supply much conversation . [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth was ready to speak whenever there was an opening , but [she]82-elizabeth was seated between [Charlotte]101-charlotte and [Miss de Bourgh]132-miss de bourgh -- [the former of whom]1378-the former of whom was engaged in listening to [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine , and [the latter]487-the latter said not a word to [her]82-elizabeth all the dinnertime . [Mrs. Jenkinson]145-mrs. jenkinson was chiefly employed in watching how little [Miss de Bourgh]132-miss de bourgh ate , pressing [her]145-mrs. jenkinson to try some other dish and fearing [she]145-mrs. jenkinson was indisposed . [Maria]94-maria thought speaking out of the question , and [the gentlemen]290-the gentlemen did nothing but eat and admire .

When [the ladies]249-the ladies returned to [the drawing - room]520-the drawing - room , there was little to be done but to hear [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine talk , which [she]82-elizabeth did without any intermission till coffee came in , delivering [her]82-elizabeth opinion on every subject in so decisive a manner as proved that [she]82-elizabeth was not used to have [her]82-elizabeth judgment controverted . [She]82-elizabeth inquired into [Charlotte]101-charlotte 's domestic concerns familiarly and minutely , and gave [her]101-charlotte a great deal of advice as to the management of them all ; told [her]101-charlotte how everything ought to be regulated in so small [a family]1383-a family as [hers]101-charlotte , and instructed [her]101-charlotte as to the care of [her]101-charlotte cows and [her]101-charlotte poultry . [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth found that nothing was beneath [this great lady]1384-this great lady 's attention which could furnish [her]82-elizabeth with an occasion for dictating to [others]3103-others . In the intervals of [her]82-elizabeth discourse with [Mrs. Collins]158-mrs. collins , [she]82-elizabeth addressed a variety of questions to [Maria]94-maria and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , but especially to the latter , of whose connections [she]82-elizabeth knew the least , and who , [she]82-elizabeth observed to [Mrs. Collins]158-mrs. collins , was [a very genteel , pretty kind of girl]1386-a very genteel , pretty kind of girl . [She]82-elizabeth asked [her]82-elizabeth at different times how many sisters [she]82-elizabeth had , whether [they]1387-they were older or younger than [herself]82-elizabeth , whether any of [them]1387-they were likely to be married , whether [they]1387-they were handsome , where [they]1387-they had been educated , what carriage [[her]82-elizabeth father]244-her father kept , and what had been [[her]82-elizabeth mother]241-her mother 's maiden name ? [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth felt all the impertinence of [her]82-elizabeth questions , but answered them very composedly . [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine then observed,--

" [[Your]82-elizabeth father]3223-your father 's estate is entailed on [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins , [I]86-lady catherine think ? For [your]82-elizabeth sake , "[86-lady catherine] turning to [Charlotte]101-charlotte , " [I]86-lady catherine am glad of it ; but otherwise [I]86-lady catherine see no occasion for entailing estates from [the female line]4038-the female line . It was not thought necessary in [[Sir Lewis de Bourgh]130-sir lewis de bourgh 's family]4039-sir lewis de bourgh 's family . Do [you]82-elizabeth play and sing , [Miss Bennet]82-elizabeth ? "[86-lady catherine]

" A little . "[86-lady catherine]

" Oh then -- some time or other [we]4040-we shall be happy to hear [you]82-elizabeth . [Our]4040-we instrument is a capital one , probably superior to ---- [you]82-elizabeth shall try it some day . Do [[your]82-elizabeth sisters]3060-your sisters play and sing ? "[86-lady catherine]

" [One of [them]3060-your sisters]3017-one of them does . "[86-lady catherine]

" Why did not [you]82-elizabeth all learn ? [You]82-elizabeth ought all to have learned . [The Miss Webbs]4043-the miss webbs all play , and [[their]4043-the miss webbs father]247-their father has not so good an income as [yours]82-elizabeth . Do [you]82-elizabeth draw ? "[86-lady catherine]

" No , not at all . "[86-lady catherine]

" What , none of [you]82-elizabeth ? "[86-lady catherine]

" [Not one]4045-not one . "[86-lady catherine]

" That is very strange . But [I]86-lady catherine suppose [you]82-elizabeth had no opportunity . [[Your]82-elizabeth mother]3715-your mother should have taken [you]82-elizabeth to [town]264-town every spring for the benefit of [masters]4048-masters . "[86-lady catherine]

" [[My]86-lady catherine mother]3227-my mother would have no objection , but [[my]86-lady catherine father]3256-my father hates [London]5-london . "[86-lady catherine]

" Has [[your]82-elizabeth governess]4051-your governess left [you]82-elizabeth ? "[86-lady catherine]

" [We]4052-we never had [any governess]4053-any governess . "[86-lady catherine]

" [No governess]4054-no governess ! How was that possible ? [Five daughters brought up at [home]3219-home without [a governess]4057-a governess]4055-five daughters brought up at home without a governess ! [I]86-lady catherine never heard of such a thing . [[Your]86-lady catherine mother]3715-your mother must have been quite a slave to [your]86-lady catherine education . "[86-lady catherine]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth could hardly help smiling , as [she]82-elizabeth assured [her]82-elizabeth that had not been the case .

" Then who taught [you]86-lady catherine ? who attended to [you]86-lady catherine ? Without [a governess]4057-a governess , [you]86-lady catherine must have been neglected . "[82-elizabeth]

" Compared with [some families]4060-some families , [I]82-elizabeth believe [we]4052-we were ; but such of [us]4052-we as wished to learn never wanted the means . [We]4052-we were always encouraged to read , and had all [the masters that were necessary]4061-the masters that were necessary . [Those who chose to be idle]4062-those who chose to be idle certainly might . "[82-elizabeth]

" Ay , no doubt : but that is what [a governess]4057-a governess will prevent ; and if [I]82-elizabeth had known [[your]86-lady catherine mother]3715-your mother , [I]82-elizabeth should have advised [her]3715-your mother most strenuously to engage one . [I]82-elizabeth always say that nothing is to be done in education without steady and regular instruction , and [nobody but a governess]4065-nobody but a governess can give it . It is wonderful how many [families]4066-families [I]82-elizabeth have been the means of supplying in that way . [I]82-elizabeth am always glad to get [a young person]4067-a young person well placed out . [Four nieces of [Mrs. Jenkinson]145-mrs. jenkinson]4068-four nieces of mrs. jenkinson are most delightfully situated through [my]82-elizabeth means ; and it was but the other day that [I]82-elizabeth recommended [another young person]4069-another young person , who was merely accidentally mentioned to [me]82-elizabeth , and [the family]416-the family are quite delighted with [her]4069-another young person . [Mrs. Collins]158-mrs. collins , did [I]82-elizabeth tell [you]158-mrs. collins of [Lady Metcalfe]160-lady metcalfe 's calling yesterday to thank [me]82-elizabeth ? [She]160-lady metcalfe finds [Miss Pope]161-miss pope a treasure . ' [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine , ' said [she]86-lady catherine , ' [you]86-lady catherine have given [me]82-elizabeth a treasure . ' Are any of [[your]86-lady catherine younger sisters]4071-your younger sisters out , [Miss Bennet]82-elizabeth ? "[82-elizabeth]

" Yes , [ma'am]3119-ma'am , all . "[82-elizabeth]

" All ! What , [all five]4073-all five out at once ? Very odd ! And [you]86-lady catherine only the second . [The younger ones]747-the younger ones out before [the elder]4075-the elder are married ! [[Your]86-lady catherine younger sisters]4071-your younger sisters must be very young ? "[82-elizabeth]

" Yes , [[my]82-elizabeth youngest]4077-my youngest is not sixteen . Perhaps _ [she]4077-my youngest _ is full young to be much in company . But really , [ma'am]3119-ma'am , [I]82-elizabeth think it would be very hard upon [younger sisters]4079-younger sisters that [they]4079-younger sisters should not have [their]4079-younger sisters share of society and amusement , because [the elder]4075-the elder may not have the means or inclination to marry early . [The last born]4081-the last born has as good a right to the pleasures of youth as the first . And to be kept back on _ such _ a motive ! [I]82-elizabeth think it would not be very likely to promote sisterly affection or delicacy of mind . "[82-elizabeth]

" Upon [my]3464-her ladyship word , "[3464-her ladyship] said [[her]1390-her Ladyship]3464-her ladyship , " [you]82-elizabeth give [your]82-elizabeth opinion very decidedly for [so young a person]4082-so young a person . Pray , what is [your]82-elizabeth age ? "[3464-her ladyship]

" With [three younger sisters]4083-three younger sisters grown up , "[82-elizabeth] replied [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , smiling , " [[your]86-lady catherine Ladyship]4084-your ladyship can hardly expect [me]82-elizabeth to own [it]4085-it . "[82-elizabeth]

[Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine seemed quite astonished at not receiving a direct answer ; and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth suspected [herself]82-elizabeth to be [the first creature who had ever dared to trifle with so much dignified impertinence]1392-the first creature who had ever dared to trifle with so much dignified impertinence .

" [You]86-lady catherine can not be more than twenty , [I]86-lady catherine am sure,--therefore [you]86-lady catherine need not conceal [your]86-lady catherine age . "[86-lady catherine]

" [I]86-lady catherine am not one - and - twenty . "[86-lady catherine]

When [the gentlemen]290-the gentlemen had joined [them]290-the gentlemen , and tea was over , the card tables were placed . [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine , [Sir William]80-sir william , and [Mr.]1394-mr. and [Mrs. Collins]158-mrs. collins sat down to quadrille ; and as [Miss De Bourgh]132-miss de bourgh chose to play at cassino , [the two girls]566-the two girls had the honour of assisting [Mrs. Jenkinson]145-mrs. jenkinson to make up [her]145-mrs. jenkinson party . [Their]566-the two girls table was superlatively stupid . Scarcely a syllable was uttered that did not relate to the game , except when [Mrs. Jenkinson]145-mrs. jenkinson expressed [her]145-mrs. jenkinson fears of [Miss De Bourgh]132-miss de bourgh 's being too hot or too cold , or having too much or too little light . A great deal more passed at the other table . [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine was generally speaking -- stating the mistakes of [the three others]1396-the three others , or relating some anecdote of [herself]86-lady catherine . [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins was employed in agreeing to everything [[her]86-lady catherine Ladyship]3464-her ladyship said , thanking [her]3464-her ladyship for every fish [he]129-mr. collins won , and apologizing if [he]129-mr. collins thought [he]129-mr. collins won too many . [Sir William]80-sir william did not say much . [He]80-sir william was storing [his]80-sir william memory with anecdotes and noble names .

When [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine and [[her]86-lady catherine daughter]463-her daughter had played as long as [they]566-the two girls chose , the tables were broken up , [the carriage]3217-the carriage was offered to [Mrs. Collins]158-mrs. collins , gratefully accepted , and immediately ordered . [The party]3009-the party then gathered round the fire to hear [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine determine what weather [they]3009-the party were to have on the morrow . From these instructions [they]3009-the party were summoned by the arrival of [the coach]3221-the coach ; and with many speeches of thankfulness on [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins 's side , and as many bows on [Sir William]80-sir william 's , [they]3009-the party departed . As soon as [they]3009-the party had driven from the door , [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth was called on by [[her]82-elizabeth cousin]3587-her cousin to give [her]82-elizabeth opinion of all that [she]82-elizabeth had seen at [Rosings]20-rosings , which , for [Charlotte]101-charlotte 's sake , [she]82-elizabeth made more favourable than it really was . But [her]82-elizabeth commendation , though costing [her]82-elizabeth some trouble , could by no means satisfy [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins , and [he]129-mr. collins was very soon obliged to take [her]82-elizabeth [Ladyship]162-ladyship 's praise into [his]129-mr. collins own hands .

[Sir William]80-sir william stayed only a week at [Hunsford]15-hunsford ; but [his]80-sir william visit was long enough to convince [him]80-sir william of [[his]80-sir william daughter]1106-his daughter 's being most comfortably settled , and of [her]1106-his daughter possessing such [a husband]3760-a husband and such [a neighbour]1405-a neighbour as were not often met with . While [Sir William]80-sir william was with [them]1406-them , [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins devoted [his]129-mr. collins mornings to driving [him]80-sir william out in [[his]129-mr. collins gig]1407-his gig , and showing [him]80-sir william [the country]448-the country : but when [he]129-mr. collins went away , [the whole family]311-the whole family returned to [their]311-the whole family usual employments , and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth was thankful to find that [they]1406-them did not see more of [[her]82-elizabeth cousin]3587-her cousin by the alteration ; for the chief of the time between breakfast and dinner was now passed by [him]129-mr. collins either at work in [the garden]1289-the garden , or in reading and writing , and looking out of window in [[his]129-mr. collins own book room]1412-his own book room , which fronted [the road]1290-the road . [The room in which [the ladies]249-the ladies sat]1414-the room in which the ladies sat was backwards . [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth at first had rather wondered that [Charlotte]101-charlotte should not prefer [the dining parlour]1416-the dining parlour for common use ; it was [a better sized room]1417-a better sized room , and had a pleasanter aspect : but [she]82-elizabeth soon saw that [[her]82-elizabeth friend]402-her friend had an excellent reason for what [she]82-elizabeth did , for [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins would undoubtedly have been much less in [[his]129-mr. collins own apartment]1419-his own apartment had [they]1420-their sat in one equally lively ; and [she]82-elizabeth gave [Charlotte]101-charlotte credit for the arrangement .
