" And [[my]82-elizabeth mother]3227-my mother -- how is [she]3227-my mother ? How are [you]83-jane all ? "[82-elizabeth]

" [[My]83-jane mother]3227-my mother is tolerably well , [I]83-jane trust ; though [her]3227-my mother spirits are greatly shaken . [She]3227-my mother is [upstairs]703-upstairs , and will have great satisfaction in seeing [you]83-jane all . [She]3227-my mother does not yet leave [[her]3227-my mother dressing - room]4662-her dressing - room . [Mary]87-mary and [Kitty]86-lady catherine , thank [Heaven]181-heaven ! are quite well . "[83-jane]

" But [you]83-jane -- how are [you]83-jane ? "[82-elizabeth] cried [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth . " [You]83-jane look pale . How much [you]83-jane must have gone through ! "[82-elizabeth]

[[Her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister , however , assured [her]82-elizabeth of [her]82-elizabeth being perfectly well ; and [their]2273-their conversation , which had been passing while [Mr.]2274-mr. and [Mrs. Gardiner]125-mrs. gardiner were engaged with [[their]2273-their children]2275-their children , was now put an end to by the approach of [the whole party]521-the whole party . [Jane]83-jane ran to [[her]83-jane uncle]573-her uncle and [aunt]3971-aunt , and welcomed and thanked [them]2273-their both , with alternate smiles and tears .

When [they]2273-their were all in [the drawing - room]520-the drawing - room , the questions which [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth had already asked were of course repeated by [the others]507-the others , and [they]2273-their soon found that [Jane]83-jane had no intelligence to give . The sanguine hope of good , however , which the benevolence of [her]83-jane heart suggested , had not yet deserted [her]83-jane ; [she]83-jane still expected that it would all end well , and that every morning would bring some letter , either from [Lydia]84-lydia or [[her]84-lydia father]244-her father , to explain [their]2273-their proceedings , and , perhaps , announce the marriage .

[Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet , to whose apartment [they]2273-their all repaired , after a few minutes ' conversation together , received [them]2273-their exactly as might be expected ; with tears and lamentations of regret , invectives against the villainous conduct of [Wickham]136-wickham , and complaints of [her]85-mrs. bennet own sufferings and ill - usage ; blaming [everybody]304-everybody but [the person to whose ill - judging indulgence the errors of [[her]85-mrs. bennet daughter]463-her daughter]2283-the person to whose ill - judging indulgence the errors of her daughter must be principally owing .

" If [I]85-mrs. bennet had been able , "[85-mrs. bennet] said [she]85-mrs. bennet , " to carry [my]85-mrs. bennet point in going to [Brighton]32-brighton with all [[my]85-mrs. bennet family]3727-my family , _ this _ would not have happened : but [poor dear [Lydia]84-lydia]4664-poor dear lydia had [nobody]3077-nobody to take care of [her]84-lydia . Why did [the Forsters]4666-the forsters ever let [her]84-lydia go out of [their]4666-the forsters sight ? [I]85-mrs. bennet am sure there was some great neglect or other on [their]4666-the forsters side , for [she]84-lydia is not the kind of girl to do such a thing , if [she]84-lydia had been well looked after . [I]85-mrs. bennet always thought [they]4666-the forsters were very unfit to have the charge of [her]84-lydia ; but [I]85-mrs. bennet was over - ruled , as [I]85-mrs. bennet always am . [Poor , dear child]4667-poor , dear child ! And now here 's [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet gone away , and [I]85-mrs. bennet know [he]75-mr. bennet will fight [Wickham]136-wickham , wherever [he]75-mr. bennet meets [him]75-mr. bennet , and then [he]75-mr. bennet will be killed , and what is to become of [us]2285-they all ? [The Collinses]163-the collinses will turn [us]2285-they out , before [he]75-mr. bennet is cold in [his]75-mr. bennet grave ; and if [you]75-mr. bennet are not kind to [us]2285-they , [brother]4668-brother , [I]85-mrs. bennet do not know what [we]2285-they shall do . "[85-mrs. bennet]

[They]2285-they all exclaimed against such terrific ideas ; and [Mr. Gardiner]153-mr. gardiner , after general assurances of [his]153-mr. gardiner affection for [her]2286-her and [all [her]2286-her family]1671-all her family , told [her]2286-her that [he]153-mr. gardiner meant to be in [London]5-london the very next day , and would assist [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet in every endeavour for recovering [Lydia]84-lydia .

" Do not give way to useless alarm , "[153-mr. gardiner] added [he]153-mr. gardiner : " though it is right to be prepared for the worst , there is no occasion to look on it as certain . It is not quite a week since [they]2285-they left [Brighton]32-brighton . In a few days more , [we]2285-they may gain some news of [them]2285-they ; and till [we]2285-they know that [they]2285-they are not married , and have no design of marrying , do not let [us]2285-they give the matter over as lost . As soon as [I]153-mr. gardiner get to [town]264-town , [I]153-mr. gardiner shall go to [[my]153-mr. gardiner brother]3212-my brother , and make [him]3212-my brother come [home]3219-home with [me]153-mr. gardiner to [Gracechurch Street]28-gracechurch street , and then [we]2285-they may consult together as to what is to be done . "[153-mr. gardiner]

" Oh , [[my]85-mrs. bennet dear brother]4672-my dear brother , "[85-mrs. bennet] replied [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet , " that is exactly what [I]85-mrs. bennet could most wish for . And now do , when [you]4672-my dear brother get to [town]264-town , find [them]2285-they out , wherever [they]2285-they may be ; and if [they]2285-they are not married already , _ make _ [them]2285-they marry . And as for wedding clothes , do not let [them]2285-they wait for that , but tell [Lydia]84-lydia [she]84-lydia shall have as much money as [she]84-lydia chooses to buy [them]2285-they , after [they]2285-they are married . And , above all things , keep [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet from fighting . Tell [him]75-mr. bennet what a dreadful state [I]85-mrs. bennet am in -- that [I]85-mrs. bennet am frightened out of [my]85-mrs. bennet wits ; and have such tremblings , such flutterings all over [me]85-mrs. bennet , such spasms in [my]85-mrs. bennet side , and pains in [my]85-mrs. bennet head , and such beatings at [my]85-mrs. bennet heart , that [I]85-mrs. bennet can get no rest by night nor by day . And tell [[my]85-mrs. bennet dear]2993-my dear [Lydia]84-lydia not to give any directions about [her]84-lydia clothes till [she]84-lydia has seen [me]85-mrs. bennet , for [she]84-lydia does not know which are the best warehouses . Oh , [brother]4668-brother , how kind [you]4668-brother are ! [I]85-mrs. bennet know [you]4668-brother will contrive it all . "[85-mrs. bennet]

But [Mr. Gardiner]153-mr. gardiner , though [he]153-mr. gardiner assured [her]2288-her again of [his]153-mr. gardiner earnest endeavours in the cause , could not avoid recommending moderation to [her]2288-her , as well in [her]2288-her hopes as [her]2288-her fears ; and after talking with [her]2288-her in this manner till dinner was on table , [they]2289-they left [her]2288-her to vent all [her]2288-her feelings on [the housekeeper]816-the housekeeper , who attended in the absence of [[her]816-the housekeeper daughters]237-her daughters .

Though [[her]2288-her brother]3108-her brother and [sister]3891-sister were persuaded that there was no real occasion for such a seclusion from [the family]416-the family , [they]2289-they did not attempt to oppose it ; for [they]2289-they knew that [she]2288-her had not prudence enough to hold [her]2288-her tongue before [the servants]692-the servants , while [they]2289-they waited at table , and judged it better that [_ one _ only of [the household]2297-the household]2296-_ one _ only of the household , and [the one whom [they]2289-they could most trust]2298-the one whom they could most trust , should comprehend all [her]2288-her fears and solicitude on the subject .

In [the dining - room]686-the dining - room [they]2289-they were soon joined by [Mary]87-mary and [Kitty]86-lady catherine , who had been too busily engaged in [[their]2289-they separate apartments]2300-their separate apartments to make [their]2289-they appearance before . [One]3041-one came from [her]3041-one books , and the other from [her]3041-one toilette . The faces of both , however , were tolerably calm ; and no change was visible in either , except that the loss of [[her]3041-one favourite sister]2302-her favourite sister , or the anger which [she]3041-one had [herself]3041-one incurred in the business , had given something more of fretfulness than usual to the accents of [Kitty]86-lady catherine . As for [Mary]87-mary , [she]87-mary was mistress enough of [herself]87-mary to whisper to [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , with a countenance of grave reflection , soon after [they]2289-they were seated at table,--

" This is a most unfortunate affair , and will probably be much talked of . But [we]2289-they must stem the tide of malice , and pour into the wounded bosoms of [each other]3144-each other the balm of sisterly consolation . "[87-mary]

Then perceiving in [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth no inclination of replying , [she]87-mary added , " Unhappy as the event must be for [Lydia]84-lydia , [we]2289-they may draw from it this useful lesson:--that loss of virtue in [a female]4677-a female is irretrievable , that one false step involves [her]84-lydia in endless ruin , that [her]84-lydia reputation is no less brittle than it is beautiful , and that [she]84-lydia can not be too much guarded in [her]84-lydia behaviour towards the undeserving of the other sex . "[87-mary]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth lifted up [her]82-elizabeth eyes in amazement , but was too much oppressed to make any reply . [Mary]87-mary , however , continued to console [herself]87-mary with such kind of moral extractions from the evil before [them]2289-they .

In the afternoon , the two elder [Miss Bennets]99-the bennets were able to be for half an hour by [themselves]99-the bennets ; and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth instantly availed [herself]82-elizabeth of the opportunity of making any inquiries which [Jane]83-jane was equally eager to satisfy . After joining in general lamentations over the dreadful sequel of this event , which [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth considered as all but certain , and [Miss Bennet]84-lydia could not assert to be wholly impossible , [the former]327-the former continued the subject by saying , " But tell [me]327-the former all and everything about it which [I]327-the former have not already heard . Give [me]327-the former further particulars . What did [Colonel Forster]107-colonel forster say ? Had [they]2289-they no apprehension of anything before the elopement took place ? [They]2289-they must have seen [them]2289-they together for ever . "[327-the former]

" [Colonel Forster]107-colonel forster did own that [he]107-colonel forster had often suspected some partiality , especially on [Lydia]84-lydia 's side , but nothing to give [him]107-colonel forster any alarm . [I]327-the former am so grieved for [him]107-colonel forster . [His]107-colonel forster behaviour was attentive and kind to the utmost . [He]107-colonel forster _ was _ coming to [us]4678-us , in order to assure [us]4678-us of [his]107-colonel forster concern , before [he]107-colonel forster had any idea of [their]2289-they not being gone to [Scotland]49-scotland : when that apprehension first got abroad , it hastened [his]107-colonel forster journey . "[327-the former]

" And was [Denny]135-denny convinced that [Wickham]136-wickham would not marry ? Did [he]135-denny know of [their]2289-they intending to go off ? Had [Colonel Forster]107-colonel forster seen [Denny]135-denny [himself]107-colonel forster ? "[327-the former]

" Yes ; but when questioned by _ [him]135-denny _ , [Denny]135-denny denied knowing anything of [their]2289-they plan , and would not give [his]135-denny real opinion about it . "[327-the former]

" And till [Colonel Forster]107-colonel forster came [himself]107-colonel forster , not one of [you]4679-you entertained a doubt , [I]327-the former suppose , of [their]2289-they being really married ? "[327-the former]

" How was it possible that such an idea should enter [our]2289-they brains ? [I]327-the former felt a little uneasy -- a little fearful of [[my]327-the former sister]3280-my sister 's happiness with [him]107-colonel forster in marriage , because [I]327-the former knew that [his]107-colonel forster conduct had not been always quite right . [[My]327-the former father]3256-my father and [mother]3198-mother knew nothing of that ; [they]2289-they only felt how imprudent a match it must be . [Kitty]86-lady catherine then owned , with a very natural triumph on knowing more than the rest of [us]2289-they , that in [Lydia]84-lydia 's last letter [she]86-lady catherine had prepared [her]86-lady catherine for such a step . [She]86-lady catherine had known , it seems , of [their]2289-they being in love with [each other]3144-each other many weeks . "[327-the former]

" But not before [they]2289-they went to [Brighton]32-brighton ? "[327-the former]

" No , [I]327-the former believe not . "[327-the former]

" And did [Colonel Forster]107-colonel forster appear to think ill of [Wickham]136-wickham [himself]107-colonel forster ? Does [he]107-colonel forster know [his]107-colonel forster real character ? "[327-the former]

" [I]327-the former must confess that [he]107-colonel forster did not speak so well of [Wickham]136-wickham as [he]107-colonel forster formerly did . [He]107-colonel forster believed [him]107-colonel forster to be imprudent and extravagant ; and since this sad affair has taken place , it is said that [he]107-colonel forster left [Meryton]9-meryton greatly in debt : but [I]327-the former hope this may be false . "[327-the former]

" Oh , [Jane]83-jane , had [we]4684-we been less secret , had [we]4684-we told what [we]4684-we knew of [him]107-colonel forster , this could not have happened ! "[327-the former]

" Perhaps it would have been better , "[328-her sister] replied [[her]2304-her sister]328-her sister .

" But to expose the former faults of [any person]4685-any person , without knowing what [their]4685-any person present feelings were , seemed unjustifiable . "[327-the former]

" [We]4684-we acted with the best intentions . "[327-the former]

" Could [Colonel Forster]107-colonel forster repeat the particulars of [Lydia]84-lydia 's note to [[his]107-colonel forster wife]231-his wife ? "[327-the former]

" [He]107-colonel forster brought it with [him]107-colonel forster for [us]4684-we to see . "[327-the former]

[Jane]83-jane then took it from [her]83-jane pocket - book , and gave it to [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth . These were the contents:--

/ * NIND " [[My]327-the former dear]2993-my dear [Harriet]174-harriet , * /[327-the former]

" [You]174-harriet will laugh when [you]174-harriet know where [I]327-the former am gone , and [I]327-the former can not help laughing [myself]327-the former at [your]174-harriet surprise to - morrow morning , as soon as [I]327-the former am missed . [I]327-the former am going to [Gretna Green]50-gretna green , and if [you]174-harriet can not guess with who , [I]327-the former shall think [you]174-harriet [a simpleton]3140-a simpleton , for there is but [one man in [the world]303-the world [I]327-the former love]4689-one man in the world i love , and [he]4689-one man in the world i love is [an angel]4691-an angel . [I]327-the former should never be happy without [him]4689-one man in the world i love , so think it no harm to be off . [You]174-harriet need not send [them]4692-them word at [Longbourn]7-longbourn of [my]327-the former going , if [you]174-harriet do not like it , for it will make the surprise the greater when [I]327-the former write to [them]4692-them , and sign [my]327-the former name [Lydia Wickham]196-lydia wickham . What a good joke it will be ! [I]327-the former can hardly write for laughing . Pray make [my]327-the former excuses to [Pratt]177-pratt for not keeping [my]327-the former engagement , and dancing with [him]177-pratt to - night . Tell [him]177-pratt [I]327-the former hope [he]177-pratt will excuse [me]327-the former when [he]177-pratt knows all , and tell [him]177-pratt [I]327-the former will dance with [him]177-pratt at the next ball [we]4693-we meet with great pleasure . [I]327-the former shall send for [my]327-the former clothes when [I]327-the former get to [Longbourn]7-longbourn ; but [I]327-the former wish [you]4694-you would tell [Sally]197-sally to mend a great slit in [my]327-the former worked muslin gown before [they]4695-they are packed up . Good - bye . Give [my]327-the former love to [Colonel Forster]107-colonel forster . [I]327-the former hope [you]4694-you will drink to [our]4693-we good journey .[327-the former]

" [[Your]4694-you affectionate friend]4696-your affectionate friend ,[327-the former]

" [LYDIA BENNET]84-lydia . "[327-the former]

" Oh , thoughtless , thoughtless [Lydia]84-lydia ! "[82-elizabeth] cried [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth when [she]82-elizabeth had finished it . " What a letter is this , to be written at such a moment ! But at least it shows that _ [she]84-lydia _ was serious in the object of [her]84-lydia journey . Whatever [he]107-colonel forster might afterwards persuade [her]84-lydia to , it was not on [her]84-lydia side a _ scheme _ of infamy . [[My]82-elizabeth poor father]4697-my poor father ! how [he]4697-my poor father must have felt it ! "[82-elizabeth]

" [I]327-the former never saw [anyone]3102-anyone so shocked . [He]4697-my poor father could not speak a word for full ten minutes . [[My]327-the former mother]3227-my mother was taken ill immediately , and [the whole house]1332-the whole house in such confusion ! "[327-the former]

" Oh , [Jane]83-jane , "[82-elizabeth] cried [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , " was there [a servant belonging to it who did not know the whole story before the end of the day]4701-a servant belonging to it who did not know the whole story before the end of the day ? "[82-elizabeth]

" [I]327-the former do not know : [I]327-the former hope there was . But to be guarded at such a time is very difficult . [[My]327-the former mother]3227-my mother was in hysterics ; and though [I]327-the former endeavoured to give [her]3227-my mother every assistance in [my]327-the former power , [I]327-the former am afraid [I]327-the former did not do so much as [I]327-the former might have done . But the horror of what might possibly happen almost took from [me]327-the former [my]327-the former faculties . "[327-the former]

" [Your]327-the former attendance upon [her]3227-my mother has been too much for [you]327-the former . [You]327-the former do not look well . Oh that [I]327-the former had been with [you]327-the former ! [you]327-the former have had every care and anxiety upon [yourself]327-the former alone . "[327-the former]

" [Mary]87-mary and [Kitty]86-lady catherine have been very kind , and would have shared in every fatigue , [I]327-the former am sure , but [I]327-the former did not think it right for either of [them]4703-them . [Kitty]86-lady catherine is slight and delicate , and [Mary]87-mary studies so much that [her]87-mary hours of repose should not be broken in on . [[My]327-the former aunt]3204-my aunt [Philips]110-philips came to [Longbourn]7-longbourn on Tuesday , after [[my]327-the former father]3256-my father went away ; and was so good as to stay till Thursday with [me]327-the former . [She]3204-my aunt was of great use and comfort to [[us]4706-us all]4707-us all , and [Lady Lucas]81-lady lucas has been very kind : [she]3204-my aunt walked here on Wednesday morning to condole with [us]4706-us , and offered [her]3204-my aunt services , or any of [[her]3204-my aunt daughters]237-her daughters , if [they]237-her daughters could be of use to [us]4706-us . "[327-the former]

" [She]3204-my aunt had better have stayed at [home]3219-home , "[82-elizabeth] cried [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth : " perhaps [she]3204-my aunt _ meant _ well , but , under such a misfortune as this , one can not see too little of [one 's neighbours]4710-one 's neighbours . Assistance is impossible ; condolence , insufferable . Let [them]4710-one 's neighbours triumph over [us]4706-us at a distance , and be satisfied . "[82-elizabeth]

[She]82-elizabeth then proceeded to inquire into the measures which [[her]82-elizabeth father]244-her father had intended to pursue , while in [town]264-town , for the recovery of [[his]244-her father daughter]1106-his daughter .

" [He]244-her father meant , [I]83-jane believe , "[83-jane] replied [Jane]83-jane , " to go to [Epsom]53-epsom , [the place where [they]4710-one 's neighbours last changed horses]4711-the place where they last changed horses , see [the postilions]4712-the postilions , and try if anything could be made out from [them]4712-the postilions . [His]244-her father principal object must be to discover the number of [the hackney coach which took [them]4710-one 's neighbours from [Clapham]52-clapham]4713-the hackney coach which took them from clapham . [It]4713-the hackney coach which took them from clapham had come with a fare from [London]5-london ; and as [he]244-her father thought the circumstance of [a gentleman]3407-a gentleman and [lady]428-lady 's removing from [one carriage]4716-one carriage into another might be remarked , [he]244-her father meant to make inquiries at [Clapham]52-clapham . If [he]244-her father could anyhow discover at [what house [the coachman]1685-the coachman had before set down [his]244-her father fare]4717-what house the coachman had before set down his fare , [he]244-her father determined to make inquiries [there]305-there , and hoped it might not be impossible to find out the stand and number of [the coach]3221-the coach . [I]83-jane do not know of any other designs that [he]244-her father had formed ; but [he]244-her father was in such a hurry to be gone , and [his]244-her father spirits so greatly discomposed , that [I]83-jane had difficulty in finding out even so much as this . "[83-jane]

[VIII]198-viii .

[The whole party]521-the whole party were in hopes of a letter from [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet the next morning , but the post came in without bringing a single line from [him]75-mr. bennet . [[His]75-mr. bennet family]375-his family knew [him]75-mr. bennet to be , on all common occasions , [a most negligent and dilatory correspondent]2311-a most negligent and dilatory correspondent ; but at such a time [they]375-his family had hoped for exertion . [They]375-his family were forced to conclude , that [he]75-mr. bennet had no pleasing intelligence to send ; but even of _ that _ [they]375-his family would have been glad to be certain . [Mr. Gardiner]153-mr. gardiner had waited only for the letters before [he]75-mr. bennet set off .

When [he]75-mr. bennet was gone , [they]375-his family were certain at least of receiving constant information of what was going on ; and [[their]375-his family uncle]3247-their uncle promised , at parting , to prevail on [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet to return to [Longbourn]7-longbourn as soon as [he]75-mr. bennet could , to the great consolation of [[his]75-mr. bennet sister]559-his sister , who considered it as the only security for [[her]559-his sister husband]255-her husband 's not being killed in a duel .

[Mrs. Gardiner]125-mrs. gardiner and [the children]1848-the children were to remain in [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire a few days longer , as [the former]327-the former thought [her]327-the former presence might be serviceable to [[her]327-the former nieces]3045-her nieces . [She]327-the former shared in [their]375-his family attendance on [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet , and was a great comfort to [them]375-his family in [their]375-his family hours of freedom . [[Their]375-his family other aunt]2318-their other aunt also visited [them]375-his family frequently , and always , as [she]2318-their other aunt said , with the design of cheering and heartening [them]375-his family up -- though , as [she]2318-their other aunt never came without reporting some fresh instance of [Wickham]136-wickham 's extravagance or irregularity , [she]2318-their other aunt seldom went away without leaving [them]375-his family more dispirited than [she]2318-their other aunt found [them]375-his family .

[All Meryton]9-meryton seemed striving to blacken [the man who , but three months before , had been almost an angel of light]2319-the man who , but three months before , had been almost an angel of light . [He]2319-the man who , but three months before , had been almost an angel of light was declared to be in debt to [every tradesman in [the place]2998-the place]2320-every tradesman in the place , and [his]2319-the man who , but three months before , had been almost an angel of light intrigues , all honoured with the title of seduction , had been extended into [[every tradesman]2322-every tradesman 's family]2323-every tradesman 's family . [Everybody]304-everybody declared that [he]2319-the man who , but three months before , had been almost an angel of light was [the wickedest young man in [the world]303-the world]2325-the wickedest young man in the world ; and [everybody]304-everybody began to find out that [they]304-everybody had always distrusted the appearance of [his]2319-the man who , but three months before , had been almost an angel of light goodness . [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , though [she]82-elizabeth did not credit above half of what was said , believed enough to make [her]82-elizabeth former assurance of [[her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister 's ruin still more certain ; and even [Jane]83-jane , who believed still less of it , became almost hopeless , more especially as the time was now come , when , if [they]2329-they had gone to [Scotland]49-scotland , which [she]83-jane had never before entirely despaired of , [they]2329-they must in all probability have gained some news of [them]2329-they .

[Mr. Gardiner]153-mr. gardiner left [Longbourn]7-longbourn on Sunday ; on Tuesday , [[his]153-mr. gardiner wife]231-his wife received a letter from [him]153-mr. gardiner : it told [them]231-his wife , that on [his]153-mr. gardiner arrival [he]153-mr. gardiner had immediately found out [[his]153-mr. gardiner brother]2331-his brother , and persuaded [him]2331-his brother to come to [Gracechurch Street]28-gracechurch street . That [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet had been to [Epsom]53-epsom and [Clapham]52-clapham , before [his]75-mr. bennet arrival , but without gaining any satisfactory information ; and that [he]75-mr. bennet was now determined to inquire at [all the principal hotels in [town]264-town]2332-all the principal hotels in town , as [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet thought it possible [they]2334-they might have gone to one of [them]2332-all the principal hotels in town , on [their]2334-they first coming to [London]5-london , before [they]2334-they procured lodgings . [Mr. Gardiner]153-mr. gardiner [himself]153-mr. gardiner did not expect any success from this measure ; but as [[his]153-mr. gardiner brother]2331-his brother was eager in it , [he]153-mr. gardiner meant to assist [him]2331-his brother in pursuing it . [He]153-mr. gardiner added , that [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet seemed wholly disinclined at present to leave [London]5-london , and promised to write again very soon . There was also a postscript to this effect:--

" [I]153-mr. gardiner have written to [Colonel Forster]107-colonel forster to desire [him]107-colonel forster to find out , if possible , from [some of [the young man]764-the young man 's intimates in [the regiment]650-the regiment]4721-some of the young man 's intimates in the regiment , whether [Wickham]136-wickham has any relations or connections who would be likely to know in [what part of [the town]1033-the town [he]75-mr. bennet has now concealed [himself]75-mr. bennet]4724-what part of the town he has now concealed himself . If there were [anyone that one could apply to , with a probability of gaining such a clue as that]4726-anyone that one could apply to , with a probability of gaining such a clue as that , it might be of essential consequence . At present [we]4727-us have nothing to guide [us]4727-us . [Colonel Forster]107-colonel forster will , [I]153-mr. gardiner dare say , do everything in [his]107-colonel forster power to satisfy [us]4727-us on this head . But , on second thoughts , perhaps [Lizzy]82-elizabeth could tell [us]4727-us what relations [he]75-mr. bennet has now living better than [any other person]1085-any other person . "[153-mr. gardiner]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth was at no loss to understand from whence this deference for [her]82-elizabeth authority proceeded ; but it was not in [her]82-elizabeth power to give any information of so satisfactory a nature as the compliment deserved .

[She]82-elizabeth had never heard of [his]2336-his having had any relations , except [a father]3245-a father and [mother , both of whom had been dead many years]2338-mother , both of whom had been dead many years . It was possible , however , that [some of [[his]2336-his companions in the ----shire]2340-his companions in the ----shire]2339-some of his companions in the ----shire might be able to give more information ; and though [she]82-elizabeth was not very sanguine in expecting it , the application was a something to look forward to .

Every day at [Longbourn]7-longbourn was now a day of anxiety ; but the most anxious part of each was when the post was expected . The arrival of letters was the first grand object of every morning 's impatience . Through letters , whatever of good or bad was to be told would be communicated ; and every succeeding day was expected to bring some news of importance .

But before [they]2341-they heard again from [Mr. Gardiner]153-mr. gardiner , a letter arrived for [[their]2341-they father]247-their father , from [a different quarter]2343-a different quarter , from [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins ; which , as [Jane]83-jane had received directions to open all that came for [him]2336-his in [his]2336-his absence , [she]83-jane accordingly read ; and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , who knew what curiosities [his]2336-his letters always were , looked over [her]83-jane , and read it likewise . It was as follows:--

/ * " [[My]82-elizabeth dear]2993-my dear Sir , * /[82-elizabeth]

" [I]82-elizabeth feel [myself]82-elizabeth called upon , by [our]4730-our relationship , and [my]82-elizabeth situation in life , to condole with [you]2993-my dear on the grievous affliction [you]2993-my dear are now suffering under , of which [we]4730-our were yesterday informed by a letter from [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire . Be assured , [[my]82-elizabeth dear sir]3625-my dear sir , that [Mrs. Collins]158-mrs. collins and [myself]82-elizabeth sincerely sympathize with [you]2993-my dear , and all [[your]2993-my dear respectable family]4732-your respectable family , in [your]2993-my dear present distress , which must be of the bitterest kind , because proceeding from a cause which no time can remove . No arguments shall be wanting on [my]82-elizabeth part , that can alleviate so severe a misfortune ; or that may comfort [you]2993-my dear , under a circumstance that must be , of all others , most afflicting to [a parent]4733-a parent 's mind . The death of [[your]2993-my dear daughter]3233-your daughter would have been a blessing in comparison of this . And it is the more to be lamented , because there is reason to suppose , as [[my]82-elizabeth dear]2993-my dear [Charlotte]172-charlotte informs [me]82-elizabeth , that this licentiousness of behaviour in [[your]2993-my dear[82-elizabeth]

daughter]3233-your daughter has proceeded from a faulty degree of indulgence ; though , at the same time , for the consolation of [yourself]2344-your and [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet , [I]0-i am inclined to think that [her]85-mrs. bennet own disposition must be naturally bad , or [she]85-mrs. bennet could not be guilty of such an enormity , at so early an age . Howsoever that may be , [you]2344-your are grievously to be pitied ; in which opinion [I]0-i am not only joined by [Mrs. Collins]158-mrs. collins , but likewise by [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine and [[her]86-lady catherine daughter]463-her daughter , to whom [I]0-i have related the affair . [They]2346-they agree with [me]0-i in apprehending that this false step in [one daughter]2347-one daughter will be injurious to the fortunes of all the others : for who , as [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine [herself]86-lady catherine condescendingly says , will connect [themselves]2346-they with [such a family]2348-such a family ? And this consideration leads [me]0-i , moreover , to reflect , with augmented satisfaction , on a certain event of last November ; for had it been otherwise , [I]0-i must have been involved in all [your]2344-your sorrow and disgrace . Let [me]0-i advise [you]2344-your , then , [[my]0-i dear sir]3625-my dear sir , to console [yourself]2344-your as much as possible , to throw off [[your]2344-your unworthy child]2350-your unworthy child from [your]2344-your affection for ever , and leave [her]2350-your unworthy child to reap the fruits of [her]2350-your unworthy child own heinous offence .

" [I]153-mr. gardiner am , [dear sir]3423-dear sir , "[153-mr. gardiner] etc . , etc .

[Mr. Gardiner]153-mr. gardiner did not write again , till [he]153-mr. gardiner had received an answer from [Colonel Forster]107-colonel forster ; and then [he]153-mr. gardiner had nothing of a pleasant nature to send . It was not known that [Wickham]136-wickham had a single relation with whom [he]136-wickham kept up any connection , and it was certain that [he]136-wickham had [no near one living]2351-no near one living . [[His]136-wickham former acquaintance]2352-his former acquaintance had been numerous ; but since [he]136-wickham had been in [the militia]2353-the militia , it did not appear that [he]136-wickham was on terms of particular friendship with [any of [them]2352-his former acquaintance]2354-any of them . There was [no one]3271-no one , therefore , who could be pointed out as likely to give any news of [him]136-wickham . And in the wretched state of [his]136-wickham own finances , there was a very powerful motive for secrecy , in addition to [his]136-wickham fear of discovery by [Lydia]84-lydia 's relations ; for it had just transpired that [he]136-wickham had left gaming debts behind [him]136-wickham to a very considerable amount . [Colonel Forster]107-colonel forster believed that more than a thousand pounds would be necessary to clear [his]136-wickham expenses at [Brighton]32-brighton . [He]136-wickham owed a good deal in [the town]1033-the town , but [his]136-wickham debts of honour were still more formidable . [Mr. Gardiner]153-mr. gardiner did not attempt to conceal these particulars from [[the Longbourn]7-longbourn family]725-the longbourn family ; [Jane]83-jane heard [them]2358-them with horror . " [A gamester]4738-a gamester ! "[83-jane] [she]83-jane cried . " This is wholly unexpected ; [I]83-jane had not an idea of it . "[83-jane]

[Mr. Gardiner]153-mr. gardiner added , in [his]153-mr. gardiner letter , that [they]725-the longbourn family might expect to see [[their]725-the longbourn family father]247-their father at [home]3219-home on the following day , which was Saturday . Rendered spiritless by the ill success of all [their]725-the longbourn family endeavours , [he]153-mr. gardiner had yielded to [[his]153-mr. gardiner brother - in - law]284-his brother - in - law 's entreaty that [he]153-mr. gardiner would return to [[his]153-mr. gardiner family]375-his family and leave it to [him]153-mr. gardiner to do whatever occasion might suggest to be advisable for continuing [their]725-the longbourn family pursuit . When [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet was told of this , [she]85-mrs. bennet did not express so much satisfaction as [[her]85-mrs. bennet children]990-her children expected , considering what [her]85-mrs. bennet anxiety for [his]153-mr. gardiner life had been before .

" What ! is [he]153-mr. gardiner coming [home]3219-home , and without poor [Lydia]84-lydia ? "[85-mrs. bennet] [she]85-mrs. bennet cried . " Sure [he]153-mr. gardiner will not leave [London]5-london before [he]153-mr. gardiner has found [them]990-her children . Who is to fight [Wickham]136-wickham , and make [him]153-mr. gardiner marry [her]84-lydia , if [he]153-mr. gardiner comes away ? "[85-mrs. bennet]

As [Mrs. Gardiner]125-mrs. gardiner began to wish to be at [home]3219-home , it was settled that [she]125-mrs. gardiner and [[her]125-mrs. gardiner children]990-her children should go to [London]5-london at the same time that [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet came from [it]2366-it . [The coach]3221-the coach , therefore , took [them]990-her children the first stage of [their]990-her children journey , and brought [its master]1160-its master back to [Longbourn]7-longbourn .

[Mrs. Gardiner]125-mrs. gardiner went away in all the perplexity about [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth and [[her]82-elizabeth Derbyshire friend]2369-her derbyshire friend , that had attended [her]125-mrs. gardiner from [that part of [the world]303-the world]2370-that part of the world . [His]2369-her derbyshire friend name had never been voluntarily mentioned before [them]990-her children by [[her]125-mrs. gardiner niece]1276-her niece ; and the kind of half - expectation which [Mrs. Gardiner]125-mrs. gardiner had formed , of [their]990-her children being followed by a letter from [him]2369-her derbyshire friend , had ended in nothing . [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth had received none since [her]82-elizabeth return , that could come from [Pemberley]12-pemberley .

The present unhappy state of [the family]416-the family rendered any other excuse for the lowness of [her]82-elizabeth spirits unnecessary ; nothing , therefore , could be fairly conjectured from _ that_,--though [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , who was by this time tolerably well acquainted with [her]82-elizabeth own feelings , was perfectly aware that , had [she]82-elizabeth known nothing of [Darcy]89-mr. darcy , [she]82-elizabeth could have borne the dread of [Lydia]84-lydia 's infamy somewhat better . It would have spared [her]82-elizabeth , [she]82-elizabeth thought , one sleepless night out of two .

When [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet arrived , [he]75-mr. bennet had all the appearance of [his]75-mr. bennet usual philosophic composure . [He]75-mr. bennet said as little as [he]75-mr. bennet had ever been in the habit of saying ; made no mention of the business that had taken [him]75-mr. bennet away ; and it was some time before [[his]75-mr. bennet daughters]431-his daughters had courage to speak of it .

It was not till the afternoon , when [he]75-mr. bennet joined [them]2375-them at tea , that [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth ventured to introduce the subject ; and then , on [her]82-elizabeth briefly expressing [her]82-elizabeth sorrow for what [he]75-mr. bennet must have endured , [he]75-mr. bennet replied , " Say nothing of that . Who should suffer but [myself]75-mr. bennet ? It has been [my]75-mr. bennet own doing , and [I]75-mr. bennet ought to feel it . "[75-mr. bennet]

" [You]75-mr. bennet must not be too severe upon [yourself]75-mr. bennet , "[82-elizabeth] replied [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth .

" [You]75-mr. bennet may well warn [me]82-elizabeth against such an evil . Human nature is so prone to fall into it ! No , [Lizzy]82-elizabeth , let [me]82-elizabeth once in [my]82-elizabeth life feel how much [I]82-elizabeth have been to blame . [I]82-elizabeth am not afraid of being overpowered by the impression . It will pass away soon enough . "[82-elizabeth]

" Do [you]244-her father suppose [them]4740-them to be in [London]5-london ? "[244-her father]

" Yes ; where else can [they]4740-them be so well concealed ? "[82-elizabeth]

" And [Lydia]84-lydia used to want to go to [London]5-london , "[86-lady catherine] added [Kitty]86-lady catherine .

" [She]84-lydia is happy , then , "[244-her father] said [[her]86-lady catherine father]244-her father , drily ; " and [[her]84-lydia residence]4741-her residence there will probably be of some duration . "[244-her father]

Then , after a short silence , [he]244-her father continued , " [Lizzy]82-elizabeth , [I]244-her father bear [you]82-elizabeth no ill - will for being justified in [your]82-elizabeth advice to [me]244-her father last May , which , considering the event , shows some greatness of mind . "[244-her father]

[They]2377-they were interrupted by [Miss Bennet]84-lydia , who came to fetch [[her]86-lady catherine mother]241-her mother 's tea .

" This is a parade , "[244-her father] cried [he]244-her father , " which does one good ; it gives such an elegance to misfortune ! Another day [I]244-her father will do the same ; [I]244-her father will sit in [[my]244-her father library]4742-my library , in [my]244-her father nightcap and powdering gown , and give as much trouble as [I]244-her father can,--or perhaps [I]244-her father may defer it till [Kitty]86-lady catherine runs away . "[244-her father]

" [I]86-lady catherine am not going to run away , [papa]4432-papa , "[86-lady catherine] said [Kitty]86-lady catherine , fretfully . " If _ [I]86-lady catherine _ should ever go to [Brighton]32-brighton , [I]86-lady catherine would behave better than [Lydia]84-lydia . "[86-lady catherine]

" _ [You]86-lady catherine _ go to [Brighton]32-brighton ! [I]244-her father would not trust [you]86-lady catherine so near [it]32-brighton as [Eastbourne]56-eastbourne , for fifty pounds ! No , [Kitty]86-lady catherine , [I]244-her father have at least learnt to be cautious , and [you]86-lady catherine will feel the effects of it . [No officer]4744-no officer is ever to enter [[my]244-her father house]4745-my house again , nor even to pass through [the village]319-the village . Balls will be absolutely prohibited , unless [you]86-lady catherine stand up with [one of [[your]86-lady catherine sisters]3060-your sisters]4747-one of your sisters . And [you]86-lady catherine are never to stir out of doors , till [you]86-lady catherine can prove that [you]86-lady catherine have spent ten minutes of every day in a rational manner . "[244-her father]

[Kitty]86-lady catherine , who took all these threats in a serious light , began to cry .

" Well , well , "[2379-he] said [he]2379-he , " do not make [yourself]86-lady catherine unhappy . If [you]86-lady catherine are [a good girl]4749-a good girl for the next ten years , [I]2379-he will take [you]86-lady catherine to a review at the end of [them]4750-them . "[2379-he]

IX .

Two days after [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet 's return , as [Jane]83-jane and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth were walking together in the shrubbery behind [the house]3001-the house , [they]2381-they saw [the housekeeper]816-the housekeeper coming towards [them]2381-they , and concluding that [she]816-the housekeeper came to call [them]2381-they to [[their]2381-they mother]434-their mother , went forward to meet [her]816-the housekeeper ; but instead of the expected summons , when [they]2381-they approached [her]816-the housekeeper , [she]816-the housekeeper said to [Miss Bennet]84-lydia , " [I]816-the housekeeper beg [your]84-lydia pardon , [madam]3281-madam , for interrupting [you]84-lydia , but [I]816-the housekeeper was in hopes [you]84-lydia might have got some good news from [town]264-town , so [I]816-the housekeeper took the liberty of coming to ask . "[816-the housekeeper]

" What do [you]84-lydia mean , [Hill]128-hill ? [We]2381-they have heard nothing from [town]264-town . "[816-the housekeeper]

" [Dear madam]4754-dear madam , "[128-hill] cried [Mrs. Hill]128-hill , in great astonishment , " do n't [you]84-lydia know there is an express come for [master]4755-master from [Mr. Gardiner]153-mr. gardiner ? [He]2387-the library;--their father has been [here]2994-here this half hour , and [master]4755-master has had a letter . "[128-hill]

Away ran [the girls]3008-the girls , too eager to get in to have time for speech . [They]3008-the girls ran through [the vestibule]1004-the vestibule into [the breakfast - room]1005-the breakfast - room ; from thence to [the library;--their father]2387-the library;--their father was in neither ; and [they]3008-the girls were on the point of seeking [him]2387-the library;--their father [upstairs]703-upstairs with [[their]3008-the girls mother]434-their mother , when [they]3008-the girls were met by [the butler]2390-the butler , who said,--

" If [you]3008-the girls are looking for [[my]2390-the butler master]4485-my master , [ma'am]3119-ma'am , [he]2387-the library;--their father is walking towards the little copse . "[2390-the butler]

Upon this information , [they]3008-the girls instantly passed through [the hall]685-the hall once more , and ran across [the lawn]1954-the lawn after [[their]3008-the girls father]247-their father , who was deliberately pursuing [his]247-their father way towards a small wood on [one side of [the paddock]2264-the paddock]2394-one side of the paddock .

[Jane]83-jane , who was not so light , nor so much in the habit of running as [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , soon lagged behind , while [[her]83-jane sister]328-her sister , panting for breath , came up with [him]247-their father , and eagerly cried out,--

" Oh , [papa]4432-papa , what news ? what news ? have [you]4432-papa heard from [[my]328-her sister uncle]3488-my uncle ? "[328-her sister]

" Yes , [I]247-their father have had a letter from [him]3488-my uncle by express . "[247-their father]

" Well , and what news does it bring -- good or bad ? "[328-her sister]

" What is there of good to be expected ? "[247-their father] said [he]247-their father , taking the letter from [his]247-their father pocket ; " but perhaps [you]82-elizabeth would like to read it . "[247-their father]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth impatiently caught it from [his]247-their father hand . [Jane]83-jane now came up .

" Read it aloud , "[247-their father] said [[their]2397-they father]247-their father , " for [I]247-their father hardly know [myself]247-their father what it is about . "[247-their father]

/ * RIGHT " [Gracechurch Street]28-gracechurch street , _ Monday , August 2 _ . * /[247-their father]

" [[My]247-their father dear [Brother]4668-brother]4672-my dear brother ,[247-their father]

" At last [I]247-their father am able to send [you]4668-brother some tidings of [[my]247-their father niece]4329-my niece , and such as , upon the whole , [I]247-their father hope will give [you]4668-brother satisfaction . Soon after [you]4668-brother left [me]247-their father on Saturday , [I]247-their father was fortunate enough to find out in what part of [London]5-london [they]2397-they were . The particulars [I]247-their father reserve till [we]4765-we meet . It is enough to know [they]2397-they are discovered : [I]247-their father have seen [them]2397-they both---- "[247-their father]

" Then it is as [I]83-jane always hoped , "[83-jane] cried [Jane]83-jane : " [they]2397-they are married ! "[83-jane]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth read on : " [I]82-elizabeth have seen [them]2397-they both . [They]2397-they are not married , nor can [I]82-elizabeth find there was any intention of being so ; but if [you]4668-brother are willing to perform the engagements which [I]82-elizabeth have ventured to make on [your]4668-brother side , [I]82-elizabeth hope it will not be long before [they]2397-they are . All that is required of [you]4668-brother is , to assure to [[your]4668-brother daughter]3233-your daughter , by settlement , [her]3233-your daughter equal share of the five thousand pounds , secured among [[your]4668-brother children]4767-your children after the decease of [yourself]4668-brother and [[my]82-elizabeth sister]3280-my sister ; and , moreover , to enter into an engagement of allowing [her]3233-your daughter , during [your]4668-brother life , one hundred pounds per annum . These are conditions which , considering everything , [I]82-elizabeth had no hesitation in complying with , as far as [I]82-elizabeth thought [myself]82-elizabeth privileged , for [you]4668-brother . [I]82-elizabeth shall send this by express , that no time may be lost in bringing [me]82-elizabeth [your]4668-brother answer . [You]4668-brother will easily comprehend , from these particulars , that [Mr. Wickham]136-wickham 's circumstances are not so hopeless as they are generally believed to be . [The world]303-the world has been deceived in that respect ; and [I]82-elizabeth am happy to say , there will be some little money , even when all [his]136-wickham debts are discharged , to settle on [[my]82-elizabeth niece]4329-my niece , in addition to [her]4329-my niece own fortune . If , as [I]82-elizabeth conclude will be the case , [you]4668-brother send [me]82-elizabeth full powers to act in [your]4668-brother name throughout the whole of this business , [I]82-elizabeth will immediately give directions to [Haggerston]200-haggerston for preparing a proper settlement . There will not be the smallest occasion for [your]4668-brother coming to [town]264-town again ; therefore stay quietly at [Longbourn]7-longbourn , and depend on [my]82-elizabeth diligence and care . Send back [your]4668-brother answer as soon as [you]4668-brother can , and be careful to write explicitly . [We]4772-we have judged it best that [[my]82-elizabeth niece]4329-my niece should be married from [this house]3416-this house , of which [I]82-elizabeth hope [you]4668-brother will approve . [She]4329-my niece comes to [us]4772-we to - day . [I]82-elizabeth shall write again as soon as anything more is determined on . [Yours]4668-brother , etc .[82-elizabeth]

" EDW . [GARDINER]153-mr. gardiner . "[82-elizabeth]

" Is it possible ? "[82-elizabeth] cried [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , when [she]82-elizabeth had finished . " Can it be possible that [he]4775-he will marry [her]4329-my niece ? "[82-elizabeth]

" [Wickham]136-wickham is not so undeserving , then , as [we]4772-we have thought [him]136-wickham , "[328-her sister] said [[her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister . " [[My]328-her sister dear father]4442-my dear father , [I]328-her sister congratulate [you]4442-my dear father . "[328-her sister]

" And have [you]4442-my dear father answered the letter ? "[82-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth .

" No ; but it must be done soon . "[82-elizabeth]

Most earnestly did [she]82-elizabeth then entreat [him]2400-he to lose no more time before [he]2400-he wrote .

" Oh ! [[my]82-elizabeth dear father]4442-my dear father , "[82-elizabeth] [she]82-elizabeth cried , " come back and write immediately . Consider how important every moment is in such a case . "[82-elizabeth]

" Let [me]83-jane write for [you]2400-he , "[83-jane] said [Jane]83-jane , " if [you]2400-he dislike the trouble [yourself]2400-he . "[83-jane]

" [I]2400-he dislike it very much , "[2400-he] [he]2400-he replied ; " but it must be done . "[2400-he]

And so saying , [he]2400-he turned back with [them]2401-they , and walked towards [the house]3001-the house .

" And -- may [I]82-elizabeth ask ? "[82-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth ; " but the terms , [I]82-elizabeth suppose , must be complied with . "[82-elizabeth]

" Complied with ! [I]83-jane am only ashamed of [his]2400-he asking so little . "[83-jane]

" And [they]2401-they _ must _ marry ! Yet [he]2400-he is _ such _ [a man]3042-a man . "[82-elizabeth]

" Yes , yes , [they]2401-they must marry . There is nothing else to be done . But there are two things that [I]83-jane want very much to know:--one is , how much money [[your]2400-he uncle]3374-your uncle has laid down to bring it about ; and the other , how [I]83-jane am ever to pay [him]2400-he . "[83-jane]

" Money ! [[my]83-jane uncle]3488-my uncle ! "[83-jane] cried [Jane]83-jane , " what do [you]83-jane mean , [sir]3161-sir ? "[83-jane]

" [I]83-jane mean that [no man in [his]2400-he proper senses]4782-no man in his proper senses would marry [Lydia]84-lydia on so slight a temptation as one hundred a year during [my]83-jane life , and fifty after [I]83-jane am gone . "[83-jane]

" That is very true , "[82-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth ; " though it had not occurred to [me]82-elizabeth before . [His]2400-he debts to be discharged , and something still to remain ! Oh , it must be [[my]82-elizabeth uncle]3488-my uncle 's doings ! [Generous , good man]4784-generous , good man , [I]82-elizabeth am afraid [he]2400-he has distressed [himself]2400-he . A small sum could not do all this . "[82-elizabeth]

" No , "[244-her father] said [[her]82-elizabeth father]244-her father . " [Wickham]136-wickham 's [a fool]4785-a fool if [he]2400-he takes [her]2400-he with a farthing less than ten thousand pounds : [I]244-her father should be sorry to think so ill of [him]2400-he , in the very beginning of [our]2404-they relationship . "[244-her father]

" Ten thousand pounds ! Heaven forbid ! How is half such a sum to be repaid ? "[244-her father]

[Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet made no answer ; and each of [them]2404-they , deep in thought , continued silent till [they]2404-they reached [the house]3001-the house . [[Their]2404-they father]247-their father then went to [the library]1011-the library to write , and [the girls]3008-the girls walked into [the breakfast - room]1005-the breakfast - room .

" And [they]2404-they are really to be married ! "[82-elizabeth] cried [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , as soon as [they]2404-they were by [themselves]2404-they . " How strange this is ! and for _ this _ [we]2404-they are to be thankful . That [they]2404-they should marry , small as is [their]2404-they chance of happiness , and wretched as is [his]2400-he character , [we]2404-they are forced to rejoice ! Oh , [Lydia]84-lydia ! "[82-elizabeth]

" [I]83-jane comfort [myself]83-jane with thinking , "[83-jane] replied [Jane]83-jane , " that [he]2400-he certainly would not marry [Lydia]84-lydia , if [he]2400-he had not a real regard for [her]84-lydia . Though [[our]2404-they kind uncle]4786-our kind uncle has done something towards clearing [him]2400-he , [I]83-jane can not believe that ten thousand pounds , or anything like it , has been advanced . [He]2400-he has [children]4512-children of [his]2400-he own , and may have more . How could [he]2400-he spare half ten thousand pounds ? "[83-jane]

" If [we]2404-they are ever able to learn what [Wickham]136-wickham 's debts have been , "[82-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , " and how much is settled on [his]136-wickham side on [[our]2404-they sister]3803-our sister , [we]2404-they shall exactly know what [Mr. Gardiner]153-mr. gardiner has done for [them]4512-children , because [Wickham]136-wickham has not sixpence of [his]136-wickham own . The kindness of [[my]82-elizabeth uncle]3488-my uncle and [aunt]3971-aunt can never be requited . [Their]4512-children taking [her]3971-aunt [home]3219-home , and affording [her]3971-aunt [their]4512-children personal protection and countenance , is such a sacrifice to [her]3971-aunt advantage as years of gratitude can not enough acknowledge . By this time [she]3971-aunt is actually with [them]4512-children ! If such goodness does not make [her]3971-aunt miserable now , [she]3971-aunt will never deserve to be happy ! What a meeting for [her]3971-aunt , when [she]3971-aunt first sees [[my]82-elizabeth aunt]3204-my aunt ! "[82-elizabeth]

" [We]4793-we must endeavour to forget all that has passed on either side , "[83-jane] said [Jane]83-jane : " [I]83-jane hope and trust [they]4512-children will yet be happy . [His]3488-my uncle consenting to marry [her]3971-aunt is a proof , [I]83-jane will believe , that [he]3488-my uncle is come to a right way of thinking . [Their]4512-children mutual affection will steady [them]4512-children ; and [I]83-jane flatter [myself]83-jane [they]4512-children will settle so quietly , and live in so rational a manner , as may in time make [their]4512-children past imprudence forgotten . "[83-jane]

" [Their]4512-children conduct has been such , "[82-elizabeth] replied [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , " as neither [you]4794-you , nor [I]82-elizabeth , nor [anybody]3099-anybody , can ever forget . It is useless to talk of it . "[82-elizabeth]

It now occurred to [the girls]3008-the girls that [[their]3008-the girls mother]434-their mother was in all likelihood perfectly ignorant of what had happened . [They]3008-the girls went to [the library]1011-the library , therefore , and asked [[their]3008-the girls father]247-their father whether [he]247-their father would not wish [them]3008-the girls to make it known to [her]434-their mother . [He]247-their father was writing , and , without raising [his]247-their father head , coolly replied,--

" Just as [you]82-elizabeth please . "[247-their father]

" May [we]3008-the girls take [[my]247-their father uncle]3488-my uncle 's letter to read to [her]434-their mother ? "[247-their father]

" Take whatever [you]82-elizabeth like , and get away . "[247-their father]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth took the letter from [his]247-their father writing - table , and [they]3008-the girls went [upstairs]703-upstairs together . [Mary]87-mary and [Kitty]86-lady catherine were both with [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet : one communication would , therefore , do for all . After a slight preparation for good news , the letter was read aloud . [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet could hardly contain [herself]85-mrs. bennet . As soon as [Jane]83-jane had read [Mr. Gardiner]153-mr. gardiner 's hope of [Lydia]84-lydia 's being soon married , [her]83-jane joy burst forth , and every following sentence added to its exuberance . [She]83-jane was now in an irritation as violent from delight as [she]83-jane had ever been fidgety from alarm and vexation . To know that [[her]83-jane daughter]463-her daughter would be married was enough . [She]83-jane was disturbed by no fear for [her]83-jane felicity , nor humbled by any remembrance of [her]83-jane misconduct .

" [[My]83-jane dear]2993-my dear , dear [Lydia]84-lydia ! "[83-jane] [she]83-jane cried : " this is delightful indeed ! [She]84-lydia will be married ! [I]83-jane shall see [her]84-lydia again ! [She]84-lydia will be married at sixteen ! [[My]83-jane good , kind brother]4798-my good , kind brother ! [I]83-jane knew how it would be -- [I]83-jane knew [he]4798-my good , kind brother would manage everything . How [I]83-jane long to see [her]84-lydia ! and to see [dear Wickham]136-wickham too ! But the clothes , the wedding clothes ! [I]83-jane will write to [[my]83-jane sister]3280-my sister [Gardiner]153-mr. gardiner about [them]4800-them directly . [Lizzy]82-elizabeth , [[my]83-jane dear]2993-my dear , run down to [[your]82-elizabeth father]3223-your father , and ask [him]4798-my good , kind brother how much [he]4798-my good , kind brother will give [her]84-lydia . Stay , stay , [I]83-jane will go [myself]83-jane . Ring the bell , [Kitty]86-lady catherine , for [Hill]128-hill . [I]83-jane will put on [my]83-jane things in a moment . [[My]83-jane dear]2993-my dear , dear [Lydia]84-lydia ! How merry [we]4804-we shall be together when [we]4804-we meet ! "[83-jane]

[[Her]2416-her eldest daughter]312-her eldest daughter endeavoured to give some relief to the violence of [these transports]2418-these transports , by leading [her]312-her eldest daughter thoughts to the obligations which [Mr. Gardiner]153-mr. gardiner 's behaviour laid [them]2419-them all under .

" For [we]4804-we must attribute this happy conclusion , "[2416-her] [she]2416-her added , " in a great measure to [his]153-mr. gardiner kindness . [We]4804-we are persuaded that [he]153-mr. gardiner has pledged [himself]153-mr. gardiner to assist [Mr. Wickham]136-wickham with money . "[2416-her]

" Well , "[241-her mother] cried [[her]312-her eldest daughter mother]241-her mother , " it is all very right ; who should do it but [[her]312-her eldest daughter own uncle]4805-her own uncle ? If [he]153-mr. gardiner had not had [a family of [his]153-mr. gardiner own]4806-a family of his own , [I]241-her mother and [[my]241-her mother children]3192-my children must have had all [his]153-mr. gardiner money , [you]4808-you know ; and it is the first time [we]4804-we have ever had anything from [him]153-mr. gardiner except a few presents . Well ! [I]241-her mother am so happy . In a short time , [I]241-her mother shall have [a daughter]1117-a daughter married . [Mrs. Wickham]201-mrs. wickham ! How well it sounds ! And [she]1117-a daughter was only sixteen last [June]202-june . [[My]241-her mother dear]2993-my dear [Jane]83-jane , [I]241-her mother am in such a flutter , that [I]241-her mother am sure [I]241-her mother ca n't write ; so [I]241-her mother will dictate , and [you]83-jane write for [me]241-her mother . [We]4811-we will settle with [[your]83-jane father]3223-your father about the money afterwards ; but the things should be ordered immediately . "[241-her mother]

[She]2421-i was then proceeding to all the particulars of calico , muslin , and cambric , and would shortly have dictated some very plentiful orders , had not [Jane]83-jane , though with some difficulty , persuaded [her]2421-i to wait till [[her]2421-i father]244-her father was at leisure to be consulted . One day 's delay , [she]2421-i observed , would be of small importance ; and [[her]2421-i mother]241-her mother was too happy to be quite so obstinate as usual . Other schemes , too , came into [her]2421-i head .

" [I]2421-i will go to [Meryton]9-meryton , "[2421-i] said [she]2421-i , " as soon as [I]2421-i am dressed , and tell the good , good news to [[my]2421-i sister]3280-my sister [Philips]110-philips . And as [I]2421-i come back , [I]2421-i can call on [Lady Lucas]81-lady lucas and [Mrs. Long]76-mrs. long . [Kitty]86-lady catherine , run down and order [the carriage]3217-the carriage . An airing would do [me]2421-i a great deal of good , [I]2421-i am sure . [Girls]3052-girls , can [I]2421-i do anything for [you]3052-girls in [Meryton]9-meryton ? Oh ! here comes [Hill]128-hill . [[My]2421-i dear]2993-my dear [Hill]128-hill , have [you]128-hill heard the good news ? [Miss Lydia]84-lydia is going to be married ; and [you]128-hill shall all have a bowl of punch to make merry at [her]84-lydia wedding . "[2421-i]

[Mrs. Hill]128-hill began instantly to express [her]128-hill joy . [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth received [her]82-elizabeth congratulations amongst [the rest]2102-the rest , and then , sick of this folly , took refuge in [[her]82-elizabeth own room]1549-her own room , that [she]82-elizabeth might think with freedom . [Poor Lydia]203-lydia 's situation must , at best , be bad enough ; but that it was no worse , [she]82-elizabeth had need to be thankful . [She]82-elizabeth felt it so ; and though , in looking forward , neither rational happiness , nor worldly prosperity could be justly expected for [[her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister , in looking back to what [they]2427-they had feared , only two hours ago , [she]82-elizabeth felt all the advantages of what [they]2427-they had gained .

[CHAPTER L.

Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet had very often wished , before this period of [his]75-mr. bennet life , that , instead of spending [his]75-mr. bennet whole income , [he]75-mr. bennet had laid by an annual sum , for the better provision of [[his]75-mr. bennet children]2428-his children , and of [[his]75-mr. bennet wife]231-his wife , if [she]231-his wife survived [him]75-mr. bennet . [He]75-mr. bennet now wished it more than ever . Had [he]75-mr. bennet done [his]75-mr. bennet duty in that respect , [Lydia]203-lydia need not have been indebted to [[her]203-lydia uncle]573-her uncle for whatever of honour or credit could now be purchased for [her]203-lydia . The satisfaction of prevailing on [one of [the most worthless young men in [Great Britain]58-great britain]2432-the most worthless young men in great britain to be [[her]203-lydia husband]255-her husband]2431-one of the most worthless young men in great britain to be her husband might then have rested in its proper place .

[He]75-mr. bennet was seriously concerned that a cause of so little advantage to [anyone]3102-anyone should be forwarded at the sole expense of [[his]75-mr. bennet brother - in - law]284-his brother - in - law ; and [he]75-mr. bennet was determined , if possible , to find out the extent of [his]75-mr. bennet assistance , and to discharge the obligation as soon as [he]75-mr. bennet could .

When first [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet had married , economy was held to be perfectly useless ; for , of course , [they]2436-their were to have [a son]2437-a son . [This son]2438-this son was to join in cutting off the entail , as soon as [he]2438-this son should be of age , and [the widow]2439-the widow and [younger children]2440-younger children would by that means be provided for . [Five daughters]659-five daughters successively entered [the world]303-the world , but yet [the son]1612-the son was to come ; and [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet , for many years after [Lydia]203-lydia 's birth , had been certain that [he]1612-the son would . This event had at last been despaired of , but it was then too late to be saving . [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet had no turn for economy ; and [[her]85-mrs. bennet husband]255-her husband 's love of independence had alone prevented [their]2436-their exceeding [their]2436-their income .

Five thousand pounds was settled by marriage articles on [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet and [the children]1848-the children . But in what proportions it should be divided amongst [the latter]487-the latter depended on the will of [the parents]2447-the parents . This was one point , with regard to [Lydia]203-lydia at least , which was now to be settled , and [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet could have no hesitation in acceding to the proposal before [him]75-mr. bennet . In terms of grateful acknowledgment for the kindness of [[his]75-mr. bennet brother]2331-his brother , though expressed most concisely , [he]75-mr. bennet then delivered on paper [his]75-mr. bennet perfect approbation of all that was done , and [his]75-mr. bennet willingness to fulfil the engagements that had been made for [him]75-mr. bennet . [He]75-mr. bennet had never before supposed that , could [Wickham]136-wickham be prevailed on to marry [[his]136-wickham daughter]1106-his daughter , it would be done with so little inconvenience to [himself]136-wickham as by the present arrangement . [He]136-wickham would scarcely be ten pounds a year [the loser]2450-the loser , by the hundred that was to be paid [them]2450-the loser ; for , what with [her]203-lydia board and pocket allowance , and the continual presents in money which passed to [her]203-lydia through [[her]203-lydia mother]241-her mother 's hands , [Lydia]203-lydia 's expenses had been very little within that sum .

That it would be done with such trifling exertion on [his]75-mr. bennet side , too , was another very welcome surprise ; for [his]75-mr. bennet chief wish at present was to have as little trouble in the business as possible . When the first transports of rage which had produced [his]75-mr. bennet activity in seeking [her]203-lydia were over , [he]75-mr. bennet naturally returned to all [his]75-mr. bennet former indolence . [His]75-mr. bennet letter was soon despatched ; for though dilatory in undertaking business , [he]75-mr. bennet was quick in its execution . [He]75-mr. bennet begged to know further particulars of what [he]75-mr. bennet was indebted to [[his]75-mr. bennet brother]2331-his brother ; but was too angry with [Lydia]203-lydia to send any message to [her]203-lydia .

The good news quickly spread through [the house]3001-the house ; and with proportionate speed through [the neighbourhood]3015-the neighbourhood . It was borne in the latter with decent philosophy . To be sure , it would have been more for the advantage of conversation , had [Miss Lydia Bennet]84-lydia come upon [the town]1033-the town ; or , as the happiest alternative , been secluded from [the world]303-the world in [some distant farm - house]2457-some distant farm - house . But there was much to be talked of , in marrying [her]203-lydia ; and the good - natured wishes for [her]203-lydia well - doing , which had proceeded before from [all the spiteful old ladies in [Meryton]9-meryton]2458-all the spiteful old ladies in meryton , lost but little of [their]2458-all the spiteful old ladies in meryton spirit in this change of circumstances , because with [such a husband]2459-such a husband [her]203-lydia misery was considered certain .

It was a fortnight since [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet had been down [stairs]519-stairs , but on this happy day [she]85-mrs. bennet again took [her]85-mrs. bennet seat at the head of [her]85-mrs. bennet table , and in spirits oppressively high . No sentiment of shame gave a damp to [her]85-mrs. bennet triumph . The marriage of [a daughter]1117-a daughter , which had been the first object of [her]85-mrs. bennet wishes since [Jane]83-jane was sixteen , was now on the point of accomplishment , and [her]85-mrs. bennet thoughts and [her]85-mrs. bennet words ran wholly on [those attendants of elegant nuptials , fine muslins , new carriages]2462-those attendants of elegant nuptials , fine muslins , new carriages , and [servants]3324-servants . [She]85-mrs. bennet was busily searching through [the neighbourhood]3015-the neighbourhood for a proper situation for [[her]85-mrs. bennet daughter]463-her daughter ; and , without knowing or considering what [their]2466-their income might be , rejected many as deficient in size and importance .

" [Haye Park]59-haye park might do , "[85-mrs. bennet] said [she]85-mrs. bennet , " if [the Gouldings]204-the gouldings would quit [it]59-haye park , or [the great house at [Stoke]60-stoke]4817-the great house at stoke , if [the drawing - room]520-the drawing - room were larger ; but [Ashworth]205-ashworth is too far off . [I]85-mrs. bennet could not bear to have [her]463-her daughter ten miles from [me]85-mrs. bennet ; and as for [Purvis Lodge]61-purvis lodge , the attics are dreadful . "[85-mrs. bennet]

[[Her]85-mrs. bennet husband]255-her husband allowed [her]85-mrs. bennet to talk on without interruption while [the servants]692-the servants remained . But when [they]692-the servants had withdrawn , [he]255-her husband said to [her]85-mrs. bennet , " [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet , before [you]85-mrs. bennet take any , or all of [these houses]4819-these houses , for [[your]85-mrs. bennet son]4820-your son and [daughter]4036-daughter , let [us]4822-us come to a right understanding . Into [_ one _ house in [this neighbourhood]3314-this neighbourhood]4823-_ one _ house in this neighbourhood [they]4819-these houses shall never have admittance . [I]255-her husband will not encourage the imprudence of either , by receiving [them]4819-these houses at [Longbourn]7-longbourn . "[255-her husband]

A long dispute followed this declaration ; but [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet was firm : it soon led to another ; and [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet found , with amazement and horror , that [[her]85-mrs. bennet husband]255-her husband would not advance a guinea to buy clothes for [[his]255-her husband daughter]1106-his daughter . [He]255-her husband protested that [she]85-mrs. bennet should receive from [him]255-her husband no mark of affection whatever on the occasion . [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet could hardly comprehend it . That [his]255-her husband anger could be carried to such a point of inconceivable resentment as to refuse [[his]255-her husband daughter]1106-his daughter a privilege , without which [her]85-mrs. bennet marriage would scarcely seem valid , exceeded all that [she]85-mrs. bennet could believe possible . [She]85-mrs. bennet was more alive to the disgrace , which [her]85-mrs. bennet want of new clothes must reflect on [[her]85-mrs. bennet daughter]463-her daughter 's nuptials , than to any sense of shame at [her]85-mrs. bennet eloping and living with [Wickham]136-wickham a fortnight before [they]2473-they took place .

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth was now most heartily sorry that [she]82-elizabeth had , from the distress of the moment , been led to make [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy acquainted with [their]2474-their fears for [[her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister ; for since [her]82-elizabeth marriage would so shortly give the proper termination to the elopement , [they]2474-their might hope to conceal its unfavourable beginning from [all those who were not immediately on the spot]2476-all those who were not immediately on the spot .

[She]82-elizabeth had no fear of its spreading farther , through [his]89-mr. darcy means . There were [few people on whose secrecy]2477-few people on whose secrecy [she]82-elizabeth would have more confidently depended ; but at the same time there was [no one whose knowledge of]2478-no one whose knowledge of [a sister]437-a sister 's frailty would have mortified [her]82-elizabeth so much . Not , however , from any fear of disadvantage from it individually to [herself]82-elizabeth ; for at any rate there seemed a gulf impassable between [them]2480-them . Had [Lydia]84-lydia 's marriage been concluded on the most honourable terms , it was not to be supposed that [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy would connect [himself]89-mr. darcy with [a family]1383-a family , where to every other objection would now be added an alliance and relationship of the nearest kind with [the man whom [he]89-mr. darcy so justly scorned]2482-the man whom he so justly scorned .

From such a connection [she]82-elizabeth could not wonder that [he]89-mr. darcy should shrink . The wish of procuring [her]82-elizabeth regard , which [she]82-elizabeth had assured [herself]82-elizabeth of [his]89-mr. darcy feeling in [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire , could not in rational expectation survive such a blow as this . [She]82-elizabeth was humbled , [she]82-elizabeth was grieved ; [she]82-elizabeth repented , though [she]82-elizabeth hardly knew of what . [She]82-elizabeth became jealous of [his]89-mr. darcy esteem , when [she]82-elizabeth could no longer hope to be benefited by it . [She]82-elizabeth wanted to hear of [him]89-mr. darcy , when there seemed the least chance of gaining intelligence . [She]82-elizabeth was convinced that [she]82-elizabeth could have been happy with [him]89-mr. darcy , when it was no longer likely [they]2483-they should meet .

What a triumph for [him]89-mr. darcy , as [she]82-elizabeth often thought , could [he]89-mr. darcy know that the proposals which [she]82-elizabeth had proudly spurned only four months ago would now have been gladly and gratefully received ! [He]89-mr. darcy was as generous , [she]82-elizabeth doubted not , as the most generous of [his]89-mr. darcy sex . But while [he]89-mr. darcy was mortal , there must be a triumph .

[She]82-elizabeth began now to comprehend that [he]89-mr. darcy was exactly [the man who , in disposition and talents , would most suit [her]82-elizabeth]2484-the man who , in disposition and talents , would most suit her . [His]89-mr. darcy understanding and temper , though unlike [her]82-elizabeth own , would have answered all [her]82-elizabeth wishes . It was an union that must have been to the advantage of both : by [her]82-elizabeth ease and liveliness , [his]89-mr. darcy mind might have been softened , [his]89-mr. darcy manners improved ; and from [his]89-mr. darcy judgment , information , and knowledge of [the world]303-the world , [she]82-elizabeth must have received benefit of greater importance .

But no such happy marriage could now teach [the admiring multitude]2486-the admiring multitude what connubial felicity really was . An union of a different tendency , and precluding the possibility of the other , was soon to be formed in [[their]2487-their family]2488-their family .

How [Wickham]136-wickham and [Lydia]84-lydia were to be supported in tolerable independence [she]82-elizabeth could not imagine . But how little of permanent happiness could belong to [a couple who were only brought together because [their]2489-a couple who were only brought together because their passions were stronger than their virtue passions were stronger than [their]2489-a couple who were only brought together because their passions were stronger than their virtue virtue]2489-a couple who were only brought together because their passions were stronger than their virtue , [she]82-elizabeth could easily conjecture .

[Mr. Gardiner]153-mr. gardiner soon wrote again to [[his]153-mr. gardiner brother]2331-his brother . To [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet 's acknowledgments [he]153-mr. gardiner briefly replied , with assurances of [his]153-mr. gardiner eagerness to promote the welfare of [any of [[his]153-mr. gardiner family]375-his family]2491-any of his family ; and concluded with entreaties that the subject might never be mentioned to [him]153-mr. gardiner again . The principal purport of [his]153-mr. gardiner letter was to inform [them]2493-them , that [Mr. Wickham]136-wickham had resolved on quitting [the militia]2353-the militia .

" It was greatly [my]153-mr. gardiner wish that [he]136-wickham should do so , "[153-mr. gardiner] [he]153-mr. gardiner added , " as soon as [his]136-wickham marriage was fixed on . And [I]153-mr. gardiner think [you]2493-them will agree with [me]153-mr. gardiner , in considering a removal from [that corps]4825-that corps as highly advisable , both on [his]136-wickham account and [[my]153-mr. gardiner niece]4329-my niece 's . It is [Mr. Wickham]136-wickham 's intention to go into [the Regulars]62-the regulars ; and , among [[his]136-wickham former friends]4827-his former friends , there are still some who are able and willing to assist [him]136-wickham in [the army]4484-the army . [He]136-wickham has the promise of an ensigncy in [[General----]4829-general---- 's regiment]4830-general---- 's regiment , now quartered in [the north]4831-the north . It is an advantage to have it so far from [this part of [the kingdom]3670-the kingdom]4832-this part of the kingdom . [He]136-wickham promises fairly ; and [I]153-mr. gardiner hope among [different people]4834-different people , where [they]4834-different people may each have a character to preserve , [they]4834-different people will both be more prudent . [I]153-mr. gardiner have written to [Colonel Forster]107-colonel forster , to inform [him]107-colonel forster of [our]4835-our present arrangements , and to request that [he]107-colonel forster will satisfy [the various creditors of [Mr. Wickham]136-wickham in and near [Brighton]32-brighton]4836-the various creditors of mr. wickham in and near brighton with assurances of speedy payment , for which [I]153-mr. gardiner have pledged [myself]153-mr. gardiner . And will [you]4837-you give [yourself]4837-you the trouble of carrying similar assurances to [[his]107-colonel forster creditors]4838-his creditors in [Meryton]9-meryton , of whom [I]153-mr. gardiner shall subjoin a list , according to [his]107-colonel forster information ? [He]107-colonel forster has given in all [his]107-colonel forster debts ; [I]153-mr. gardiner hope at least [he]107-colonel forster has not deceived [us]4835-our . [Haggerston]200-haggerston has [our]4835-our directions , and all will be completed in a week .
