[They]4836-the various creditors of mr. wickham in and near brighton will then join [[his]107-colonel forster regiment]4839-his regiment , unless [they]4836-the various creditors of mr. wickham in and near brighton are first invited to [Longbourn]7-longbourn ; and [I]153-mr. gardiner understand from [Mrs. Gardiner]125-mrs. gardiner that [[my]153-mr. gardiner niece]4329-my niece is very desirous of seeing [you]4841-you all before [she]4329-my niece leaves [the south]4842-the south . [She]4329-my niece is well , and begs to be dutifully remembered to [you]4841-you and [[her]4329-my niece mother.--Yours]4843-her mother.--yours , etc .[153-mr. gardiner]

" [E. GARDINER]206-e. gardiner . "[85-mrs. bennet]

[Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet and [[his]75-mr. bennet daughters]431-his daughters saw all the advantages of [Wickham]136-wickham 's removal from [the ----shire]21-the ----shire , as clearly as [Mr. Gardiner]153-mr. gardiner could do . But [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet was not so well pleased with it . [Lydia]84-lydia 's being settled in [the north]4831-the north , just when [she]84-lydia had expected most pleasure and pride in [her]84-lydia company , for [she]84-lydia had by no means given up [her]84-lydia plan of [their]2497-their residing in [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire , was a severe disappointment ; and , besides , it was such a pity that [Lydia]84-lydia should be taken from [a regiment where [she]84-lydia was acquainted with [everybody]304-everybody , and had so many favourites]2498-a regiment where she was acquainted with everybody , and had so many favourites .

" [She]84-lydia is so fond of [Mrs. Forster]107-colonel forster , "[84-lydia] said [she]84-lydia , " it will be quite shocking to send [her]84-lydia away ! And there are several of [the young men]4844-the young men , too , that [she]84-lydia likes very much . [The officers]454-the officers may not be so pleasant in [[General----]207-general---- 's regiment]4830-general---- 's regiment . "[84-lydia]

[[His]2500-his daughter]1106-his daughter 's request , for such it might be considered , of being admitted into [[her]1106-his daughter family]885-her family again , before [she]1106-his daughter set off for [the north]4831-the north , received at first an absolute negative . But [Jane]83-jane and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , who agreed in wishing , for the sake of [[their]2504-they sister]943-their sister 's feelings and consequence , that [she]1106-his daughter should be noticed on [her]1106-his daughter marriage by [[her]1106-his daughter parents]1718-her parents , urged [him]2500-his so earnestly , yet so rationally and so mildly , to receive [her]1106-his daughter and [[her]1106-his daughter husband]255-her husband at [Longbourn]7-longbourn , as soon as [they]2504-they were married , that [he]2500-his was prevailed on to think as [they]2504-they thought , and act as [they]2504-they wished . And [[their]2504-they mother]434-their mother had the satisfaction of knowing , that [she]434-their mother should be able to show [[her]434-their mother married daughter]2509-her married daughter in [the neighbourhood]3015-the neighbourhood , before [she]434-their mother was banished to [the north]4831-the north . When [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet wrote again to [[his]75-mr. bennet brother]2331-his brother , therefore , [he]75-mr. bennet sent [his]75-mr. bennet permission for [them]2504-they to come ; and it was settled , that , as soon as the ceremony was over , [they]2504-they should proceed to [Longbourn]7-longbourn . [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth was surprised , however , that [Wickham]136-wickham should consent to such a scheme ; and , had [she]82-elizabeth consulted only [her]82-elizabeth own inclination , any meeting with [him]136-wickham would have been the last object of [her]82-elizabeth wishes .

CHAPTER LI .

[[Their]2504-they sister]943-their sister 's wedding - day arrived ; and [Jane]83-jane and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth felt for [her]943-their sister probably more than [she]943-their sister felt for [herself]943-their sister . [The carriage]3217-the carriage was sent to meet [them]2504-they at---- , and [they]2504-they were to return in [it]3217-the carriage by dinnertime . [Their]2504-they arrival was dreaded by [the elder Miss Bennets]99-the bennets -- and [Jane]83-jane more especially , who gave [Lydia]84-lydia the feelings which would have attended [herself]83-jane , had _ [she]83-jane _ been the culprit , and was wretched in the thought of what [[her]83-jane sister]328-her sister must endure .

[They]2504-they came . [The family]416-the family were assembled in [the breakfast - room]1005-the breakfast - room to receive [them]2504-they . Smiles decked the face of [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet , as [the carriage]3217-the carriage drove up to the door ; [[her]85-mrs. bennet husband]255-her husband looked impenetrably grave ; [[her]85-mrs. bennet daughters]237-her daughters , alarmed , anxious , uneasy .

[Lydia]84-lydia 's voice was heard in the vestibule ; the door was thrown open , and [she]84-lydia ran into [the room]250-the room . [[Her]84-lydia mother]241-her mother stepped forwards , embraced [her]84-lydia , and welcomed [her]84-lydia with rapture ; gave [her]84-lydia hand with an affectionate smile to [Wickham]136-wickham , who followed [[his]136-wickham lady]230-his lady ; and wished [them]2524-their both joy , with an alacrity which showed no doubt of [their]2524-their happiness .

[Their]2524-their reception from [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet , to whom [they]2524-their then turned , was not quite so cordial . [His]136-wickham countenance rather gained in austerity ; and [he]136-wickham scarcely opened [his]136-wickham lips . The easy assurance of [the young couple]2525-the young couple , indeed , was enough to provoke [him]136-wickham .

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth was disgusted , and even [Miss Bennet]84-lydia was shocked . [Lydia]84-lydia was [Lydia]84-lydia still ; untamed , unabashed , wild , noisy , and fearless . [She]84-lydia turned from [sister]3891-sister to [sister]3891-sister , demanding [their]2524-their congratulations ; and when at length [they]2524-their all sat down , looked eagerly round [the room]250-the room , took notice of some little alteration in it , and observed , with a laugh , that it was a great while since [she]84-lydia had been [there]305-there .

[Wickham]136-wickham was not at all more distressed than [herself]82-elizabeth ; but [his]136-wickham manners were always so pleasing , that , had [his]136-wickham character and [his]136-wickham marriage been exactly what [they]2525-the young couple ought , [his]136-wickham smiles and [his]136-wickham easy address , while [he]136-wickham claimed [their]2524-their relationship , would have delighted [them]2524-their all . [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth had not before believed [him]136-wickham quite equal to such assurance ; but [she]82-elizabeth sat down , resolving within [herself]82-elizabeth to draw no limits in future to the impudence of [an impudent man]2530-an impudent man . _ [She]82-elizabeth _ blushed , and [Jane]83-jane blushed ; but the cheeks of the two who caused [their]2524-their confusion suffered no variation of colour .

There was no want of discourse . [The bride]1223-the bride and [[her]1223-the bride mother]241-her mother could neither of [them]2524-their talk fast enough ; and [Wickham]136-wickham , who happened to sit near [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , began inquiring after [his]136-wickham acquaintance in [that neighbourhood]3261-that neighbourhood , with a good - humoured ease , which [she]82-elizabeth felt very unable to equal in [her]82-elizabeth replies . [They]2524-their seemed each of [them]2524-their to have the happiest memories in [the world]303-the world . Nothing of the past was recollected with pain ; and [Lydia]84-lydia led voluntarily to subjects which [[her]84-lydia sisters]3023-her sisters would not have alluded to for [the world]303-the world .

" Only think of its being three months , "[84-lydia] [she]84-lydia cried , " since [I]84-lydia went away : it seems but a fortnight , [I]84-lydia declare ; and yet there have been things enough happened in the time . Good gracious ! when [I]84-lydia went away , [I]84-lydia am sure [I]84-lydia had no more idea of being married till [I]84-lydia came back again ! though [I]84-lydia thought it would be very good fun if [I]84-lydia was . "[84-lydia]

[[Her]84-lydia father]244-her father lifted up [his]244-her father eyes , [Jane]83-jane was distressed , [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth looked expressively at [Lydia]84-lydia ; but [she]84-lydia , who never heard nor saw anything of which [she]84-lydia chose to be insensible , gaily continued,--

" Oh , [mamma]3033-mamma , do [the people hereabouts]4848-the people hereabouts know [I]84-lydia am married to - day ? [I]84-lydia was afraid [they]4848-the people hereabouts might not ; and [we]4849-we overtook [William Goulding]208-william goulding in [his]208-william goulding curricle , so [I]84-lydia was determined [he]208-william goulding should know it , and so [I]84-lydia let down the side glass next to [him]208-william goulding , and took off [my]84-lydia glove and let [my]84-lydia hand just rest upon the window frame , so that [he]208-william goulding might see the ring , and then [I]84-lydia bowed and smiled like anything . "[84-lydia]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth could bear it no longer . [She]82-elizabeth got up and ran out of [the room]250-the room ; and returned no more , till [she]82-elizabeth heard [them]2539-them passing through [the hall]685-the hall to [the dining - parlour]518-the dining - parlour . [She]82-elizabeth then joined [them]2539-them soon enough to see [Lydia]84-lydia , with anxious parade , walk up to [[her]84-lydia mother]241-her mother 's right hand , and hear [her]84-lydia say to [[her]84-lydia eldest]2543-her eldest sister,--

" Ah , [Jane]83-jane , [I]84-lydia take [your]83-jane place now , and [you]83-jane must go lower , because [I]84-lydia am [a married woman]4850-a married woman . "[84-lydia]

It was not to be supposed that time would give [Lydia]84-lydia that embarrassment from which [she]84-lydia had been so wholly free at first . [Her]84-lydia ease and good spirits increased . [She]84-lydia longed to see [Mrs. Philips]111-mrs. philips , [the Lucases]100-the lucases , and all [[their]2539-them other neighbours]2544-their other neighbours , and to hear [herself]84-lydia called " [Mrs. Wickham]201-mrs. wickham "[84-lydia] by [each of [them]2539-them]2545-each of them ; and in the meantime [she]84-lydia went after dinner to show [her]84-lydia ring and boast of being married to [Mrs. Hill]128-hill and [the two housemaids]2546-the two housemaids .

" Well , [mamma]3033-mamma , "[84-lydia] said [she]84-lydia , when [they]2539-them were all returned to [the breakfast - room]1005-the breakfast - room , " and what do [you]3033-mamma think of [[my]84-lydia husband]4852-my husband ? Is not [he]4852-my husband [a charming man]4853-a charming man ? [I]84-lydia am sure [[my]84-lydia sisters]4854-my sisters must all envy [me]84-lydia . [I]84-lydia only hope [they]4854-my sisters may have half [my]84-lydia good luck . [They]4854-my sisters must all go to [Brighton]32-brighton . That is the place to get [husbands]4377-husbands . What a pity it is , [mamma]3033-mamma , [we]2539-them did not all go ! "[84-lydia]

" Very true ; and if [I]241-her mother had [my]241-her mother will [we]2539-them should . But , [[my]241-her mother dear]2993-my dear [Lydia]84-lydia , [I]241-her mother do n't at all like [your]84-lydia going such a way off . Must it be so ? "[241-her mother]

" Oh , [Lord]4858-lord ! yes ; there is nothing in that . [I]84-lydia shall like it of all things . [You]84-lydia and [papa]4432-papa , and [[my]84-lydia sisters]4854-my sisters , must come down and see [us]2539-them . [We]2539-them shall be at [Newcastle]63-newcastle all the winter , and [I]84-lydia dare say there will be some balls , and [I]84-lydia will take care to get [good partners]4861-good partners for [them]2539-them all . "[84-lydia]

" [I]241-her mother should like it beyond anything ! "[241-her mother] said [[her]2548-her mother]241-her mother .

" And then when [you]84-lydia go away , [you]84-lydia may leave [one or two of [[my]84-lydia sisters]4854-my sisters]4862-one or two of my sisters behind [you]84-lydia ; and [I]84-lydia dare say [I]84-lydia shall get [husbands]4377-husbands for [them]2539-them before the winter is over . "[84-lydia]

" [I]82-elizabeth thank [you]84-lydia for [my]82-elizabeth share of the favour , "[82-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth ; " but [I]82-elizabeth do not particularly like [your]84-lydia way of getting [husbands]4377-husbands . "[82-elizabeth]

[[Their]2550-their visitors]2109-their visitors were not to remain above ten days with [them]2550-their . [Mr. Wickham]136-wickham had received [his]136-wickham commission before [he]136-wickham left [London]5-london , and [he]136-wickham was to join [[his]136-wickham regiment]4839-his regiment at the end of a fortnight .

[No one]3271-no one but [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet regretted that [their]2550-their stay would be so short ; and [she]85-mrs. bennet made the most of the time by visiting about with [[her]85-mrs. bennet daughter]463-her daughter , and having very frequent parties at [home]3219-home . These parties were acceptable to [all]755-all ; to avoid a family circle was even more desirable to [such as did think than such as did not]2557-such as did think than such as did not .

[Wickham]136-wickham 's affection for [Lydia]84-lydia was just what [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth had expected to find it ; not equal to [Lydia]84-lydia 's for [him]136-wickham . [She]82-elizabeth had scarcely needed [her]82-elizabeth present observation to be satisfied , from the reason of things , that [their]2550-their elopement had been brought on by the strength of [her]82-elizabeth love rather than by [his]136-wickham ; and [she]82-elizabeth would have wondered why , without violently caring for [her]84-lydia , [he]136-wickham chose to elope with [her]84-lydia at all , had [she]82-elizabeth not felt certain that [his]136-wickham flight was rendered necessary by distress of circumstances ; and if that were the case , [he]136-wickham was not [the young man]764-the young man to resist an opportunity of having [a companion]1305-a companion .

[Lydia]84-lydia was exceedingly fond of [him]136-wickham . [He]136-wickham was [[her]84-lydia dear]2560-her dear [Wickham]136-wickham on every occasion ; [no one]3271-no one was to be put in competition with [him]136-wickham . [He]136-wickham did everything best in [the world]303-the world ; and [she]82-elizabeth was sure [he]136-wickham would kill more birds on the first of September than [anybody else in [the country]448-the country]2563-anybody else in the country .

One morning , soon after [their]2565-their arrival , as [she]82-elizabeth was sitting with [[her]82-elizabeth two elder sisters]2566-her two elder sisters , [she]82-elizabeth said to [Elizabeth,--]159-elizabeth,--

" [Lizzy]82-elizabeth , [I]82-elizabeth never gave _ [you]82-elizabeth _ an account of [my]82-elizabeth wedding , [I]82-elizabeth believe . [You]82-elizabeth were not by , when [I]82-elizabeth told [mamma]3033-mamma , and [the others]507-the others , all about it . Are not [you]82-elizabeth curious to hear how it was managed ? "[82-elizabeth]

" No , really , "[82-elizabeth] replied [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth ; " [I]82-elizabeth think there can not be too little said on the subject . "[82-elizabeth]

" La ! [You]82-elizabeth are so strange ! But [I]82-elizabeth must tell [you]82-elizabeth how it went off . [We]4868-we were married , [you]82-elizabeth know , at [St. Clement 's]64-st. clement 's , because [[Wickham]136-wickham 's lodgings]4869-wickham 's lodgings were in [that parish]4870-that parish . And it was settled that [we]4868-we should all be [there]305-there by eleven o'clock . [[My]82-elizabeth uncle]3488-my uncle and [aunt]3971-aunt and [I]82-elizabeth were to go together ; and [the others]507-the others were to meet [us]4868-we at [the church]3524-the church .[82-elizabeth]

" Well , Monday morning came , and [I]82-elizabeth was in such a fuss ! [I]82-elizabeth was so afraid , [you]82-elizabeth know , that something would happen to put it off , and then [I]82-elizabeth should have gone quite distracted . And there was [[my]82-elizabeth aunt]3204-my aunt , all the time [I]82-elizabeth was dressing , preaching and talking away just as if [she]3204-my aunt was reading a sermon . However , [I]82-elizabeth did not hear above one word in ten , for [I]82-elizabeth was thinking , [you]82-elizabeth may suppose , of [[my]82-elizabeth dear]2993-my dear [Wickham]136-wickham . [I]82-elizabeth longed to know whether [he]136-wickham would be married in [his]136-wickham blue coat .[82-elizabeth]

" Well , and so [we]4868-we breakfasted at ten as usual : [I]82-elizabeth thought it would never be over ; for , by the bye , [you]82-elizabeth are to understand that [[my]82-elizabeth uncle]3488-my uncle and [aunt]3971-aunt were horrid unpleasant all the time [I]82-elizabeth was with [them]4880-we . If [you]82-elizabeth 'll believe [me]82-elizabeth , [I]82-elizabeth did not once put [my]82-elizabeth foot out of doors , though [I]82-elizabeth was there a fortnight . Not one party , or scheme , or anything ! To be sure , [London]5-london was rather thin , but , however , [the Little Theatre]65-the little theatre was open .[82-elizabeth]

" Well , and so , just as [the carriage]3217-the carriage came to the door , [[my]82-elizabeth uncle]3488-my uncle was called away upon business to [that horrid man]4883-that horrid man [Mr. Stone]209-mr. stone . And then , [you]82-elizabeth know , when once [they]4880-we get together , there is no end of it . Well , [I]82-elizabeth was so frightened [I]82-elizabeth did not know what to do , for [[my]82-elizabeth uncle]3488-my uncle was to give [me]82-elizabeth away ; and if [we]4880-we were beyond the hour [we]4880-we could not be married all day . But , luckily , [he]3488-my uncle came back again in ten minutes ' time , and then [we]4880-we all set out . However , [I]82-elizabeth recollected afterwards , that if [he]3488-my uncle _ had _ been prevented going , the wedding need not be put off , for [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy might have done as well . "[82-elizabeth]

" [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy ! "[82-elizabeth] repeated [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , in utter amazement .

" Oh , yes ! [he]3488-my uncle was to come [there]305-there with [Wickham]136-wickham , [you]136-wickham know . But , gracious [me]82-elizabeth ! [I]82-elizabeth quite forgot ! [I]82-elizabeth ought not to have said a word about it . [I]82-elizabeth promised [them]4886-them so faithfully ! What will [Wickham]136-wickham say ? It was to be such a secret ! "[82-elizabeth]

" If it was to be a secret , "[83-jane] said [Jane]83-jane , " say not another word on the subject . [You]136-wickham may depend upon [my]83-jane seeking no further . "[83-jane]

" Oh , certainly , "[82-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , though burning with curiosity ; " [we]4887-we will ask [you]136-wickham no questions . "[82-elizabeth]

" Thank [you]136-wickham , "[84-lydia] said [Lydia]84-lydia ; " for if [you]136-wickham did , [I]84-lydia should certainly tell [you]136-wickham all , and then [Wickham]136-wickham would be so angry . "[84-lydia]

On such encouragement to ask , [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth was forced to put it out of [her]82-elizabeth power , by running away .

But to live in ignorance on such a point was impossible ; or at least it was impossible not to try for information . [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy had been at [[her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister 's wedding . It was exactly a scene , and exactly among [people]3234-people , where [he]89-mr. darcy had apparently least to do , and least temptation to go . Conjectures as to the meaning of it , rapid and wild , hurried into [her]82-elizabeth brain ; but [she]82-elizabeth was satisfied with none . Those that best pleased [her]82-elizabeth , as placing [his]89-mr. darcy conduct in the noblest light , seemed most improbable . [She]82-elizabeth could not bear such suspense ; and hastily seizing a sheet of paper , wrote a short letter to [[her]82-elizabeth aunt]1198-her aunt , to request an explanation of what [Lydia]84-lydia had dropped , if it were compatible with the secrecy which had been intended .

" [You]1198-her aunt may readily comprehend , "[82-elizabeth] [she]82-elizabeth added , " what [my]82-elizabeth curiosity must be to know how [a person unconnected with any of [us]4889-us]4888-a person unconnected with any of us , and , comparatively speaking , [a stranger to [[our]4889-us family]4891-our family]4890-a stranger to our family , should have been amongst [you]1198-her aunt at such a time . Pray write instantly , and let [me]82-elizabeth understand it -- unless it is , for very cogent reasons , to remain in the secrecy which [Lydia]84-lydia seems to think necessary ; and then [I]82-elizabeth must endeavour to be satisfied with ignorance . "[82-elizabeth]

" Not that [I]82-elizabeth _ shall _ , though , "[82-elizabeth] [she]82-elizabeth added to [herself]82-elizabeth , and [she]82-elizabeth finished the letter ; " and , [[my]82-elizabeth dear aunt]3934-my dear aunt , if [you]3934-my dear aunt do not tell [me]82-elizabeth in an honourable manner , [I]82-elizabeth shall certainly be reduced to tricks and stratagems to find it out . "[82-elizabeth]

[Jane]83-jane 's delicate sense of honour would not allow [her]83-jane to speak to [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth privately of what [Lydia]84-lydia had let fall ; [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth was glad of it:--till it appeared whether [her]82-elizabeth inquiries would receive any satisfaction , [she]82-elizabeth had rather be without [a confidante]2570-a confidante .

CHAPTER LII .

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth had the satisfaction of receiving an answer to [her]82-elizabeth letter as soon as [she]82-elizabeth possibly could . [She]82-elizabeth was no sooner in possession of it , than hurrying into [the little copse]2571-the little copse , where [she]82-elizabeth was least likely to be interrupted , [she]82-elizabeth sat down on one of the benches , and prepared to be happy ; for the length of the letter convinced [her]82-elizabeth that it did not contain a denial .

/ * RIGHT " [Gracechurch Street]28-gracechurch street , _ Sept. 6 _ . * /[89-mr. darcy]

" [[My]89-mr. darcy dear Niece]4893-my dear niece ,[89-mr. darcy]

" [I]89-mr. darcy have just received [your]4893-my dear niece letter , and shall devote this whole morning to answering it , as [I]89-mr. darcy foresee that a _ little _ writing will not comprise what [I]89-mr. darcy have to tell [you]4893-my dear niece . [I]89-mr. darcy must confess [myself]89-mr. darcy surprised by [your]4893-my dear niece application ; [I]89-mr. darcy did not expect it from _ [you]4893-my dear niece _ . Do n't think [me]89-mr. darcy angry , however , for [I]89-mr. darcy only mean to let [you]4893-my dear niece know , that [I]89-mr. darcy had not imagined such inquiries to be necessary on _ [your]4893-my dear niece _ side . If [you]4893-my dear niece do not choose to understand [me]89-mr. darcy , forgive [my]89-mr. darcy impertinence . [[Your]4893-my dear niece uncle]3374-your uncle is as much surprised as [I]89-mr. darcy am ; and nothing but the belief of [your]4893-my dear niece being [a party concerned]4895-a party concerned would have allowed [him]3374-your uncle to act as [he]3374-your uncle has done . But if [you]4893-my dear niece are really innocent and ignorant , [I]89-mr. darcy must be more explicit . On the very day of [my]89-mr. darcy coming [home]3219-home from [Longbourn]7-longbourn , [[your]4893-my dear niece uncle]3374-your uncle had [a most unexpected visitor]4898-a most unexpected visitor . [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy called , and was shut up with [him]89-mr. darcy several hours . It was all over before [I]89-mr. darcy arrived ; so [my]89-mr. darcy curiosity was not so dreadfully racked as _ yours _ seems to have been . [He]89-mr. darcy came to tell [Mr. Gardiner]153-mr. gardiner that [he]89-mr. darcy had found out where [[your]4893-my dear niece sister]3139-your sister and [Mr. Wickham]136-wickham were , and that [he]89-mr. darcy had seen and talked with [them]4900-them both -- [Wickham]136-wickham repeatedly , [Lydia]84-lydia once . From what [I]89-mr. darcy can collect , [he]89-mr. darcy left [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire only one day after [ourselves]4901-ourselves , and came to [town]264-town with the resolution of hunting for [them]4900-them . The motive professed was [his]89-mr. darcy conviction of its being owing to [himself]89-mr. darcy that [Wickham]136-wickham 's worthlessness had not been so well known as to make it impossible for [any young woman of character]4903-any young woman of character to love or confide in [him]89-mr. darcy . [He]89-mr. darcy generously imputed the whole to [his]89-mr. darcy mistaken pride , and confessed that [he]89-mr. darcy had before thought it beneath [him]89-mr. darcy to lay [his]89-mr. darcy private actions open to [the world]303-the world . [His]89-mr. darcy character was to speak for itself . [He]89-mr. darcy called it , therefore , [his]89-mr. darcy duty to step forward , and endeavour to remedy an evil which had been brought on by [himself]89-mr. darcy . If [he]89-mr. darcy _ had another _ motive , [I]89-mr. darcy am sure it would never disgrace [him]89-mr. darcy . [He]89-mr. darcy had been some days in [town]264-town before [he]89-mr. darcy was able to discover them ; but [he]89-mr. darcy had something to direct [his]89-mr. darcy search , which was more than _ [we]4906-we _ had ; and the consciousness of this was another reason for [his]89-mr. darcy resolving to follow [us]4906-we . There is [a lady]3153-a lady , it seems , [a Mrs. Younge , who was some time ago governess to [Miss Darcy]124-miss darcy , and was dismissed from [her]3153-a lady charge on some cause of disapprobation]124-miss darcy , though [he]89-mr. darcy did not say what . [She]3153-a lady then took [a large house in [Edward Street]66-edward street]4908-a large house in edward street , and has since maintained [herself]3153-a lady by letting lodgings . [This Mrs. Younge]124-miss darcy was , [he]89-mr. darcy knew , intimately acquainted with [Wickham]136-wickham ; and [he]89-mr. darcy went to [her]124-miss darcy for intelligence of [him]89-mr. darcy , as soon as [he]89-mr. darcy got to [town]264-town . But it was two or three days before [he]89-mr. darcy could get from [her]124-miss darcy what [he]89-mr. darcy wanted . [She]124-miss darcy would not betray [her]124-miss darcy trust , [I]89-mr. darcy suppose , without bribery and corruption , for [she]124-miss darcy really did know where [[her]124-miss darcy friend]402-her friend was to be found . [Wickham]136-wickham , indeed , had gone to [her]124-miss darcy on [their]4911-their first arrival in [London]5-london ; and had [she]124-miss darcy been able to receive [them]4911-their into [[her]124-miss darcy house]4912-her house , [they]4911-their would have taken up [[their]4911-their abode]4913-their abode with [her]124-miss darcy . At length , however , [[our]4914-our kind friend]4915-our kind friend procured the wished - for direction . [They]4911-their were in ---- [Street]67-street . [He]4915-our kind friend saw [Wickham]136-wickham , and afterwards insisted on seeing [Lydia]84-lydia . [His]4915-our kind friend first object with [her]84-lydia , [he]4915-our kind friend acknowledged , had been to persuade [her]84-lydia to quit [her]84-lydia present disgraceful situation , and return to [[her]84-lydia friends]310-her friends as soon as [they]310-her friends could be prevailed on to receive [her]84-lydia , offering [his]4915-our kind friend assistance as far as it would go . But [he]4915-our kind friend found [Lydia]84-lydia absolutely resolved on remaining where [she]84-lydia was . [She]84-lydia cared for [none of [[her]84-lydia friends]310-her friends]4917-none of her friends ; [she]84-lydia wanted no help of [his]4915-our kind friend ; [she]84-lydia would not hear of leaving [Wickham]136-wickham . [She]84-lydia was sure [they]4919-they should be married some time or other , and it did not much signify when . Since such were [her]84-lydia feelings , it only remained , [he]4915-our kind friend thought , to secure and expedite a marriage , which , in [his]4915-our kind friend very first conversation with [Wickham]136-wickham , [he]4915-our kind friend easily learnt had never been _ [his]4915-our kind friend _ design . [He]4915-our kind friend confessed [himself]4915-our kind friend obliged to leave [the regiment]650-the regiment on account of some debts of honour which were very pressing ; and scrupled not to lay all the ill consequences of [Lydia]84-lydia 's flight on [her]84-lydia own folly alone . [He]4915-our kind friend meant to resign [his]4915-our kind friend commission immediately ; and as to [his]4915-our kind friend future situation , [he]4915-our kind friend could conjecture very little about it . [He]4915-our kind friend must go somewhere , but [he]4915-our kind friend did not know where , and [he]4915-our kind friend knew [he]4915-our kind friend should have nothing to live on . [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy asked why [he]4915-our kind friend did not marry [[your]4921-your sister]3139-your sister at once . Though [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet was not imagined to be very rich , [he]4915-our kind friend would have been able to do something for [him]4915-our kind friend , and [his]4915-our kind friend situation must have been benefited by marriage . But [he]4915-our kind friend found , in reply to this question , that [Wickham]136-wickham still cherished the hope of more effectually making [his]136-wickham fortune by marriage , in [some other country]4923-some other country . Under such circumstances , however , [he]136-wickham was not likely to be proof against the temptation of immediate relief . [They]4924-they met several times , for there was much to be discussed . [Wickham]136-wickham , of course , wanted more than [he]136-wickham could get ; but at length was reduced to be reasonable . Everything being settled between _ [them]4924-they _ , [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy 's next step was to make [[your]4921-your uncle]3374-your uncle acquainted with it , and [he]3374-your uncle first called in [Gracechurch Street]28-gracechurch street the evening before [I]89-mr. darcy came [home]3219-home . But [Mr. Gardiner]153-mr. gardiner could not be seen ; and [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy found , on further inquiry , that [[your]4921-your father]3223-your father was still with [him]3374-your uncle , but would quit [town]264-town the next morning . [He]89-mr. darcy did not judge [[your]4921-your father]3223-your father to be [a person whom [he]89-mr. darcy could so properly consult as [[your]4921-your uncle]3374-your uncle , and therefore readily postponed seeing [him]3223-your father till after the departure of [the former]327-the former]4930-a person whom he could so properly consult as your uncle , and therefore readily postponed seeing him till after the departure of the former . [He]3223-your father did not leave [his]3223-your father name , and till the next day it was only known that [a gentleman had called on business]4933-a gentleman had called on business . On Saturday [he]3223-your father came again . [[Your]4921-your father]3223-your father was gone , [[your]4921-your uncle]3374-your uncle at [home]3219-home , and , as [I]89-mr. darcy said before , [they]4937-they had a great deal of talk together . [They]4937-they met again on Sunday , and then _ [I]89-mr. darcy _ saw [him]3223-your father too . It was not all settled before Monday : as soon as it was , [the express]4938-the express was sent off to [Longbourn]7-longbourn . But [[our]4937-they visitor]4939-our visitor was very obstinate . [I]89-mr. darcy fancy , [Lizzy]82-elizabeth , that obstinacy is the real defect of [his]3223-your father character , after all . [He]3223-your father has been accused of many faults at different times ; but _ this _ is the true one . Nothing was to be done that [he]3223-your father did not do [himself]3223-your father ; though [I]89-mr. darcy am sure ( and [I]89-mr. darcy do not speak it to be thanked , therefore say nothing about it ) [[your]4921-your uncle]3374-your uncle would most readily have settled the whole . [They]4937-they battled it together for a long time , which was more than either [the gentleman]285-the gentleman or [lady]428-lady concerned in it deserved . But at last [[your]4921-your uncle]3374-your uncle was forced to yield , and instead of being allowed to be of use to [[his]3223-your father niece]4944-his niece , was forced to put up with only having the probable credit of it , which went sorely against the grain ; and [I]89-mr. darcy really believe [your]4921-your letter this morning gave [him]3223-your father great pleasure , because it required an explanation that would rob [him]3223-your father of [his]3223-your father borrowed feathers , and give the praise where it was due . But , [Lizzy]82-elizabeth , this must go no further than [yourself]4921-your , or [Jane]83-jane at most . [You]4921-your know pretty well , [I]89-mr. darcy suppose , what has been done for [the young people]803-the young people . [His]3223-your father debts are to be paid , amounting , [I]89-mr. darcy believe , to considerably more than a thousand pounds , another thousand in addition to [her]4944-his niece own settled upon _ [her]4944-his niece _ , and [his]3223-your father commission purchased . The reason why all this was to be done by [him]3223-your father alone , was such as [I]89-mr. darcy have given above . It was owing to [him]3223-your father , to [his]3223-your father reserve and want of proper consideration , that [Wickham]136-wickham 's character had been so misunderstood , and consequently that [he]3223-your father had been received and noticed as [he]3223-your father was . Perhaps there was some truth in _ this _ ; though [I]89-mr. darcy doubt whether _ [his]3223-your father _ reserve , or _ [anybody]3099-anybody 's _ reserve can be answerable for the event . But in spite of all this fine talking , [[my]89-mr. darcy dear]2993-my dear [Lizzy]82-elizabeth , [you]82-elizabeth may rest perfectly assured that [[your]82-elizabeth uncle]3374-your uncle would never have yielded , if [we]4949-us had not given [him]3374-your uncle credit for _ another interest _ in the affair . When all this was resolved on , [he]3374-your uncle returned again to [[his]3374-your uncle friends , who were still staying at [Pemberley]12-pemberley]4950-his friends , who were still staying at pemberley ; but it was agreed that [he]3374-your uncle should be in [London]5-london once more when the wedding took place , and all money matters were then to receive the last finish . [I]89-mr. darcy believe [I]89-mr. darcy have now told [you]82-elizabeth everything . It is a relation which [you]82-elizabeth tell [me]89-mr. darcy is to give [you]82-elizabeth great surprise ; [I]89-mr. darcy hope at least it will not afford [you]82-elizabeth any displeasure . [Lydia]84-lydia came to [us]4949-us , and [Wickham]136-wickham had constant admission to [the house]3001-the house . _ [He]136-wickham _ was exactly what [he]136-wickham had been when [I]89-mr. darcy knew [him]136-wickham in [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire ; but [I]89-mr. darcy would not tell [you]82-elizabeth how little [I]89-mr. darcy was satisfied with _ [her]84-lydia _ behaviour while [she]84-lydia stayed with [us]4949-us , if [I]89-mr. darcy had not perceived , by [Jane]83-jane 's letter last Wednesday , that [her]84-lydia conduct on coming [home]3219-home was exactly of a piece with it , and therefore what [I]89-mr. darcy now tell [you]82-elizabeth can give [you]82-elizabeth no fresh pain . [I]89-mr. darcy talked to [her]84-lydia repeatedly in the most serious manner , representing to [her]84-lydia the wickedness of what [she]84-lydia had done , and all the unhappiness [she]84-lydia had brought on [[her]84-lydia family]885-her family . If [she]84-lydia heard [me]89-mr. darcy , it was by good luck , for [I]89-mr. darcy am sure [she]84-lydia did not listen . [I]89-mr. darcy was sometimes quite provoked ; but then [I]89-mr. darcy recollected [[my]89-mr. darcy dear]2993-my dear [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth and [Jane]83-jane , and for [their]4955-their sakes had patience with [her]84-lydia . [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy was punctual in [his]89-mr. darcy return , and , as [Lydia]84-lydia imformed [you]4956-you , attended the wedding . [He]89-mr. darcy dined with [us]4957-us the next day , and was to leave [town]264-town again on Wednesday or Thursday . Will [you]4956-you be very angry with [me]89-mr. darcy , [[my]89-mr. darcy dear]2993-my dear [Lizzy]82-elizabeth , if [I]89-mr. darcy take this opportunity of saying ( what [I]89-mr. darcy was never bold enough to say before ) how much [I]89-mr. darcy like [him]89-mr. darcy ? [His]89-mr. darcy behaviour to [us]4957-us has , in every respect , been as pleasing as when [we]4957-us were in [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire . [His]89-mr. darcy understanding and opinions all please [me]89-mr. darcy ; [he]89-mr. darcy wants nothing but a little more liveliness , and _ that _ , if [he]89-mr. darcy marry _ prudently _ , [[his]89-mr. darcy wife]231-his wife may teach [him]89-mr. darcy . [I]89-mr. darcy thought [him]89-mr. darcy very sly ; [he]89-mr. darcy hardly ever mentioned [your]82-elizabeth name . But slyness seems the fashion . Pray forgive [me]89-mr. darcy , if [I]89-mr. darcy have been very presuming , or at least do not punish [me]89-mr. darcy so far as to exclude [me]89-mr. darcy from P. [I]89-mr. darcy shall never be quite happy till [I]89-mr. darcy have been all round [the park]1315-the park . [A low phaeton with a nice little pair of ponies]4962-a low phaeton with a nice little pair of ponies would be the very thing . But [I]89-mr. darcy must write no more . [The children]1848-the children have been wanting [me]89-mr. darcy this half hour .[89-mr. darcy]

" [Yours]82-elizabeth , very sincerely ,[89-mr. darcy]

" [M. GARDINER]210-m. gardiner . "[89-mr. darcy]

The contents of this letter threw [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth into a flutter of spirits , in which it was difficult to determine whether pleasure or pain bore the greatest share . The vague and unsettled suspicions which uncertainty had produced , of what [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy might have been doing to forward [[her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister 's match -- which [she]82-elizabeth had feared to encourage , as an exertion of goodness too great to be probable , and at the same time dreaded to be just , from the pain of obligation -- were proved beyond their greatest extent to be true ! [He]2573-he had followed [them]2574-them purposely to [town]264-town , [he]2573-he had taken on [himself]2573-he all the trouble and mortification attendant on such a research ; in which supplication had been necessary to [a woman whom [he]2573-he must abominate and despise]2576-a woman whom he must abominate and despise , and where [he]2573-he was reduced to meet , frequently meet , reason with , persuade , and finally bribe [the man whom [he]2573-he always most wished to avoid , and whose very name it was punishment to [him]2573-he to pronounce]2577-the man whom he always most wished to avoid , and whose very name it was punishment to him to pronounce . [He]2573-he had done all this for [a girl whom [he]2573-he could neither regard nor esteem]2578-a girl whom he could neither regard nor esteem . [Her]82-elizabeth heart did whisper that [he]2573-he had done it for [her]82-elizabeth . But it was a hope shortly checked by other considerations ; and [she]82-elizabeth soon felt that even [her]82-elizabeth vanity was insufficient , when required to depend on [his]2573-he affection for [her]82-elizabeth , for [a woman who had already refused [him]2573-he , as able to overcome a sentiment so natural as abhorrence against relationship with [Wickham]136-wickham]2579-a woman who had already refused him , as able to overcome a sentiment so natural as abhorrence against relationship with wickham . [Brother - in - law of [Wickham]136-wickham]2580-brother - in - law of wickham ! Every kind of pride must revolt from the connection . [He]2573-he had , to be sure , done much . [She]82-elizabeth was ashamed to think how much . But [he]2573-he had given a reason for [his]2573-he interference , which asked no extraordinary stretch of belief . It was reasonable that [he]2573-he should feel [he]2573-he had been wrong ; [he]2573-he had liberality , and [he]2573-he had the means of exercising it ; and though [she]82-elizabeth would not place [herself]82-elizabeth as [his]2573-he principal inducement , [she]82-elizabeth could perhaps believe , that remaining partiality for [her]82-elizabeth might assist [his]2573-he endeavours in a cause where [her]82-elizabeth peace of mind must be materially concerned . It was painful , exceedingly painful , to know that [they]2581-they were under obligations to [a person who could never receive a return]2582-a person who could never receive a return . [They]2581-they owed the restoration of [Lydia]84-lydia , [her]84-lydia character , everything to [him]2573-he . Oh , how heartily did [she]82-elizabeth grieve over every ungracious sensation [she]82-elizabeth had ever encouraged , every saucy speech [she]82-elizabeth had ever directed towards [him]2573-he ! For [herself]82-elizabeth [she]82-elizabeth was humbled ; but [she]82-elizabeth was proud of him,--proud that in a cause of compassion and honour [he]2573-he had been able to get the better of [himself]2573-he . [She]82-elizabeth read over [[her]82-elizabeth aunt]1198-her aunt 's commendation of [him]2573-he again and again . It was hardly enough ; but it pleased [her]82-elizabeth . [She]82-elizabeth was even sensible of some pleasure , though mixed with regret , on finding how steadfastly both [she]82-elizabeth and [[her]82-elizabeth uncle]573-her uncle had been persuaded that affection and confidence subsisted between [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy and [herself]82-elizabeth .

[She]82-elizabeth was roused from [her]82-elizabeth seat and [her]82-elizabeth reflections , by [someone]2585-someone 's approach ; and , before [she]82-elizabeth could strike into another path , [she]82-elizabeth was overtaken by [Wickham]136-wickham .

" [I]136-wickham am afraid [I]136-wickham interrupt [your]82-elizabeth solitary ramble , [[my]136-wickham dear sister]3825-my dear sister ? "[136-wickham] said [he]136-wickham , as [he]136-wickham joined [her]82-elizabeth .

" [You]136-wickham certainly do , "[82-elizabeth] [she]82-elizabeth replied with a smile ; " but it does not follow that the interruption must be unwelcome . "[82-elizabeth]

" [I]136-wickham should be sorry , indeed , if it were . _ [We]4965-we _ were always [good friends]4966-good friends , and now [we]4965-we are better . "[136-wickham]

" True . Are [the others]507-the others coming out ? "[82-elizabeth]

" [I]136-wickham do not know . [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet and [Lydia]84-lydia are going in [the carriage]3217-the carriage to [Meryton]9-meryton . And so , [[my]136-wickham dear sister]3825-my dear sister , [I]136-wickham find , from [[our]4965-we uncle]4970-our uncle and [aunt]3971-aunt , that [you]3825-my dear sister have actually seen [Pemberley]12-pemberley . "[136-wickham]

[She]82-elizabeth replied in the affirmative .

" [I]136-wickham almost envy [you]3825-my dear sister the pleasure , and yet [I]136-wickham believe it would be too much for [me]136-wickham , or else [I]136-wickham could take it in [my]136-wickham way to [Newcastle]63-newcastle . And [you]3825-my dear sister saw [the old housekeeper]4972-the old housekeeper , [I]136-wickham suppose ? [Poor Reynolds]211-poor reynolds , [she]4972-the old housekeeper was always very fond of [me]136-wickham . But of course [she]4972-the old housekeeper did not mention [my]136-wickham name to [you]3825-my dear sister . "[136-wickham]

" Yes , [she]4972-the old housekeeper did . "[136-wickham]

" And what did [she]4972-the old housekeeper say ? "[136-wickham]

" That [you]3825-my dear sister were gone into [the army]4484-the army , and [she]4972-the old housekeeper was afraid had -- not turned out well . At such a distance as _ that _ , [you]3825-my dear sister know , things are strangely misrepresented . "[136-wickham]

" Certainly , "[2586-he] [he]2586-he replied , biting [his]2586-he lips . [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth hoped [she]82-elizabeth had silenced [him]2586-he ; but [he]2586-he soon afterwards said,--

" [I]136-wickham was surprised to see [Darcy]89-mr. darcy in [town]264-town last month . [We]4975-we passed each other several times . [I]136-wickham wonder what [he]2586-he can be doing [there]305-there . "[136-wickham]

" Perhaps preparing for [his]2586-he marriage with [Miss de Bourgh]132-miss de bourgh , "[82-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth . " It must be something particular to take [him]2586-he [there]305-there at this time of year . "[82-elizabeth]

" Undoubtedly . Did [you]3825-my dear sister see [him]2586-he while [you]3825-my dear sister were at [Lambton]44-lambton ? [I]136-wickham thought [I]136-wickham understood from [the Gardiners]154-the gardiners that [you]3825-my dear sister had . "[136-wickham]

" Yes ; [he]2586-he introduced [us]4975-we to [[his]2586-he sister]559-his sister . "[82-elizabeth]

" And do [you]3825-my dear sister like [her]559-his sister ? "[136-wickham]

" Very much . "[82-elizabeth]

" [I]136-wickham have heard , indeed , that [she]559-his sister is uncommonly improved within this year or two . When [I]136-wickham last saw [her]559-his sister , [she]559-his sister was not very promising . [I]136-wickham am very glad [you]3825-my dear sister liked [her]559-his sister . [I]136-wickham hope [she]559-his sister will turn out well . "[136-wickham]

" [I]82-elizabeth dare say [she]559-his sister will ; [she]559-his sister has got over the most trying age . "[82-elizabeth]

" Did [you]3825-my dear sister go by [the village of Kympton]4979-the village of kympton ? "[136-wickham]

" [I]82-elizabeth do not recollect that [we]4980-we did . "[82-elizabeth]

" [I]136-wickham mention it because it is the living which [I]136-wickham ought to have had . [A most delightful place]4981-a most delightful place ! [Excellent parsonage - house]4982-excellent parsonage - house ! [It]4982-excellent parsonage - house would have suited [me]136-wickham in every respect . "[136-wickham]

" How should [you]3825-my dear sister have liked making sermons ? "[82-elizabeth]

" Exceedingly well . [I]136-wickham should have considered it as part of [my]136-wickham duty , and the exertion would soon have been nothing . [One]3041-one ought not to repine ; but , to be sure , it would have been such a thing for [me]136-wickham ! The quiet , the retirement of such a life , would have answered all [my]136-wickham ideas of happiness ! But it was not to be . Did [you]3825-my dear sister ever hear [Darcy]89-mr. darcy mention the circumstance when [you]3825-my dear sister were in [Kent]17-kent ? "[136-wickham]

" [I]82-elizabeth _ have _ heard from authority , which [I]82-elizabeth thought _ as good _ , that it was left [you]3825-my dear sister conditionally only , and at the will of [the present patron]4984-the present patron . "[82-elizabeth]

" [You]3825-my dear sister have ! Yes , there was something in _ that _ ; [I]136-wickham told [you]3825-my dear sister so from the first , [you]3825-my dear sister may remember . "[136-wickham]

" [I]82-elizabeth _ did _ hear , too , that there was a time when sermon - making was not so palatable to [you]3825-my dear sister as it seems to be at present ; that [you]3825-my dear sister actually declared [your]3825-my dear sister resolution of never taking orders , and that the business had been compromised accordingly . "[82-elizabeth]

" [You]3825-my dear sister did ! and it was not wholly without foundation . [You]3825-my dear sister may remember what [I]136-wickham told [you]3825-my dear sister on that point , when first [we]2587-we talked of it . "[136-wickham]

[They]2587-we were now almost at the door of [the house]3001-the house , for [she]2589-she had walked fast to get rid of [him]2590-him ; and unwilling , for [[her]2589-she sister]328-her sister 's sake , to provoke [him]2590-him , [she]2589-she only said in reply , with a good - humoured smile,--

" Come , [Mr. Wickham]136-wickham , [we]2587-we are [brother]4668-brother and [sister]3891-sister , [you]136-wickham know . Do not let [us]2587-we quarrel about the past . In future , [I]2589-she hope [we]2587-we shall be always of one mind . "[2589-she]

[She]2589-she held out [her]2589-she hand : [he]2590-him kissed it with affectionate gallantry , though [he]2590-him hardly knew how to look , and [they]2587-we entered [the house]3001-the house .

CHAPTER LIII .

[Mr. Wickham]136-wickham was so perfectly satisfied with this conversation , that [he]136-wickham never again distressed [himself]136-wickham , or provoked [[his]136-wickham dear sister]2593-his dear sister [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , by introducing the subject of it ; and [she]82-elizabeth was pleased to find that [she]82-elizabeth had said enough to keep [him]2590-him quiet .

The day of [his]136-wickham and [Lydia]84-lydia 's departure soon came ; and [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet was forced to submit to a separation , which , as [[her]85-mrs. bennet husband]255-her husband by no means entered into [her]85-mrs. bennet scheme of [their]2587-we all going to [Newcastle]63-newcastle , was likely to continue at least a twelvemonth .

" Oh , [[my]85-mrs. bennet dear]2993-my dear [Lydia]84-lydia , "[85-mrs. bennet] [she]85-mrs. bennet cried , " when shall [we]2587-we meet again ? "[85-mrs. bennet]

" Oh , [Lord]4988-lord ! [I]136-wickham do n't know . Not these two or three years , perhaps . "[136-wickham]

" Write to [me]85-mrs. bennet very often , [[my]85-mrs. bennet dear]2993-my dear . "[85-mrs. bennet]

" As often as [I]136-wickham can . But [you]2993-my dear know [married women]4990-married women have never much time for writing . [[My]136-wickham sisters]4854-my sisters may write to _ [me]136-wickham _ . [They]4854-my sisters will have nothing else to do . "[136-wickham]

[Mr. Wickham]136-wickham 's adieus were much more affectionate than [[his]136-wickham wife]231-his wife 's . [He]136-wickham smiled , looked handsome , and said many pretty things .

" [He]136-wickham is as fine [a fellow]4992-a fellow , "[75-mr. bennet] said [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet , as soon as [they]2596-they were out of [the house]3001-the house , " as ever [I]75-mr. bennet saw . [He]136-wickham simpers , and smirks , and makes love to [[us]2596-they all]4707-us all . [I]75-mr. bennet am prodigiously proud of [him]136-wickham . [I]75-mr. bennet defy even [Sir William Lucas]80-sir william [himself]80-sir william to produce [a more valuable son - in - law]4994-a more valuable son - in - law . "[75-mr. bennet]

The loss of [[her]231-his wife daughter]463-her daughter made [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet very dull for several days .

" [I]85-mrs. bennet often think , "[85-mrs. bennet] said [she]85-mrs. bennet , " that there is nothing so bad as parting with [[one]3041-one 's friends]4996-one 's friends . [One]3041-one seems so forlorn without [them]4996-one 's friends . "[85-mrs. bennet]

" This is the consequence , [you]85-mrs. bennet see , [madam]3281-madam , of marrying [a daughter]1117-a daughter , "[82-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth . " It must make [you]85-mrs. bennet better satisfied that [[your]85-mrs. bennet other four]5000-your other four are single . "[82-elizabeth]

" It is no such thing . [Lydia]84-lydia does not leave [me]85-mrs. bennet because [she]84-lydia is married ; but only because [[her]84-lydia husband]255-her husband 's regiment happens to be so far off . If that had been nearer , [she]84-lydia would not have gone so soon . "[85-mrs. bennet]

But the spiritless condition which this event threw [her]85-mrs. bennet into was shortly relieved , and [her]85-mrs. bennet mind opened again to the agitation of hope , by an article of news which then began to be in circulation . [The housekeeper at [Netherfield]2-netherfield]2599-the housekeeper at netherfield had received orders to prepare for the arrival of [[her]2599-the housekeeper at netherfield master]1906-her master , who was coming down in a day or two , to shoot there for several weeks . [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet was quite in the fidgets . [She]85-mrs. bennet looked at [Jane]83-jane , and smiled , and shook [her]85-mrs. bennet head , by turns .

" Well , well , and so [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley is coming down , [sister]3891-sister , "[85-mrs. bennet] ( for [Mrs. Philips]111-mrs. philips first brought [her]85-mrs. bennet the news ) . " Well , so much the better . Not that [I]85-mrs. bennet care about it , though . [He]79-mr. bingley is nothing to [us]5003-us , [you]3891-sister know , and [I]85-mrs. bennet am sure [I]85-mrs. bennet never want to see [him]79-mr. bingley again . But , however , [he]79-mr. bingley is very welcome to come to [Netherfield]2-netherfield , if [he]79-mr. bingley likes it . And who knows what _ may _ happen ? But that is nothing to [us]5003-us . [You]3891-sister know , [sister]3891-sister , [we]5003-us agreed long ago never to mention a word about it . And so , it is quite certain [he]79-mr. bingley is coming ? "[85-mrs. bennet]

" [You]3891-sister may depend on it , "[590-the other] replied [the other]590-the other , " for [Mrs. Nichols]212-mrs. nichols was in [Meryton]9-meryton last night : [I]590-the other saw [her]212-mrs. nichols passing by , and went out [myself]590-the other on purpose to know the truth of it ; and [she]212-mrs. nichols told [me]590-the other that it was certainly true . [He]79-mr. bingley comes down on Thursday , at the latest , very likely on Wednesday . [She]212-mrs. nichols was going to [the butcher 's]5005-the butcher 's , [she]212-mrs. nichols told [me]590-the other , on purpose to order in some meat on Wednesday , and [she]212-mrs. nichols has got three couple of ducks just fit to be killed . "[590-the other]

[Miss Bennet]84-lydia had not been able to hear of [his]590-the other coming without changing colour . It was many months since [she]84-lydia had mentioned [his]590-the other name to [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth ; but now , as soon as [they]2602-they were alone together , [she]84-lydia said,--

" [I]84-lydia saw [you]82-elizabeth look at [me]84-lydia to - day , [Lizzy]82-elizabeth , when [[my]84-lydia aunt]3204-my aunt told [us]2602-they of the present report ; and [I]84-lydia know [I]84-lydia appeared distressed ; but do n't imagine it was from any silly cause . [I]84-lydia was only confused for the moment , because [I]84-lydia felt that [I]84-lydia _ should _ be looked at . [I]84-lydia do assure [you]82-elizabeth that the news does not affect [me]84-lydia either with pleasure or pain . [I]84-lydia am glad of one thing , that [he]2603-him comes alone ; because [we]2602-they shall see the less of [him]2603-him . Not that [I]84-lydia am afraid of _ [myself]84-lydia _ , but [I]84-lydia dread [other people]3885-other people 's remarks . "[84-lydia]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth did not know what to make of it . Had [she]82-elizabeth not seen [him]2603-him in [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire , [she]82-elizabeth might have supposed [him]2603-him capable of coming [there]305-there with no other view than what was acknowledged ; but [she]82-elizabeth still thought [him]2603-him partial to [Jane]83-jane , and [she]82-elizabeth wavered as to the greater probability of [his]2603-him coming [there]305-there _ with _ [[his]2603-him friend]286-his friend 's permission , or being bold enough to come without it .

" Yet it is hard , "[82-elizabeth] [she]82-elizabeth sometimes thought , " that [this poor man]5008-this poor man can not come to [a house]1049-a house , which [he]5008-this poor man has legally hired , without raising all this speculation ! [I]82-elizabeth _ will _ leave [him]5008-this poor man to [himself]5008-this poor man . "[82-elizabeth]

In spite of what [[her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister declared , and really believed to be [her]82-elizabeth feelings , in the expectation of [his]2603-him arrival , [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth could easily perceive that [her]82-elizabeth spirits were affected by it . [They]2608-they were more disturbed , more unequal , than [she]82-elizabeth had often seen [them]2608-they .

The subject which had been so warmly canvassed between [[their]2609-their parents]2610-their parents , about a twelvemonth ago , was now brought forward again .

" As soon as ever [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley comes , [[my]85-mrs. bennet dear]2993-my dear , "[85-mrs. bennet] said [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet , " [you]82-elizabeth will wait on [him]2603-him , of course . "[85-mrs. bennet]

" No , no . [You]82-elizabeth forced [me]2611-him into visiting [him]2611-him last year , and promised , if [I]2611-him went to see [him]2611-him , [he]2611-him should marry [one of [[my]2611-him daughters]3058-my daughters]3057-one of my daughters . But it ended in nothing , and [I]2611-him will not be sent on [a fool]4785-a fool 's errand again . "[2611-him]

[[His]2611-him wife]231-his wife represented to [him]2611-him how absolutely necessary such an attention would be from all [the neighbouring gentlemen]2613-the neighbouring gentlemen , on [his]2611-him returning to [Netherfield]2-netherfield .

" ' Tis an _ etiquette _ [I]2611-him despise , "[2611-him] said [he]2611-him . " If [he]2611-him wants [our]5014-we society , let [him]2611-him seek it . [He]2611-him knows where [we]5014-we live . [I]2611-him will not spend _ [my]2611-him _ hours in running after [[my]2611-him neighbours]5015-my neighbours every time [they]5015-my neighbours go away and come back again . "[2611-him]

" Well , all [I]2614-i know is , that it will be abominably rude if [you]5016-you do not wait on [him]2611-him . But , however , that sha n't prevent [my]2614-i asking [him]2611-him to dine here , [I]2614-i am determined . [We]5014-we must have [Mrs. Long]76-mrs. long and [the Gouldings]204-the gouldings soon . That will make thirteen with [ourselves]5014-we , so there will be just room at table for [him]2611-him . "[2614-i]

Consoled by this resolution , [she]2614-i was the better able to bear [[her]2614-i husband]255-her husband 's incivility ; though it was very mortifying to know that [[her]2614-i neighbours]821-her neighbours might all see [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley , in consequence of it , before _ [they]821-her neighbours _ did . As the day of [his]79-mr. bingley arrival drew near,--

" [I]83-jane begin to be sorry that [he]79-mr. bingley comes at all , "[83-jane] said [Jane]83-jane to [[her]83-jane sister]328-her sister . " It would be nothing ; [I]83-jane could see [him]79-mr. bingley with perfect indifference ; but [I]83-jane can hardly bear to hear it thus perpetually talked of . [[My]83-jane mother]3227-my mother means well ; but [she]3227-my mother does not know , [no one]3271-no one can know , how much [I]83-jane suffer from what [she]3227-my mother says . Happy shall [I]83-jane be when [his]79-mr. bingley stay at [Netherfield]2-netherfield is over ! "[83-jane]

" [I]82-elizabeth wish [I]82-elizabeth could say anything to comfort [you]79-mr. bingley , "[82-elizabeth] replied [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth ; " but it is wholly out of [my]82-elizabeth power . [You]79-mr. bingley must feel it ; and the usual satisfaction of preaching patience to [a sufferer]5019-a sufferer is denied [me]82-elizabeth , because [you]79-mr. bingley have always so much . "[82-elizabeth]

[Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley arrived . [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet , through the assistance of [servants]3324-servants , contrived to have the earliest tidings of it , that the period of anxiety and fretfulness on [her]85-mrs. bennet side be as long as it could . [She]85-mrs. bennet counted the days that must intervene before [their]2619-their invitation could be sent -- hopeless of seeing [him]79-mr. bingley before . But on the third morning after [his]79-mr. bingley arrival in [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire , [she]85-mrs. bennet saw [him]79-mr. bingley from [her]85-mrs. bennet dressing - room window enter [the paddock]2264-the paddock , and ride towards [the house]3001-the house .

[[Her]85-mrs. bennet daughters]237-her daughters were eagerly called to partake of [her]85-mrs. bennet joy . [Jane]83-jane resolutely kept [her]83-jane place at the table ; but [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , to satisfy [[her]82-elizabeth mother]241-her mother , went to the window -- [she]82-elizabeth looked -- [she]82-elizabeth saw [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy with [him]79-mr. bingley , and sat down again by [[her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister .

" There is [a gentleman]3407-a gentleman with [him]79-mr. bingley , [mamma]3033-mamma , "[86-lady catherine] said [Kitty]86-lady catherine ; " who can it be ? "[86-lady catherine]

" Some acquaintance or other , [[my]82-elizabeth dear]2993-my dear , [I]82-elizabeth suppose ; [I]82-elizabeth am sure [I]82-elizabeth do not know . "[82-elizabeth]

" [La]213-la ! "[86-lady catherine] replied [Kitty]86-lady catherine , " it looks just like [that man that used to be with [him]79-mr. bingley before]5023-that man that used to be with him before . Mr. what 's [his]79-mr. bingley name -- [that tall , proud man]5024-that tall , proud man . "[86-lady catherine]

" Good gracious ! [Mr. Darcy!--and]214-mr. darcy!--and so it does , [I]83-jane vow . Well , [any friend of [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley 's]5025-any friend of mr. bingley 's will always be welcome [here]2994-here , to be sure ; but else [I]83-jane must say that [I]83-jane hate the very sight of [him]2627-him . "[83-jane]

[Jane]83-jane looked at [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth with surprise and concern . [She]83-jane knew but little of [their]2625-their meeting in [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire , and therefore felt for the awkwardness which must attend [[her]83-jane sister]328-her sister , in seeing [him]2627-him almost for the first time after receiving [his]2627-him explanatory letter . [Both sisters]2628-both sisters were uncomfortable enough . [Each]2629-each felt for [the other]590-the other , and of course for [themselves]2628-both sisters ; and [[their]2628-both sisters mother]434-their mother talked on of [her]434-their mother dislike of [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy , and [her]434-their mother resolution to be civil to [him]2627-him only as [[Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley 's friend]2632-mr. bingley 's friend , without being heard by [either of [them]2628-both sisters]2633-either of them . But [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth had sources of uneasiness which could not yet be suspected by [Jane]83-jane , to whom [she]83-jane had never yet had courage to show [Mrs. Gardiner]125-mrs. gardiner 's letter , or to relate [her]83-jane own change of sentiment towards [him]2627-him . To [Jane]83-jane , [he]2627-him could be only [a man whose proposals [she]83-jane had refused , and whose merits [she]83-jane had undervalued]2634-a man whose proposals she had refused , and whose merits she had undervalued ; but to [her]83-jane own more extensive information , [he]2627-him was [the person to whom [the whole family]311-the whole family]2635-the person to whom the whole family were indebted for the first of benefits , and whom [she]83-jane regarded [herself]83-jane with an interest , if not quite so tender , at least as reasonable and just , as what [Jane]83-jane felt for [Bingley]79-mr. bingley . [Her]83-jane astonishment at [his]79-mr. bingley coming -- at [his]79-mr. bingley coming to [Netherfield]2-netherfield , to [Longbourn]7-longbourn , and voluntarily seeking [her]83-jane again , was almost equal to what [she]83-jane had known on first witnessing [his]79-mr. bingley altered behaviour in [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire .

The colour which had been driven from [her]83-jane face returned for half a minute with an additional glow , and a smile of delight added lustre to [her]83-jane eyes , as [she]83-jane thought for that space of time that [his]79-mr. bingley affection and wishes must still be unshaken ; but [she]83-jane would not be secure .

" Let [me]83-jane first see how [he]79-mr. bingley behaves , "[83-jane] said [she]83-jane ; " it will then be early enough for expectation . "[83-jane]

[She]83-jane sat intently at work , striving to be composed , and without daring to lift up [her]83-jane eyes , till anxious curiosity carried them to the face of [[her]83-jane sister]328-her sister as [the servant]462-the servant was approaching the door . [Jane]83-jane looked a little paler than usual , but more sedate than [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth had expected . On [the gentlemen]290-the gentlemen 's appearing , [her]83-jane colour increased ; yet [she]83-jane received [them]290-the gentlemen with tolerable ease , and with a propriety of behaviour equally free from any symptom of resentment , or any unnecessary complaisance .

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth said as little to either as civility would allow , and sat down again to [her]82-elizabeth work , with an eagerness which it did not often command . [She]82-elizabeth had ventured only one glance at [Darcy]89-mr. darcy . [He]89-mr. darcy looked serious as usual ; and , [she]82-elizabeth thought , more as [he]89-mr. darcy had been used to look in [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire , than as [she]82-elizabeth had seen [him]89-mr. darcy at [Pemberley]12-pemberley . But , perhaps , [he]89-mr. darcy could not in [[her]82-elizabeth mother]241-her mother 's presence be what [he]89-mr. darcy was before [[her]82-elizabeth uncle]573-her uncle and [aunt]3971-aunt . It was a painful , but not an improbable , conjecture .

[Bingley]79-mr. bingley [she]82-elizabeth had likewise seen for an instant , and in that short period saw [him]79-mr. bingley looking both pleased and embarrassed . [He]89-mr. darcy was received by [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet with a degree of civility which made [[her]85-mrs. bennet two daughters]2643-her two daughters ashamed , especially when contrasted with the cold and ceremonious politeness of [her]85-mrs. bennet courtesy and address of [[his]89-mr. darcy friend]286-his friend .

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth particularly , who knew that [[her]82-elizabeth mother]241-her mother owed to the latter the preservation of [[her]241-her mother favourite daughter]2646-her favourite daughter from irremediable infamy , was hurt and distressed to a most painful degree by a distinction so ill applied .

[Darcy]89-mr. darcy , after inquiring of [her]82-elizabeth how [Mr.]2647-mr. and [Mrs. Gardiner]125-mrs. gardiner did -- a question which [she]82-elizabeth could not answer without confusion -- said scarcely anything . [He]89-mr. darcy was not seated by [her]82-elizabeth : perhaps that was the reason of [his]89-mr. darcy silence ; but it had not been so in [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire . There [he]89-mr. darcy had talked to [[her]82-elizabeth friends]310-her friends when [he]89-mr. darcy could not to [herself]82-elizabeth . But now several minutes elapsed , without bringing the sound of [his]89-mr. darcy voice ; and when occasionally , unable to resist the impulse of curiosity , [she]82-elizabeth raised [her]82-elizabeth eyes to [his]89-mr. darcy face , [she]82-elizabeth as often found [him]89-mr. darcy looking at [Jane]83-jane as at [herself]82-elizabeth , and frequently on no object but the ground . More thoughtfulness and less anxiety to please , than when [they]2649-they last met , were plainly expressed . [She]82-elizabeth was disappointed , and angry with [herself]82-elizabeth for being so .

" Could [I]82-elizabeth expect it to be otherwise ? "[82-elizabeth] said [she]82-elizabeth . " Yet why did [he]89-mr. darcy come ? "[82-elizabeth]

[She]82-elizabeth was in no humour for conversation with [anyone]3102-anyone but [himself]89-mr. darcy ; and to [him]89-mr. darcy [she]82-elizabeth had hardly courage to speak .

[She]82-elizabeth inquired after [[his]89-mr. darcy sister]559-his sister , but could do no more .

" It is a long time , [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley , since [you]89-mr. darcy went away , "[85-mrs. bennet] said [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet .

[He]89-mr. darcy readily agreed to it .

" [I]89-mr. darcy began to be afraid [you]89-mr. darcy would never come back again . [People]3234-people _ did _ say , [you]89-mr. darcy meant to quit [the place]2998-the place entirely at [Michaelmas]78-michaelmas ; but , however , [I]89-mr. darcy hope it is not true . A great many changes have happened in [the neighbourhood]3015-the neighbourhood since [you]89-mr. darcy went away . [Miss Lucas]92-miss lucas is married and settled : and [one of [[my]89-mr. darcy own daughters]5031-my own daughters]5030-one of my own daughters . [I]89-mr. darcy suppose [you]89-mr. darcy have heard of it ; indeed , [you]89-mr. darcy must have seen it in the papers . It was in the ' Times ' and the ' Courier , ' [I]89-mr. darcy know ; though it was not put in as it ought to be . It was only said , ' Lately , [George Wickham]143-george wickham , Esq . , to [Miss Lydia Bennet]84-lydia , ' without there being a syllable said of [[her]84-lydia father]244-her father , or the place where [she]84-lydia lived , or anything . It was [[my]89-mr. darcy brother]3212-my brother [Gardiner]125-mrs. gardiner 's drawing up , too , and [I]89-mr. darcy wonder how [he]3212-my brother came to make such an awkward business of it . Did [you]241-her mother see it ? "[89-mr. darcy]

[Bingley]79-mr. bingley replied that [he]79-mr. bingley did , and made [his]79-mr. bingley congratulations . [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth dared not lift up [her]82-elizabeth eyes . How [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy looked , therefore , [she]82-elizabeth could not tell .

" It is a delightful thing , to be sure , to have [a daughter]1117-a daughter well married , "[241-her mother] continued [[her]82-elizabeth mother]241-her mother ; " but at the same time , [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley , it is very hard to have [her]1117-a daughter taken away from [me]241-her mother . [They]5035-they are gone down to [Newcastle]63-newcastle , [a place quite northward it seems , and there [they]5035-they are to stay]5036-a place quite northward it seems , and there they are to stay , [I]241-her mother do not know how long . [[His]89-mr. darcy regiment]4839-his regiment is [there]305-there ; for [I]241-her mother suppose [you]5039-you have heard of [his]89-mr. darcy leaving [the ----shire]21-the ----shire , and of [his]89-mr. darcy being gone into [the Regulars]62-the regulars . Thank heaven ! [he]89-mr. darcy has _ [some _ friends]5040-some _ friends , though , perhaps , not so many as [he]89-mr. darcy deserves . "[241-her mother]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , who knew this to be levelled at [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy , was in such misery of shame that [she]82-elizabeth could hardly keep [her]82-elizabeth seat . It drew from [her]82-elizabeth , however , the exertion of speaking , which nothing else had so effectually done before ; and [she]82-elizabeth asked [Bingley]79-mr. bingley whether [he]79-mr. bingley meant to make any stay in [the country]448-the country at present . A few weeks , [he]79-mr. bingley believed .

" When [you]79-mr. bingley have killed all [your]79-mr. bingley own birds , [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley , "[241-her mother] said [[her]82-elizabeth mother]241-her mother , " [I]241-her mother beg [you]79-mr. bingley will come here and shoot as many as [you]79-mr. bingley please on [[Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet 's manor]5041-mr. bennet 's manor . [I]241-her mother am sure [he]75-mr. bennet will be vastly happy to oblige [you]79-mr. bingley , and will save all the best of the coveys for [you]79-mr. bingley . "[241-her mother]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth 's misery increased at such unnecessary , such officious attention ! Were the same fair prospect to arise at present , as had flattered [them]2655-them a year ago , everything , [she]82-elizabeth was persuaded , would be hastening to the same vexatious conclusion . At that instant [she]82-elizabeth felt , that years of happiness could not make [Jane]83-jane or [herself]83-jane amends for moments of such painful confusion .

" The first wish of [my]82-elizabeth heart , "[82-elizabeth] said [she]82-elizabeth to [herself]82-elizabeth , " is never more to be in company with [either of [them]2655-them]2633-either of them . [[Their]2655-them society]1051-their society can afford no pleasure that will atone for such wretchedness as this ! Let [me]82-elizabeth never see [either one or the other]5044-either one or the other again ! "[82-elizabeth]

Yet the misery , for which years of happiness were to offer no compensation , received soon afterwards material relief , from observing how much the beauty of [[her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister rekindled the admiration of [[her]82-elizabeth former lover]2657-her former lover . When first [he]2657-her former lover came in , [he]2657-her former lover had spoken to [her]83-jane but little , but every five minutes seemed to be giving [her]83-jane more of [his]2657-her former lover attention . [He]2657-her former lover found [her]83-jane as handsome as [she]83-jane had been last year ; as good - natured , and as unaffected , though not quite so chatty . [Jane]83-jane was anxious that no difference should be perceived in [her]83-jane at all , and was really persuaded that [she]83-jane talked as much as ever ; but [her]83-jane mind was so busily engaged , that [she]83-jane did not always know when [she]83-jane was silent .

When [the gentlemen]290-the gentlemen rose to go away , [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet was mindful of [her]85-mrs. bennet intended civility , and [they]290-the gentlemen were invited and engaged to dine at [Longbourn]7-longbourn in a few days ' time .

" [You]2657-her former lover are quite a visit in [my]85-mrs. bennet debt , [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley , "[85-mrs. bennet] [she]85-mrs. bennet added ; " for when [you]79-mr. bingley went to [town]264-town last winter , [you]79-mr. bingley promised to take a family dinner with [us]290-the gentlemen as soon as [you]79-mr. bingley returned . [I]85-mrs. bennet have not forgot , [you]79-mr. bingley see ; and [I]85-mrs. bennet assure [you]79-mr. bingley [I]85-mrs. bennet was very much disappointed that [you]79-mr. bingley did not come back and keep [your]79-mr. bingley engagement . "[85-mrs. bennet]

[Bingley]79-mr. bingley looked a little silly at this reflection , and said something of [his]79-mr. bingley concern at having been prevented by business . [They]290-the gentlemen then went away .

[Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet had been strongly inclined to ask [them]290-the gentlemen to stay and dine [there]305-there that day ; but , though [she]85-mrs. bennet always kept a very good table , [she]85-mrs. bennet did not think anything less than two courses could be good enough for [a man on whom [she]85-mrs. bennet had such anxious designs , or satisfy the appetite and pride of one who had ten thousand a year]2660-a man on whom she had such anxious designs , or satisfy the appetite and pride of one who had ten thousand a year .

[CHAPTER LIV]215-chapter liv .

As soon as [they]290-the gentlemen were gone , [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth walked out to recover [her]82-elizabeth spirits ; or , in other words , to dwell without interruption on those subjects which must deaden [them]290-the gentlemen more . [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy 's behaviour astonished and vexed [her]82-elizabeth .

" Why , if [he]89-mr. darcy came only to be silent , grave , and indifferent , "[82-elizabeth] said [she]82-elizabeth , " did [he]89-mr. darcy come at all ? "[82-elizabeth]

[She]82-elizabeth could settle it in no way that gave [her]82-elizabeth pleasure .

" [He]89-mr. darcy could be still amiable , still pleasing to [[my]82-elizabeth uncle]3488-my uncle and [aunt]3971-aunt , when [he]89-mr. darcy was in [town]264-town ; and why not to [me]82-elizabeth ? If [he]89-mr. darcy fears [me]82-elizabeth , why come hither ? If [he]89-mr. darcy no longer cares for [me]82-elizabeth , why silent ? [Teasing , teasing man]5049-teasing , teasing man ! [I]82-elizabeth will think no more about [him]89-mr. darcy . "[82-elizabeth]

[Her]82-elizabeth resolution was for a short time involuntarily kept by the approach of [[her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister , who joined [her]82-elizabeth with a cheerful look which showed [her]328-her sister better satisfied with [[their]2662-their visitors]2109-their visitors than [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth .

" Now , "[328-her sister] said [she]328-her sister , " that this first meeting is over , [I]328-her sister feel perfectly easy . [I]328-her sister know [my]328-her sister own strength , and [I]328-her sister shall never be embarrassed again by [his]89-mr. darcy coming . [I]328-her sister am glad [he]89-mr. darcy dines [here]2994-here on Tuesday . It will then be publicly seen , that on both sides [we]2662-their meet only as [common and indifferent acquaintance]5051-common and indifferent acquaintance . "[328-her sister]

" Yes , very indifferent , indeed , "[82-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , laughingly . " Oh , [Jane]83-jane ! take care . "[82-elizabeth]

" [[My]328-her sister dear]2993-my dear [Lizzy]82-elizabeth , [you]82-elizabeth can not think [me]328-her sister so weak as to be in danger now . "[328-her sister]

" [I]82-elizabeth think [you]82-elizabeth are in very great danger of making [him]79-mr. bingley as much in love with [you]82-elizabeth as ever . "[82-elizabeth]

[They]2664-they did not see [the gentlemen]290-the gentlemen again till Tuesday ; and [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet , in the meanwhile , was giving way to all the happy schemes which the good - humour and common politeness of [Bingley]79-mr. bingley , in half an hour 's visit , had revived .

On Tuesday there was [a large party assembled at [Longbourn]7-longbourn]2666-a large party assembled at longbourn ; and [the two who were most anxiously expected]2667-the two who were most anxiously expected , to the credit of [their]2667-the two who were most anxiously expected punctuality as [sportsmen]2668-sportsmen , were in very good time . When [they]2664-they repaired to [the dining - room]686-the dining - room , [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth eagerly watched to see whether [Bingley]79-mr. bingley would take the place which , in all [their]2664-they former parties , had belonged to [him]79-mr. bingley , by [[her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister . [[Her]82-elizabeth prudent mother]2671-her prudent mother , occupied by the same ideas , forbore to invite [him]79-mr. bingley to sit by [herself]2671-her prudent mother . On entering [the room]250-the room , [he]79-mr. bingley seemed to hesitate ; but [Jane]83-jane happened to look round , and happened to smile : it was decided . [He]79-mr. bingley placed [himself]79-mr. bingley by [her]83-jane .

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , with a triumphant sensation , looked towards [[his]79-mr. bingley friend]286-his friend . [He]79-mr. bingley bore it with noble indifference ; and [she]82-elizabeth would have imagined that [Bingley]79-mr. bingley had received [his]79-mr. bingley sanction to be happy , had [she]82-elizabeth not seen [his]79-mr. bingley eyes likewise turned towards [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy , with an expression of half - laughing alarm .
