[His]79-mr. bingley behaviour to [[her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister was such during dinnertime as showed an admiration of [her]82-elizabeth , which , though more guarded than formerly , persuaded [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , that , if left wholly to [himself]79-mr. bingley , [Jane]83-jane 's happiness , and [his]79-mr. bingley own , would be speedily secured . Though [she]82-elizabeth dared not depend upon the consequence , [she]82-elizabeth yet received pleasure from observing [his]79-mr. bingley behaviour . It gave [her]82-elizabeth all the animation that [her]82-elizabeth spirits could boast ; for [she]82-elizabeth was in no cheerful humour . [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy was almost as far from [her]82-elizabeth as the table could divide [them]2675-them . [He]89-mr. darcy was on one side of [[her]82-elizabeth mother]241-her mother . [She]82-elizabeth knew how little such a situation would give pleasure to either , or make either appear to advantage . [She]82-elizabeth was not near enough to hear any of [their]2675-them discourse ; but [she]82-elizabeth could see how seldom [they]2675-them spoke to [each other]3144-each other , and how formal and cold was [their]2675-them manner whenever [they]2675-them did . [[Her]82-elizabeth mother]241-her mother 's ungraciousness made the sense of what [they]2675-them owed [him]89-mr. darcy more painful to [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth 's mind ; and [she]82-elizabeth would , at times , have given anything to be privileged to tell [him]89-mr. darcy , that [his]89-mr. darcy kindness was neither unknown nor unfelt by [the whole of [the family]416-the family]2679-the whole of the family .

[She]82-elizabeth was in hopes that the evening would afford some opportunity of bringing [them]2675-them together ; that the whole of the visit would not pass away without enabling [them]2675-them to enter into something more of conversation , than the mere ceremonious salutation attending [his]89-mr. darcy entrance . Anxious and uneasy , the period which passed in [the drawing - room]520-the drawing - room before [the gentlemen]290-the gentlemen came , was wearisome and dull to a degree that almost made [her]82-elizabeth uncivil . [She]82-elizabeth looked forward to [their]2675-them entrance as the point on which all [her]82-elizabeth chance of pleasure for the evening must depend .

" If [he]89-mr. darcy does not come to [me]82-elizabeth , _ then _ , "[82-elizabeth] said [she]82-elizabeth , " [I]82-elizabeth shall give [him]89-mr. darcy up for ever . "[82-elizabeth]

[The gentlemen]290-the gentlemen came ; and [she]82-elizabeth thought [he]89-mr. darcy looked as if [he]89-mr. darcy would have answered [her]82-elizabeth hopes ; but , alas ! [the ladies]249-the ladies had crowded round the table , where [Miss Bennet]84-lydia was making tea , and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth pouring out the coffee , in so close a confederacy , that there was not a single vacancy near [her]82-elizabeth which would admit of a chair . And on [the gentlemen]290-the gentlemen 's approaching , [one of [the girls]3008-the girls]2686-one of the girls moved closer to [her]82-elizabeth than ever , and said , in a whisper,--

" The men sha n't come and part [us]5053-we , [I]2686-one of the girls am determined . [We]5053-we want none of [them]290-the gentlemen ; do [we]5053-we ? "[2686-one of the girls]

[Darcy]89-mr. darcy had walked away to another part of [the room]250-the room . [She]82-elizabeth followed [him]89-mr. darcy with [her]82-elizabeth eyes , envied everyone to whom [he]89-mr. darcy spoke , had scarcely patience enough to help [anybody]3099-anybody to coffee , and then was enraged against [herself]82-elizabeth for being so silly !

" [A man who has once been refused]5054-a man who has once been refused ! How could [I]82-elizabeth ever be foolish enough to expect a renewal of [his]89-mr. darcy love ? Is there [one among the sex who would not protest against such a weakness as a second proposal to [the same woman]5056-the same woman]5055-one among the sex who would not protest against such a weakness as a second proposal to the same woman ? There is no indignity so abhorrent to [their]5057-their feelings . "[82-elizabeth]

[She]82-elizabeth was a little revived , however , by [his]89-mr. darcy bringing back [his]89-mr. darcy coffee - cup [himself]89-mr. darcy ; and [she]82-elizabeth seized the opportunity of saying,--

" Is [[your]89-mr. darcy sister]3139-your sister at [Pemberley]12-pemberley still ? "[82-elizabeth]

" Yes ; [she]3139-your sister will remain [there]305-there till Christmas . "[82-elizabeth]

" And quite alone ? Have all [[her]3139-your sister friends]310-her friends left [her]3139-your sister ? "[82-elizabeth]

" [Mrs. Annesley]187-mrs. annesley is with [her]3139-your sister . [The others]507-the others have been gone on to [Scarborough]70-scarborough these three weeks . "[82-elizabeth]

[She]82-elizabeth could think of nothing more to say ; but if [he]89-mr. darcy wished to converse with [her]82-elizabeth , [he]89-mr. darcy might have better success . [He]89-mr. darcy stood by [her]82-elizabeth , however , for some minutes , in silence ; and , at last , on [the young lady]2690-the young lady 's whispering to [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth again , [he]89-mr. darcy walked away .

When the tea things were removed , and the card tables placed , [the ladies]249-the ladies all rose ; and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth was then hoping to be soon joined by [him]89-mr. darcy , when all [her]82-elizabeth views were overthrown , by seeing [him]89-mr. darcy fall a victim to [[her]82-elizabeth mother]241-her mother 's rapacity for [whist players]2693-whist players , and in a few moments after seated with [the rest of the party]2694-the rest of the party . [She]82-elizabeth now lost every expectation of pleasure . [They]2695-they were confined for the evening at different tables ; and [she]82-elizabeth had nothing to hope , but that [his]89-mr. darcy eyes were so often turned towards [her]82-elizabeth side of [the room]250-the room , as to make [him]89-mr. darcy play as unsuccessfully as [herself]82-elizabeth .

[Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet had designed to keep [the two Netherfield gentlemen]2697-the two netherfield gentlemen to supper ; but [[their]2697-the two netherfield gentlemen carriage]977-their carriage was , unluckily , ordered before [any of [the others]507-the others]2699-any of the others , and [she]85-mrs. bennet had no opportunity of detaining [them]2697-the two netherfield gentlemen .

" Well , [girls]3052-girls , "[85-mrs. bennet] said [she]85-mrs. bennet , as soon as [they]2697-the two netherfield gentlemen were left to [themselves]2697-the two netherfield gentlemen , " what say [you]3052-girls to the day ? [I]85-mrs. bennet think everything has passed off uncommonly well , [I]85-mrs. bennet assure [you]3052-girls . The dinner was as well dressed as any [I]85-mrs. bennet ever saw . The venison was roasted to a turn -- and [everybody]304-everybody said , [they]304-everybody never saw so fat a haunch . The soup was fifty times better than what [we]5064-we had at [the Lucases]100-the lucases ' last week ; and even [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy acknowledged that the partridges were remarkably well done ; and [I]85-mrs. bennet suppose [he]89-mr. darcy has [two or three French cooks]5065-two or three french cooks at least . And , [[my]85-mrs. bennet dear]2993-my dear [Jane]83-jane , [I]85-mrs. bennet never saw [you]83-jane look in greater beauty . [Mrs. Long]76-mrs. long said so too , for [I]85-mrs. bennet asked [her]76-mrs. long whether [you]83-jane did not . And what do [you]83-jane think [she]76-mrs. long said besides ? ' Ah ! [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet , [we]5064-we shall have [her]76-mrs. long at [Netherfield]2-netherfield at last ! ' [She]76-mrs. long did , indeed . [I]85-mrs. bennet do think [Mrs. Long]76-mrs. long is as good a creature as ever lived -- and [[her]76-mrs. long nieces]3045-her nieces are [very pretty behaved girls]5068-very pretty behaved girls , and not at all handsome : [I]85-mrs. bennet like [them]3045-her nieces prodigiously . "[85-mrs. bennet]

[Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet , in short , was in very great spirits : [she]85-mrs. bennet had seen enough of [Bingley]79-mr. bingley 's behaviour to [Jane]83-jane to be convinced that [she]85-mrs. bennet would get [him]79-mr. bingley at last ; and [her]85-mrs. bennet expectations of advantage to [[her]85-mrs. bennet family]885-her family , when in a happy humour , were so far beyond reason , that [she]85-mrs. bennet was quite disappointed at not seeing [him]79-mr. bingley [there]305-there again the next day , to make [his]79-mr. bingley proposals .

" It has been a very agreeable day , "[84-lydia] said [Miss Bennet]84-lydia to [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth . " [The party]3009-the party seemed so well selected , so suitable one with the other . [I]84-lydia hope [we]5070-we may often meet again . "[84-lydia]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth smiled .

" [Lizzy]82-elizabeth , [you]82-elizabeth must not do so . [You]82-elizabeth must not suspect [me]82-elizabeth . It mortifies [me]82-elizabeth . [I]82-elizabeth assure [you]82-elizabeth that [I]82-elizabeth have now learnt to enjoy [his]79-mr. bingley conversation as [an agreeable and sensible young man]5071-an agreeable and sensible young man without having a wish beyond it . [I]82-elizabeth am perfectly satisfied , from what [his]79-mr. bingley manners now are , that [he]79-mr. bingley never had any design of engaging [my]82-elizabeth affection . " [You]82-elizabeth are very cruel , "[328-her sister] said [[her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister , " [you]82-elizabeth will not let [me]328-her sister smile , and are provoking [me]328-her sister to it every moment . "[328-her sister]

" How hard it is in some cases to be believed ! And how impossible in others ! But why should [you]82-elizabeth wish to persuade [me]82-elizabeth that [I]82-elizabeth feel more than [I]82-elizabeth acknowledge ? "[82-elizabeth]

" That is a question which [I]328-her sister hardly know how to answer . [We]5073-we all love to instruct , though [we]5073-we can teach only what is not worth knowing . CHAPTER LV .

A few days after this visit , [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley called again , and alone . [[His]79-mr. bingley friend]286-his friend had left [him]79-mr. bingley that morning for [London]5-london , but was to return [home]3219-home in ten days ' time . [He]79-mr. bingley sat with [them]2706-them above an hour , and was in remarkably good spirits . [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet invited [him]79-mr. bingley to dine with [them]2706-them ; but , with many expressions of concern , [he]79-mr. bingley confessed [himself]79-mr. bingley engaged elsewhere .

" Next time [you]79-mr. bingley call , "[85-mrs. bennet] said [she]85-mrs. bennet , " [I]85-mrs. bennet hope [we]2706-them shall be more lucky . "[85-mrs. bennet]

[He]79-mr. bingley should be particularly happy at any time , etc . , etc . ; and if [she]85-mrs. bennet would give [him]79-mr. bingley leave , would take an early opportunity of waiting on [them]2706-them .

" Can [you]79-mr. bingley come to - morrow ? "[85-mrs. bennet]

Yes , [he]79-mr. bingley had no engagement at all for to - morrow ; and [her]85-mrs. bennet invitation was accepted with alacrity .

[He]79-mr. bingley came , and in such very good time , that [the ladies]249-the ladies were none of [them]249-the ladies dressed . In ran [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet to [[[her]85-mrs. bennet daughters]237-her daughters ' room]2709-her daughters ' room , in [her]85-mrs. bennet dressing - gown , and with [her]85-mrs. bennet hair half finished , crying out,--

" [[My]85-mrs. bennet dear]2993-my dear [Jane]83-jane , make haste and hurry down . [He]79-mr. bingley is come -- [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley is come . [He]79-mr. bingley is , indeed . Make haste , make haste . Here , [Sarah]197-sally , come to [Miss Bennet]84-lydia this moment , and help [her]84-lydia on with [her]84-lydia gown . Never mind [Miss Lizzy]82-elizabeth 's hair . "[85-mrs. bennet]

" [We]5076-we will be down as soon as [we]5076-we can , "[83-jane] said [Jane]83-jane ; " but [I]83-jane dare say [Kitty]86-lady catherine is forwarder than either of [us]5076-we , for [she]86-lady catherine went [upstairs]703-upstairs half an hour ago . "[83-jane]

" Oh ! hang [Kitty]86-lady catherine ! what has [she]86-lady catherine to do with it ? Come , be quick , be quick ! where is [your]83-jane sash , [[my]83-jane dear]2993-my dear ? "[83-jane]

But when [[her]83-jane mother]241-her mother was gone , [Jane]83-jane would not be prevailed on to go down without [one of [[her]83-jane sisters]3023-her sisters]2711-one of her sisters .

The same anxiety to get [them]3023-her sisters by [themselves]3023-her sisters was visible again in the evening . After tea , [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet retired to [the library]1011-the library , as was [his]75-mr. bennet custom , and [Mary]87-mary went [upstairs]703-upstairs to [her]87-mary instrument . Two obstacles of the five being thus removed , [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet sat looking and winking at [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth and [Catherine]86-lady catherine for a considerable time , without making any impression on [them]3023-her sisters . [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth would not observe [her]85-mrs. bennet ; and when at last [Kitty]86-lady catherine did , [she]86-lady catherine very innocently said , " What is the matter , [mamma]3033-mamma ? What do [you]3033-mamma keep winking at [me]86-lady catherine for ? What am [I]86-lady catherine to do ? "[86-lady catherine]

" Nothing , [child]3675-child , nothing . [I]85-mrs. bennet did not wink at [you]3033-mamma . "[85-mrs. bennet] [She]85-mrs. bennet then sat still five minutes longer ; but unable to waste such a precious occasion , [she]85-mrs. bennet suddenly got up , and saying to [Kitty,--]216-kitty,--

" Come here , [[my]85-mrs. bennet love]3055-my love , [I]85-mrs. bennet want to speak to [you]82-elizabeth , "[85-mrs. bennet] took [her]85-mrs. bennet out of [the room]250-the room . [Jane]83-jane instantly gave a look at [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth which spoke [her]83-jane distress at such premeditation , and [her]83-jane entreaty that _ [she]83-jane _ would not give in to it . In a few minutes , [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet half opened the door and called out,--

" [Lizzy]82-elizabeth , [[my]85-mrs. bennet dear]2993-my dear , [I]85-mrs. bennet want to speak with [you]82-elizabeth . "[85-mrs. bennet]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth was forced to go .

" [We]5083-we may as well leave [them]5084-them by [themselves]5084-them , [you]82-elizabeth know , "[241-her mother] said [[her]82-elizabeth mother]241-her mother as soon as [she]241-her mother was in [the hall]685-the hall . " [Kitty]86-lady catherine and [I]241-her mother are going [upstairs]703-upstairs to sit in [[my]241-her mother dressing - room]5086-my dressing - room . "[241-her mother]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth made no attempt to reason with [[her]82-elizabeth mother]241-her mother , but remained quietly in [the hall]685-the hall till [she]82-elizabeth and [Kitty]86-lady catherine were out of sight , then returned into [the drawing - room]520-the drawing - room .

[Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet 's schemes for this day were ineffectual . [Bingley]79-mr. bingley was everything that was charming , except [the professed lover of [[her]85-mrs. bennet daughter]463-her daughter]2721-the professed lover of her daughter . [His]79-mr. bingley ease and cheerfulness rendered [him]79-mr. bingley a most agreeable addition to [their]2723-their evening party ; and [he]79-mr. bingley bore with the ill - judged officiousness of [the mother]395-the mother , and heard all [her]395-the mother silly remarks with a forbearance and command of countenance particularly grateful to [the daughter]1372-the daughter .

[He]79-mr. bingley scarcely needed an invitation to stay supper ; and before [he]79-mr. bingley went away an engagement was formed , chiefly through [his]79-mr. bingley own and [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet 's means , for [his]79-mr. bingley coming next morning to shoot with [[her]85-mrs. bennet husband]255-her husband .

After this day , [Jane]83-jane said no more of [her]83-jane indifference . Not a word passed between [the sisters]492-the sisters concerning [Bingley]79-mr. bingley ; but [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth went to bed in the happy belief that all must speedily be concluded , unless [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy returned within the stated time . Seriously , however , [she]82-elizabeth felt tolerably persuaded that all this must have taken place with [that gentleman]3305-that gentleman 's concurrence .

[Bingley]79-mr. bingley was punctual to [his]79-mr. bingley appointment ; and [he]79-mr. bingley and [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet spent the morning together , as had been agreed on . [The latter]487-the latter was much more agreeable than [[his]79-mr. bingley companion]424-his companion expected . There was nothing of presumption or folly in [Bingley]79-mr. bingley that could provoke [his]79-mr. bingley ridicule , or disgust [him]79-mr. bingley into silence ; and [he]79-mr. bingley was more communicative , and less eccentric , than [the other]590-the other had ever seen [him]79-mr. bingley . [Bingley]79-mr. bingley of course returned with [him]79-mr. bingley to dinner ; and in the evening [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet 's invention was again at work to get [everybody]304-everybody away from [him]79-mr. bingley and [[her]85-mrs. bennet daughter]463-her daughter . [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , who had a letter to write , went into [the breakfast - room]1005-the breakfast - room for that purpose soon after tea ; for as [the others]507-the others were all going to sit down to cards , [she]82-elizabeth could not be wanted to counteract [[her]82-elizabeth mother]241-her mother 's schemes .

But on [her]82-elizabeth returning to [the drawing - room]520-the drawing - room , when [her]82-elizabeth letter was finished , [she]82-elizabeth saw , to [her]82-elizabeth infinite surprise , there was reason to fear that [[her]82-elizabeth mother]241-her mother had been too ingenious for [her]82-elizabeth . On opening the door , [she]82-elizabeth perceived [[her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister and [Bingley]79-mr. bingley standing together over the hearth , as if engaged in earnest conversation ; and had this led to no suspicion , the faces of both , as [they]2740-they hastily turned round and moved away from [each other]3144-each other , would have told it all . _ [Their]2740-they _ situation was awkward enough ; but _ [hers]2742-hers _ [she]82-elizabeth thought was still worse . Not a syllable was uttered by either ; and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth was on the point of going away again , when [Bingley]79-mr. bingley , who as well as [the other]590-the other had sat down , suddenly rose , and , whispering a few words to [[her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister , ran out of [the room]250-the room .

[Jane]83-jane could have no reserves from [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , where confidence would give pleasure ; and , instantly embracing [her]82-elizabeth , acknowledged , with the liveliest emotion , that [she]82-elizabeth was [the happiest creature in [the world]303-the world]2746-the happiest creature in the world .

" ' Tis too much ! "[83-jane] [she]83-jane added , " by far too much . [I]83-jane do not deserve it . Oh , why is not [everybody]304-everybody as happy ? "[83-jane]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth 's congratulations were given with a sincerity , a warmth , a delight , which words could but poorly express . Every sentence of kindness was a fresh source of happiness to [Jane]83-jane . But [she]82-elizabeth would not allow [herself]82-elizabeth to stay with [[her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister , or say half that remained to be said , for the present .

" [I]82-elizabeth must go instantly to [[my]82-elizabeth mother]3227-my mother , "[82-elizabeth] [she]82-elizabeth cried . " [I]82-elizabeth would not on any account trifle with [her]3227-my mother affectionate solicitude , or allow [her]3227-my mother to hear it from anyone but [myself]82-elizabeth . [He]5089-he is gone to [[my]82-elizabeth father]3256-my father already . Oh , [Lizzy]82-elizabeth , to know that what [I]82-elizabeth have to relate will give such pleasure to all [[my]82-elizabeth dear family]5091-my dear family ! how shall [I]82-elizabeth bear so much happiness ? "[82-elizabeth]

[She]82-elizabeth then hastened away to [[her]82-elizabeth mother]241-her mother , who had purposely broken up the card - party , and was sitting [upstairs]703-upstairs with [Kitty]86-lady catherine .

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , who was left by [herself]82-elizabeth , now smiled at the rapidity and ease with which an affair was finally settled , that had given [them]2751-them so many previous months of suspense and vexation .

" And this , "[82-elizabeth] said [she]82-elizabeth , " is the end of all [[his]79-mr. bingley friend]286-his friend 's anxious circumspection ! of all [[his]79-mr. bingley sister]559-his sister 's falsehood and contrivance ! the happiest , wisest , and most reasonable end ! "[82-elizabeth]

In a few minutes [she]82-elizabeth was joined by [Bingley]79-mr. bingley , whose conference with [[her]82-elizabeth father]244-her father had been short and to the purpose .

" Where is [[your]82-elizabeth sister]3139-your sister ? "[79-mr. bingley] said [he]79-mr. bingley hastily , as [he]79-mr. bingley opened the door .

" With [[my]79-mr. bingley mother]3227-my mother [upstairs]703-upstairs . [She]3139-your sister will be down in a moment , [I]79-mr. bingley dare say . "[79-mr. bingley]

[He]79-mr. bingley then shut the door , and , coming up to [her]82-elizabeth , claimed the good wishes and affection of [a sister]437-a sister . [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth honestly and heartily expressed [her]82-elizabeth delight in the prospect of [their]2754-their relationship . [They]2754-their shook hands with great cordiality ; and then , till [[her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister came down , [she]82-elizabeth had to listen to all [he]79-mr. bingley had to say of [his]79-mr. bingley own happiness , and of [Jane]83-jane 's perfections ; and in spite of [his]79-mr. bingley being [a lover]2756-a lover , [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth really believed all [his]79-mr. bingley expectations of felicity to be rationally founded , because [they]2754-their had for basis the excellent understanding and super - excellent disposition of [Jane]83-jane , and a general similarity of feeling and taste between [her]83-jane and [himself]79-mr. bingley .

It was an evening of no common delight to [them]2754-their all ; the satisfaction of [Miss Bennet]82-elizabeth 's mind gave such a glow of sweet animation to [her]82-elizabeth face , as made [her]82-elizabeth look handsomer than ever . [Kitty]86-lady catherine simpered and smiled , and hoped [her]86-lady catherine turn was coming soon . [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet could not give [her]82-elizabeth consent , or speak [her]82-elizabeth approbation in terms warm enough to satisfy [her]82-elizabeth feelings , though [she]82-elizabeth talked to [Bingley]79-mr. bingley of nothing else , for half an hour ; and when [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet joined [them]2754-their at supper , [his]75-mr. bennet voice and manner plainly showed how really happy [he]75-mr. bennet was .

Not a word , however , passed [his]75-mr. bennet lips in allusion to it , till [[their]2754-their visitor]1550-their visitor took [his]75-mr. bennet leave for the night ; but as soon as [he]75-mr. bennet was gone , [he]75-mr. bennet turned to [[his]75-mr. bennet daughter]1106-his daughter and said,--

" [Jane]83-jane , [I]75-mr. bennet congratulate [you]83-jane . [You]83-jane will be [a very happy woman]5097-a very happy woman . "[75-mr. bennet]

[Jane]83-jane went to [him]75-mr. bennet instantly , kissed [him]75-mr. bennet , and thanked [him]75-mr. bennet for [his]75-mr. bennet goodness .

" [You]83-jane are [a good girl]4749-a good girl , "[75-mr. bennet] [he]75-mr. bennet replied , " and [I]75-mr. bennet have great pleasure in thinking [you]83-jane will be so happily settled . [I]75-mr. bennet have not a doubt of [your]83-jane doing very well together . [Your]83-jane tempers are by no means unlike . [You]83-jane are each of [you]83-jane so complying , that nothing will ever be resolved on ; so easy , that [every servant]5099-every servant will cheat [you]83-jane ; and so generous , that [you]83-jane will always exceed [your]83-jane income . "[75-mr. bennet]

" [I]231-his wife hope not so . Imprudence or thoughtlessness in money matters would be unpardonable in _ [me]231-his wife _ . "[231-his wife]

" Exceed [their]5100-their income ! [[My]231-his wife dear]2993-my dear [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet , "[231-his wife] cried [[his]75-mr. bennet wife]231-his wife , " what are [you]75-mr. bennet talking of ? Why , [he]75-mr. bennet has four or five thousand a year , and very likely more . "[231-his wife] Then addressing [[her]231-his wife daughter]463-her daughter , " Oh , [[my]231-his wife dear]2993-my dear , [dear Jane]83-jane , [I]231-his wife am so happy ! [I]231-his wife am sure [I]231-his wife sha n't get a wink of sleep all night . [I]231-his wife knew how it would be . [I]231-his wife always said it must be so , at last . [I]231-his wife was sure [you]83-jane could not be so beautiful for nothing ! [I]231-his wife remember , as soon as ever [I]231-his wife saw [him]75-mr. bennet , when [he]75-mr. bennet first came into [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire last year , [I]231-his wife thought how likely it was that [you]83-jane should come together . Oh , [he]75-mr. bennet is [the handsomest young man that ever was seen]5103-the handsomest young man that ever was seen ! "[231-his wife]

[Wickham]143-george wickham , [Lydia]84-lydia , were all forgotten . [Jane]83-jane was beyond competition [[her]83-jane favourite child]2761-her favourite child . At that moment [she]83-jane cared for [no other]2260-no other . [[Her]83-jane younger sisters]418-her younger sisters soon began to make interest with [her]83-jane for objects of happiness which [she]83-jane might in future be able to dispense .

[Mary]87-mary petitioned for the use of [the library at [Netherfield]2-netherfield]2764-the library at netherfield ; and [Kitty]86-lady catherine begged very hard for a few balls [there]305-there every winter .

[Bingley]79-mr. bingley , from this time , was of course a daily visitor at [Longbourn]7-longbourn ; coming frequently before breakfast , and always remaining till after supper ; unless when [some barbarous neighbour , who could not be enough detested]2766-some barbarous neighbour , who could not be enough detested , had given [him]79-mr. bingley an invitation to dinner , which [he]79-mr. bingley thought [himself]79-mr. bingley obliged to accept .

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth had now but little time for conversation with [[her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister ; for while [he]79-mr. bingley was present [Jane]83-jane had no attention to bestow on [anyone else]3349-anyone else : but [she]83-jane found [herself]83-jane considerably useful to both of [them]2769-them , in those hours of separation that must sometimes occur . In the absence of [Jane]83-jane , [he]79-mr. bingley always attached [himself]79-mr. bingley to [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth for the pleasure of talking of [her]83-jane ; and when [Bingley]79-mr. bingley was gone , [Jane]83-jane constantly sought the same means of relief .

" [He]79-mr. bingley has made [me]83-jane so happy , "[83-jane] said [she]83-jane , one evening , " by telling [me]83-jane that [he]79-mr. bingley was totally ignorant of [my]83-jane being in [town]264-town last spring ! [I]83-jane had not believed it possible . "[83-jane]

" [I]82-elizabeth suspected as much , "[82-elizabeth] replied [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth . " But how did [he]79-mr. bingley account for it ? "[83-jane]

" It must have been [[his]79-mr. bingley sisters]282-his sisters ' doing . [They]282-his sisters were certainly no friends to [his]79-mr. bingley acquaintance with [me]83-jane , which [I]83-jane can not wonder at , since [he]79-mr. bingley might have chosen so much more advantageously in many respects . But when [they]282-his sisters see , as [I]83-jane trust [they]282-his sisters will , that [[their]282-his sisters brother]339-their brother is happy with [me]83-jane , [they]282-his sisters will learn to be contented , and [we]5107-we shall be on good terms again : though [we]5107-we can never be what [we]5107-we once were to [each other]3144-each other . "[83-jane]

" That is the most unforgiving speech , "[82-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , " that [I]82-elizabeth ever heard [you]83-jane utter . [Good girl]5109-good girl ! It would vex [me]82-elizabeth , indeed , to see [you]83-jane again the dupe of [Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley 's pretended regard . "[82-elizabeth]

" Would [you]83-jane believe it , [Lizzy]82-elizabeth , that when [he]2770-he went to [town]264-town last November [he]2770-he really loved [me]83-jane , and nothing but a persuasion of _ [my]83-jane _ being indifferent would have prevented [his]2770-he coming down again ? "[83-jane]

" [He]2770-he made a little mistake , to be sure ; but it is to the credit of [his]2770-he modesty . "[82-elizabeth]

This naturally introduced a panegyric from [Jane]83-jane on [his]2770-he diffidence , and the little value [he]2770-he put on [his]2770-he own good qualities .

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth was pleased to find that [he]2770-he had not betrayed the interference of [[his]2770-he friend]286-his friend ; for , though [Jane]83-jane had the most generous and forgiving heart in [the world]303-the world , [she]83-jane knew it was a circumstance which must prejudice [her]83-jane against [him]2770-he .

" [I]83-jane am certainly [the most fortunate creature that ever existed]5111-the most fortunate creature that ever existed ! "[83-jane] cried [Jane]83-jane . " Oh , [Lizzy]82-elizabeth , why am [I]83-jane thus singled from [[my]83-jane family]3727-my family , and blessed above [them]3727-my family all ? If [I]83-jane could but see [you]82-elizabeth as happy ! If there were but [such another man for [you]82-elizabeth]5113-such another man for you ! "[83-jane]

" If [you]82-elizabeth were to give [me]85-mrs. bennet forty [such men]5114-such men [I]85-mrs. bennet never could be so happy as [you]82-elizabeth . Till [I]85-mrs. bennet have [your]82-elizabeth disposition , [your]82-elizabeth goodness , [I]85-mrs. bennet never can have [your]82-elizabeth happiness . No , no , let [me]85-mrs. bennet shift for [myself]85-mrs. bennet ; and , perhaps , if [I]85-mrs. bennet have very good luck , [I]85-mrs. bennet may meet with another [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins in time . "[85-mrs. bennet]

The situation of affairs in [the Longbourn family]725-the longbourn family could not be long a secret . [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet was privileged to whisper it to [Mrs. Philips]111-mrs. philips , and [she]85-mrs. bennet ventured , without any permission , to do the same by [all [[her]85-mrs. bennet neighbours]821-her neighbours in [Meryton]9-meryton]2774-all her neighbours in meryton .

[The Bennets]99-the bennets were speedily pronounced to be [the luckiest family in [the world]303-the world]2776-the luckiest family in the world ; though only a few weeks before , when [Lydia]84-lydia had first run away , [they]2776-the luckiest family in the world had been generally proved to be marked out for misfortune .

CHAPTER LVI .

One morning , about a week after [Bingley]91-miss bingley 's engagement with [Jane]83-jane had been formed , as [he]2778-he and [the females of [the family]416-the family]2779-the females of the family were sitting together in [the dining - room]686-the dining - room , [their]2776-the luckiest family in the world attention was suddenly drawn to the window by the sound of [a carriage]3123-a carriage ; and [they]2776-the luckiest family in the world perceived a chaise and four driving up [the lawn]1954-the lawn . It was too early in the morning for [visitors]4477-visitors ; and besides , the equipage did not answer to that of [any of [[their]2776-the luckiest family in the world neighbours]2786-their neighbours]2785-any of their neighbours . The horses were post ; and neither [the carriage]3217-the carriage , nor the livery of [the servant who preceded it]2788-the servant who preceded it , were familiar to [them]2776-the luckiest family in the world . As it was certain , however , that [somebody]3598-somebody was coming , [Bingley]91-miss bingley instantly prevailed on [Miss Bennet]84-lydia to avoid the confinement of such an intrusion , and walk away with [him]2778-he into the shrubbery . [They]2776-the luckiest family in the world both set off ; and the conjectures of [the remaining three]2790-the remaining three continued , though with little satisfaction , till the door was thrown open , and [[their]2776-the luckiest family in the world visitor]1550-their visitor entered . It was [Lady Catherine de Bourgh]86-lady catherine .

[They]2776-the luckiest family in the world were of course all intending to be surprised : but [their]2776-the luckiest family in the world astonishment was beyond [their]2776-the luckiest family in the world expectation ; and on the part of [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet and [Kitty]86-lady catherine , though [she]86-lady catherine was perfectly unknown to [them]2776-the luckiest family in the world , even inferior to what [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth felt .

[She]86-lady catherine entered [the room]250-the room with an air more than usually ungracious , made no other reply to [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth 's salutation than a slight inclination of the head , and sat down without saying a word . [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth had mentioned [her]82-elizabeth name to [[her]82-elizabeth mother]241-her mother on [her]82-elizabeth Ladyship 's entrance , though no request of introduction had been made .

[Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet , all amazement , though flattered by having [a guest of such high importance]2794-a guest of such high importance , received [her]82-elizabeth with the utmost politeness . After sitting for a moment in silence , [she]85-mrs. bennet said , very stiffly , to [Elizabeth,--]159-elizabeth,--

" [I]85-mrs. bennet hope [you]159-elizabeth,-- are well , [Miss Bennet]82-elizabeth . [That lady]2146-that lady , [I]85-mrs. bennet suppose , is [[your]159-elizabeth,-- mother]3715-your mother ? "[85-mrs. bennet]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth replied very concisely that [she]82-elizabeth was .

" And _ that _ , [I]85-mrs. bennet suppose , is [one of [[your]159-elizabeth,-- sisters]3060-your sisters]4747-one of your sisters ? "[85-mrs. bennet]

" Yes , [madam]3281-madam , "[85-mrs. bennet] said [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet , delighted to speak to [a Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine . " [She]86-lady catherine is [[my]85-mrs. bennet youngest girl]5120-my youngest girl but one . [[My]85-mrs. bennet youngest of all]5121-my youngest of all is lately married , and [[my]85-mrs. bennet eldest]5122-my eldest is somewhere about the ground , walking with [a young man , who , [I]85-mrs. bennet believe , will soon become a part of [the family]416-the family]5123-a young man , who , i believe , will soon become a part of the family . "[85-mrs. bennet]

" [You]86-lady catherine have [a very small park here]5125-a very small park here , "[86-lady catherine] returned [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine , after a short silence .

" It is nothing in comparison of [Rosings]20-rosings , [[my]85-mrs. bennet Lady]5126-my lady , [I]85-mrs. bennet dare say ; but , [I]85-mrs. bennet assure [you]86-lady catherine , it is much larger than [Sir William Lucas]80-sir william 's . "[85-mrs. bennet]

" This must be a most inconvenient sitting - room for the evening in summer : the windows are full west . "[85-mrs. bennet]

[Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet assured [her]86-lady catherine that [they]2795-they never sat [there]305-there after dinner ; and then added,--

" May [I]85-mrs. bennet take the liberty of asking [[your]86-lady catherine Ladyship]4084-your ladyship whether [you]86-lady catherine left [Mr.]5128-mr. and [Mrs. Collins]158-mrs. collins well ? "[85-mrs. bennet]

" Yes , very well . [I]85-mrs. bennet saw [them]2795-they the night before last . "[85-mrs. bennet]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth now expected that [she]82-elizabeth would produce a letter for [her]86-lady catherine from [Charlotte]172-charlotte , as it seemed the only probable motive for [her]86-lady catherine calling . But no letter appeared , and [she]82-elizabeth was completely puzzled .

[Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet , with great civility , begged [[her]85-mrs. bennet Ladyship]3464-her ladyship to take some refreshment : but [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine very resolutely , and not very politely , declined eating anything ; and then , rising up , said to [Elizabeth,--]159-elizabeth,--

" [Miss Bennet]82-elizabeth , there seemed to be a prettyish kind of a little wilderness on one side of [[your]82-elizabeth lawn]5129-your lawn . [I]159-elizabeth,-- should be glad to take a turn in it , if [you]82-elizabeth will favour [me]159-elizabeth,-- with [your]82-elizabeth company . "[159-elizabeth,--]

" Go , [[my]241-her mother dear]2993-my dear , "[241-her mother] cried [[her]82-elizabeth mother]241-her mother , " and show [her]86-lady catherine [Ladyship]162-ladyship about the different walks . [I]241-her mother think [she]86-lady catherine will be pleased with the hermitage . "[241-her mother]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth obeyed ; and , running into [[her]82-elizabeth own room]1549-her own room for [her]82-elizabeth parasol , attended [[her]82-elizabeth noble guest]2800-her noble guest [downstairs]2267-downstairs . As [they]2802-they passed through [the hall]685-the hall , [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine opened the doors into [the dining - parlour]518-the dining - parlour and [drawing - room]2805-drawing - room , and pronouncing [them]2806-them , after a short survey , to be [decent - looking rooms]2807-decent - looking rooms , walked on .

[[Her]86-lady catherine carriage]563-her carriage remained at the door , and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth saw that [[her]86-lady catherine waiting - woman]2809-her waiting - woman was in [it]563-her carriage . [They]2802-they proceeded in silence along [the gravel walk that led to [the copse]2811-the copse]2810-the gravel walk that led to the copse ; [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth was determined to make no effort for conversation with [a woman who was now more than usually insolent and disagreeable .

" How could [I]82-elizabeth ever think [her]2809-her waiting - woman like [[her]2809-her waiting - woman nephew]3592-her nephew]5131-a woman who was now more than usually insolent and disagreeable . " how could i ever think her like her nephew ? "[82-elizabeth] said [she]82-elizabeth , as [she]82-elizabeth looked in [her]82-elizabeth face .

As soon as [they]2802-they entered [the copse]2811-the copse , [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine began in the following manner:--

" [You]82-elizabeth can be at no loss , [Miss Bennet]82-elizabeth , to understand the reason of [my]86-lady catherine journey hither . [Your]82-elizabeth own heart , [your]82-elizabeth own conscience , must tell [you]82-elizabeth why [I]86-lady catherine come . "[86-lady catherine]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth looked with unaffected astonishment .

" Indeed , [you]82-elizabeth are mistaken , [madam]3281-madam ; [I]86-lady catherine have not been at all able to account for the honour of seeing [you]82-elizabeth here . "[86-lady catherine]

" [Miss Bennet]82-elizabeth , "[3464-her ladyship] replied [[her]82-elizabeth Ladyship]3464-her ladyship , in an angry tone , " [you]82-elizabeth ought to know that [I]3464-her ladyship am not to be trifled with . But however insincere _ [you]82-elizabeth _ may choose to be , [you]82-elizabeth shall not find _ [me]3464-her ladyship _ so . [My]3464-her ladyship character has ever been celebrated for its sincerity and frankness ; and in a cause of such moment as this , [I]3464-her ladyship shall certainly not depart from it . A report of a most alarming nature reached [me]3464-her ladyship two days ago . [I]3464-her ladyship was told , that not only [[your]82-elizabeth sister]3139-your sister was on the point of being most advantageously married , but that _ you_--that [Miss Elizabeth Bennet]82-elizabeth would , in all likelihood , be soon afterwards united to [[my]3464-her ladyship nephew]5135-my nephew -- [[my]3464-her ladyship own nephew]5136-my own nephew , [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy . Though [I]3464-her ladyship _ know _ it must be a scandalous falsehood , though [I]3464-her ladyship would not injure [him]5135-my nephew so much as to suppose the truth of it possible , [I]3464-her ladyship instantly resolved on setting off for [this place]4473-this place , that [I]3464-her ladyship might make [my]3464-her ladyship sentiments known to [you]82-elizabeth . "[3464-her ladyship]

" If [you]82-elizabeth believed it impossible to be true , "[82-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , colouring with astonishment and disdain , " [I]82-elizabeth wonder [you]82-elizabeth took the trouble of coming so far . What could [[your]82-elizabeth Ladyship]4084-your ladyship propose by it ? "[82-elizabeth]

" At once to insist upon having such a report universally contradicted . "[3464-her ladyship]

" [Your]82-elizabeth coming to [Longbourn]7-longbourn , to see [me]82-elizabeth and [[my]82-elizabeth family]3727-my family , "[82-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth coolly , " will be rather a confirmation of it -- if , indeed , such a report is in existence . "[82-elizabeth]

" If ! do [you]82-elizabeth then pretend to be ignorant of it ? Has it not been industriously circulated by [yourselves]82-elizabeth ? Do [you]82-elizabeth not know that such a report is spread abroad ? "[3464-her ladyship]

" [I]82-elizabeth never heard that it was . "[82-elizabeth]

" And can [you]82-elizabeth likewise declare , that there is no _ foundation _ for it ? "[3464-her ladyship]

" [I]82-elizabeth do not pretend to possess equal frankness with [[your]82-elizabeth Ladyship]4084-your ladyship . _ [You]82-elizabeth _ may ask questions which _ [I]82-elizabeth _ shall not choose to answer . "[82-elizabeth]

" This is not to be borne . [Miss Bennet]82-elizabeth , [I]3464-her ladyship insist on being satisfied . Has [he]3464-her ladyship , has [[my]3464-her ladyship nephew]5135-my nephew , made [you]82-elizabeth an offer of marriage ? "[3464-her ladyship]

" [[Your]82-elizabeth Ladyship]4084-your ladyship has declared it to be impossible . "[82-elizabeth]

" It ought to be so ; it must be so , while [he]3464-her ladyship retains the use of [his]3464-her ladyship reason . But _ [your]82-elizabeth _ arts and allurements may , in a moment of infatuation , have made [him]3464-her ladyship forget what [he]3464-her ladyship owes to [himself]3464-her ladyship and to [all [his]3464-her ladyship family]5143-all his family . [You]82-elizabeth may have drawn [him]3464-her ladyship in . "[3464-her ladyship]

" If [I]82-elizabeth have , [I]82-elizabeth shall be [the last person to confess it]5144-the last person to confess it . "[82-elizabeth]

" [Miss Bennet]82-elizabeth , do [you]82-elizabeth know who [I]3464-her ladyship am ? [I]3464-her ladyship have not been accustomed to such language as this . [I]3464-her ladyship am almost [the nearest relation [he]3464-her ladyship has in [the world]303-the world]5145-the nearest relation he has in the world , and am entitled to know all [his]3464-her ladyship dearest concerns . "[3464-her ladyship]

" But [you]82-elizabeth are not entitled to know _ mine _ ; nor will such behaviour as this ever induce [me]82-elizabeth to be explicit . "[82-elizabeth]

" Let [me]3464-her ladyship be rightly understood . This match , to which [you]82-elizabeth have the presumption to aspire , can never take place . No , never . [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy is engaged to _ [[my]3464-her ladyship daughter]4422-my daughter _ . Now , what have [you]82-elizabeth to say ? "[3464-her ladyship]

" Only this,--that if [he]3464-her ladyship is so , [you]82-elizabeth can have no reason to suppose [he]3464-her ladyship will make an offer to [me]82-elizabeth . "[82-elizabeth]

[Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine hesitated for a moment , and then replied,--

" The engagement between [them]5148-their is of a peculiar kind . From [their]5148-their infancy , [they]5148-their have been intended for [each other]3144-each other . It was the favourite wish of _ [[his]3464-her ladyship _ mother]5150-his _ mother , as well as of [hers]5150-his _ mother . While in [their]5148-their cradles [we]5151-we planned the union ; and now , at the moment when the wishes of [both sisters]2628-both sisters would be accomplished , is [their]5148-their marriage to be prevented by [a young woman of inferior birth]5153-a young woman of inferior birth , of no importance in [the world]303-the world , and wholly unallied to [the family]416-the family ? Do [you]82-elizabeth pay no regard to the wishes of [[his]3464-her ladyship friends]407-his friends -- to [his]3464-her ladyship tacit engagement with [Miss de Bourgh]132-miss de bourgh ? Are [you]82-elizabeth lost to every feeling of propriety and delicacy ? Have [you]82-elizabeth not heard [me]3464-her ladyship say , that from [his]3464-her ladyship earliest hours [he]3464-her ladyship was destined for [[his]3464-her ladyship cousin]704-his cousin ? "[3464-her ladyship]

" Yes ; and [I]3464-her ladyship had heard it before . But what is that to [me]3464-her ladyship ? If there is no other objection to [my]3464-her ladyship marrying [[your]82-elizabeth nephew]5158-your nephew , [I]3464-her ladyship shall certainly not be kept from it by knowing that [[his]3464-her ladyship mother]5159-his mother and [aunt]3971-aunt wished [him]3464-her ladyship to marry [Miss de Bourgh]132-miss de bourgh . [You]82-elizabeth both did as much as [you]82-elizabeth could in planning the marriage . Its completion depended on [others]3103-others . If [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy is neither by honour nor inclination confined to [[his]89-mr. darcy cousin]704-his cousin , why is not [he]89-mr. darcy to make another choice ? And if [I]3464-her ladyship am that choice , why may not [I]3464-her ladyship accept [him]89-mr. darcy ? "[3464-her ladyship]

" Because honour , decorum , prudence -- nay , interest -- forbid it . Yes , [Miss Bennet]82-elizabeth , interest ; for do not expect to be noticed by [[his]89-mr. darcy family]375-his family or [friends]3787-friends , if [you]82-elizabeth wilfully act against the inclinations of all . [You]82-elizabeth will be censured , slighted , and despised , by [everyone connected with [him]89-mr. darcy]3593-everyone connected with him . [Your]82-elizabeth alliance will be a disgrace ; [your]82-elizabeth name will never even be mentioned by any of [us]5166-us . "[3464-her ladyship]

" These are heavy misfortunes , "[82-elizabeth] replied [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth . " But [the wife of [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy]5167-the wife of mr. darcy must have such extraordinary sources of happiness necessarily attached to [her]5167-the wife of mr. darcy situation , that [she]5167-the wife of mr. darcy could , upon the whole , have no cause to repine . "[3464-her ladyship]

" [Obstinate , headstrong girl]5168-obstinate , headstrong girl ! [I]3464-her ladyship am ashamed of [you]82-elizabeth ! Is this [your]82-elizabeth gratitude for [my]3464-her ladyship attentions to [you]82-elizabeth last spring ? Is nothing due to [me]3464-her ladyship on that score ? Let [us]5166-us sit down . [You]82-elizabeth are to understand , [Miss Bennet]82-elizabeth , that [I]3464-her ladyship came here with the determined resolution of carrying [my]3464-her ladyship purpose ; nor will [I]3464-her ladyship be dissuaded from it . [I]3464-her ladyship have not been used to submit to [any person]4685-any person 's whims . [I]3464-her ladyship have not been in the habit of brooking disappointment . "[3464-her ladyship]

" _ That _ will make [[your]82-elizabeth Ladyship]4084-your ladyship 's situation at present more pitiable ; but it will have no effect on _ [me]3464-her ladyship _ . "[3464-her ladyship]

" [I]3464-her ladyship will not be interrupted ! Hear [me]3464-her ladyship in silence . [[My]3464-her ladyship daughter]4422-my daughter and [[my]3464-her ladyship nephew]5135-my nephew are formed for each other . [They]5173-they are descended , on the maternal side , from [the same noble line]5174-the same noble line ; and , on [the father]261-the father 's , from [respectable , honourable , and ancient , though untitled , families]5176-respectable , honourable , and ancient , though untitled , families . [Their]5173-they fortune on both sides is splendid . [They]5173-they are destined for each other by the voice of [every member of [[their]5173-they respective houses]5178-their respective houses]5177-every member of their respective houses ; and what is to divide them?--the upstart pretensions of [a young woman without family , connections]5179-a young woman without family , connections , or fortune ! Is this to be endured ? But it must not , shall not be ! If [you]82-elizabeth were sensible of [your]82-elizabeth own good , [you]82-elizabeth would not wish to quit the sphere in which [you]82-elizabeth have been brought up . "[3464-her ladyship]

" In marrying [[your]82-elizabeth nephew]5158-your nephew , [I]3464-her ladyship should not consider [myself]3464-her ladyship as quitting that sphere . [He]5158-your nephew is [a gentleman]3407-a gentleman ; [I]3464-her ladyship am [[a gentleman]3407-a gentleman 's daughter]5183-a gentleman 's daughter ; so far [we]5184-we are equal . "[3464-her ladyship]

" True . [You]3464-her ladyship _ are _ [[a gentleman]3407-a gentleman 's daughter]5183-a gentleman 's daughter . But what was [[your]3464-her ladyship mother]3715-your mother ? Who are [[your]3464-her ladyship uncles]5188-your uncles and [aunts]5189-aunts ? Do not imagine [me]3464-her ladyship ignorant of [their]5190-their condition . "[3464-her ladyship]

" Whatever [my]82-elizabeth connections may be , "[82-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , " if [[your]82-elizabeth nephew]5158-your nephew does not object to [them]5190-their , [they]5190-their can be nothing to _ [you]82-elizabeth _ . "[82-elizabeth]

" Tell [me]3464-her ladyship , once for all , are [you]82-elizabeth engaged to [him]5158-your nephew ? "[3464-her ladyship]

Though [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth would not , for the mere purpose of obliging [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine , have answered this question , [she]82-elizabeth could not but say , after a moment 's deliberation,--

" [I]3464-her ladyship am not . "[3464-her ladyship]

[Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine seemed pleased .

" And will [you]82-elizabeth promise [me]3464-her ladyship never to enter into such an engagement ? "[3464-her ladyship]

" [I]3464-her ladyship will make no promise of the kind . "[3464-her ladyship]

" [Miss Bennet]82-elizabeth , [I]3464-her ladyship am shocked and astonished . [I]3464-her ladyship expected to find [a more reasonable young woman]5192-a more reasonable young woman . But do not deceive [yourself]82-elizabeth into a belief that [I]3464-her ladyship will ever recede . [I]3464-her ladyship shall not go away till [you]82-elizabeth have given [me]3464-her ladyship the assurance [I]3464-her ladyship require . "[3464-her ladyship]

" And [I]3464-her ladyship certainly _ never _ shall give it . [I]3464-her ladyship am not to be intimidated into anything so wholly unreasonable . [[Your]82-elizabeth Ladyship]4084-your ladyship wants [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy to marry [[your]82-elizabeth daughter]3233-your daughter ; but would [my]3464-her ladyship giving [you]82-elizabeth the wished - for promise make _ [their]5195-their _ marriage at all more probable ? Supposing [him]89-mr. darcy to be attached to [me]3464-her ladyship , would _ [my]3464-her ladyship _ refusing to accept [his]89-mr. darcy hand make [him]89-mr. darcy wish to bestow it on [[his]89-mr. darcy cousin]704-his cousin ? Allow [me]3464-her ladyship to say , [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine , that the arguments with which [you]82-elizabeth have supported this extraordinary application have been as frivolous as the application was ill - judged . [You]82-elizabeth have widely mistaken [my]3464-her ladyship character , if [you]82-elizabeth think [I]3464-her ladyship can be worked on by such persuasions as these . How far [[your]82-elizabeth nephew]5158-your nephew might approve of [your]82-elizabeth interference in _ [his]5158-your nephew _ affairs , [I]3464-her ladyship can not tell ; but [you]82-elizabeth have certainly no right to concern [yourself]82-elizabeth in [mine]3464-her ladyship . [I]3464-her ladyship must beg , therefore , to be importuned no further on the subject . "[3464-her ladyship]

" Not so hasty , if [you]82-elizabeth please . [I]3464-her ladyship have by no means done . To all the objections [I]3464-her ladyship have already urged [I]3464-her ladyship have still another to add . [I]3464-her ladyship am no stranger to the particulars of [[your]82-elizabeth youngest sister]5198-your youngest sister 's infamous elopement . [I]3464-her ladyship know it all ; that [the young man]764-the young man 's marrying [her]5198-your youngest sister was a patched - up business , at the expense of [[your]82-elizabeth father]3223-your father and [uncle]5201-uncle . And is _ such _ [a girl]3566-a girl to be [[my]3464-her ladyship nephew 's sister]5203-my nephew 's sister ? Is _ [her]5198-your youngest sister _ husband , who is [the son of [[his]764-the young man late father 's steward]5205-his late father 's steward]5204-the son of his late father 's steward , to be [[his]764-the young man brother]2331-his brother ? Heaven and earth!--of what are [you]2814-you thinking ? Are the shades of [Pemberley]12-pemberley to be thus polluted ? "[3464-her ladyship]

" [You]2814-you can _ now _ have nothing further to say , "[2814-you] [she]2814-you resentfully answered . " [You]2814-you have insulted [me]2814-you , in every possible method . [I]2814-you must beg to return to [the house]3001-the house . "[2814-you]

And [she]2814-you rose as [she]2814-you spoke . [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine rose also , and [they]2815-they turned back . [[Her]86-lady catherine Ladyship]3464-her ladyship was highly incensed .

" [You]2814-you have no regard , then , for the honour and credit of [[my]3464-her ladyship nephew]5135-my nephew ! [Unfeeling , selfish girl]5209-unfeeling , selfish girl ! Do [you]2814-you not consider that a connection with [you]2814-you must disgrace [him]5135-my nephew in the eyes of [everybody]304-everybody ? "[3464-her ladyship]

" [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine , [I]86-lady catherine have nothing further to say . [You]86-lady catherine know [my]86-lady catherine sentiments . "[86-lady catherine]

" [You]2814-you are then resolved to have [him]5135-my nephew ? "[3464-her ladyship]

" [I]86-lady catherine have said no such thing . [I]86-lady catherine am only resolved to act in that manner , which will , in [my]86-lady catherine own opinion , constitute [my]86-lady catherine happiness , without reference to _ [you]86-lady catherine _ , or to [any person so wholly unconnected with [me]86-lady catherine]5211-any person so wholly unconnected with me . "[86-lady catherine]

" It is well . [You]2814-you refuse , then , to oblige [me]3464-her ladyship . [You]2814-you refuse to obey the claims of duty , honour , and gratitude . [You]2814-you are determined to ruin [him]5135-my nephew in the opinion of all [[his]5135-my nephew friends]407-his friends , and make [him]5135-my nephew the contempt of [the world]303-the world . "[3464-her ladyship]

" Neither duty , nor honour , nor gratitude , "[82-elizabeth] replied [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , " has any possible claim on [me]82-elizabeth , in the present instance . No principle of either would be violated by [my]82-elizabeth marriage with [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy . And with regard to the resentment of [[his]5135-my nephew family]375-his family , or the indignation of [the world]303-the world , if [the former _]5216-the former _ were _ excited by [his]5135-my nephew marrying [me]82-elizabeth , it would not give [me]82-elizabeth one moment 's concern -- and [the world]303-the world in general would have too much sense to join in the scorn . "[82-elizabeth]

" And this is [your]2814-you real opinion ! This is [your]2814-you final resolve ! Very well . [I]86-lady catherine shall now know how to act . Do not imagine , [Miss Bennet]82-elizabeth , that [your]2814-you ambition will ever be gratified . [I]86-lady catherine came to try [you]2814-you . [I]86-lady catherine hoped to find [you]2814-you reasonable ; but depend upon it [I]86-lady catherine will carry [my]86-lady catherine point . "[86-lady catherine]

In this manner [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine talked on till [they]2817-they were at the door of [the carriage]3217-the carriage , when , turning hastily round , [she]86-lady catherine added,--

" [I]86-lady catherine take no leave of [you]2814-you , [Miss Bennet]82-elizabeth . [I]86-lady catherine send no compliments to [[your]2814-you mother]3715-your mother . [You]2814-you deserve no such attention . [I]86-lady catherine am most seriously displeased . "[86-lady catherine]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth made no answer ; and without attempting to persuade [[her]82-elizabeth Ladyship]3464-her ladyship to return into [the house]3001-the house , walked quietly into [it]3001-the house [herself]82-elizabeth . [She]82-elizabeth heard [the carriage]3217-the carriage drive away as [she]82-elizabeth proceeded [upstairs]703-upstairs . [[Her]82-elizabeth mother]241-her mother impatiently met [her]82-elizabeth at the door of [[her]241-her mother dressing - room]4662-her dressing - room , to ask why [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine would not come in again and rest [herself]86-lady catherine .

" [She]86-lady catherine did not choose it , "[463-her daughter] said [[her]241-her mother daughter]463-her daughter ; " [she]86-lady catherine would go . "[463-her daughter]

" [She]86-lady catherine is [a very fine - looking woman]5219-a very fine - looking woman ! and [her]86-lady catherine calling [here]2994-here was prodigiously civil ! for [she]86-lady catherine only came , [I]463-her daughter suppose , to tell [us]5221-us [the Collinses]4423-the collinses were well . [She]86-lady catherine is on [[her]86-lady catherine road]5223-her road somewhere , [I]463-her daughter dare say ; and so , passing through [Meryton]9-meryton , thought [she]86-lady catherine might as well call on [you]82-elizabeth . [I]463-her daughter suppose [she]86-lady catherine had nothing particular to say to [you]82-elizabeth , [Lizzy]82-elizabeth ? "[463-her daughter]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth was forced to give in to a little falsehood here ; for to acknowledge the substance of [their]2826-their conversation was impossible .

CHAPTER LVII .

The discomposure of spirits which this extraordinary visit threw [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth into could not be easily overcome ; nor could [she]82-elizabeth for many hours learn to think of it less than incessantly . [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine , it appeared , had actually taken the trouble of this journey from [Rosings]20-rosings for the sole purpose of breaking off [her]86-lady catherine supposed engagement with [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy . It was a rational scheme , to be sure ! but from what the report of [their]2826-their engagement could originate , [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth was at a loss to imagine ; till [she]82-elizabeth recollected that _ [his]2827-his _ being [the intimate friend of [Bingley]91-miss bingley]2828-the intimate friend of bingley , and _ [her]2829-her _ being [the sister of [Jane]83-jane]2830-the sister of jane , was enough , at a time when the expectation of one wedding made [everybody eager for another]2831-everybody eager for another , to supply the idea . [She]82-elizabeth had not [herself]82-elizabeth forgotten to feel that the marriage of [[her]82-elizabeth sister]328-her sister must bring [them]2826-their more frequently together . And [[her]82-elizabeth neighbours]821-her neighbours at [Lucas Lodge]10-lucas lodge , therefore , ( for through [their]821-her neighbours communication with [the Collinses]4423-the collinses , the report , [she]82-elizabeth concluded , had reached [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine , ) had only set _ that _ down as almost certain and immediate which _ [she]86-lady catherine _ had looked forward to as possible at some future time .

In revolving [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine 's expressions , however , [she]86-lady catherine could not help feeling some uneasiness as to the possible consequence of [her]86-lady catherine persisting in this interference . From what [she]86-lady catherine had said of [her]86-lady catherine resolution to prevent the marriage , it occurred to [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth that [she]82-elizabeth must meditate an application to [[her]82-elizabeth nephew]3592-her nephew ; and how [he]3592-her nephew might take a similar representation of the evils attached to a connection with [her]82-elizabeth [she]82-elizabeth dared not pronounce . [She]82-elizabeth knew not the exact degree of [his]3592-her nephew affection for [[his]3592-her nephew aunt]924-his aunt , or [his]3592-her nephew dependence on [her]82-elizabeth judgment , but it was natural to suppose that [he]3592-her nephew thought much higher of [her]82-elizabeth Ladyship than _ [she]82-elizabeth _ could do ; and it was certain , that in enumerating the miseries of a marriage with _ one _ whose immediate connections were so unequal to [his]3592-her nephew own , [[his]3592-her nephew aunt]924-his aunt would address [him]3592-her nephew on [his]3592-her nephew weakest side . With [his]3592-her nephew notions of dignity , [he]3592-her nephew would probably feel that the arguments , which to [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth had appeared weak and ridiculous , contained much good sense and solid reasoning .

If [he]3592-her nephew had been wavering before , as to what [he]3592-her nephew should do , which had often seemed likely , the advice and entreaty of so near a relation might settle every doubt , and determine [him]3592-her nephew at once to be as happy as dignity unblemished could make [him]3592-her nephew . In that case [he]3592-her nephew would return no more . [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine might see [him]3592-her nephew in [her]86-lady catherine way through [town]264-town ; and [his]3592-her nephew engagement to [Bingley]91-miss bingley of coming again to [Netherfield]2-netherfield must give way .

" If , therefore , an excuse for not keeping [his]3592-her nephew promise should come to [[his]3592-her nephew friend]286-his friend within a few days , "[82-elizabeth] [she]82-elizabeth added , " [I]82-elizabeth shall know how to understand it . [I]82-elizabeth shall then give over every expectation , every wish of [his]3592-her nephew constancy . If [he]3592-her nephew is satisfied with only regretting [me]82-elizabeth , when [he]3592-her nephew might have obtained [my]82-elizabeth affections and hand , [I]82-elizabeth shall soon cease to regret [him]3592-her nephew at all . "[82-elizabeth]

The surprise of [the rest of [the family]416-the family]874-the rest of the family , on hearing who [[their]874-the rest of the family visitor]1550-their visitor had been , was very great : but [they]874-the rest of the family obligingly satisfied it with the same kind of supposition which had appeased [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet 's curiosity ; and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth was spared from much teasing on the subject .

The next morning , as [she]82-elizabeth was going down [stairs]519-stairs , [she]82-elizabeth was met by [[her]82-elizabeth father]244-her father , who came out of [[his]244-her father library]259-his library with a letter in [his]244-her father hand .

" [Lizzy]82-elizabeth , "[244-her father] said [he]244-her father , " [I]244-her father was going to look for [you]82-elizabeth : come into [[my]244-her father room]3753-my room . "[244-her father]

[She]82-elizabeth followed [him]244-her father thither ; and [her]82-elizabeth curiosity to know what [he]244-her father had to tell [her]82-elizabeth was heightened by the supposition of its being in some manner connected with the letter [he]244-her father held . It suddenly struck [her]82-elizabeth that it might be from [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine , and [she]82-elizabeth anticipated with dismay all the consequent explanations .

[She]82-elizabeth followed [[her]82-elizabeth father]244-her father to the fireplace , and [they]2846-they both sat down . [He]244-her father then said,--

" [I]244-her father have received a letter this morning that has astonished [me]244-her father exceedingly . As it principally concerns [yourself]82-elizabeth , [you]82-elizabeth ought to know its contents . [I]244-her father did not know before that [I]244-her father had _ two _ daughters on the brink of matrimony . Let [me]244-her father congratulate [you]82-elizabeth on a very important conquest . "[244-her father]

The colour now rushed into [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth 's cheeks in the instantaneous conviction of its being a letter from [the nephew]2847-the nephew , instead of [the aunt]2141-the aunt ; and [she]82-elizabeth was undetermined whether most to be pleased that [he]244-her father explained [himself]244-her father at all , or offended that [his]244-her father letter was not rather addressed to [herself]82-elizabeth , when [[her]82-elizabeth father]244-her father continued,--

" [You]82-elizabeth look conscious . [Young ladies]3263-young ladies have great penetration in such matters as these ; but [I]244-her father think [I]244-her father may defy even _ [your]82-elizabeth _ sagacity to discover the name of [[your]82-elizabeth admirer]5227-your admirer . This letter is from [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins . "[244-her father]

" From [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins ! and what can _ [he]244-her father _ have to say ? "[82-elizabeth]

" Something very much to the purpose , of course . [He]244-her father begins with congratulations on the approaching nuptials of [[my]244-her father eldest daughter]5228-my eldest daughter , of which , it seems , [he]244-her father has been told by [some of [the good - natured , gossiping Lucases]5230-the good - natured , gossiping lucases]5229-some of the good - natured , gossiping lucases . [I]244-her father shall not sport with [your]82-elizabeth impatience by reading what [he]244-her father says on that point . What relates to [yourself]82-elizabeth is as follows:--'Having thus offered [you]82-elizabeth the sincere congratulations of [Mrs. Collins]158-mrs. collins and [myself]244-her father on this happy event , let [me]244-her father now add a short hint on the subject of another , of which [we]5231-we have been advertised by the same authority . [[Your]82-elizabeth daughter]3233-your daughter [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , it is presumed , will not long bear the name of [Bennet]85-mrs. bennet , after [[her]3233-your daughter eldest sister]918-her eldest sister has resigned it ; and [the chosen partner of [her]3233-your daughter fate]5234-the chosen partner of her fate may be reasonably looked up to as [one of the most illustrious personages in [this land]5236-this land]5235-one of the most illustrious personages in this land . ' Can [you]82-elizabeth possibly guess , [Lizzy]82-elizabeth , who is meant by this ? ' [This young gentleman]5237-this young gentleman is blessed , in a peculiar way , with everything the heart of [mortal]5238-mortal can most desire,--splendid property , noble kindred , and extensive patronage . Yet , in spite of all these temptations , let [me]244-her father warn [[my]244-her father cousin]3414-my cousin [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , and [yourself]82-elizabeth , of what evils [you]82-elizabeth may incur by a precipitate closure with [this gentleman]3177-this gentleman 's proposals , which , of course , [you]82-elizabeth will be inclined to take immediate advantage of . ' Have [you]82-elizabeth any idea , [Lizzy]82-elizabeth , who [this gentleman]3177-this gentleman is ? But now it comes out . ' [My]244-her father motive for cautioning [you]82-elizabeth is as follows:--We have reason to imagine that [[his]3177-this gentleman aunt]924-his aunt , [Lady Catherine de Bourgh]86-lady catherine , does not look on the match with a friendly eye . ' _ [Mr. Darcy _]89-mr. darcy , [you]82-elizabeth see , is [the man]3091-the man ! Now , [Lizzy]82-elizabeth , [I]244-her father think [I]244-her father _ have _ surprised [you]82-elizabeth . Could [he]3177-this gentleman , or [the Lucases]100-the lucases , have pitched on [any man , within the circle of [our]5245-our acquaintance]5244-any man , within the circle of our acquaintance , whose name would have given the lie more effectually to what [they]5246-they related ? [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy , who never looks at [any woman but to see a blemish]5247-any woman but to see a blemish , and who probably never looked at _ [you]82-elizabeth _ in [his]3177-this gentleman life ! It is admirable ! "[244-her father]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth tried to join in [[her]82-elizabeth father]244-her father 's pleasantry , but could only force one most reluctant smile . Never had [his]244-her father wit been directed in a manner so little agreeable to [her]82-elizabeth .

" Are [you]244-her father not diverted ? "[82-elizabeth]

" Oh , yes . Pray read on . "[82-elizabeth]

" ' After mentioning the likelihood of this marriage to [[her]3177-this gentleman Ladyship]3464-her ladyship last night , [she]3177-this gentleman immediately , with [her]3177-this gentleman usual condescension , expressed what [she]3177-this gentleman felt on the occasion ; when it became apparent , that , on the score of some family objections on the part of [[my]82-elizabeth cousin]3414-my cousin , [she]3177-this gentleman would never give [her]3177-this gentleman consent to what [she]3177-this gentleman termed so disgraceful a match . [I]82-elizabeth thought it [my]82-elizabeth duty to give the speediest intelligence of this to [[my]82-elizabeth cousin]3414-my cousin , that [she]3177-this gentleman and [[her]3177-this gentleman noble admirer]5251-her noble admirer may be aware of what [they]5252-they are about , and not run hastily into a marriage which has not been properly sanctioned . ' [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins , moreover , adds , ' [I]82-elizabeth am truly rejoiced that [[my]82-elizabeth cousin]3414-my cousin [Lydia]84-lydia 's sad business has been so well hushed up , and am only concerned that [their]5252-they living together before the marriage took place should be so generally known . [I]82-elizabeth must not , however , neglect the duties of [my]82-elizabeth station , or refrain from declaring [my]82-elizabeth amazement , at hearing that [you]5254-his received [the young couple]2525-the young couple into [[your]5254-his house]3434-your house as soon as [they]2525-the young couple were married . It was an encouragement of vice ; and had [I]82-elizabeth been [the rector of [Longbourn]7-longbourn]5257-the rector of longbourn , [I]82-elizabeth should very strenuously have opposed it . [You]5254-his ought certainly to forgive [them]2525-the young couple as [a Christian]5258-a christian , but never to admit [them]2525-the young couple in [your]5254-his sight , or allow [their]2525-the young couple names to be mentioned in [your]5254-his hearing . ' _ That _ is [his]5254-his notion of Christian forgiveness ! The rest of [his]5254-his letter is only about [his]5254-his dear [Charlotte]172-charlotte 's situation , and [his]5254-his expectation of [a young olive - branch]5259-a young olive - branch . But , [Lizzy]82-elizabeth , [you]82-elizabeth look as if [you]82-elizabeth did not enjoy it . [You]82-elizabeth are not going to be _ missish _ , [I]82-elizabeth hope , and pretend to be affronted at an idle report . For what do [we]5260-our live , but to make sport for [[our]5260-our neighbours]5261-our neighbours , and laugh at [them]5261-our neighbours in [our]5260-our turn ? "[82-elizabeth]

" Oh , "[82-elizabeth] cried [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , " [I]82-elizabeth am exceedingly diverted . But it is so strange ! "[82-elizabeth]

" Yes , _ that _ is what makes it amusing . Had [they]2525-the young couple fixed on [any other man]5072-any other man it would have been nothing ; but _ [his]5254-his _ perfect indifference and _ [your]82-elizabeth _ pointed dislike make it so delightfully absurd ! Much as [I]82-elizabeth abominate writing , [I]82-elizabeth would not give up [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins 's correspondence for any consideration . Nay , when [I]82-elizabeth read a letter of [his]5254-his , [I]82-elizabeth can not help giving [him]5254-his the preference even over [Wickham]143-george wickham , much as [I]82-elizabeth value the impudence and hypocrisy of [[my]82-elizabeth son - in - law]5263-my son - in - law . And pray , [Lizzy]82-elizabeth , what said [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine about this report ? Did [she]86-lady catherine call to refuse [her]86-lady catherine consent ? "[82-elizabeth]

To this question [[his]2851-his daughter]1106-his daughter replied only with a laugh ; and as it had been asked without the least suspicion , [she]1106-his daughter was not distressed by [his]2851-his repeating it . [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth had never been more at a loss to make [her]82-elizabeth feelings appear what they were not . It was necessary to laugh when [she]82-elizabeth would rather have cried . [[Her]82-elizabeth father]244-her father had most cruelly mortified [her]82-elizabeth by what [he]244-her father said of [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy 's indifference ; and [she]82-elizabeth could do nothing but wonder at such a want of penetration , or fear that , perhaps , instead of [his]244-her father seeing too _ little _ , [she]82-elizabeth might have fancied too _ much _ .

CHAPTER LVIII .

Instead of receiving any such letter of excuse from [[his]2851-his friend]286-his friend , as [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth half expected [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley to do , [he]2851-his was able to bring [Darcy]89-mr. darcy with [him]2851-his to [Longbourn]7-longbourn before many days had passed after [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine 's visit . [The gentlemen]290-the gentlemen arrived early ; and , before [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet had time to tell [him]2851-his of [their]290-the gentlemen having seen [[his]2851-his aunt]924-his aunt , of which [[her]85-mrs. bennet daughter]463-her daughter sat in momentary dread , [Bingley]79-mr. bingley , who wanted to be alone with [Jane]83-jane , proposed [their]290-the gentlemen all walking out . It was agreed to . [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet was not in the habit of walking , [Mary]87-mary could never spare time , but [the remaining five]2858-the remaining five set off together . [Bingley]79-mr. bingley and [Jane]83-jane , however , soon allowed [the others]507-the others to outstrip [them]290-the gentlemen . [They]290-the gentlemen lagged behind , while [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , [Kitty]86-lady catherine , and [Darcy]89-mr. darcy were to entertain [each other]3144-each other . Very little was said by either ; [Kitty]86-lady catherine was too much afraid of [him]2851-his to talk ; [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth was secretly forming a desperate resolution ; and , perhaps , [he]2851-his might be doing the same .

[They]290-the gentlemen walked towards [the Lucases]100-the lucases ' , because [Kitty]86-lady catherine wished to call upon [Maria]94-maria ; and as [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth saw no occasion for making it a general concern , when [Kitty]86-lady catherine left [them]290-the gentlemen [she]86-lady catherine went boldly on with [him]2851-his alone . Now was the moment for [her]86-lady catherine resolution to be executed ; and while [her]86-lady catherine courage was high , [she]86-lady catherine immediately said,--

" [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy , [I]86-lady catherine am [a very selfish creature]5264-a very selfish creature , and for the sake of giving relief to [my]86-lady catherine own feelings care not how much [I]86-lady catherine may be wounding [yours]89-mr. darcy . [I]86-lady catherine can no longer help thanking [you]89-mr. darcy for [your]89-mr. darcy unexampled kindness to [[my]86-lady catherine poor sister]5265-my poor sister . Ever since [I]86-lady catherine have known it [I]86-lady catherine have been most anxious to acknowledge to [you]89-mr. darcy how gratefully [I]86-lady catherine feel it . Were it known to [the rest of [[my]86-lady catherine family]3727-my family]5266-the rest of my family [I]86-lady catherine should not have merely [my]86-lady catherine own gratitude to express . "[86-lady catherine]

" [I]89-mr. darcy am sorry , exceedingly sorry , "[89-mr. darcy] replied [Darcy]89-mr. darcy , in a tone of surprise and emotion , " that [you]89-mr. darcy have ever been informed of what may , in a mistaken light , have given [you]89-mr. darcy uneasiness . [I]89-mr. darcy did not think [Mrs. Gardiner]125-mrs. gardiner was so little to be trusted . "[89-mr. darcy]

" [You]89-mr. darcy must not blame [[my]86-lady catherine aunt]3204-my aunt . [Lydia]84-lydia 's thoughtlessness first betrayed to [me]86-lady catherine that [you]89-mr. darcy had been concerned in the matter ; and , of course , [I]86-lady catherine could not rest till [I]86-lady catherine knew the particulars . Let [me]86-lady catherine thank [you]89-mr. darcy again and again , in the name of all [[my]86-lady catherine family]3727-my family , for that generous compassion which induced [you]89-mr. darcy to take so much trouble , and bear so many mortifications , for the sake of discovering them . "[86-lady catherine]

" If [you]89-mr. darcy _ will _ thank [me]89-mr. darcy , "[89-mr. darcy] [he]89-mr. darcy replied , " let it be for [yourself]89-mr. darcy alone . That the wish of giving happiness to [you]89-mr. darcy might add force to the other inducements which led [me]89-mr. darcy on , [I]89-mr. darcy shall not attempt to deny . But [[your]89-mr. darcy _ family]4548-your _ family _ owe [me]89-mr. darcy nothing . Much as [I]89-mr. darcy respect [them]4548-your _ family , [I]89-mr. darcy believe [I]89-mr. darcy thought only of _ [you]89-mr. darcy _ . "[89-mr. darcy]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth was too much embarrassed to say a word . After a short pause , [[her]82-elizabeth companion]1675-her companion added , " [You]89-mr. darcy are too generous to trifle with [me]1675-her companion . If [your]89-mr. darcy feelings are still what they were last [April]217-april , tell [me]1675-her companion so at once . _ [My]1675-her companion _ affections and wishes are unchanged ; but one word from [you]89-mr. darcy will silence [me]1675-her companion on this subject for ever . "[1675-her companion]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , feeling all the more than common awkwardness and anxiety of [his]1675-her companion situation , now forced [herself]82-elizabeth to speak ; and immediately , though not very fluently , gave [him]1675-her companion to understand that [her]82-elizabeth sentiments had undergone so material a change since the period to which [he]1675-her companion alluded , as to make [her]82-elizabeth receive with gratitude and pleasure [his]1675-her companion present assurances . The happiness which this reply produced was such as [he]1675-her companion had probably never felt before ; and [he]1675-her companion expressed [himself]1675-her companion on the occasion as sensibly and as warmly as [a man violently in love]2862-a man violently in love can be supposed to do .
