Had [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth been able to encounter [his]1675-her companion eyes , [she]82-elizabeth might have seen how well the expression of heartfelt delight diffused over [his]1675-her companion face became [him]1675-her companion : but though [she]82-elizabeth could not look [she]82-elizabeth could listen ; and [he]1675-her companion told [her]82-elizabeth of feelings which , in proving of what importance [she]82-elizabeth was to [him]1675-her companion , made [his]1675-her companion affection every moment more valuable .

[They]2863-they walked on without knowing in what direction . There was too much to be thought , and felt , and said , for attention to any other objects . [She]82-elizabeth soon learnt that [they]2863-they were indebted for [their]2863-they present good understanding to the efforts of [[his]1675-her companion aunt]924-his aunt , who _ did _ call on [him]1675-her companion in [her]924-his aunt return through [London]5-london , and there relate [her]924-his aunt journey to [Longbourn]7-longbourn , its motive , and the substance of [her]924-his aunt conversation with [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth ; dwelling emphatically on every expression of the latter , which , in [her]82-elizabeth Ladyship 's apprehension , peculiarly denoted [her]82-elizabeth perverseness and assurance , in the belief that such a relation must assist [her]82-elizabeth endeavours to obtain that promise from [[her]82-elizabeth nephew]3592-her nephew which _ [she]82-elizabeth _ had refused to give . But , unluckily for [her]82-elizabeth Ladyship , its effect had been exactly contrariwise .

" It taught [me]1675-her companion to hope , "[1675-her companion] said [he]1675-her companion , " as [I]1675-her companion had scarcely ever allowed [myself]1675-her companion to hope before . [I]1675-her companion knew enough of [your]82-elizabeth disposition to be certain , that had [you]82-elizabeth been absolutely , irrevocably decided against [me]1675-her companion , [you]82-elizabeth would have acknowledged it to [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine frankly and openly . "[1675-her companion]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth coloured and laughed as [she]82-elizabeth replied , " Yes , [you]82-elizabeth know enough of [my]82-elizabeth _ frankness _ to believe [me]82-elizabeth capable of _ that _ . After abusing [you]82-elizabeth so abominably to [your]82-elizabeth face , [I]82-elizabeth could have no scruple in abusing [you]82-elizabeth to all [your]82-elizabeth relations . "[82-elizabeth]

" What did [you]82-elizabeth say of [me]1675-her companion that [I]1675-her companion did not deserve ? For though [your]82-elizabeth accusations were ill - founded , formed on mistaken premises , [my]1675-her companion behaviour to [you]82-elizabeth at the time had merited the severest reproof . It was unpardonable . [I]1675-her companion can not think of it without abhorrence . "[1675-her companion]

" [We]5271-we will not quarrel for the greater share of blame annexed to that evening , "[82-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth . " The conduct of neither , if strictly examined , will be irreproachable ; but since then [we]5271-we have both , [I]82-elizabeth hope , improved in civility . "[82-elizabeth]

" [I]1675-her companion can not be so easily reconciled to [myself]1675-her companion . The recollection of what [I]1675-her companion then said , of [my]1675-her companion conduct , [my]1675-her companion manners , [my]1675-her companion expressions during the whole of it , is now , and has been many months , inexpressibly painful to [me]1675-her companion . [Your]82-elizabeth reproof , so well applied , [I]1675-her companion shall never forget : ' Had [you]82-elizabeth behaved in a more gentlemanlike manner . ' Those were [your]82-elizabeth words . [You]82-elizabeth know not , [you]82-elizabeth can scarcely conceive , how [they]5272-their have tortured [me]1675-her companion ; though it was some time , [I]1675-her companion confess , before [I]1675-her companion was reasonable enough to allow [their]5272-their justice . "[1675-her companion]

" [I]82-elizabeth was certainly very far from expecting [them]5272-their to make so strong an impression . [I]82-elizabeth had not the smallest idea of [their]5272-their being ever felt in such a way . "[82-elizabeth]

" [I]1675-her companion can easily believe it . [You]82-elizabeth thought [me]1675-her companion then devoid of every proper feeling , [I]1675-her companion am sure [you]82-elizabeth did . The turn of [your]82-elizabeth countenance [I]1675-her companion shall never forget , as [you]82-elizabeth said that [I]1675-her companion could not have addressed [you]82-elizabeth in any possible way that would induce [you]82-elizabeth to accept [me]1675-her companion . "[1675-her companion]

" Oh , do not repeat what [I]82-elizabeth then said . These recollections will not do at all . [I]82-elizabeth assure [you]82-elizabeth that [I]82-elizabeth have long been most heartily ashamed of it . "[82-elizabeth]

[Darcy]89-mr. darcy mentioned [his]89-mr. darcy letter . " Did it , "[89-mr. darcy] said he,--"did it _ soon _ make [you]82-elizabeth think better of [me]2866-her ? Did [you]82-elizabeth , on reading it , give any credit to its contents ? "[2866-her]

[She]2866-her explained what its effects on [her]2866-her had been , and how gradually all [her]2866-her former prejudices had been removed .

" [I]89-mr. darcy knew , "[89-mr. darcy] said [he]89-mr. darcy , " that what [I]89-mr. darcy wrote must give [you]82-elizabeth pain , but it was necessary . [I]89-mr. darcy hope [you]82-elizabeth have destroyed the letter . There was one part , especially the opening of it , which [I]89-mr. darcy should dread [your]82-elizabeth having the power of reading again . [I]89-mr. darcy can remember some expressions which might justly make [you]82-elizabeth hate [me]89-mr. darcy . "[89-mr. darcy]

" The letter shall certainly be burnt , if [you]82-elizabeth believe it essential to the preservation of [my]89-mr. darcy regard ; but , though [we]5273-we have both reason to think [my]89-mr. darcy opinions not entirely unalterable , they are not , [I]89-mr. darcy hope , quite so easily changed as that implies . "[89-mr. darcy]

" When [I]89-mr. darcy wrote that letter , "[89-mr. darcy] replied [Darcy]89-mr. darcy , " [I]89-mr. darcy believed [myself]89-mr. darcy perfectly calm and cool ; but [I]89-mr. darcy am since convinced that it was written in a dreadful bitterness of spirit . "[89-mr. darcy]

" The letter , perhaps , began in bitterness , but it did not end so . The adieu is charity itself . But think no more of the letter . The feelings of [the person who wrote]5274-the person who wrote and [the person who received it]5275-the person who received it are now so widely different from what [they]5273-we were then , that every unpleasant circumstance attending it ought to be forgotten . [You]82-elizabeth must learn some of [my]89-mr. darcy philosophy . Think only of the past as its remembrance gives [you]82-elizabeth pleasure . "[89-mr. darcy]

" [I]89-mr. darcy can not give [you]82-elizabeth credit for any philosophy of the kind . _ [Your]82-elizabeth _ retrospections must be so totally void of reproach , that the contentment arising from them is not of philosophy , but , what is much better , of ignorance . But with _ [me]89-mr. darcy _ , it is not so . Painful recollections will intrude , which can not , which ought not to be repelled . [I]89-mr. darcy have been [a selfish being]5276-a selfish being all [my]89-mr. darcy life , in practice , though not in principle . As [a child]3569-a child [I]89-mr. darcy was taught what was _ right _ , but [I]89-mr. darcy was not taught to correct [my]89-mr. darcy temper . [I]89-mr. darcy was given good principles , but left to follow them in pride and conceit . Unfortunately [an only son]5278-an only son ( for many years [an only _ child]5279-an only _ child _ ) , [I]89-mr. darcy was spoiled by [[my]89-mr. darcy parents]5280-my parents , who , though good [themselves]5280-my parents , ( [[my]89-mr. darcy father]3256-my father particularly , all that was benevolent and amiable , ) allowed , encouraged , almost taught [me]89-mr. darcy to be selfish and overbearing , to care for [none beyond [[my]89-mr. darcy own family circle]5283-my own family circle]5282-none beyond my own family circle , to think meanly of all the rest of [the world]303-the world , to _ wish _ at least to think meanly of [their]5280-my parents sense and worth compared with [my]89-mr. darcy own . Such [I]89-mr. darcy was , from eight to eight - and - twenty ; and such [I]89-mr. darcy might still have been but for [you]5285-you , dearest , [loveliest Elizabeth]82-elizabeth ! What do [I]89-mr. darcy not owe [you]5285-you ! [You]5285-you taught [me]89-mr. darcy a lesson , hard indeed at first , but most advantageous . By [you]5285-you , [I]89-mr. darcy was properly humbled . [I]89-mr. darcy came to [you]5285-you without a doubt of [my]89-mr. darcy reception . [You]5285-you showed [me]89-mr. darcy how insufficient were all [my]89-mr. darcy pretensions to please [a woman worthy of being pleased]5286-a woman worthy of being pleased . "[89-mr. darcy]

" Had [you]5285-you then persuaded [yourself]5285-you that [I]89-mr. darcy should ? "[89-mr. darcy]

" Indeed [I]89-mr. darcy had . What will [you]5285-you think of [my]89-mr. darcy vanity ? [I]89-mr. darcy believed [you]5285-you to be wishing , expecting [my]89-mr. darcy addresses . "[89-mr. darcy]

" [My]89-mr. darcy manners must have been in fault , but not intentionally , [I]89-mr. darcy assure [you]5285-you . [I]89-mr. darcy never meant to deceive [you]5285-you , but [my]89-mr. darcy spirits might often lead [me]89-mr. darcy wrong . How [you]5285-you must have hated [me]89-mr. darcy after _ that _ evening ! "[89-mr. darcy]

" Hate [you]5285-you ! [I]89-mr. darcy was angry , perhaps , at first , but [my]89-mr. darcy anger soon began to take a proper direction . "[89-mr. darcy]

" [I]89-mr. darcy am almost afraid of asking what [you]5285-you thought of [me]89-mr. darcy when [we]5287-we met at [Pemberley]12-pemberley . [You]5285-you blamed [me]89-mr. darcy for coming ? "[89-mr. darcy]

" No , indeed , [I]89-mr. darcy felt nothing but surprise . "[89-mr. darcy]

" [Your]89-mr. darcy surprise could not be greater than _ mine _ in being noticed by [you]5285-you . [My]89-mr. darcy conscience told [me]89-mr. darcy that [I]89-mr. darcy deserved no extraordinary politeness , and [I]89-mr. darcy confess that [I]89-mr. darcy did not expect to receive _ more _ than [my]89-mr. darcy due . "[89-mr. darcy]

" [My]89-mr. darcy object _ then _ , "[89-mr. darcy] replied [Darcy]89-mr. darcy , " was to show [you]5285-you , by every civility in [my]89-mr. darcy power , that [I]89-mr. darcy was not so mean as to resent the past ; and [I]89-mr. darcy hoped to obtain [your]5285-you forgiveness , to lessen [your]5285-you ill opinion , by letting [you]5285-you see that [your]5285-you reproofs had been attended to . How soon any other wishes introduced [themselves]5288-themselves , [I]89-mr. darcy can hardly tell , but [I]89-mr. darcy believe in about half an hour after [I]89-mr. darcy had seen [you]5285-you . "[89-mr. darcy]

[He]89-mr. darcy then told [her]2867-her of [Georgiana]147-georgiana 's delight in [her]147-georgiana acquaintance , and of [her]147-georgiana disappointment at its sudden interruption ; which naturally leading to the cause of that interruption , [she]2867-her soon learnt that [his]89-mr. darcy resolution of following [her]147-georgiana from [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire in quest of [[her]147-georgiana sister]328-her sister had been formed before [he]89-mr. darcy quitted [the inn]1717-the inn , and that [his]89-mr. darcy gravity and thoughtfulness there had arisen from no other struggles than what such a purpose must comprehend .

[She]2867-her expressed [her]2867-her gratitude again , but it was too painful a subject to each to be dwelt on farther .

After walking several miles in a leisurely manner , and too busy to know anything about it , [they]2870-their found at last , on examining [their]2870-their watches , that it was time to be at [home]3219-home .

" What could have become of [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley and [Jane]83-jane ? "[147-georgiana] was a wonder which introduced the discussion of _ [their]2870-their _ affairs . [Darcy]147-georgiana was delighted with [their]2870-their engagement ; [[his]89-mr. darcy friend]286-his friend had given [him]89-mr. darcy the earliest information of it .

" [I]82-elizabeth must ask whether [you]89-mr. darcy were surprised ? "[82-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth .

" Not at all . When [I]82-elizabeth went away , [I]82-elizabeth felt that it would soon happen . "[82-elizabeth]

" That is to say , [you]89-mr. darcy had given [your]89-mr. darcy permission . [I]89-mr. darcy guessed as much . "[89-mr. darcy] And though [he]89-mr. darcy exclaimed at the term , [she]82-elizabeth found that it had been pretty much the case .

" On the evening before [my]89-mr. darcy going to [London]5-london , "[89-mr. darcy] said [he]89-mr. darcy , " [I]89-mr. darcy made a confession to [him]89-mr. darcy , which [I]89-mr. darcy believe [I]89-mr. darcy ought to have made long ago . [I]89-mr. darcy told [him]89-mr. darcy of all that had occurred to make [my]89-mr. darcy former interference in [his]89-mr. darcy affairs absurd and impertinent . [His]89-mr. darcy surprise was great . [He]89-mr. darcy had never had the slightest suspicion . [I]89-mr. darcy told [him]89-mr. darcy , moreover , that [I]89-mr. darcy believed [myself]89-mr. darcy mistaken in supposing , as [I]89-mr. darcy had done , that [[your]2873-i sister]3139-your sister was indifferent to [him]89-mr. darcy ; and as [I]89-mr. darcy could easily perceive that [his]89-mr. darcy attachment to [her]3139-your sister was unabated , [I]89-mr. darcy felt no doubt of [their]5290-their happiness together . "[89-mr. darcy]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth could not help smiling at [his]2873-i easy manner of directing [[his]2873-i friend]286-his friend .

" Did [you]2873-i speak from [your]2873-i own observation , "[82-elizabeth] said [she]82-elizabeth , " when [you]2873-i told [him]89-mr. darcy that [[my]82-elizabeth sister]3280-my sister loved [him]89-mr. darcy , or merely from [my]82-elizabeth information last spring ? "[82-elizabeth]

" From [the former]327-the former . [I]2873-i had narrowly observed [her]3139-your sister , during the two visits which [I]2873-i had lately made [her]3139-your sister [here]2994-here ; and [I]2873-i was convinced of [her]3139-your sister affection . "[2873-i]

" And [your]2873-i assurance of it , [I]82-elizabeth suppose , carried immediate conviction to [him]89-mr. darcy . "[82-elizabeth]

" It did . [Bingley]79-mr. bingley is most unaffectedly modest . [His]79-mr. bingley diffidence had prevented [his]79-mr. bingley depending on [his]79-mr. bingley own judgment in so anxious a case , but [his]79-mr. bingley reliance on [mine]82-elizabeth made everything easy . [I]2873-i was obliged to confess one thing , which for a time , and not unjustly , offended [him]79-mr. bingley . [I]2873-i could not allow [myself]2873-i to conceal that [[your]2873-i sister]3139-your sister had been in [town]264-town three months last winter , that [I]2873-i had known it , and purposely kept it from [him]79-mr. bingley . [He]79-mr. bingley was angry . But [his]79-mr. bingley anger , [I]2873-i am persuaded , lasted no longer than [he]79-mr. bingley remained in any doubt of [[your]2873-i sister]3139-your sister 's sentiments . [He]79-mr. bingley has heartily forgiven [me]2873-i now . "[2873-i]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth longed to observe that [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley had been [a most delightful friend]2875-a most delightful friend ; so easily guided that [his]79-mr. bingley worth was invaluable ; but [she]82-elizabeth checked [herself]82-elizabeth . [She]82-elizabeth remembered that [he]79-mr. bingley had yet to learn to be laughed at , and it was rather too early to begin . In anticipating the happiness of [Bingley]79-mr. bingley , which of course was to be inferior only to [his]79-mr. bingley own , [he]79-mr. bingley continued the conversation till [they]2876-they reached [the house]3001-the house . In [the hall]685-the hall [they]2876-they parted .

[CHAPTER LIX]218-chapter lix .

" [[My]218-chapter lix dear]2993-my dear [Lizzy]82-elizabeth , where can [you]82-elizabeth have been walking to ? "[218-chapter lix] was a question which [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth received from [Jane]83-jane as soon as [she]82-elizabeth entered [the room]250-the room , and from [all the others]2880-all the others when [they]2876-they sat down to table . [She]82-elizabeth had only to say in reply , that [they]2876-they had wandered about till [she]82-elizabeth was beyond [her]82-elizabeth own knowledge . [She]82-elizabeth coloured as [she]82-elizabeth spoke ; but neither that , nor anything else , awakened a suspicion of the truth .

The evening passed quietly , unmarked by anything extraordinary . [The acknowledged lovers]2881-the acknowledged lovers talked and laughed ; the unacknowledged were silent . [Darcy]147-georgiana was not of a disposition in which happiness overflows in mirth ; and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , agitated and confused , rather _ knew _ that [she]82-elizabeth was happy than _ felt _ [herself]82-elizabeth to be so ; for , besides the immediate embarrassment , there were other evils before [her]82-elizabeth . [She]82-elizabeth anticipated what would be felt in [the family]416-the family when [her]82-elizabeth situation became known : [she]82-elizabeth was aware that [no one]3271-no one liked [him]2884-him but [Jane]83-jane ; and even feared that with [the others]507-the others it was a _ dislike _ which not all [his]2884-him fortune and consequence might do away .

At night [she]82-elizabeth opened [her]82-elizabeth heart to [Jane]83-jane . Though suspicion was very far from [Miss Bennet]82-elizabeth 's general habits , [she]82-elizabeth was absolutely incredulous here .

" [You]83-jane are joking , [Lizzy]82-elizabeth . This can not be ! Engaged to [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy ! No , no , [you]83-jane shall not deceive [me]82-elizabeth : [I]82-elizabeth know it to be impossible . "[82-elizabeth]

" This is a wretched beginning , indeed ! [My]82-elizabeth sole dependence was on [you]83-jane ; and [I]82-elizabeth am sure [nobody else]1483-nobody else will believe [me]82-elizabeth , if [you]83-jane do not . Yet , indeed , [I]82-elizabeth am in earnest . [I]82-elizabeth speak nothing but the truth . [He]89-mr. darcy still loves [me]82-elizabeth , and [we]5299-we are engaged . "[82-elizabeth]

[Jane]83-jane looked at [her]83-jane doubtingly . " Oh , [Lizzy]82-elizabeth ! it can not be . [I]83-jane know how much [you]83-jane dislike [him]89-mr. darcy . "[83-jane]

" [You]83-jane know nothing of the matter . _ That _ is all to be forgot . Perhaps [I]82-elizabeth did not always love [him]89-mr. darcy so well as [I]82-elizabeth do now ; but in such cases as these a good memory is unpardonable . This is the last time [I]82-elizabeth shall ever remember it [myself]82-elizabeth . "[82-elizabeth]

[Miss Bennet]82-elizabeth still looked all amazement . [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth again , and more seriously , assured [her]83-jane of its truth .

" Good heaven ! can it be really so ? Yet now [I]83-jane must believe [you]83-jane , "[83-jane] cried [Jane]83-jane . " [[My]83-jane dear]2993-my dear , dear [Lizzy]82-elizabeth , [I]83-jane would , [I]83-jane do congratulate [you]82-elizabeth ; but are [you]82-elizabeth certain -- forgive the question -- are [you]82-elizabeth quite certain that [you]82-elizabeth can be happy with [him]89-mr. darcy ? "[83-jane]

" There can be no doubt of that . It is settled between [us]5301-we already that [we]5301-we are to be [the happiest couple in [the world]303-the world]5302-the happiest couple in the world . But are [you]82-elizabeth pleased , [Jane]83-jane ? Shall [you]82-elizabeth like to have such [a brother]440-a brother ? "[82-elizabeth]

" Very , very much . Nothing could give either [Bingley]79-mr. bingley or [myself]83-jane more delight . But [we]5301-we considered it , [we]5301-we talked of it as impossible . And do [you]82-elizabeth really love [him]89-mr. darcy quite well enough ? Oh , [Lizzy]82-elizabeth ! do anything rather than marry without affection . Are [you]82-elizabeth quite sure that [you]82-elizabeth feel what [you]82-elizabeth ought to do ? "[83-jane]

" Oh , yes ! [You]82-elizabeth will only think [I]82-elizabeth feel _ more _ than [I]82-elizabeth ought to do when [I]82-elizabeth tell [you]82-elizabeth all . "[82-elizabeth]

" What do [you]82-elizabeth mean ? "[83-jane]

" Why , [I]82-elizabeth must confess that [I]82-elizabeth love [him]89-mr. darcy better than [I]82-elizabeth do [Bingley]79-mr. bingley . [I]82-elizabeth am afraid [you]82-elizabeth will be angry . "[82-elizabeth]

" [[My]83-jane dearest sister]4567-my dearest sister , now be , _ be _ serious . [I]83-jane want to talk very seriously . Let [me]83-jane know everything that [I]83-jane am to know without delay . Will [you]82-elizabeth tell [me]83-jane how long [you]82-elizabeth have loved [him]89-mr. darcy ? "[83-jane]

" It has been coming on so gradually , that [I]82-elizabeth hardly know when it began ; but [I]82-elizabeth believe [I]82-elizabeth must date it from [my]82-elizabeth first seeing [[his]89-mr. darcy beautiful grounds at [Pemberley]12-pemberley]5306-his beautiful grounds at pemberley . "[82-elizabeth]

Another entreaty that [she]2886-i would be serious , however , produced the desired effect ; and [she]2886-i soon satisfied [Jane]83-jane by [her]2886-i solemn assurances of attachment . When convinced on that article , [Miss Bennet]82-elizabeth had nothing further to wish .

" Now [I]2886-i am quite happy , "[2886-i] said [she]2886-i , " for [you]82-elizabeth will be as happy as [myself]2886-i . [I]2886-i always had a value for [him]89-mr. darcy . Were it for nothing but [his]89-mr. darcy love of [you]82-elizabeth , [I]2886-i must always have esteemed [him]89-mr. darcy ; but now , as [[Bingley]79-mr. bingley 's friend]5307-bingley 's friend and [[your]82-elizabeth husband]5308-your husband , there can be only [Bingley]79-mr. bingley and [yourself]82-elizabeth more dear to [me]2886-i . But , [Lizzy]82-elizabeth , [you]82-elizabeth have been very sly , very reserved with [me]2886-i . How little did [you]82-elizabeth tell [me]2886-i of what passed at [Pemberley]12-pemberley and [Lambton]44-lambton ! [I]2886-i owe all that [I]2886-i know of it to another , not to [you]82-elizabeth . "[2886-i]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth told [her]82-elizabeth the motives of [her]82-elizabeth secrecy . [She]82-elizabeth had been unwilling to mention [Bingley]79-mr. bingley ; and the unsettled state of [her]82-elizabeth own feelings had made [her]82-elizabeth equally avoid the name of [[his]79-mr. bingley friend]286-his friend : but now [she]82-elizabeth would no longer conceal from [her]82-elizabeth [his]79-mr. bingley share in [Lydia]84-lydia 's marriage . All was acknowledged , and half the night spent in conversation .

" Good gracious ! "[85-mrs. bennet] cried [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet , as [she]85-mrs. bennet stood at a window the next morning , " if [that disagreeable Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy is not coming here again with [[our]5309-our dear]5310-our dear [Bingley]79-mr. bingley ! What can [he]89-mr. darcy mean by being so tiresome as to be always coming [here]2994-here ? [I]85-mrs. bennet had no notion but [he]89-mr. darcy would go a - shooting , or something or other , and not disturb [us]5309-our with [his]89-mr. darcy company . What shall [we]5309-our do with [him]89-mr. darcy ? [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth could hardly help laughing at so convenient a proposal ; yet was really vexed that [[her]82-elizabeth mother]241-her mother should be always giving [him]2889-him such an epithet .

As soon as [they]2890-they entered , [Bingley]79-mr. bingley looked at [her]82-elizabeth so expressively , and shook hands with such warmth , as left no doubt of [his]79-mr. bingley good information ; and [he]79-mr. bingley soon afterwards said aloud , " [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet , have [you]85-mrs. bennet no more lanes hereabouts in which [Lizzy]82-elizabeth may lose [her]82-elizabeth way again to - day ? "[79-mr. bingley]

" [I]85-mrs. bennet advise [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy , and [Lizzy]82-elizabeth , and [Kitty]86-lady catherine , "[85-mrs. bennet] said [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet , " to walk to [Oakham Mount]71-oakham mount this morning . It is a nice long walk , and [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy has never seen the view . "[85-mrs. bennet]

" It may do very well for the others , "[79-mr. bingley] replied [Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley ; " but [I]79-mr. bingley am sure it will be too much for [Kitty]86-lady catherine . Wo n't it , [Kitty]86-lady catherine ? "[79-mr. bingley]

[Kitty]86-lady catherine owned that [she]86-lady catherine had rather stay at [home]3219-home . [Darcy]89-mr. darcy professed a great curiosity to see the view from [the Mount]2892-the mount , and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth silently consented . As [she]82-elizabeth went [upstairs]703-upstairs to get ready , [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet followed [her]82-elizabeth , saying,--

" [I]85-mrs. bennet am quite sorry , [Lizzy]82-elizabeth , that [you]82-elizabeth should be forced to have [that disagreeable man]5312-that disagreeable man all to [yourself]82-elizabeth ; but [I]85-mrs. bennet hope [you]82-elizabeth will not mind it . It is all for [Jane]83-jane 's sake , [you]82-elizabeth know ; and there is no occasion for talking to [him]5312-that disagreeable man except just now and then ; so do not put [yourself]82-elizabeth to inconvenience . "[85-mrs. bennet]

During [their]2894-their walk , it was resolved that [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet 's consent should be asked in the course of the evening : [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth reserved to [herself]82-elizabeth the application for [[her]82-elizabeth mother]241-her mother 's . [She]82-elizabeth could not determine how [[her]82-elizabeth mother]241-her mother would take it ; sometimes doubting whether all [his]75-mr. bennet wealth and grandeur would be enough to overcome [her]82-elizabeth abhorrence of [the man]3091-the man ; but whether [she]82-elizabeth were violently set against the match , or violently delighted with it , it was certain that [her]82-elizabeth manner would be equally ill adapted to do credit to [her]82-elizabeth sense ; and [she]82-elizabeth could no more bear that [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy should hear the first raptures of [her]82-elizabeth joy , than the first vehemence of [her]82-elizabeth disapprobation .

In the evening , soon after [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet withdrew to [the library]1011-the library , [she]82-elizabeth saw [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy rise also and follow [him]89-mr. darcy , and [her]82-elizabeth agitation on seeing it was extreme . [She]82-elizabeth did not fear [[her]82-elizabeth father]244-her father 's opposition , but [he]244-her father was going to be made unhappy , and that it should be through [her]82-elizabeth means ; that _ [she]82-elizabeth _ , [[his]244-her father favourite child]2900-his favourite child , should be distressing [him]244-her father by [her]82-elizabeth choice , should be filling [him]244-her father with fears and regrets in disposing of [her]82-elizabeth , was a wretched reflection , and [she]82-elizabeth sat in misery till [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy appeared again , when , looking at [him]89-mr. darcy , [she]82-elizabeth was a little relieved by [his]89-mr. darcy smile . In a few minutes [he]89-mr. darcy approached the table where [she]82-elizabeth was sitting with [Kitty]86-lady catherine ; and , while pretending to admire [her]82-elizabeth work , said in a whisper , " Go to [[your]82-elizabeth father]3223-your father ; [he]244-her father wants [you]82-elizabeth in [the library]1011-the library . "[82-elizabeth] [She]82-elizabeth was gone directly .

[[Her]82-elizabeth father]244-her father was walking about [the room]250-the room , looking grave and anxious . " [Lizzy]82-elizabeth , "[244-her father] said [he]244-her father , " what are [you]82-elizabeth doing ? Are [you]82-elizabeth out of [your]82-elizabeth senses to be accepting [this man]3106-this man ? Have not [you]82-elizabeth always hated [him]3106-this man ? "[244-her father]

How earnestly did [she]82-elizabeth then wish that [her]82-elizabeth former opinions had been more reasonable , [her]82-elizabeth expressions more moderate ! It would have spared [her]82-elizabeth from explanations and professions which it was exceedingly awkward to give ; but they were now necessary , and [she]82-elizabeth assured [him]244-her father , with some confusion , of [her]82-elizabeth attachment to [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy .

" Or , in other words , [you]244-her father are determined to have [him]3106-this man . [He]3106-this man is rich , to be sure , and [you]244-her father may have more fine clothes and [fine carriages]5316-fine carriages than [Jane]83-jane . But will [they]5317-they make [you]244-her father happy ? "[82-elizabeth]

" Have [you]244-her father any other objection , "[82-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , " than [your]244-her father belief of [my]82-elizabeth indifference ? "[82-elizabeth]

" None at all . [We]5318-we all know [him]3106-this man to be [a proud , unpleasant sort of man]5319-a proud , unpleasant sort of man ; but this would be nothing if [you]244-her father really liked [him]3106-this man . "[82-elizabeth]

" [I]82-elizabeth do , [I]82-elizabeth do like [him]3106-this man , "[82-elizabeth] [she]82-elizabeth replied , with tears in [her]82-elizabeth eyes ; " [I]82-elizabeth love [him]3106-this man . Indeed [he]3106-this man has no improper pride . [He]3106-this man is perfectly amiable . [You]244-her father do not know what [he]3106-this man really is ; then pray do not pain [me]82-elizabeth by speaking of [him]3106-this man in such terms . "[82-elizabeth]

" [Lizzy]82-elizabeth , "[244-her father] said [[her]82-elizabeth father]244-her father , " [I]244-her father have given [him]3106-this man [my]244-her father consent . [He]3106-this man is [the kind of man]5320-the kind of man , indeed , to whom [I]244-her father should never dare refuse anything , which [he]3106-this man condescended to ask . [I]244-her father now give it to _ [you]82-elizabeth _ , if [you]82-elizabeth are resolved on having [him]3106-this man . But let [me]244-her father advise [you]82-elizabeth to think better of it . [I]244-her father know [your]82-elizabeth disposition , [Lizzy]82-elizabeth . [I]244-her father know that [you]82-elizabeth could be neither happy nor respectable , unless [you]82-elizabeth truly esteemed [[your]82-elizabeth husband]5308-your husband , unless [you]82-elizabeth looked up to [him]5308-your husband as [a superior]5322-a superior . [Your]82-elizabeth lively talents would place [you]82-elizabeth in the greatest danger in an unequal marriage . [You]82-elizabeth could scarcely escape discredit and misery . [[My]244-her father child]5323-my child , let [me]244-her father not have the grief of seeing _ [you]82-elizabeth _ unable to respect [[your]82-elizabeth partner]3071-your partner in life . [You]82-elizabeth know not what [you]82-elizabeth are about . "[244-her father]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , still more affected , was earnest and solemn in [her]82-elizabeth reply ; and , at length , by repeated assurances that [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy was really the object of [her]82-elizabeth choice , by explaining the gradual change which [her]82-elizabeth estimation of [him]89-mr. darcy had undergone , relating [her]82-elizabeth absolute certainty that [his]89-mr. darcy affection was not the work of a day , but had stood the test of many months ' suspense , and enumerating with energy all [his]89-mr. darcy good qualities , [she]82-elizabeth did conquer [[her]82-elizabeth father]244-her father 's incredulity , and reconcile [him]89-mr. darcy to the match .

" Well , [[my]89-mr. darcy dear]2993-my dear , "[89-mr. darcy] said [he]89-mr. darcy , when [she]82-elizabeth ceased speaking , " [I]89-mr. darcy have no more to say . If this be the case , [he]89-mr. darcy deserves [you]2993-my dear . [I]89-mr. darcy could not have parted with [you]2993-my dear , [[my]89-mr. darcy [Lizzy]82-elizabeth]5326-my lizzy , to [anyone less worthy]5327-anyone less worthy . "[89-mr. darcy]

To complete the favourable impression , [she]82-elizabeth then told [him]89-mr. darcy what [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy had voluntarily done for [Lydia]84-lydia . [He]89-mr. darcy heard [her]82-elizabeth with astonishment .

" This is an evening of wonders , indeed ! And so , [Darcy]89-mr. darcy did everything ; made up the match , gave the money , paid [the fellow]5328-the fellow 's debts , and got [him]89-mr. darcy [his]89-mr. darcy commission ! So much the better . It will save [me]82-elizabeth a world of trouble and economy . Had it been [[your]2993-my dear uncle]3374-your uncle 's doing , [I]82-elizabeth must and _ would _ have paid [him]89-mr. darcy ; but [these violent young lovers]5330-these violent young lovers carry everything [their]5330-these violent young lovers own way . [I]82-elizabeth shall offer to pay [him]89-mr. darcy to - morrow , [he]89-mr. darcy will rant and storm about [his]89-mr. darcy love for [you]2993-my dear , and there will be an end of the matter . "[82-elizabeth]

[He]89-mr. darcy then recollected [her]82-elizabeth embarrassment a few days before on [his]89-mr. darcy reading [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins 's letter ; and after laughing at [her]82-elizabeth some time , allowed [her]82-elizabeth at last to go , saying , as [she]82-elizabeth quitted [the room]250-the room , " If [any young men]5331-any young men come for [Mary]87-mary or [Kitty]86-lady catherine , send [them]5331-any young men in , for [I]82-elizabeth am quite at leisure . "[82-elizabeth]

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth 's mind was now relieved from a very heavy weight ; and , after half an hour 's quiet reflection in [[her]82-elizabeth own room]1549-her own room , [she]82-elizabeth was able to join [the others]507-the others with tolerable composure . Everything was too recent for gaiety , but the evening passed tranquilly away ; there was no longer anything material to be dreaded , and the comfort of ease and familiarity would come in time .

When [[her]82-elizabeth mother]241-her mother went up to [[her]241-her mother dressing - room]4662-her dressing - room at night , [she]241-her mother followed [her]241-her mother , and made the important communication . Its effect was most extraordinary ; for , on first hearing it , [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet sat quite still , and unable to utter a syllable . Nor was it under many , many minutes , that [she]85-mrs. bennet could comprehend what [she]85-mrs. bennet heard , though not in general backward to credit what was for the advantage of [[her]85-mrs. bennet family]885-her family , or that came in the shape of [a lover]2756-a lover to any of [them]885-her family . [She]85-mrs. bennet began at length to recover , to fidget about in [her]85-mrs. bennet chair , get up , sit down again , wonder , and bless [herself]85-mrs. bennet .

" [Good gracious]5332-good gracious ! [Lord]5333-lord bless [me]85-mrs. bennet ! only think ! dear [me]85-mrs. bennet ! [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy ! Who would have thought it ? And is it really true ? Oh , [my]85-mrs. bennet sweetest [Lizzy]82-elizabeth ! how rich and how great [you]82-elizabeth will be ! What pin - money , what jewels , what carriages [you]82-elizabeth will have ! [Jane]83-jane 's is nothing to it -- nothing at all . [I]85-mrs. bennet am so pleased -- so happy . [Such a charming man]5334-such a charming man ! so handsome ! so tall ! Oh , [my]85-mrs. bennet dear [Lizzy]82-elizabeth ! pray apologize for [my]85-mrs. bennet having disliked [him]5334-such a charming man so much before . [I]85-mrs. bennet hope [he]5334-such a charming man will overlook it . Dear , [dear Lizzy]82-elizabeth . [A house in [town]264-town]3169-a house in town ! Everything that is charming ! [Three daughters]552-three daughters married ! Ten thousand a year ! Oh , [Lord]5338-lord ! what will become of [me]85-mrs. bennet ? [I]85-mrs. bennet shall go distracted . "[85-mrs. bennet]

This was enough to prove that [her]2912-her approbation need not be doubted ; and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , rejoicing that such an effusion was heard only by [herself]82-elizabeth , soon went away . But before [she]82-elizabeth had been three minutes in [[her]82-elizabeth own room]1549-her own room , [[her]82-elizabeth mother]241-her mother followed [her]82-elizabeth .

" [[My]241-her mother dearest child]5339-my dearest child , "[241-her mother] [she]241-her mother cried , " [I]241-her mother can think of nothing else . Ten thousand a year , and very likely more ! ' Tis as good as [a lord]5340-a lord ! And a special licence -- [you]5339-my dearest child must and shall be married by a special licence . But , [[my]241-her mother dearest love]5341-my dearest love , tell [me]241-her mother what [dish Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy is particularly fond of , that [I]241-her mother may have it to - morrow . "[241-her mother]

This was a sad omen of what [[her]82-elizabeth mother]241-her mother 's behaviour to [the gentleman]285-the gentleman [himself]285-the gentleman might be ; and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth found that , though in the certain possession of [his]285-the gentleman warmest affection , and secure of [[her]82-elizabeth relations]577-her relations ' consent , there was still something to be wished for . But the morrow passed off much better than [she]82-elizabeth expected ; for [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet luckily stood in such awe of [[her]85-mrs. bennet intended son - in - law]2918-her intended son - in - law , that [she]85-mrs. bennet ventured not to speak to [him]285-the gentleman , unless it was in [her]85-mrs. bennet power to offer [him]285-the gentleman any attention , or mark [her]85-mrs. bennet deference for [his]285-the gentleman opinion .

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth had the satisfaction of seeing [[her]82-elizabeth father]244-her father taking pains to get acquainted with [him]285-the gentleman ; and [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet soon assured [her]82-elizabeth that [he]285-the gentleman was rising every hour in [his]285-the gentleman esteem .

" [I]75-mr. bennet admire all [[my]75-mr. bennet three sons - in - law]5342-my three sons - in - law highly , "[75-mr. bennet] said [he]75-mr. bennet . " [Wickham]136-wickham , perhaps , is [my]75-mr. bennet favourite ; but [I]75-mr. bennet think [I]75-mr. bennet shall like _ [[your]82-elizabeth _ husband]5343-your _ husband quite as well as [Jane]83-jane 's . "[75-mr. bennet]

[CHAPTER LX]219-chapter lx .

[Elizabeth]82-elizabeth 's spirits soon rising to playfulness again , [she]82-elizabeth wanted [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy to account for [his]89-mr. darcy having ever fallen in love with [her]82-elizabeth . " How could [you]89-mr. darcy begin ? "[82-elizabeth] said [she]82-elizabeth . " [I]82-elizabeth can comprehend [your]89-mr. darcy going on charmingly , when [you]89-mr. darcy had once made a beginning ; but what could set [you]89-mr. darcy off in the first place ? "[82-elizabeth]

" [I]82-elizabeth can not fix on the hour , or the spot , or the look , or the words , which laid the foundation . It is too long ago . [I]82-elizabeth was in the middle before [I]82-elizabeth knew that [I]82-elizabeth _ had _ begun . "[82-elizabeth]

" [My]82-elizabeth beauty [you]89-mr. darcy had early withstood , and as for [my]82-elizabeth manners -- [my]82-elizabeth behaviour to _ [you]89-mr. darcy _ was at least always bordering on the uncivil , and [I]82-elizabeth never spoke to [you]89-mr. darcy without rather wishing to give [you]89-mr. darcy pain than not . Now , be sincere ; did [you]89-mr. darcy admire [me]82-elizabeth for [my]82-elizabeth impertinence ? "[82-elizabeth]

" For the liveliness of [your]89-mr. darcy mind [I]82-elizabeth did . "[82-elizabeth]

" [You]89-mr. darcy may as well call it impertinence at once . It was very little less . The fact is , that [you]89-mr. darcy were sick of civility , of deference , of officious attention . [You]89-mr. darcy were disgusted with [the women who were always speaking , and looking , and thinking for _]5344-the women who were always speaking , and looking , and thinking for _ [your]89-mr. darcy _ approbation alone . [I]82-elizabeth roused and interested [you]89-mr. darcy , because [I]82-elizabeth was so unlike _ [them]5344-the women who were always speaking , and looking , and thinking for _ _ . Had [you]89-mr. darcy not been really amiable [you]89-mr. darcy would have hated [me]82-elizabeth for it : but in spite of the pains [you]89-mr. darcy took to disguise [yourself]89-mr. darcy , [your]89-mr. darcy feelings were always noble and just ; and in [your]89-mr. darcy heart [you]89-mr. darcy thoroughly despised [the persons who so assiduously courted [you]89-mr. darcy]5345-the persons who so assiduously courted you . There -- [I]82-elizabeth have saved [you]89-mr. darcy the trouble of accounting for it ; and really , all things considered , [I]82-elizabeth begin to think it perfectly reasonable . To be sure [you]89-mr. darcy know no actual good of [me]82-elizabeth -- but [nobody]3077-nobody thinks of _ that _ when [they]3077-nobody fall in love . "[82-elizabeth]

" Was there no good in [your]82-elizabeth affectionate behaviour to [Jane]83-jane , while [she]83-jane was ill at [Netherfield]2-netherfield ? "[82-elizabeth]

" [Dearest Jane]220-jane ! who could have done less for [her]83-jane ? But make a virtue of it by all means . [My]82-elizabeth good qualities are under [your]89-mr. darcy protection , and [you]89-mr. darcy are to exaggerate them as much as possible ; and , in return , it belongs to [me]82-elizabeth to find occasions for teasing and quarrelling with [you]89-mr. darcy as often as may be ; and [I]82-elizabeth shall begin directly , by asking [you]89-mr. darcy what made [you]89-mr. darcy so unwilling to come to the point at last ? What made [you]89-mr. darcy so shy of [me]82-elizabeth , when [you]89-mr. darcy first called , and afterwards dined [here]2994-here ? Why , especially , when [you]89-mr. darcy called , did [you]89-mr. darcy look as if [you]89-mr. darcy did not care about [me]82-elizabeth ? "[82-elizabeth]

" Because [you]89-mr. darcy were grave and silent , and gave [me]82-elizabeth no encouragement . "[82-elizabeth]

" But [I]82-elizabeth was embarrassed . "[82-elizabeth]

" And so was [I.]82-elizabeth "[82-elizabeth]

" [You]89-mr. darcy might have talked to [me]82-elizabeth more when [you]89-mr. darcy came to dinner . "[82-elizabeth]

" [A man who had felt less might]5348-a man who had felt less might . "[82-elizabeth]

" How unlucky that [you]89-mr. darcy should have a reasonable answer to give , and that [I]82-elizabeth should be so reasonable as to admit it ! But [I]82-elizabeth wonder how long [you]89-mr. darcy _ would _ have gone on , if [you]89-mr. darcy had been left to [yourself]89-mr. darcy . [I]82-elizabeth wonder when [you]89-mr. darcy _ would _ have spoken if [I]82-elizabeth had not asked [you]89-mr. darcy ! [My]82-elizabeth resolution of thanking [you]89-mr. darcy for [your]89-mr. darcy kindness to [Lydia]84-lydia had certainly great effect . _ Too much _ , [I]82-elizabeth am afraid ; for what becomes of the moral , if [our]5349-our comfort springs from a breach of promise , for [I]82-elizabeth ought not to have mentioned the subject ? This will never do . "[82-elizabeth]

" [You]89-mr. darcy need not distress [yourself]89-mr. darcy . The moral will be perfectly fair . [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine 's unjustifiable endeavours to separate [us]5349-our were the means of removing all [my]82-elizabeth doubts . [I]82-elizabeth am not indebted for [my]82-elizabeth present happiness to [your]89-mr. darcy eager desire of expressing [your]89-mr. darcy gratitude . [I]82-elizabeth was not in a humour to wait for an opening of [yours]89-mr. darcy . [[My]82-elizabeth aunt]3204-my aunt 's intelligence had given [me]82-elizabeth hope , and [I]82-elizabeth was determined at once to know everything . "[82-elizabeth]

" [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine has been of infinite use , which ought to make [her]86-lady catherine happy , for [she]86-lady catherine loves to be of use . But tell [me]82-elizabeth , what did [you]89-mr. darcy come down to [Netherfield]2-netherfield for ? Was it merely to ride to [Longbourn]7-longbourn and be embarrassed ? or had [you]89-mr. darcy intended any more serious consequences ? "[82-elizabeth]

" [My]82-elizabeth real purpose was to see _ [you]89-mr. darcy _ , and to judge , if [I]82-elizabeth could , whether [I]82-elizabeth might ever hope to make [you]89-mr. darcy love [me]82-elizabeth . [My]82-elizabeth avowed one , or what [I]82-elizabeth avowed to [myself]82-elizabeth , was to see whether [[your]89-mr. darcy sister]3139-your sister was still partial to [Bingley]79-mr. bingley , and if [she]3139-your sister were , to make the confession to [him]79-mr. bingley which [I]82-elizabeth have since made . "[82-elizabeth]

" Shall [you]89-mr. darcy ever have courage to announce to [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine what is to befall [her]86-lady catherine ? "[82-elizabeth]

" [I]82-elizabeth am more likely to want time than courage , [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth . But it ought to be done ; and if [you]89-mr. darcy will give [me]82-elizabeth a sheet of paper it shall be done directly . "[82-elizabeth]

" And if [I]82-elizabeth had not a letter to write [myself]82-elizabeth , [I]82-elizabeth might sit by [you]89-mr. darcy , and admire the evenness of [your]89-mr. darcy writing , as [another young lady]5352-another young lady once did . But [I]82-elizabeth have [an aunt]5353-an aunt , too , who must not be longer neglected . "[82-elizabeth]

From an unwillingness to confess how much [her]2920-her intimacy with [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy had been overrated , [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth had never yet answered [Mrs. Gardiner]125-mrs. gardiner 's long letter ; but now , having _ that _ to communicate which [she]82-elizabeth knew would be most welcome , [she]82-elizabeth was almost ashamed to find that [[her]82-elizabeth uncle]573-her uncle and [aunt]3971-aunt had already lost three days of happiness , and immediately wrote as follows:--

" [I]89-mr. darcy would have thanked [you]89-mr. darcy before , [[my]89-mr. darcy dear aunt]3934-my dear aunt , as [I]89-mr. darcy ought to have done , for [your]89-mr. darcy long , kind , satisfactory detail of particulars ; but , to say the truth , [I]89-mr. darcy was too cross to write . [You]89-mr. darcy supposed more than really existed . But _ now _ suppose as much as [you]89-mr. darcy choose ; give a loose to [your]89-mr. darcy fancy , indulge [your]89-mr. darcy imagination in every possible flight which the subject will afford , and unless [you]89-mr. darcy believe [me]89-mr. darcy actually married , [you]89-mr. darcy can not greatly err . [You]89-mr. darcy must write again very soon , and praise [him]89-mr. darcy a great deal more than [you]89-mr. darcy did in [your]89-mr. darcy last . [I]89-mr. darcy thank [you]89-mr. darcy again and again , for not going to [the Lakes]72-the lakes . How could [I]89-mr. darcy be so silly as to wish it ! [Your]89-mr. darcy idea of the ponies is delightful . [We]5355-we will go round [the park]1315-the park every day . [I]89-mr. darcy am the happiest creature in [the world]303-the world . Perhaps [other people]3885-other people have said so before , but [no one with such justice]5359-no one with such justice . [I]89-mr. darcy am happier even than [Jane]220-jane ; [she]220-jane only smiles , [I]89-mr. darcy laugh . [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy sends [you]89-mr. darcy all the love in [the world]303-the world that can be spared from [me]89-mr. darcy . [You]89-mr. darcy are all to come to [Pemberley]12-pemberley at Christmas . [Yours]89-mr. darcy , "[89-mr. darcy] etc .

[Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy 's letter to [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine was in a different style , and still different from either was what [Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet sent to [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins , in return for [his]129-mr. collins last .

/ * " [Dear Sir]3423-dear sir , * /[89-mr. darcy]

" [I]75-mr. bennet must trouble [you]3423-dear sir once more for congratulations . [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth will soon be [the wife of [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy]5167-the wife of mr. darcy . [Console Lady Catherine]221-console lady catherine as well as [you]3423-dear sir can . But , if [I]75-mr. bennet were [you]3423-dear sir , [I]75-mr. bennet would stand by [the nephew]2847-the nephew . [He]2847-the nephew has more to give .[75-mr. bennet]

" [Yours]3423-dear sir sincerely , "[91-miss bingley] etc .

[Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley 's congratulations to [[her]91-miss bingley brother]3108-her brother on [his]3108-her brother approaching marriage were all that was affectionate and insincere . [She]91-miss bingley wrote even to [Jane]220-jane on the occasion , to express [her]91-miss bingley delight , and repeat all [her]91-miss bingley former professions of regard . [Jane]220-jane was not deceived , but [she]220-jane was affected ; and though feeling no reliance on [her]220-jane , could not help writing [her]220-jane a much kinder answer than [she]220-jane knew was deserved .

The joy which [Miss Darcy]124-miss darcy expressed on receiving similar information was as sincere as [[her]124-miss darcy brother]3108-her brother 's in sending it . Four sides of paper were insufficient to contain all [her]124-miss darcy delight , and all [her]124-miss darcy earnest desire of being loved by [[her]124-miss darcy sister]328-her sister .

Before any answer could arrive from [Mr. Collins]129-mr. collins , or any congratulations to [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth from [[his]129-mr. collins wife]231-his wife , [the Longbourn family]725-the longbourn family heard that [the Collinses]4423-the collinses were come [themselves]725-the longbourn family to [Lucas Lodge]10-lucas lodge . The reason of this sudden removal was soon evident . [Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine had been rendered so exceedingly angry by the contents of [[her]86-lady catherine nephew]3592-her nephew 's letter , that [Charlotte]172-charlotte , really rejoicing in the match , was anxious to get away till the storm was blown over . At such a moment , the arrival of [[her]86-lady catherine friend]402-her friend was a sincere pleasure to [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , though in the course of [their]2931-their meetings [she]82-elizabeth must sometimes think the pleasure dearly bought , when [she]82-elizabeth saw [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy exposed to all the parading and obsequious civility of [[her]86-lady catherine husband]255-her husband . [He]255-her husband bore it , however , with admirable calmness . [He]255-her husband could even listen to [Sir William Lucas]80-sir william , when [he]80-sir william complimented [him]255-her husband on carrying away the brightest jewel of [the country]448-the country , and expressed [his]80-sir william hopes of [their]2931-their all meeting frequently at [[St. James]11-st. james 's]379-st. james 's , with very decent composure . If [he]80-sir william did shrug [his]80-sir william shoulders , it was not till [Sir William]80-sir william was out of sight .

[Mrs. Philips]111-mrs. philips 's vulgarity was another , and , perhaps , a greater tax on [his]255-her husband forbearance ; and though [Mrs. Philips]111-mrs. philips , as well as [[her]111-mrs. philips sister]328-her sister , stood in too much awe of [him]255-her husband to speak with the familiarity which [Bingley]91-miss bingley 's good - humour encouraged ; yet , whenever [she]111-mrs. philips _ did _ speak , [she]111-mrs. philips must be vulgar . Nor was [her]111-mrs. philips respect for [him]255-her husband , though it made [her]111-mrs. philips more quiet , at all likely to make [her]111-mrs. philips more elegant . [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth did all [she]82-elizabeth could to shield [him]255-her husband from the frequent notice of either , and was ever anxious to keep [him]255-her husband to [herself]82-elizabeth , and to [those of [[her]82-elizabeth family]885-her family with whom [he]255-her husband might converse without mortification]2936-those of her family with whom he might converse without mortification ; and though the uncomfortable feelings arising from all this took from the season of courtship much of its pleasure , it added to the hope of the future ; and [she]82-elizabeth looked forward with delight to the time when [they]2938-they should be removed from society so little pleasing to either , to all the comfort and elegance of [[their]2938-they family]2488-their family party at [Pemberley]12-pemberley .

CHAPTER LXI .

Happy for all [her]111-mrs. philips maternal feelings was the day on which [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet got rid of [[her]111-mrs. philips two most deserving daughters]2940-her two most deserving daughters . With what delighted pride [she]111-mrs. philips afterwards visited [Mrs. Bingley]222-mrs. bingley , and talked of [Mrs. Darcy]124-miss darcy , may be guessed . [I]0-i wish [I]0-i could say , for the sake of [[her]111-mrs. philips family]885-her family , that the accomplishment of [her]111-mrs. philips earnest desire in the establishment of [so many of [[her]111-mrs. philips children]990-her children]2942-so many of her children produced so happy an effect as to make [her]111-mrs. philips [a sensible , amiable , well - informed woman]2944-a sensible , amiable , well - informed woman for the rest of [her]111-mrs. philips life ; though , perhaps , it was lucky for [[her]111-mrs. philips husband]255-her husband , who might not have relished domestic felicity in so unusual a form , that [she]111-mrs. philips still was occasionally nervous and invariably silly .

[Mr. Bennet]75-mr. bennet missed [[his]75-mr. bennet second daughter]240-his second daughter exceedingly ; [his]75-mr. bennet affection for [her]240-his second daughter drew [him]75-mr. bennet oftener from [home]3219-home than anything else could do . [He]75-mr. bennet delighted in going to [Pemberley]12-pemberley , especially when [he]75-mr. bennet was least expected .

[Mr. Bingley]79-mr. bingley and [Jane]220-jane remained at [Netherfield]2-netherfield only a twelvemonth . So near a vicinity to [[her]240-his second daughter mother]241-her mother and [Meryton]9-meryton relations was not desirable even to _ [his]75-mr. bennet _ easy temper , or _ [her]111-mrs. philips _ affectionate heart . The darling wish of [[his]75-mr. bennet sisters]282-his sisters was then gratified : [he]75-mr. bennet bought [an estate in [a neighbouring county]2951-a neighbouring county to [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire]2950-an estate in a neighbouring county to derbyshire ; and [Jane]220-jane and [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , in addition to every other source of happiness , were within thirty miles of each other .

[Kitty]86-lady catherine , to [her]86-lady catherine very material advantage , spent the chief of [her]86-lady catherine time with [[her]86-lady catherine two elder sisters]2566-her two elder sisters . In society so superior to what [she]86-lady catherine had generally known , [her]86-lady catherine improvement was great . [She]86-lady catherine was not of so ungovernable a temper as [Lydia]84-lydia ; and , removed from the influence of [Lydia]84-lydia 's example , [she]86-lady catherine became , by proper attention and management , less irritable , less ignorant , and less insipid . From the further disadvantage of [Lydia]84-lydia 's society [she]86-lady catherine was of course carefully kept ; and though [Mrs. Wickham]201-mrs. wickham frequently invited [her]86-lady catherine to come and stay with [her]86-lady catherine , with the promise of balls and [young men]2953-young men , [[her]86-lady catherine father]244-her father would never consent to [her]86-lady catherine going .

[Mary]87-mary was [the only daughter who remained at [home]3219-home]2955-the only daughter who remained at home ; and [she]87-mary was necessarily drawn from the pursuit of accomplishments by [Mrs. Bennet]85-mrs. bennet 's being quite unable to sit alone . [Mary]87-mary was obliged to mix more with [the world]303-the world , but [she]87-mary could still moralize over every morning visit ; and as [she]87-mary was no longer mortified by comparisons between [[her]87-mary sisters]3023-her sisters ' beauty and [her]87-mary own , it was suspected by [[her]87-mary father]244-her father that [she]87-mary submitted to the change without much reluctance .

As for [Wickham]201-mrs. wickham and [Lydia]84-lydia , [[their]2960-their characters]2961-their characters suffered no revolution from the marriage of [[her]87-mary sisters]3023-her sisters . [He]244-her father bore with philosophy the conviction that [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth must now become acquainted with whatever of [his]244-her father ingratitude and falsehood had before been unknown to [her]82-elizabeth ; and , in spite of everything , was not wholly without hope that [Darcy]124-miss darcy might yet be prevailed on to make [his]244-her father fortune . The congratulatory letter which [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth received from [Lydia]84-lydia on [her]84-lydia marriage explained to [her]82-elizabeth that , by [[his]244-her father wife]231-his wife at least , if not by [himself]244-her father , such a hope was cherished . The letter was to this effect:--

/ * " [[My]84-lydia dear]2993-my dear [Lizzy]82-elizabeth , * /[84-lydia]

" [I]82-elizabeth wish [you]82-elizabeth joy . If [you]82-elizabeth love [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy half so well as [I]82-elizabeth do [my]82-elizabeth dear [Wickham]201-mrs. wickham , [you]82-elizabeth must be very happy . It is a great comfort to have [you]82-elizabeth so rich ; and when [you]82-elizabeth have nothing else to do , [I]82-elizabeth hope [you]82-elizabeth will think of [us]5365-us . [I]82-elizabeth am sure [Wickham]201-mrs. wickham would like a place at [court]5366-court very much ; and [I]82-elizabeth do not think [we]5365-us shall have quite money enough to live upon without some help . [Any place]5367-any place would do of about three or four hundred a year ; but , however , do not speak to [Mr. Darcy]89-mr. darcy about it , if [you]82-elizabeth had rather not .[82-elizabeth]

" [Yours]82-elizabeth , "[84-lydia] etc .

As it happened that [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth had much rather not , [she]82-elizabeth endeavoured in [her]82-elizabeth answer to put an end to every entreaty and expectation of the kind . Such relief , however , as it was in [her]82-elizabeth power to afford , by the practice of what might be called economy in [her]82-elizabeth own private expenses , [she]82-elizabeth frequently sent them . It had always been evident to [her]82-elizabeth that such an income as [theirs]2964-theirs , under the direction of [two persons so extravagant in [their]2965-two persons so extravagant in their wants , and heedless of the future wants , and heedless of the future]2965-two persons so extravagant in their wants , and heedless of the future , must be very insufficient to [their]2965-two persons so extravagant in their wants , and heedless of the future support ; and whenever [they]2965-two persons so extravagant in their wants , and heedless of the future changed [[their]2965-two persons so extravagant in their wants , and heedless of the future quarters]2966-their quarters , either [Jane]220-jane or [herself]220-jane were sure of being applied to for some little assistance towards discharging [their]2965-two persons so extravagant in their wants , and heedless of the future bills . [Their]2965-two persons so extravagant in their wants , and heedless of the future manner of living , even when the restoration of peace dismissed [them]2965-two persons so extravagant in their wants , and heedless of the future to [a home]2967-a home , was unsettled in the extreme . [They]2965-two persons so extravagant in their wants , and heedless of the future were always moving from place to place in quest of a cheap situation , and always spending more than [they]2965-two persons so extravagant in their wants , and heedless of the future ought . [His]2968-his affection for [her]82-elizabeth soon sunk into indifference : [hers]82-elizabeth lasted a little longer ; and , in spite of [her]82-elizabeth youth and [her]82-elizabeth manners , [she]82-elizabeth retained all the claims to reputation which [her]82-elizabeth marriage had given [her]82-elizabeth . Though [Darcy]89-mr. darcy could never receive _ [him]2968-his _ at [Pemberley]12-pemberley , yet , for [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth 's sake , [he]89-mr. darcy assisted [him]2968-his further in [his]2968-his profession . [Lydia]84-lydia was occasionally [a visitor]1506-a visitor [there]305-there , when [[her]82-elizabeth husband]255-her husband was gone to enjoy [himself]255-her husband in [London]5-london or [Bath]73-bath ; and with [the Bingleys]141-the bingleys [they]2972-they both of [them]2972-they frequently stayed so long , that even [Bingley]79-mr. bingley 's good - humour was overcome , and [he]79-mr. bingley proceeded so far as to _ talk _ of giving [them]2972-they a hint to be gone .

[Miss Bingley]91-miss bingley was very deeply mortified by [Darcy]89-mr. darcy 's marriage ; but as [she]91-miss bingley thought it advisable to retain the right of visiting at [Pemberley]12-pemberley , [she]91-miss bingley dropped all [her]91-miss bingley resentment ; was fonder than ever of [Georgiana]147-georgiana , almost as attentive to [Darcy]147-georgiana as heretofore , and paid off every arrear of civility to [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth .

[Pemberley]12-pemberley was now [[Georgiana]147-georgiana 's [home]3219-home]2973-georgiana 's home ; and the attachment of [the sisters]492-the sisters was exactly what [Darcy]147-georgiana had hoped to see . [They]2972-they were able to love [each other]3144-each other , even as well as [they]2972-they intended . [Georgiana]147-georgiana had the highest opinion in [the world]303-the world of [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth ; though at first [she]147-georgiana often listened with an astonishment bordering on alarm at [her]147-georgiana lively , sportive manner of talking to [[her]147-georgiana brother]3108-her brother . [He]3108-her brother , who had always inspired in [herself]147-georgiana a respect which almost overcame [her]147-georgiana affection , [she]147-georgiana now saw the object of open pleasantry . [Her]147-georgiana mind received knowledge which had never before fallen in [her]147-georgiana way . By [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth 's instructions [she]147-georgiana began to comprehend that [a woman]3011-a woman may take liberties with [[her]3011-a woman husband]255-her husband , which [a brother]440-a brother will not always allow in [a sister more than ten years younger than [himself]440-a brother]2982-a sister more than ten years younger than himself .

[Lady Catherine]86-lady catherine was extremely indignant on the marriage of [[her]86-lady catherine nephew]3592-her nephew ; and as [she]86-lady catherine gave way to all the genuine frankness of [her]86-lady catherine character , in [her]86-lady catherine reply to the letter which announced its arrangement , [she]86-lady catherine sent [him]3592-her nephew language so very abusive , especially of [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , that for some time all intercourse was at an end . But at length , by [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth 's persuasion , [he]3592-her nephew was prevailed on to overlook the offence , and seek a reconciliation ; and , after a little further resistance on the part of [[his]3592-her nephew aunt]924-his aunt , [her]82-elizabeth resentment gave way , either to [her]82-elizabeth affection for [him]3592-her nephew , or [her]82-elizabeth curiosity to see how [[his]3592-her nephew wife]231-his wife conducted [herself]231-his wife ; and [she]82-elizabeth condescended to wait on [them]2986-them at [Pemberley]12-pemberley , in spite of that pollution which [[its]12-pemberley woods]2987-its woods had received , not merely from the presence of [such a mistress]2988-such a mistress , but the visits of [[her]82-elizabeth uncle]573-her uncle and aunt from [the city]2990-the city .

With [the Gardiners]154-the gardiners [they]2986-them were always on the most intimate terms . [Darcy]147-georgiana , as well as [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth , really loved [them]2986-them ; and [they]2986-them were both ever sensible of the warmest gratitude towards [the persons who , by bringing [her]82-elizabeth into [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire]2991-the persons who , by bringing her into derbyshire , had been the means of uniting [them]2986-them .

[CHISWICK PRESS:--CHARLES WHITTINGHAM AND CO . TOOKS COURT]2992-chiswick press:--charles whittingham and co . tooks court , [CHANCERY LANE]74-chancery lane , [LONDON]5-london .
